只要在所有副本上保留版权声明和本许可声明，就允许制作和分发本书的逐字副本。

在逐字复制的条件下，允许复制和分发本书的修改版本，但前提是修改版本必须显著地标记为修改版本，修改后的版本作者姓名和标题保持不变（但可以添加副标题和其他作者姓名），并且整个衍生作品必须按照与本许可声明相同的许可声明条款进行分发。

Permission is granted to copy and distribute modified versions of this book under the conditions for verbatim copying, provided also that they are labeled prominently as modified versions, that the authors' names and title from this version are unchanged (though subtitles and additional authors' names may be added), and that the entire resulting derived work is distributed under the terms of a permission notice identical to this one.

在遵守上述修改版本条件的情况下，允许复制和分发本书的其他语言的译本。

Permission is granted to copy and distribute translations of this book into another language, under the above conditions for modified versions.

第一版前言

Foreword to the First Edition

VLSI 系统主题涉及广泛的学科，包括半导体器件和处理、集成电子电路、数字逻辑、用于创建复杂系统的设计学科和工具，以及完整 VLSI 系统的架构、算法和应用。Addison-Wesley VLSI 系统系列被组织成一套教科书和研究参考资料，介绍这个令人兴奋且多样化的领域中当前最好的工作，每本书都为其主题提供了一个将其与相关学科联系起来的视角。

The subject of VLSI systems spans a broad range of disciplines, including semiconductor devices and processing, integrated electronic circuits, digital logic, design disciplines and tools for creating complex systems, and the architecture, algorithms, and applications of complete VLSI systems. The Addison-Wesley VLSI Systems Series is being organized as a set of textbooks and research references that present the best current work across this exciting and diverse field, with each book providing for its subject a perspective that ties it to related disciplines.

Steven Rubin 所著的《VLSI 设计的计算机辅助》全面而连贯地介绍了 VLSI 设计师可用的计算工具。本书包含的见解和信息对芯片设计师和工具制造商都很有价值。现代 VLSI 计算机辅助设计 (CAD) 系统允许芯片设计师以一致且方便的方式访问各种综合和分析工具。这些工具在过去几年中取得了长足的进步，无论是在范围上还是在处理大型设计的能力上。

Computer Aids for VLSI Design by Steven Rubin presents a broad and coherent view of the computational tools available to the VLSI designer. This book contains insights and information that will be valuable both to chip designers and to tool builders. Modern VLSI computer aided design (CAD) systems allow the chip designer to access in a consistent and convenient way a variety of synthesis and analysis tools. Such tools have advanced considerably in the past several years, both in their scope and in their ability to handle large designs.

专家级芯片设计师与新手之间的区别之一在于，他们是否了解可用的整套工具，以及这些工具如何协同工作以支持项目的设计流程。在某些情况下，人们可以通过工具的外部接口和在设计过程中的作用来了解各个工具的功能和局限性。在其他情况下，了解工具的内部工作原理也很有用。Rubin 对所有重要的综合和分析工具类别都从两个角度进行了介绍。任何熟悉芯片设计和计算机编程的人都可以轻松理解这一阐述。

Part of what distinguishes the expert chip designer from the novice is an understanding the entire suite of tools that are available, and how they work together to support the design flow of a project. One can come to understand the capabilities and limitations of individual tools in some cases from their external interfaces and roles in the design process. In other cases it is useful to appreciate how the tools work internally. Rubin presents both perspectives for all of the important categories of synthesis and analysis tools. The exposition is readily understandable to anyone familiar with chip design and computer programming.

本书的起点是一个名为“Electric”的设计系统，Rubin 在过去四年中几乎独自设计和编程了该系统。Electric 是一个完整而优雅的系统，已用于许多芯片的设计和验证。本书不是使用Electric 的“手册”。相反，Electric 被用作展示当前许多先进设计系统所共有的设计选择和内部接口的载体。因此，本书允许人们在现实环境中学习 VLSI 设计系统开发人员所实践的一些艺术。

The starting point for this book was a design system called "Electric," which Rubin designed and programmed almost single-handedly over the past four years. Electric is a complete and elegant system that has been used for the design and verification of many chips. The book is not a "manual" for using Electric. Rather, Electric is used as a vehicle for exposing design choices and internal interfaces that are common to many of the advanced design systems currently available. Thus this book allows one to learn in a realistic setting something of the art practiced by VLSI design system developers.

林恩·康威

密歇根州安娜堡



查克·塞茨

加利福尼亚州帕萨迪纳

Lynn Conway

Ann Arbor, Michigan



Chuck Seitz

Pasadena, California

 

 

第一版前言

Preface to the First Edition

本书介绍了如何对计算机进行编程以帮助设计超大规模集成电路 (VLSI)。此类电路由于易于制造、成本低廉和设计方法简化而变得越来越普遍。设计人员不再需要学习电子学和物理学来构建集成电路。数字电子设计课程广泛，任何科学背景的人都可以学习。

This book describes how computers can be programmed to help in the design of very-large-scale integrated (VLSI) circuits. Such circuits are becoming increasingly common due to their ease of manufacture, low cost, and simplified design methodologies. No longer must the designer study electronics and physics to build an integrated circuit. Digital electronic design is taught widely and is accessible to people with any scientific background.

随着这些电子电路的复杂性不断增加，使用计算机进行设计的需求也变得越来越重要。尽管计算机辅助设计 (CAD) 系统已经存在了很长一段时间，但其中许多系统不足以完成当前的任务，而且新工具不断涌现。这些工具执行了 VLSI 系统设计中涉及的越来越多的详细和重复性工作，从而缩短了生产芯片所需的时间。

As the complexity of these electronic circuits increases, the need to use computers for their design becomes more important. Although computer-aided design (CAD) systems have existed for quite some time, many of them are inadequate for current tasks, and a continuous flow of new tools is being developed. These tools perform more and more of the detailed and repetitive work involved in VLSI system design, thus reducing the time it takes to produce a chip.

对更好的 VLSI 设计系统的需求促使人们更仔细地研究这些系统。Mead和 Conway 合著的《VLSI 系统简介》一书为这一研究领域开辟了比以往更广泛的受众。Weste 和 Eshraghian 合著的后续著作《CMOS VLSI 设计原理》与第一本书相结合，为 VLSI 电路的构建奠定了广泛的基础。本书延续了其他书籍的思路：探讨了实现此类构建的计算机辅助设计系统。

The need for better VLSI design systems has fostered a need to study these systems more carefully. The book, Introduction to VLSI Systems by Mead and Conway, opened up this field of study to a wider audience than ever before. A follow-on book, Principles of CMOS VLSI Design by Weste and Eshraghian, combined with the first text to present a broad foundation for the construction of VLSI circuits. This book continues where the others have left off: it explores the computer-aided design systems that enable such construction.

虽然本书的学生不必这样做，但建议他们学习上述 VLSI 书籍之一并进行一些芯片设计。这将提供适当的背景知识，以区分 VLSI 设计和更传统的电路布局。学生还应该熟悉基本的计算机编程问题。因此，本书的读者被认为是希望开发更好的设计工具的 VLSI 设计师。除了技术描述外，本书还提供了许多参考信息。

Although students of this textbook need not have done so, they are advised to have studied one of the mentioned VLSI books and to have done some chip design. This will provide the proper background to distinguish VLSI design from more traditional circuit layout. Students should also be familiar with basic computer-programming issues. The reader of this text is therefore presumed to be a VLSI designer who would like to develop better design tools. In addition to descriptions of techniques, much reference information is provided in this book.

本书的另一个潜在读者是 VLSI 设计师，他们虽然对编写新工具不感兴趣，但希望更深入地了解已在使用的工具。本书说明了 VLSI 设计系统各部分的操作和相互关系。理解这些概念的设计师将能够更好地使用他们的系统并帮助指定未来的 CAD 方向。

Another potential reader of this book is the VLSI designer who, although not interested in programming new tools, would like to develop a finer understanding of the tools that are already in use. This book illustrates the operation and interrelation of the parts of VLSI design systems. Designers who understand these concepts will be better able to work with their systems and to help specify future CAD directions.

此外，从未设计过芯片的人仍然可以从这本书中受益。本书的主题是大型系统设计，其中包括许多与电子无关的考虑因素。但是，许多示例确实提到了电路中的晶体管或逻辑门。如果读者不熟悉这些概念，那么他或她可能会发现这些讨论令人困惑。然而，读者只需要抽象地理解这些概念；本书不依赖电路分析或电气工程概念。

Also, a person who has never designed chips can still benefit from this book. The subject matter is large system design, which includes many considerations that are independent of electronics. However, many examples do refer to transistors or logic gates as they appear in a circuit. If the reader is not familiar with these notions, then he or she is likely to find the discussions confusing. The reader needs to understand these concepts only abstractly, however; the book does not rely on circuit analysis or electrical-engineering concepts.

本书面向高年级本科生或研究生。在斯伦贝谢面向设计师和工具制造者的课程中，本书每章包含一个讲座。虽然有些章节可以轻松延伸到两个讲座，但进度并不太快。该课程很好地阐述了 VLSI 系统的 CAD。每章末尾的问题包括简单的练习和可用作讨论要点的未解决问题。

This book is geared for advanced undergraduate or graduate students. In a course taught to designers and tool builders at Schlumberger, the book was covered with one lecture per chapter. Although some chapters could easily stretch into two lectures, the pace was not too fast. The course provided a good exposition of CAD for VLSI systems. Questions at the end of each chapter range from simple exercises to unsolved problems that can be used as discussion points.

以前关于 CAD 系统的教材主要关注设计问题的特定方面，例如综合算法或硬件描述语言。本书的视角更加广泛。它从基础知识开始，例如设计环境和机器表示；涵盖了综合和分析工具的基本主题；还讨论了重要的外围概念，例如输出格式、可编程性、图形和人体工程学。

Previous texts on CAD systems have focused on specific aspects of the design problem, such as synthesis algorithms or hardware-description languages. This book takes a much broader view. It starts with basics, such as design environments and machine representations; covers the fundamental subjects of synthesis and analysis tools; and also discusses important peripheral notions such as output formats, programmability, graphics, and human engineering.

本书的最后一章通过描述一个名为“Electric”的 VLSI 设计系统将课程联系在一起。这是一个有启发性的例子，因为它体现了文本中描述的许多特性，并且源代码可供大学进行实验。感兴趣的学校可以联系本书的作者获取该系统。Schlumberger 旗下的 Applicon 公司正在商业销售一个更广泛的 Electric 版本，称为“Bravo3 VLSI”。

The last chapter of the book ties together the lessons by describing a working VLSI design system called "Electric." This is an instructive example because it embodies many of the features described in the text and because the source code is available to universities for experimentation. Interested schools can contact the author of this book to obtain the system. A more extensive version of Electric, called "Bravo3 VLSI," is sold commercially by Applicon, a Schlumberger company.

和任何参考书一样，这本书肯定不准确。读者应注意不要盲目接受细节，并应彻底测试所有技术。确保算法正确的唯一方法是在系统中测试它。

Like any reference book, this one is certain to be inaccurate. Readers are cautioned against blindly accepting details, and should test all techniques thoroughly. The only way to ensure that an algorithm is correct is to test it in a system.

 

 

第二版前言

Preface to the Second Edition

本书首次出版已有十年，电子 CAD 领域也发生了很多变化。虽然第一版中的一些细节已不再正确，但所有基本概念仍然适用。例如，过去十年中出现了 ASIC（专用集成电路）和 FPGA（现场可编程门阵列）这两个术语。虽然这些术语在第一版中没有出现，但它们所体现的概念并不新鲜，因此本书涵盖了这些概念。

It has been a decade since this book first appeared in print, and much has happened in the world of electronic CAD. Although some of the details in the first edition are no longer correct, all of the basic concepts still apply. For example, the last ten years have seen the creation of the terms ASIC (Application-Specific Integrated Circuit) and FPGA (field-programmable gate-array). Although these terms did not appear in the first edition, the concepts they embody are not new, and therefore are covered in the book.

在编写第二版时，我纠正了那些错误的细节，但保留了本书的大部分内容。因此，本版的读者会发现对 CIF 附录、电气内部结构以及许多细小但有用的细节的更正。但是，我既没有时间也没有意愿彻底修改这本书。因此，如果您正在寻找关于以前不存在的概念（例如技术映射）的新章节，那么您将不得不去别处寻找。

In creating this second edition, I have corrected those details that are wrong, but left the bulk of the book untouched. Thus, readers of this edition will find corrections to the CIF Appendix, the Electric internals, and many small but useful details. However, I have had neither the time nor the inclination to radically alter the book. So, if you are looking for new chapters on concepts that did not exist before (such as technology mapping), then you will have to look elsewhere.

作为时代的标志，本书的这一版本以电子版而非纸质版的形式出版。整本书都在这里，可以免费获取。虽然我不会要求对本书的使用进行补偿，但您必须保留您使用的所有部分的版权信息。

As a sign of the times, this edition of the book appears electronically, rather than on paper. The entire volume is here, and is freely available. Although I ask no compensation for the book's use, you must retain the copyright information on all parts that you use.

 

 

第一版致谢

Acknowledgments to the First Edition

感谢许多帮助我完成本书的人。丛书编辑 Lynn Conway 和 Chuck Seitz 对本书初稿提供了很好的反馈，审阅者还有 AT&T 贝尔实验室的 Bryan Ackland、密歇根大学的 John Hayes、Schlumberger Palo Alto Research 的 Richard F. Lyon、Symbolics, Inc. 的 Neil Weste 和 Schlumberger Palo Alto Research 的 Telle Whitney。还要感谢两位客座作者：Bob Hon 和 Sundar Iyengar。Fairchild 图书馆管理员不知疲倦地提供了大量参考资料。最后，我要向参加初始课程并仔细审阅初稿的 Schlumberger 员工致以最诚挚的谢意。

Thanks are due to a number of people who helped me with this book. The series editors, Lynn Conway and Chuck Seitz, provided good feedback on early drafts of the manuscript, as did the reviewers Bryan Ackland, AT&T Bell Laboratories; John Hayes, University of Michigan; Richard F. Lyon, Schlumberger Palo Alto Research; Neil Weste, Symbolics, Inc.; and Telle Whitney, Schlumberger Palo Alto Research. Thanks are also due to the two guest authors: Bob Hon and Sundar Iyengar. The Fairchild librarians tirelessly helped with numerous references. Finally, a broad note of appreciation goes to the employees of Schlumberger who attended the initial course and waded through the first draft.

就我个人而言，我要感谢我的妻子艾米·兰斯基和我的家人，他们在这段艰难的时期给予了我很大的支持。艾米提醒我，写书的过程与读研究生并努力完成论文的过程有多么相似，这让我有了新的认识。我还要感谢朋克摇滚乐队 SD

On a personal level, I am indebted to my wife, Amy Lansky, and my family who have been supportive during this ordeal. Amy provided perspective by reminding me how similar the process of writing a book is to being in graduate school and struggling with a dissertation. I would also like to thank the punk-rock band, S.D.

加利福尼亚州帕洛阿尔托，1987 年小型磁共振

 

 

第二版致谢

Acknowledgments to the Second Edition

如果没有 Brian Gardiner 的努力，本书的这个版本就不会存在，他采用了我的 CAD 系统 Electric，并成立了一家公司来销售它。

This edition of the book would not exist if it weren't for the efforts of Brian Gardiner, who took my CAD system, Electric, and created a company to sell it.

从个人角度来说，我仍然感激我的妻子艾米·兰斯基和我的家人，现在我有两个孩子：伊萨克和马克斯。当然，我还要感谢摇滚乐队 Severe Tire Damage。

On a personal level, I remain indebted to my wife, Amy Lansky, and my family, which now numbers two children: Izaak and Max. And, of course, I would like to thank the rock&roll band, Severe Tire Damage.

加利福尼亚州波托拉谷，1997 年小型磁共振

史蒂文·M·鲁宾
        静态自由软件        开始
超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第1章：数字电子设计的特点

Chapter 1: The Characteristics of Digital Electronic Design

1.1 设计

1.1 Design

设计是人类最重要的事业：它是实现创造力的渠道。设计决定了我们的每一项活动以及这些活动的结果；因此它包括规划、解决问题和生产。通常，“设计”一词适用于珠宝、房屋、汽车和城市等工艺品的规划和生产。设计也存在于数学证明和游戏等解决问题的任务中。最后，设计存在于纯粹的规划活动中，例如制定法律或举办派对。

更具体地说，手头上的问题就是可制造工件的设计。这项活动涉及设计的各个方面，因为除了可生产物体的规范外，它还需要规划该物体的制造，并在此过程中解决许多问题。物体的设计通常从草图开始，然后通过添加精确的尺寸进行完善。最终计划不仅必须指定确切的尺寸，还必须包括对生产步骤进行排序的方案。其他考虑因素取决于生产环境；例如，是生产一百万件还是一千万件，以及如何精确地控制制造环境。

More specific to the matter at hand is the design of manufacturable artifacts. This activity uses all facets of design because, in addition to the specification of a producible object, it requires the planning of that object's manufacture, and much problem solving along the way. Design of objects usually begins with a rough sketch that is refined by adding precise dimensions. The final plan must not only specify exact sizes, but also include a scheme for ordering the steps of production. Additional considerations depend on the production environment; for example, whether one or ten million will be made, and how precisely the manufacturing environment can be controlled.

本书特别关注高度复杂的电子电路（称为VLSI （超大规模集成电路））的设计。在设计 VLSI 系统时，必须采取相同的步骤（见图 1.1）。初始草图显示了电路的“黑匣子”特性：哪些线路将带来哪些信息，哪些线路将获得结果。然后将其细化为架构设计，显示电路的主要功能单元及其相互作用。然后，每个单元在更详细但仍然抽象的层面上进行设计，通常使用执行反转、结合和分离的逻辑门。最终的细化将此原理图规范转换为集成电路布局，无论使用哪种半导体技术来构建芯片。也可以生产工作电路，而无需定制芯片制造，只需组装标准芯片以执行指定的功能即可。虽然设计很少严格地从抽象到具体进行，但细化概念在描述任何设计过程时都很有用。实际上，设计是在多个层面上进行的，来回反复完善细节、概念及其界面。
图 1.1 电子设计的细化：（a）黑匣子（b）架构（c）逻辑（d）集成电路布局。

半导体工艺技术 是一种根据设计规范制造工作电路的方法。此类技术有很多，每种技术都会产生不同的环境或设计风格。在本书主要关注的集成电路( IC ) 设计中，规范由导电和半导体材料的多边形组成，这些多边形将层叠在一起以产生工作芯片（见图 1.2）。当芯片是为特定用途而定制设计的，它被称为专用 集成电路( ASIC )。 印刷电路( PC ) 设计还可以使导电材料在电路板上的位置精确；此外，PC 设计将大部分电子活动聚集到标准 IC 封装中，这些封装的位置和互连对于最终电路至关重要（见图 1.3）。印刷电路可能比集成电路更容易调试，但它速度较慢、不够紧凑、成本较高，并且无法利用使 VLSI 系统如此有吸引力的专用硅布局结构 [Mead and Conway]。 绕线板与印刷电路板类似，因为它们使用的封装必须精确定位。但是，它们允许导线位置位于任何位置，只要它们连接到 IC 封装的柱子即可。此类板通常作为较便宜的 PC 板的原型制造。

A semiconductor process technology is a method by which working circuits can be manufactured from designed specifications. There are many such technologies, each of which creates a different environment or style of design. In integrated-circuit (IC) design, which is the primary focus of this book, the specification consists of polygons of conducting and semiconducting material that will be layered on top of each other to produce a working chip (see Fig. 1.2). When a chip is custom-designed for a specific use, it is called an application-specific integrated circuit (ASIC). Printed-circuit (PC) design also results in precise positions of conducting materials as they will appear on a circuit board; in addition, PC design aggregates the bulk of the electronic activity into standard IC packages, the position and interconnection of which are essential to the final circuit (see Fig. 1.3). Printed circuitry may be easier to debug than integrated circuitry is, but it is slower, less compact, more expensive, and unable to take advantage of specialized silicon layout structures that make VLSI systems so attractive [Mead and Conway]. Wire-wrap boards are like printed-circuit boards in that they use packages that must be precisely positioned. However, they allow the wire locations to fall anywhere as long as they connect to the posts of the IC packages. Such boards are typically manufactured as prototypes for less expensive PC boards.

FIGURE 1.2 图 1.2：集成电路 (IC) 的显微照片。Fairchild Clipper CPU，由 Fairchild Semiconductor Corporation 提供。照片：Ed Garrigues（点击照片可查看大图）。
FIGURE 1.3 图 1.3：印刷电路板 (PC)。AED DMA 图形界面，由 Advanced Electronics Design, Incorporated 提供。照片：Ed Garrigues（点击照片可查看大图）。

这些电子电路的设计可以在许多不同的精细化水平上实现，从最详细的布局到最抽象的架构。鉴于各个级别都要求很高的复杂性，人们越来越多地使用计算机来辅助完成每个设计步骤。使用手动设计技术（每层都需手工蚀刻或通过在胶片上贴胶带进行合成）已不再合理。因此，计算机辅助设计或CAD这个术语是对这种现代方式最准确的描述，并且其范围似乎比最近流行的计算机辅助工程 ( CAE )更为广泛。尽管 CAE 意味着更加注重电路分析，但该术语已被用来描述最近在工作站上精美包装的大量设计系统。这些系统都试图辅助电路设计。

The design of these electronic circuits can be achieved at many different refinement levels from the most detailed layout to the most abstract architectures. Given the complexity that is demanded at all levels, computers are increasingly used to aid this design at each step. It is no longer reasonable to use manual design techniques, in which each layer is hand etched or composed by laying tape on film. Thus the term computer-aided design or CAD is a most accurate description of this modern way and seems more broad in its scope than the recently popular term computer-aided engineering (CAE). Although CAE implies a greater emphasis on circuit analysis, the term has instead been used to describe the recent spate of design systems that are attractively packaged on workstations. These systems all seek to aid in the design of circuitry.

计算机在设计电子电路时可以采取许多步骤。图形绘图程序用于在显示屏上绘制电路，而硬件描述语言则利用编程语言的表达能力以文本方式实现相同的结果（见图 1.4）。专用综合程序可在设计的不同细化级别之间进行转换，分析程序有助于检查电路的正确性。最后一步是将设计转换为制造规范，以便可以制造电路。因此，计算机编程在整个电路设计过程中都用作设计活动的辅助手段和隐喻。事实上，编程和 VLSI 设计之间的相似之处非常引人注目，本书中会经常看到。

There are many steps that a computer can take in the design of electronic circuits. Graphical drawing programs are used to sketch the circuits on a display screen, whereas hardware-description languages achieve the same result textually, employing the expressive power of programming languages (see Fig. 1.4). Special synthesis programs convert among the different refinement levels of a design, and analysis programs help to check circuit correctness. A final step converts the design to a manufacturing specification so that the circuit can be fabricated. Thus computer programming is used throughout the circuit design process both as an aid to, and as a metaphor of, the design activity. In fact, the parallels between programming and VLSI design are very compelling and will be seen frequently in this book. 

SYM 内存
{
    DEF 加载 %y 加载1，加载2；
    TRAN (3,2)%270t3、%270t4、%270t5、%270t6；
    TRAN（12,2）t1，t2；
    DEF 金属扩散 md1、md2、md3、md4；
    DEF 多扩散 pd1、pd2、pd3；
    DEF 金属聚合物 mp1、mp2、mp3、mp4；
    IDEF DIFF d1，d2，d3，d4，d5；
    IDEF METAL vi，vo S=vdd，gi，go S=gnd；

    # 运行电源和接地
    W=4 vo 右至 md1.m 右 10 至 md2.m 右至 vi；
    W=4 右转至 md3.m 右转至 md4.m 右转至 gi；

    # 运行上拉 1
    md1.d 向下 1 至 load1.v；
    load1.pp 向下 8 到 pd1.p 向下 7 向左 5 向下 3 向左 6 向下 9 向右 0 到 t1.gw；
    pd1.d 右 4 下 8 右 4 下 5 右 5 到 d4；
    d4 低于 1 t2.dn；
    t1.ds 下降 2 至 md3.d；

    # 运行上拉 2
    md2.d 向下 1 至 load2.v；
    load2.pp 向下 8 到 pd2.p 向下 4 右 2 向下 6 右 9 向下 5 左 0 到 t2.ge;
    t2.gw 左 0 上 1 左 4 到 pd3.p；
    pd3.d 向下 2 向左 4 到 t1.dn；
    t2.ds 下降 6 至 md4.d；

    #连接数据线
    t3.ds 左 4 到 d1 下 9 到 d5 右 1 到 t5.ds;
    t4.dn 右 4 到 d2 下 9 到 d3 左 1 到 t6.dn；
    t3.dn 向下 0.5 向右 4 到 load1.d；
    t5.dn 向上 0.5 右 7 到 pd1.d；
    t4.ds 向下 0.5 向左 4 到 load2.d；
    t6.ds 向上 0.5 左 7 到 pd2.d；

    # 连接选择的线
    mp1.m 权利至 mp2.m；
    mp3.m 权利至 mp4.m；
    mp1.p 下降 1 至 t3.gw；
    mp2.p 下降 1 至 t4.gw；
    mp3.p 向上 1 至 t5.ge；
    mp4.p 上升 1 至 t6.ge;
}

SYM mem
{
    DEF load %y load1, load2;
    TRAN (3,2) %270 t3, %270 t4, %270 t5, %270 t6;
    TRAN (12,2) t1, t2;
    DEF metaldiffusion md1, md2, md3, md4;
    DEF polydiffusion pd1, pd2, pd3;
    DEF metalpoly mp1, mp2, mp3, mp4;
    IDEF DIFF d1, d2, d3, d4, d5;
    IDEF METAL vi, vo S=vdd, gi, go S=gnd;

    # run power and ground
    W=4 vo RIGHT TO md1.m RIGHT 10 TO md2.m RIGHT TO vi;
    W=4 go RIGHT TO md3.m RIGHT TO md4.m RIGHT TO gi;

    # run pull-up 1
    md1.d DOWN 1 TO load1.v;
    load1.pp DOWN 8 TO pd1.p DOWN 7 LEFT 5 DOWN 3 LEFT 6 DOWN 9 RIGHT 0 TO t1.gw;
    pd1.d RIGHT 4 DOWN 8 RIGHT 4 DOWN 5 RIGHT 5 TO d4;
    d4 BELOW BY 1 t2.dn;
    t1.ds DOWN 2 TO md3.d;

    # run pull-up 2
    md2.d DOWN 1 TO load2.v;
    load2.pp DOWN 8 TO pd2.p DOWN 4 RIGHT 2 DOWN 6 RIGHT 9 DOWN 5 LEFT 0 TO t2.ge;
    t2.gw LEFT 0 UP 1 LEFT 4 TO pd3.p;
    pd3.d DOWN 2 LEFT 4 TO t1.dn;
    t2.ds DOWN 6 TO md4.d;

    # connect data lines
    t3.ds LEFT 4 TO d1 DOWN 9 TO d5 RIGHT 1 TO t5.ds;
    t4.dn RIGHT 4 TO d2 DOWN 9 TO d3 LEFT 1 TO t6.dn;
    t3.dn DOWN 0.5 RIGHT 4 TO load1.d;
    t5.dn UP 0.5 RIGHT 7 TO pd1.d;
    t4.ds DOWN 0.5 LEFT 4 TO load2.d;
    t6.ds UP 0.5 LEFT 7 TO pd2.d;

    # connect the select lines
    mp1.m RIGHT TO mp2.m;
    mp3.m RIGHT TO mp4.m;
    mp1.p DOWN 1 TO t3.gw;
    mp2.p DOWN 1 TO t4.gw;
    mp3.p UP 1 TO t5.ge;
    mp4.p UP 1 TO t6.ge;
}
图 1.4 nMOS 存储单元的硬件描述语言。初始代码定义符号（负载、晶体管、触点、点）。大部分代码在组件之间布线，隐式地放置所有内容。

 

 

1.1.1 VLSI 系统设计过程

1.1.1 The VLSI System Design Process

关于 VLSI 电路的一个基本假设是它们是由人设计的，由机器构建的。因此，所有 CAD 系统都充当两者之间的转换器。CAD 系统的一端是人机界面，它必须足够智能，以便以设计师直观的方式进行交流。另一端是可用于制造电路的规范生成器。两者之间是生产 VLSI 系统所必需的许多编程和设计工具。

A fundamental assumption about VLSI circuits is that they are designed by humans and built by machines. Thus all CAD systems act as translators between the two. On one end of a CAD system is the human interface that must be intelligent enough to communicate in a manner that is intuitive to the designer. On the other end is a generator of specifications that can be used to manufacture a circuit. In between are the many programming and design tools that are necessary in the production of a VLSI system.

CAD 系统的前端是人机界面，它有两种基本操作方式：图形或文本。图形设计允许以交互方式操作电路的显示，通常使用指点设备。文本设计允许使用键盘和文本编辑器操作用硬件 描述语言编写的文本描述。例如，假设设计人员想要指定与端子耦合的晶体管的布局。这可以通过图形方式完成，方法是首先在显示屏上指向晶体管的所需位置并发出“创建”命令。类似的操作将创建端子。最后，可以通过在显示屏上跟踪其预期路径来放置连接线。要以文本方式执行此相同操作，可以输入以下内容：

The front end of a CAD system is the human interface and there are two basic ways that it can operate: graphically or textually. Graphic design allows the display of a circuit to be manipulated interactively, usually with a pointing device. Textual design allows a textual description, written in a hardware-description language, to be manipulated with a keyboard and a text editor. For example, suppose a designer wants to specify the layout of a transistor that is coupled to a terminal. This can be done graphically by first pointing on the display to the desired location for the transistor and issuing a "create" command. A similar operation will create the terminal. Finally, the connecting wire can be placed by tracing its intended path on the display. To do this same operation textually, the following might be typed: 

    晶体管位于（53,100）。
    晶体管下方的端子为30，左侧为3或更多。
    从晶体管左侧开始，再向下连接到端子。

    transistor at (53,100).
    terminal below transistor by 30, left by 3 or more.
    wire from transistor left then down to terminal.
请注意，文本描述不需要完全具体（“向左偏移 3 个或更多”）。这是文本描述的优点之一：能够不完全指定并让计算机填写详细信息。在此示例中，电路的其他部分和其他间距规则将有助于确定这些组件的确切位置。文本的其他优点包括易于口头记录、易于参数化、易于在计算机之间移动 CAD 系统，以及由于对图形显示的需求减少而使设计工作站的成本略低。

然而，文本的缺点显而易见：它不能很好地表示最终电路，因为它无法直观地捕捉空间组织。文本是一维的，图形是二维的。此外，图形在设计过程中提供更快、更清晰的反馈，因此更容易学习和使用，从而提高生产率。尽管图形不能很好地处理口头文档，但它确实提供了即时的视觉文档，这可能更有价值。即使是未指定的间距也可以通过创建抽象设计并随后充实来实现。

The disadvantage of text, however, is immediately clear: It is not as good a representation of the final circuit, because it does not visually capture the spatial organization. Text is one-dimensional and graphics is two-dimensional. Also, graphics provides faster and clearer feedback during design, so it is easier to learn and to use, which results in more productivity. Although graphics cannot handle verbal documentation as well, it does provide instant visual documentation, which can be more valuable. Even underspecified spacing can be achieved graphically by creating an abstract design that is subsequently fleshed out.

存在许多设计风格来弥合文本和图形之间的差距。这些风格试图比精确的多边形绘制系统要求更低，同时仍能捕捉图形的风格。在条形设计 [Williams] 中，电路绘制在显示器上，但元件没有真实尺寸，并且它们的间距同样不准确。 虚拟网格设计 [Weste] 也抽象了电路的图形，但它使用准真实元件尺寸来为最终布局提供一些感觉。更接近文本的是SLIC设计风格 [Gibson and Nance]，它使用文本文件中的特殊字符来指定布局。例如，“X”表示晶体管，“|”用于金属线，因此这两个字符的相邻表示连接。

A number of design styles exist to bridge the gap between text and graphics. These attempt to be less demanding than are precise polygon drawing systems while still capturing the graphical flavor. In sticks design [Williams], the circuit is drawn on a display, but the components have no true dimensions and their spacing is similarly inaccurate. Virtual grid design [Weste] also abstracts the graphics of a circuit, but it uses quasi-real component sizes to give something of the feel for the final layout. Closer to text is the SLIC design style [Gibson and Nance], which uses special characters in a text file to specify layout. For example, an "X" indicates a transistor and a "|" is used for metal wires, so the adjacency of these two characters indicates a connection.

设计系统的后端是编写制造规范的工具。复杂的电路无法手工构建，因此这些规范通常用作控制制造过程的机器中其他程序的输入。制造设备有很多种（光刻机、晶圆蚀刻机等），每种设备都有自己的格式。尽管不断有人提出标准化，但 CAD 系统必须提供的输出格式仍然有很多。图 1.5 显示了一个简单的 CAD 系统的结构，其前端和后端都已到位
图 1.5 简单的 CAD 系统结构：（a）文本（b）图形。

图 1.6 分析电路通常需要的步骤。
图 1.7 比较电路的不同版本。

在前端用户界面和后端制造规范之间是分析和综合工具，它们有助于减少创建正确布局的繁琐工作。 分析工具能够检测局部布局错误（例如违反设计规则）以及更全局的设计错误（例如逻辑故障、短路和功率不足）。图 1.6 说明了典型设计系统中分析步骤的顺序。分析工具还可用于比较独立设计的同一电路的不同版本或不同视图（见图 1.7）。

Between the front-end user interface and the back-end manufacturing specification are the analysis and synthesis tools that help reduce the tedium of creating correct layout. Analysis tools are able to detect local layout errors such as design-rule violations, and more global design errors such as logical failures, short-circuits, and power inadequacies. Figure 1.6 illustrates the sequence of analysis steps in a typical design system. Analysis tools can also be used to compare different versions or different views of the same circuit that have been independently designed (see Fig. 1.7).

综合工具有助于执行重复布局，例如可编程逻辑阵列 (PLA) 生成、复杂布局，例如布线，甚至布局操作，例如压缩。图 1.8 说明了典型综合工具的步骤顺序。随着电路设计变得越来越复杂，这些工具变得越来越有价值和数量越来越多。
图 1.8 合成电路通常需要的步骤。

当今的 VLSI 设计师会指导他们的电路完成此处概述的多个不同阶段的过程。他们必须正确控制设计的初始创建、其他细节的综合、整个电路的分析以及电路的制造准备。随着综合工具变得更加可靠和完整，对分析工具的需求将会减少。最终，整个过程将实现自动化，这样系统就可以将行为要求直接转换为制造规范。这是硅编译器的目标，目前它只能在有限的环境中通过自动调用必要的工具进行此类转换（见图 1.9）。

Today's VLSI designers guide their circuit through the many different phases of the process outlined here. They must correctly control the initial creation of a design, the synthesis of additional detail, the analysis of the entire circuit, and the circuit's preparation for manufacturing. As synthesis tools become more reliable and complete, the need for analysis tools will lessen. Ultimately, the entire process will be automated, so that a system can translate directly from behavioral requirements to manufacturing specifications. This is the goal of silicon compilers, which can currently do such translation only in limited contexts by automatically invoking the necessary tools (see Fig. 1.9).

图 1.9 典型硅编译器的结构。

当然，自从有了电路需要制造以来，人们就一直在寻求完全自动化的设计。尽管今天的系统可以轻松生产出昨天的电路，但新的制造方法似乎总是使设计能力落后于生产能力。因此，期望完全自动化是不切实际的，更现实的 CAD 方法承认设计过程需要人工指导。

Of course, totally automated design has been sought for as long as there have been circuits to fabricate. Although today's systems can easily produce yesterday's circuits, new fabrication possibilities always seem to keep design capability behind production capability. Therefore it is unreasonable to expect complete automation, and a more realistic approach to CAD acknowledges the need for human guidance of the design process.

 

 

1.1.2 设计系统计算机

1.1.2 The Design System Computer

不同计算机的数量每年都在增长。虽然推荐任何特定机器用于设计是愚蠢的，但某些要求是明确的，应该提及。特别是，大地址空间、良好的图形和有效的通信是理想的特性。

The number of different computers continues to grow with each passing year. Although it would be foolish to recommend any particular machines for design use, certain requirements are clear and should be mentioned. In particular, large address space, good graphics, and effective communication are desirable features.

大型设计会消耗大量内存。无论该内存是主内存还是磁盘内存，都必须对其进行寻址。因此，设计工作站应具有一次寻址数百万字节的能力。这意味着 16 位计算机不够用，甚至 24 位寻址也不够用。许多现代机器具有 32 位寻址，这应该能让设计师再满意几年。然而，真正具有前瞻性的机器必须具有 36 位或 40 位寻址，以避免寻址不足的痛苦。

Large designs consume large amounts of memory. Whether that memory is primary or on a disk, it must still be addressed. Therefore design workstations should have the capability for addressing many millions of bytes at once. This means that 16-bit computers are inadequate and even 24 bits of addressing will not be sufficient. Many modern machines have 32 bits of addressing, which should satisfy designers for a few more years. Nevertheless, a truly forward-looking machine must have 36 or 40 bits of addressing to prevent the agony of inadequacy.

图形显示器正成为许多计算机工作站不可或缺的一部分。虽然并非每个设计师都想要这样的功能，但在电路制造的某个阶段，它必须可用。彩色图形在 VLSI 设计中也很重要。 第 9 章“图形”讨论了许多不同的显示类型及其相对优点。

Graphic displays are becoming an integral part of many computer workstations. Although not every designer wants such a facility, it must be available at some point in the manufacturing of circuits. Color graphics is also important in VLSI design. Chapter 9, Graphics, discusses the many different display types and their relative merits.

随着计算机越来越小、越来越便宜，人们购买的计算机数量也比以往任何时候都多。因此，现代设计计算机不再是实验室中孤零零的，必须能够与其他工作站进行通信。设计师需要交换电路数据，甚至在一台计算机发生故障或繁忙时需要切换计算机。因此，需要复杂的通信设施来营造一种每个人都在使用同一台计算机的感觉。此外，还必须支持电子邮件等人类层面的通信。

As computers get smaller and less expensive, people buy more of them than ever before. Thus the modern design computer does not stand alone in its laboratory and must be able to communicate with the other workstations. Designers need to exchange circuit data and even need to switch computers when one fails or is busy. Thus sophisticated communication facilities are demanded to create a feeling that everyone is using the same computer. Also, human-level communications such as electronic mail must be supported.

 

 

1.1.3 设计作为约束优化

1.1.3 Design as Constraint Optimization

走向统一 CAD 解决方案的一步是研究设计师所需的决策过程。设计的目标是制定精确的规范，以使产品能够满足其预期用途。为了实现这一目标，设计师必须在每一步中筛选无数的替代方案。物体应该更高还是更宽？角需要圆润吗？电线应该在电路板下面还是上面走？必须不断做出这些决定，而答案取决于设计的特定要求。物体应该更宽，因为这样更稳定。角应该是圆润的，因为这样制造时错误更少。电线应该在电路板下面走，因为如果在电路板上面走，会妨碍元器件。这些收集到的信息形成了一组设计约束，图 1-10 显示了这些约束的示例。

One step toward a unified solution to CAD is a look at the decision processes required of a designer. The goal of design is to produce precise specifications that will result in a product that fulfills its intended purpose. To achieve this goal, the designer must weave through the myriad alternatives at each step. Should the object be taller or wider? Need the corners be rounded? Should this wire run under or over the board? These sorts of decisions must be made constantly and their answers depend on the particular requirements of the design. The object should be wider because that gives it more stability. The corners should be rounded because they can be fabricated with fewer errors. The wire should run under the board because it will obstruct components if it runs on top. Such collected information forms a set of constraints on the design, examples of which are shown in Fig. 1.10.

约束类
示例约束
间距多晶硅必须与扩散保持 1 微米的距离
拓扑耗尽型晶体管，源极与栅极相连，为上拉型
力量如果细电线上承载的功率太大，金属就会发生迁移
定时双相时钟先降1后升2
逻辑F F = F F T = F T F = F T T = T
包装IC 必须为 300 平方毫米才能装入 16 针 DIP
制造业制造过程中触点膨胀，因此必须缩小掩模版
粘合焊盘必须靠近外面以保持电线短
等级制度单元格的所有实例的内容均相同
布局最小金属线宽度为8微米
路由电源线和地线不得交叉
显卡顶层可见且应包含消息
测试仅可探测 PC 板的顶层和底层
缺陷芯片良率与芯片尺寸成正比
图 1.10设计约束。

有些约束是固定的，设计人员在设计开始前就知道了。这些约束是设计特定类型对象的通用规则。例如，逻辑设计人员可能从严格使用 AND、OR 和 NOT 门来构建电路的约束开始。更复杂的对象在某个时候都必须归结为这些约束。其他先验知识更为微妙，有时被认为是理所当然的，例如必须仅使用二值逻辑（真或假）而不是多值逻辑或连续（模拟）逻辑进行逻辑设计的约束。所有这些都是设计师的指导因素。

Some constraints are inflexible and known to the designer before design begins. These constraints are the generic rules for design of a particular kind of object. For example, a logic designer may begin with the constraint of using strictly AND, OR, and NOT gates to build a circuit. More complex objects must all reduce to these at some point. Other prior knowledge is more subtle and is sometimes taken for granted, such as the constraint of having to do logic design with only two-valued logic (true or false) rather than multivalued logic or continuous (analog) logic. All of these are guiding factors to a designer.

其他设计约束特定于正在设计的单个电路。这些约束的示例包括为设计选择的特定组件、电源和接地路径的位置以及时序规范。随着设计的进行，约束的数量会增加。好的设计会在最后阶段留下足够的选项，以便可以在那时进行更正和改进。糟糕的设计会让设计师“陷入困境”，最终阶段变得越来越困难，甚至无法完成。

Other design constraints are specific to the individual circuit being designed. Examples of these constraints are the particular components selected for the design, the location of power and ground paths, and the timing specifications. As design proceeds, the number of constraints increases. A good design leaves sufficient options available in the final stages so that corrections and improvements can be made at that point. A poor design can leave the designer "painted into a corner" such that the final stages become more and more difficult, even impossible to accomplish.

最难满足的设计约束是那些在权衡中持续存在的约束，由于它们相互竞争，因此没有最佳解决方案。此类约束的一个例子是同时希望保持低空间、低功耗和高性能。一般来说，这三个标准不能同时优化，因为它们的目的相互矛盾。设计人员必须选择一个方案，既能满足某些领域的特定需求，又不会在其他领域浪费太多。这方面的规则很复杂、相互交织且不精确。

The hardest design constraints to satisfy are those that are continuous in their tradeoff and, because they compete with others, have no optimum solutions. An example of such constraints is the simultaneous desire to keep space low, power consumption low, and performance high. In general, these three criteria cannot all be optimized at once because they are at cross-purposes to each other. The designer must choose a scheme that meets specified needs in some areas and is not too wasteful in the others. The rules for this are complex, intertwined, and imprecise.

鉴于设计可以视为约束优化，人们可能期望电路可以被指定为一组约束规则，计算机可以自动解决这些规则。结果将是给定约束的最佳设计。尽管这可以用于非常简单的电路，但现代 VLSI 系统有如此多的约束，以至于现有的任何自动技术都无法优化它们。而且，许多这些约束对于计算机来说很难表示，对于人类来说也很难指定。顾名思义，可以自动管理的简单设计约束一直是 CAD 工具的主要功能。这些简单的检查非常有用，因为人类经常会忽略细节并公然违反设计约束。

Given that design can be viewed as constraint optimization, one might expect that a circuit could be specified as a set of constraint rules that a computer could automatically solve. The result would be the best possible design, given the constraints. Although this can be done for very simple circuits, modern VLSI systems have so many constraints that no existing automatic technique can optimize them all. Also, many of these constraints are difficult for a computer to represent and for a human to specify. Simple design constraints that can be managed automatically have been the primary function of CAD tools, as the name suggests. These simple checks are very useful, because humans constantly lose track of the details and make flagrant design-constraint violations.

计算机不会忘记细节，但它们在对非特定约束进行复杂推理方面的能力比人类有限。最近，有人尝试使用启发式方法来模仿人类的设计方法。这些不精确的规则以模拟人类思维的方式指导复杂的过程。启发式方法并不能保证最佳设计；相反，它们承认不可能考虑所有替代方案，因此会尽力而为。这些规则规划设计的方向，消除许多不重要而不必考虑的约束，并优先考虑剩余的约束以获得合理的结果。这种对人类设计过程的建模是 人工智能领域的一部分。

Computers do not lose track of detail, but they do have a more limited capacity than do humans to perform complex reasoning about nonspecific constraints. Recently, there have been attempts to mimic human design methods with the use of heuristics. These are imprecise rules that guide complex processes in ways that model human thought. Heuristics do not guarantee an optimal design; rather, they acknowledge the impossibility of considering every alternative and instead do the best they can. These rules plan the direction of design, eliminate many constraints as too insignificant to consider, and prioritize the remaining constraints to obtain a reasonably good result. This modeling of the human design process is part of the realm of artificial intelligence.

不管是人还是机器进行设计，其目的肯定是满足约束。因此，一个好的设计系统应该允许指定约束，既可以作为对人的帮助，也可以作为直接控制设计过程的一种方式。这使得 CAD 系统能够超越哑巴画板的水平，并通过协助设计活动而名副其实。

Regardless of whether a human or a machine does design, the endeavor is certainly one of constraint satisfaction. A good design system should therefore allow constraints to be specified, both as an aid to the human and as a way of directly controlling the design process. This enables CAD systems to evolve beyond the level of dumb sketchpads and fulfill their name by aiding in the design activity.



1.1.4 数字电子设计的四个特点

1.1.4 Four Characteristics of Digital Electronic Design

要正确理解 VLSI CAD，首先必须讨论一般设计的特征，特别是数字电子设计的特征。所有设计都具有两个共同的特征：使用结构层次来控制细节，使用不同的视图来有效地抽象设计。另外两个特征更特定于电子产品：强调连接性和在电路布局中使用“平面”几何图形。

To understand VLSI CAD properly it is first necessary to discuss the characteristics of design in general and those of digital electronic design in particular. Two characteristics are universal to all design: the use of structural hierarchy to control detail and the use of differing views to abstract a design usefully. Two other characteristics are more specific to electronics: the emphasis on connectivity and the use of "flat" geometry in circuit layout.

结构层次结构将对象视为由子部件以递归方式组成的部件。例如，收音机可能有数百个部件，但将它们分成调谐器、放大器、电源和扬声器等组时更容易查看。然后可以按子组查看每个组；例如，将放大器分为第一级和第二级。当所有部件都是晶体管、电阻器和电容器等基本物理组件时，就到达了结构层次结构的底部。这种层次结构使设计人员能够可视化某个对象的整个相关方面，而无需子部件的混乱细节和超部件的无关通用性。例如，汽车燃油供应系统的层次结构视图在没有燃油泵内部工作细节的干扰下，以及没有汽车加速度要求和最大速度的无关通用性的情况下，可视化效果最好。层次结构组织是任何中等复杂对象设计中最重要的特征。

Structural hierarchy views an object as parts composed of subparts in a recursive manner. For example, a radio may have hundreds of parts in it, but they are more easily viewed when divided into groups such as the tuner, amplifier, power supply, and speaker. Each group can then be viewed in subgroups; for example, by dividing the amplifier into its first stage and its second stage. The bottom of the structural hierarchy is reached when all the parts are basic physical components such as transistors, resistors, and capacitors. This hierarchical composition enables a designer to visualize an entire related aspect of some object without the confusing detail of subparts and without the unrelated generality of superparts. For example, the hierarchical view of an automobile fuel-supply system is best visualized without the distracting detail of the inner workings of the fuel pump and also without the unrelated generality of the car's acceleration requirements and maximum speed. Hierarchical organization is the most important characteristic in the design of any moderately complex object.

另一种常用技术是使用多个视图来提供不同的视角。每个视图都包含基本工件的抽象，这对于仅聚合与设计的特定方面相关的信息非常有用。VLSI 电路在物理上可以看作是芯片不同层上的多边形集合，在结构上可以看作是逻辑门的集合，在行为上可以看作是硬件描述语言中的一组操作限制。在构建电路时能够在这些视图之间切换很有用，因为每个视图在辅助设计方面都有自己的优点。机械对象的设计者也必须使用多个视图，以便可以完全理解对象。仅使用一组平面图来设计房屋是不够的，因为那只是表达信息的一种方式。不同的视图包括管道平面图、显示日照的透视图，甚至描述房屋由不同数量的木材、金属和玻璃组成的零件清单。尽管不同的观点往往可以通过直接的方式相互推导，但分别考虑它们是有用的，因为它们各自迎合不同的思维方式，从而为设计师提供“双重检查”。

Another common technique is the use of multiple views to provide differing perspectives. Each view contains an abstraction of the essential artifact, which is useful in aggregating only the information relevant to a particular facet of the design. A VLSI circuit can be viewed physically as a collection of polygons on different layers of a chip, structurally as a collection of logic gates, or behaviorally as a set of operational restrictions in a hardware-description language. It is useful to be able to flip among these views when building a circuit because each has its own merit in aiding design. Designers of mechanical objects must also make use of multiple views so that the object can be understood completely. It is not sufficient to design a house solely with a set of floor-plans because that is only one way to express the information. Different views include the plumbing plan, perspective sketches showing solar exposure, and even parts lists that describe the house as comprising various quantities of wood, metal, and glass. Although different views can often be derived from each other in straightforward ways, they are useful to consider separately because they each cater to a different way of thinking and thus provide a "double check" for the designer.

更具体而言，VLSI 设计中存在连接性 的概念。所有电子元件都有电线从中引出，用于连接到其他元件。因此，每个元件都通过某种路径与所有其他元件互连。电路中的路径集合就是其拓扑。这种连接的使用并不总是出现在飞机或房屋等机械制品中，它们具有可选的连接性，并且通常包含不相关的元件。但是，其他设计学科确实使用连接性，特别是那些与元件之间的流动相关的学科。因此，管道、气象学和解剖学确实利用了连接性进行设计。

More specific to VLSI design is the notion of connectivity. All electronic components have wires coming out of them to connect to other components. Every component is therefore interconnected with all other components through some path. The collection of paths through a circuit is its topology. This use of connectivity is not always present in mechanical artifacts such as planes or houses, which have optional connectivity and often contain unrelated components. However, there are other design disciplines that do use connectivity, in particular those that relate to flow between components. Thus plumbing, meteorology, and anatomy do make use of connectivity for their design.

设计的最后一个特征是其特殊的几何性质。所有设计学科都具有重要的空间维度。汽车具有三维；原子结构和舞蹈编排具有四维，因为它们是经过长期研究的；音乐的呈现具有一维，另外还有不同音符的伪维度；物理 VLSI 设计由相互叠加的二维层组成。在构建设计工具时，可以利用对这种维度的理解。

The final characteristic of design is its particular geometric nature. All design disciplines have a spatial dimensionality in which they are significant. Automobiles have three dimensions; atomic structures and choreography have four because they are studied over time; music has one dimension to its presentation with an additional pseudodimension of the different notes; and physical VLSI design consists of two-dimensional layers that are placed on top of each other. An understanding of this dimensionality can be used to advantage when building design tools.

本章的其余部分讨论了设计的这四个方面，并介绍了构建 VLSI CAD 系统所需的概念。

The rest of this chapter discusses these four aspects of design and introduces the necessary concepts for the constructions of VLSI CAD systems.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第1章：数字电子设计的特点

1.2 层次结构

1.2 Hierarchy

1.2.1 条款和问题

1.2.1 Terms and Issues

VLSI 和所有其他设计的第一个重要特征是严重依赖层次化描述。使用层次化描述的主要原因是隐藏设计中的大量细节。通过将分散注意力的细节减少到层次结构较低的单个对象，可以大大简化许多 CAD 操作。例如，模拟、验证、设计规则检查和布局约束都可以从层次化表示中受益，这使得它们在计算上更易于处理。

The first significant characteristic of VLSI and all other design is a heavy reliance on hierarchical description. The major reason for using hierarchical description is to hide the vast amount of detail in a design. By reducing the distracting detail to a single object that is lower in the hierarchy, one can greatly simplify many CAD operations. For example, simulation, verification, design-rule checking, and layout constraints can all benefit from hierarchical representation, which makes them much more computationally tractable.

由于许多电路过于复杂，很难从整体上考虑，因此完整的设计通常被视为组件集合的集合，这些组件集合以递归和分层的方式进一步划分为子集合（见图 1.11）。在 VLSI 设计中，这些集合通常称为单元（或模块、 块、宏等）；在给定层次结构中使用单元称为实例。在原理图设计中，层次结构单元称为功能块或 部分；但为了保持一致性，这里将使用术语“单元”。在电路中的某个点使用单元意味着单元定义的所有内容都存在于最终电路的该点。单元的多次使用表示每次使用时都要重复单元内容。从图形上看，实例可以看作是仅显示单元定义边界的轮廓（称为覆盖 区或边界框），或者可以通过显示单元的内容来更完整地显示它。

Since many circuits are too complicated to be easily considered in their totality, a complete design is often viewed as a collection of component aggregates that are further divided into subaggregates in a recursive and hierarchical manner (see Fig. 1.11). In VLSI design, these aggregates are commonly referred to as cells (or modules, blocks, macros, and so on); the use of a cell at a given level of hierarchy is called an instance. In schematic design, hierarchical units are called function blocks or sections; for consistency, however, the term "cell" will be used here. The use of a cell at some point in a circuit implies that the entire contents of the cell's definition is present at that point in the final circuit. Multiple uses of a cell indicate that the cell contents are to be repeated at each use. Graphically, an instance can be seen as an outline (called a footprint or a bounding box) that displays only the boundary of the cell definition, or it can be displayed more fully by showing the cell's contents.

图 1.11 层次结构：（a）并行存取移位寄存器的顶层（b）触发器子组件（FF）。

某些术语通常用于描述层次结构。不包含其他单元格的实例的单元格位于层次结构的底部，称为叶单元格。不包含在任何其他单元格中的实例的单元格位于层次结构的顶部，称为根单元格。所有其他单元格都是组合单元格，因为它们组成了层次结构的主体。分离层次结构是区分叶单元格和更高级组合单元格的层次结构 [Rowson]。

Certain terms are used commonly in describing hierarchy. A cell that does not contain any instances of other cells is at the bottom of the hierarchy and is called a leaf cell. The one cell that is not contained as an instance in any other cell is at the top of the hierarchy and is called the root cell. All others are composition cells because they compose the body of the hierarchy. A separated hierarchy is one that distinguishes between leaf cells and the higher composition cells [Rowson].

按照惯例，层次结构是从深度的角度来讨论的，底部的叶单元被认为是最深的。没有层次结构的电路深度为 1，被称为扁平的。 CAD 的某些方面要求消除层次结构，因为特定工具无法处理层次结构描述。例如，许多模拟器不是分层的，并坚持将电路表示为组件和连接的简单集合。此外，许多制造输出描述通常不允许有层次结构。因此，如果电路的所有单元实例都以其内容递归替换，则其层次结构深度将减少到 1，被称为扁平化的或完全实例化的。

By convention, hierarchy is discussed in terms of depth, with leaf cells at the bottom considered deepest. A circuit with no hierarchy has a depth of one and is said to be flat. Some aspects of CAD require that hierarchy be eliminated because particular tools cannot handle hierarchical descriptions. For example, many simulators are not hierarchical and insist that the circuit be represented as a simple collection of components and connections. Also, many manufacturing-output descriptions typically permit no hierarchy. A circuit that has all its cell instances recursively replaced with their contents is thus reduced to a hierarchical depth of one and is said to be flattened, or fully instantiated.

尽管单元及其定义实现了优雅的层次结构，但它们并不总能满足设计人员的需求，因为设计人员可能希望对单元实例有另一种看法。例如，在图 1.12 中，单元“F”的内容可以用纯层次结构术语描述为由单元“C”和“G”组成。或者，单元定义可以脱离层次结构，用完全不同的图像来描述。在大多数系统中，单元实例和定义是用于实现层次结构的方法，因为定义描述了层次结构的内容，而实例通过出现在其他定义中来链接两个层次。在这种情况下，单元定义被称为与层次结构统一。但是，如图所示，可以允许单元定义与层次结构分开，这样定义就不表示电路的整体结构，而是显示实例时要使用的另一种描述。这给设计系统增加了额外的复杂性，因为每个单元必须描述两次：一次是根据其在层次结构中的定义，一次是根据其实际外观。
图 1.12 单元格定义可以与层次结构分离：（a）单元格“F”的层次结构定义（b）单元格“F”的单元格定义（c）层次结构。

1.2.2 层级组织

1.2.2 Hierarchical Organization

设计师面临的最困难的问题是为电路选择层次结构。这种结构定义了设计师思考电路的方式，因为布局通常一次检查一个层次。如果选择了错误的结构，设计师可能会感到困惑，并掩盖设计问题的简单解决方案。电路可能会变得非常复杂，以至于笨拙的层次结构比没有层次结构更糟糕。

The most difficult problem that designers face is that of selecting a hierarchical organization for their circuit. This organization defines the way that the designer will think about the circuit, since layout is typically examined one hierarchical level at a time. If the wrong organization is chosen, it may confuse the designer and obscure simple solutions to the design problem. The circuit may get so convoluted that an awkward hierarchy is worse than no hierarchy at all.

另一方面，清晰的层次结构组织使设计的所有阶段都变得更容易。如果层次结构的每一级都具有明显的功能，并且只聚合属于该层次结构的组件，那么电路就更容易理解。例如，有了良好的层次结构，就可以从底层开始完全测试层次结构的每一级，从而有效地进行模拟。良好的电路层次结构类似于编程中良好的子程序组织，这可以使代码更具自文档性。对于结构化编程和结构化电路设计，功能与结构的一对一映射提供了最终对象的清晰视图。然而，适当的层次结构组织比叶单元布局更难获得，因为它体现了整个电路的本质并捕捉了设计者的意图。

On the other hand, a clean hierarchical organization makes all phases of design easier. If each level of the hierarchy has obvious functionality and aggregates only those components that pertain to that hierarchical level, then the circuit is easier to understand. For example, with a good hierarchy, simulation can be done effectively by completely testing each level of the hierarchy starting at the bottom. Good circuit hierarchy is similar to good subroutine organization in programming, which can lead to code that is more self-documenting. For both structured programming and structured circuit design, a one-to-one mapping of function to structure provides a clean view of the final object. Nevertheless, a proper hierarchical organization is more difficult to obtain than is a leaf-cell layout, because it embodies the essence of the overall circuit and captures the intentions of the designer.

不幸的是，没有办法准确描述如何选择一个好的层次结构。电路的正确规划和实际元件的设计一样是一门艺术。因此，这里描述的技术只是指导方针；不应盲目遵循它们，而应在理解手头的特定设计任务的情况下遵循它们。

Unfortunately, there is no way to describe precisely how to choose a good hierarchical organization. The proper planning of a circuit is as much an art as the design of the actual components. For this reason, the techniques described here are only guidelines; they should be followed not blindly, but rather with an understanding of the particular design task at hand.

首先要考虑的问题是自上而下还是 自下而上的设计。在前者中，电路设计的细节逐渐增多；在后者中，电路设计的细节逐渐减少。方向的选择取决于任务的性质，在实际设计中，这两种技术几乎总是混合使用 [Ackland等人]。这种区别进一步被这样一个事实所模糊：层次结构可以用一种方法（自上而下）创建，然后实际上以相反的方向实施 [Losleben]。因此，以下示例是层次设计活动的理想图景。

The first issue to consider is that of top-down versus bottom-up design. In the former, a circuit is designed with successively more detail; in the latter, a circuit is viewed with successively less detail. The choice of direction depends on the nature of the task, and the two techniques are almost always mixed in real design [Ackland et al.]. The distinction is further clouded by the fact that the hierarchical organization may be created with one method (top-down) and then actually implemented in the opposite direction [Losleben]. Thus the following examples are idealistic pictures of hierarchical design activity.

作为自上而下设计的一个例子，考虑一个计算两个数字之间绝对差的电路（见图 1.13）。这个问题从最抽象的规范开始：仅就输入和输出进行描述。为了得到一个显示完整电路的分层组织，应该进行自上而下的设计。因此，从顶部开始，电路被分解为绝对值运算的子电路：减法和条件否定。减法可以进一步分解为否定，然后是加法。否定（在二进制补码系统中）可以分解为反转，然后是增量。整个块集可以分层划分为一位切片，这些切片逐位执行加法、反转和增量。设计的最低级别显示了实现这些功能的布局。

As an example of top-down design, consider a circuit that computes the absolute difference between two numbers (see Fig. 1.13). This problem starts with the most abstract specification: a description solely in terms of inputs and outputs. In order to arrive at a hierarchical organization that shows the complete circuit, a top-down design should be done. So, starting at the top, the circuit is decomposed into the subcircuits of the absolute value operation: subtraction and conditional negation. Subtraction can be further decomposed into negation followed by addition. Negation (in twos-complement number systems) can be decomposed into inversion followed by an increment. The entire set of blocks can be hierarchically divided into one-bit slices that do adding, inverting, and incrementing on a bit-by-bit basis. The lowest level of the design shows the layout for implementing these functions.

图 1.13 绝对值引擎自上而下的层次组织。

自上而下的层次结构的对立面当然是自下而上的。当电路的细节已知且必须正确实现时，可以使用这种设计风格。例如，假设要设计一个 4K 内存芯片，并进一步假设该内存单个位的设计已经完成。由于这个内存位的大小是芯片中最重要的因素，因此必须设计所有其他电路以容纳这个单元。因此，设计必须以自下而上的方式进行，从单个内存位开始（见图 1.14）。在此示例中，有六个层次的层次结构，从单个位开始，聚合一行八个位；垂直堆叠其中四个；在下一个更高级别堆叠八个；依此类推。层次结构的最高级别显示四个阵列，每个阵列包含 32 × 32 位。然后将具有正确间距的内存驱动电路放置在位周围。
图 1.14 4K 内存阵列自下而上的层次结构组成。

 

 

1.2.3 分支因子

1.2.3 Branching Factor

前两个示例说明了层次结构组织的一个重要属性：分支因子。将层次结构组织视为一棵树时，分支因子是任意点处进行拆分的平均数。图 1.15 显示了图 1.13 中电路的树表示。总分支因子是层次结构中任意级别进行分支的平均数。在此示例中，因子是字长函数。图 1.14 中示例的分支因子为 6.4（假设驱动器未进一步分解），该值较低。合理的低分支因子对于良好的层次结构组织非常重要，因为如果分支因子过大，设计人员将无法再一次考虑单个层次结构级别。鉴于人类的工作记忆据称包含 5 到 9 个对象 [Miller]，该范围也适用于电路层次结构的分支因子 [Mosteller]。当然，人类“组块”相似物体的能力意味着在特定级别上应该有 5 到 9 种不同的电路结构，即使其中一个结构是相同子单元的阵列。小于 5 的分支因子将过于简单，并且可能具有过多的层次深度。相反，大于 9 的分支因子可能会产生在任何层次上都具有过多细节的设计。这两种情况都会导致设计师无法有效地感知功能。

The previous two examples illustrate an important attribute of hierarchical organization: branching factor. When hierarchical organization is viewed as a tree, the branching factor is the average number of splits that are made at any point. Figure 1.15 shows the tree representation for the circuit in Fig. 1.13. The overall branching factor is the average number of branches made at any level of the hierarchy. In this example, the factor is a function of the word size. The branching factor for the example in Fig. 1.14 is 6.4 (presuming that the drivers are not further decomposed), which is low. Reasonably low branching factors are important in good hierarchical organization because, if they grow too large, the designer will no longer be able to consider a single hierarchical level at one time. Given that human working memory is said to contain from five to nine objects [Miller], this range also is good for the branching factors for circuit hierarchy [Mosteller]. Of course, the ability of a human to "chunk" similar objects means that there should be from five to nine different circuit structures at a particular level, even if one of those structures is an array of identical subcells. Branching factors that are smaller than five will be excessively simple and probably will have too much depth of hierarchy. Conversely, branching factors that are larger than nine probably will yield designs with too much detail at any level of hierarchy. Either situation will cause designers to be unable to perceive functionality effectively.

图 1.15 图 1.13 电路的分支因子。

除了关注分支因素之外，设计人员还应确保层次结构不会过早“触底”。如果层次结构的叶单元过于复杂，则组织可能还不够深入。具有数百个门的叶单元可能过于复杂。

In addition to being concerned about the branching factor, the designer should ensure that the hierarchy does not "bottom-out" too soon. If the leaf cells of the hierarchy are excessively complex, then the organization has probably not gone deep enough. Leaf cells with hundreds of gates are likely to be too complex.

 

 

1.2.4 空间组织与功能组织

1.2.4 Spatial versus Functional Organization

层次结构组织的另一个因素是分支的性质。层次结构细分经常沿着功能边界进行，偶尔沿着空间边界进行。每个类别中都有其他组织考虑因素，例如选择按数据流还是按控制流进行结构化 [Sequin]。纯功能组织是根据组件交互程度聚合组件的组织，因此计算用作互连的线路数量。这种组织对于没有与之关联的布局的电路很有用，因为它允许在不考虑任何令人困惑的物理考虑的情况下考虑功能。但是，布局必须始终在某个时候进入设计，因此在层次结构规划阶段不能忽略它。

Another factor in hierarchical organization is the nature of the branching. Hierarchical subdivision is done frequently along functional boundaries and occasionally along spatial boundaries. Within each category are other considerations for organization, such as the choice between structuring by flow of data or by flow of control [Sequin]. A purely functional organization is one that aggregates components according to the degree to which they interact, and therefore counts the number of wires used as interconnect. Such an organization is useful for circuits that have no layout associated with them, because it allows the function to be considered without any confusing physical considerations. However, layout must always enter into a design at some point, so it cannot be ignored in the hierarchy planning stage.

纯粹的空间组织是更愚蠢的做法。它假设电路是分层组织的，只是为了一次显示更少的部分，因此根据布局中的距离进行聚合。这种组织有时会追溯到需要分层操作但没有层次结构的完成的设计。如果不考虑功能交互，那么最终的组织肯定会比完全实例化的电路更难理解。

Purely spatial organization is a much more foolish thing to do. It presumes that the circuit is being hierarchically organized solely so that less of it can be displayed at a time, and therefore aggregates according to distance in the layout. This sort of organization is sometimes done retroactively to completed designs that need to be manipulated hierarchically but have no hierarchical structure. If the functional interactions are not considered, the resulting organization is sure to be more obtuse than the fully instantiated circuit.

理想的设计具有分层组织，可沿空间和功能边界划分电路。图 1.16 说明了此示例。完全实例化的电路有 12 个组件：六个 NOR 门和六个 NAND 门。纯空间组织（图 1.16b）忽略了连接性并按类型聚合组件。这是集成电路布局和布线系统在尝试将门分配给多门封装时所采用的观点。但是，它不是最佳的分层组织，因为除了其他缺点之外，它还留下了跨单元实例顶部的全局线路 [Mosteller]。纯功能视图（图 1.16c）认为两个门的每个功能聚合都值得组合成分层级别，因为它具有最小的互连需求并且具有较小的单元。这是一个更好的解决方案，但考虑到设计的性质，它仍然不是最佳的。也许最好的组织方式是图 1.16(d) 所示的组织方式，它通过将四个门与反馈线路组合在一个单元中，更多地利用了空间考虑。这使得单元连接更容易可视化，而不会牺牲功能组织。当然，所有这些细分都有其优点，并为设计师提供了不同的视角。好的 CAD 系统允许轻松进行层次重组，以便设计师能够找到最适合手头任务的结构。

The ideal design has a hierarchical organization that divides the circuit along both spatial and functional boundaries. Figure 1.16 illustrates an example of this. The fully instantiated circuit has 12 components: six NOR gates and six NAND gates. A purely spatial organization (Fig. 1.16b) ignores the connectivity and aggregates components by type. This is the sort of view that integrated-circuit placement and routing systems take when they try to make assignments of gates to multigate packages. However, it is not the best hierarchical organization because, among other faults, it leaves global wires running across the top of the cell instances [Mosteller]. The purely functional view (Fig. 1.16c) considers each functional aggregate of two gates to be worthy of composition into a hierarchical level because it has minimal interwiring needs and has small cells. This is a much better solution, but is still not optimal given the nature of the design. Perhaps the best organization is that shown in Fig. 1.16(d), which makes more use of spatial considerations by combining four gates in a cell along with the feedback wiring. This makes the cell connections easier to visualize without sacrificing functional organization. Of course, all of these subdivisions have merit and present a different point of view to the designer. Good CAD systems allow ease of hierarchical reorganization so that the designer can find the best structure for the task at hand.

图 1.16 层次化组织：（a）完整回路（b）空间组织（c）功能组织（d）功能和空间组织。

 

 

1.2.5 布局重叠

1.2.5 Layout Overlap

对于电路布局，在选择层次结构组织时还需要考虑一个额外的因素：给定层次结构级别的对象在空间上重叠的程度。有时两个组件的功能差异很大，可以将它们放置在层次结构的不同子单元中，但它们在总体设计中的相对位置非常接近。在更极端的情况下，组件和线路可以通过在不同的子单元中复制它们并使其重叠来共享（见图 1.17）。在这种情况下，单元实例的边界框会重叠，连接线会变小或不存在。这对层次结构来说不是问题，但会给检查电路的分析工具带来困难。

一些设计系统强制实施不允许重叠的方法。其中一种系统允许不规则的单元边界，以便有效地放置组件 [Scheffer]。应避免严重重叠，因为它会在视觉上分散设计师的注意力，尤其是当布线穿过单元以连接它们时。少量重叠是可以接受的，前提是设计系统允许并且不会造成清晰度问题。

Some design systems enforce methodologies that do not allow overlap. One such system allows irregular cell boundaries so that components can be efficiently placed [Scheffer]. Severe overlap should be avoided because it can become visually distracting to the designer, especially when wiring runs across cells to connect them. A small amount of overlap is acceptable provided that the design system allows it and that it does not cause clarity problems.

图 1.17 组件共享导致单元重叠：（a）一个单元（b）四个单元实例（c）四个单元实例显示组件共享。

 

 

1.2.6 参数化单元

1.2.6 Parameterized Cells

层次化设计中的一个重要问题是单元定义和单元实例之间的关系。对定义的更改将如何影响实例，对实例的更改又将如何影响定义？例如，设计人员是否可以只更改一个实例而不更改其他实例？单元的多个实例之间允许的差异量在很大程度上取决于设计环境。如果不允许差异化，则每个单元实例都将与其单元定义完全相同，并且对定义的更改将要求所有实例也进行更改。如果允许单元实例不同，则对一个单元的更改不会影响其他单元。这种可以根据环境进行不同实例化的单元称为参数化单元。

An important issue in hierarchical design is the relationship between cell definitions and cell instances. How will changes to a definition affect the instances and how will changes to the instances affect the definition? For example, can the designer make a change to just one instance and not any others? The amount of differentiation allowed between multiple instances of a cell depends heavily on the design environment. If no differentiation is allowed, then every cell instance will be exactly the same as its cell definition and a change to the definition will require that all instances change too. If cell instances are allowed to be different, changes to one will not affect the others. Such cells, which can be instantiated differently according to their environment, are called parameterized cells.

当在不允许区分的系统中更改单元定义时，更改会从层次结构的较低级别向上传播。这是因为对单元定义的每次更改都会影响层次结构中较高级别的单元定义的所有实例。相反的情况是允许参数化单元，对一个实例的更改既不会影响其他实例也不会影响原始单元定义。

When a cell definition is changed in a system that allows no differentiation, the change propagates upward from lower levels of the hierarchy. This is because each change to a cell definition affects all instances of the cell definition that reside higher up the hierarchy. The opposite situation is one in which parameterized cells are allowed and a change to one instance affects neither the other instances nor the original cell definition.

在强制所有单元实例相同的系统中，仍然允许存在一些差异。毕竟，单元实例位于不同的物理位置。一些实例可能会旋转，这表明它们的内容在整个电路中发生了改变。因此，单元实例的一些属性确实可以区分它们。真正强大的设计系统允许更多的参数化，以便实例可以完全区分。例如，随着更多输入线的添加，参数化的单元可能会改变其内容，以便它始终具有正确的电路来适应该特定实例。

In systems that force all cell instances to be the same, there is still some differentiation allowed. After all, the cell instances are at different physical locations. Some of the instances may be rotated, indicating that their contents are altered in the overall circuit. So there are some attributes of cell instances that do differentiate them. A truly powerful design system allows even more parameterization so that instances can be completely differentiated. For example, a parameterized cell might change its contents as more input lines are added, so that it always has the correct circuitry to accommodate that particular instance.

典型的参数化单元以文本形式描述，因此对实例的更改实际上是对代码行中参数的修改。这些单元参数像子程序参数一样用于调用单元定义代码并生成特定电路。以这种方式运行的系统会从层次结构的较高级别向下传播更改信息。设计系统的一个重要方面是其实现单元区分的灵活性。

The typical parameterized cell is described textually such that a change to an instance is actually a modification of the parameters in a line of code. These cell parameters are used like subroutine parameters to invoke the cell definition code and produce a particular circuit. Systems that function in this way propagate change information downward, from higher levels of the hierarchy. A significant aspect of a design system is the flexibility of its implementation of cell differentiation.

 

 

1.2.7 多设计电路中的层次结构

1.2.7 Hierarchy in Multidesigner Circuits

层次化组织的最后一项考虑是对由多名设计人员构建的电路进行适当的划分。由于这种划分通常是基于功能进行的，因此层次化组织非常适合。每个设计人员都可以处理单个单元，然后将收集到的单元集合放在一起以形成最终电路。必须对这些单元的规范进行大量规划，以确保它们能够正确连接并且可以独立设计。此外，应提前指定公共子单元库的使用，以使最终设计尽可能统一。CAD 系统必须能够将先前完成的设计混合到单个电路中。这只是使 CAD 系统可用的众多层次化设施之一。

A final consideration in hierarchical organization is the proper partitioning of a circuit that is being built by more than one designer. Since such a partition is usually done on a functional basis, it lends itself well to hierarchical organization. Each designer can work on a single cell, and the collected set of cells can be put together to form the final circuit. Much planning must go into the specification of these cells to ensure that they will connect properly and that they can be designed independently. In addition, the use of libraries of common subcells should be specified in advance to make the final design be as uniform as possible. A CAD system must be able to mix previously completed designs into a single circuit. This is just one of the many hierarchical facilities that make a CAD system usable.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第1章：数字电子设计的特点

1.3 视图

1.3 Views

设计的下一个特征是使用不同的视图来抽象对象。这当然适用于电子设计；电路设计师以多种不同的方式看待他们的工作。例如，晶体管可以绘制为原理图符号、完整的几何图形或文本语言的行为描述（见图 1.18）。类似地，反相器可以绘制为具有一个输入和一个（反相）输出的单个符号、显示转换的时间图或具有执行反相的所有晶体管和连接的完整门图（见图 1.19）。电路通常用不同的视图指定，这些表示组合起来形成完整的设计。本节将讨论电子电路的三个视图类：拓扑、时间和行为。同样重要的是保持不同视图之间的对应关系，这将在本节末尾讨论。
图 1.18 晶体管的多种视图：（a）原理图（b）MOS 电路（c）双极电路（d）行为。

图 1.19 逆变器的多种视图：（a）原理图（b）nMOS（c）双极（d）时间。

现在必须区分“层次结构”和“视图”这两个术语。这两个术语的含义比较模糊，因为从某种意义上说，层次结构组织是对象的视图，而从另一种意义上说，不同视图的集合形成层次结构。因此，存在上一节中讨论的物理层次结构，它显示了电路各部分的组成方式；电路有许多不同的视图，每个视图都可能是层次结构的；并且这些视图的组织就是层次结构。第一个层次结构是物理层次结构，最后一个层次结构是 视图层次结构。

A distinction now must be made between the terms "hierarchy" and "view." These terms blur because, in one sense, a hierarchical organization is a view of an object, and, in another sense, a collection of different views forms a hierarchy. Thus there is the physical hierarchy that was discussed in the previous section, which shows how the parts of a circuit are composed; there are many different views of a circuit, each one potentially hierarchical; and there is an organization of these views that is a hierarchy. The first hierarchy is a physical hierarchy and the last is a view hierarchy.

1.3.1 拓扑视图

1.3.1 Topological Views

电路的拓扑结构 是其结构，或描述物理部件的连接性。图 1.18 和 1.19 说明了一些拓扑视图，但图 1.18(d) 和 1.19(d) 除外，它们是行为和时间描述。每个视图都捕获了电路的一些基本抽象。最抽象的形式是架构视图，其中处理器和内存等机器组件互连。低于该视图的是组件视图，其中数据路径和寄存器连接。这通常用于描述完整的硬件设计而不提供琐碎的细节。在此之下，门视图显示所有必要的组件，但没有精确的位置或尺寸。在底部，有布局或掩模视图，显示将要制造的所有几何形状。第 2 章描述了这些拓扑视图，并表明无法精确指定它们的顺序。事实上，还有许多其他方法可以考虑电路视图的排序 [Brown、Tong 和 Foyster]。然而，所有这些观点都形成了一个层次结构，其中更抽象的表示高于更详细的描述。

The topology of a circuit is its structure, or connectivity that describes the physical parts. Figures 1.18 and 1.19 illustrate a few topological views, the exceptions being Figs. 1.18(d) and 1.19(d), which are behavioral and temporal descriptions. Each view captures some essential abstraction of the circuit. The most abstract form is the architecture view, in which machine components such as processors and memories interconnect. Lower than that is the component view, in which datapaths and registers connect. This is often used to describe a complete hardware design without giving trivial detail. Below this, the gate view shows all necessary components without precise placement or size. At the bottom, there are layout or mask views that show all the geometry that will be manufactured. Chapter 2 describes these topological views and shows that their ordering is not able to be precisely specified. In fact, there are many other ways to consider the ordering of circuit views [Brown, Tong, and Foyster]. Nevertheless, all these views form a hierarchy in which the more abstract representations are higher than are the more detailed descriptions.

 

 

1.3.2 时间视图

1.3.2 Temporal Views

时间视图捕获电路随时间变化的活动。电路时间活动的最精确视图是电压随时间变化的模拟图（见图 1.20a）。数字逻辑设计师更喜欢将电路视为更离散的过程，因此他们使用阈值将真（或“开”或“1”）与假（或“关”或“0”）区分开来。除了强制离散逻辑值外，他们还通过假设转换立即发生来离散地查看时间（见图 1.20b）。
图 1.20 连续和离散的时间视图：（a）模拟（b）数字。

当按时间描述多个信号时，通常需要查看转换并比较它们的开始和结束时间（见图 1.19d）。当切换时间才是最重要的，而切换方向并不重要时，时序图会将两个转换重叠在一起绘制（见图 1.21）。
图 1.21 时间关系：Ack 信号在 Req 信号改变之后改变。

为了将电路活动与时间联系起来，设计人员必须了解每次更改如何影响设计中的后续活动。允许每个值直接流入下一个值而无需同步的电路是异步电路。此类电路可以使用特殊结构，让设计的每个部分在完成后通知下一个部分 [Seitz]。

To relate circuit activity temporally, the designer must understand how each change affects subsequent activity in the design. A circuit that allows each value to flow directly into the next with no synchronization is an asynchronous circuit. Such circuits can use special structures to let each part of the design inform the next part when it is done [Seitz].

但更常见的是使用时钟，它以固定的时间间隔广播值。这些值迫使电路以锁步方式运行，从而使其同步。一种流行的时钟方案是两相时钟，它由两个称为1和2 的信号组成，它们交替开启和关闭（参见图 1.22）。这些值通常不重叠，因此它们永远不会同时开启（一个必须先关闭，另一个才能开启）。其他时钟方案包括单个时钟，甚至六个时钟的复杂组合。还可以有主周期和次周期，一个时钟信号在另一个时钟信号的一个脉冲期间改变多次。
图 1.22 两相非重叠时钟：两个时钟相位永远不会同时处于高电平。

对于设计师来说，最困难的问题之一是时间关系的可视化。许多同步和异步设计方法允许做出时间假设，有助于在一定程度上缓解这一问题。一个常见的假设是，在时钟的一个相位上触发的所有活动都将在该相位期间完成。但是，设计师仍需负责确保时钟相位的长度合理，并且不存在需要过多时钟时间的异常电路。当一个时钟相位中的电路活动延伸到下一个相位时，就会 出现时钟偏差问题。虽然在正确设计的情况下可以利用偏差，但它也可能导致竞争条件，即所谓的稳定值仍处于过渡状态，从而导致不可预测的结果。

One of the most difficult problems for designers is the visualization of temporal relationships. The many synchronous and asynchronous methods of design help to alleviate the problem somewhat by allowing temporal assumptions to be made. A common assumption is that all activity triggered on one phase of a clock will complete during that phase. However, designers are still responsible for ensuring that the clock phases are of reasonable length and that there are no pathological pieces of circuitry that demand excessive clock time. When circuit activity in one clock phase extends into the next phase, clock skew problems arise. Although skew can be used to advantage when properly designed, it can also cause race conditions in which supposedly stable values are still in transition, causing unpredictable results.

另一个麻烦的来源是时钟信号在芯片中传播时的延迟。这可能会导致相位重叠，预期的时钟窗口出现错误。设计人员必须并行运行时钟线以确保相同的延迟。当今的 CAD 系统对时间问题没有多大帮助，通常将最终分析留给设计人员。

Another source of trouble is the delay of clock signals as they propagate through the chip. This may cause the phases to overlap and the expected clock windows to be wrong. Designers must run the clock lines in parallel to ensure identical delays. Today's CAD systems do not help much with the problems of time and often leave the final analysis to the designer.

 

 

1.3.3 行为观点

1.3.3 Behavioral Views

除了展示电路的实际行为之外，还必须有描述其预期行为的方法。电路的行为视图可帮助设计人员抽象地直观地了解电路元件之间的相互作用。行为既显示电路的拓扑结构，又显示电路的时间活动，是可用的最高级别的描述。

In addition to showing how a circuit actually acts, there must be ways of describing its expected behavior. A behavioral view of a circuit helps designers to visualize abstractly the interactions among elements of the circuit. Behavior shows both the topology and the temporal activity of a circuit, and is the highest level of description available.

行为描述以多种方式表达拓扑结构，例如图 1.18(d)中的算法描述。硬件描述语言提供了方便的简写工具，例如将各个信号聚合为整数和总线的方法。迭代构造和宏也很常见，它们允许简洁地表达类似的行为模式。当然，行为描述应该能够处理电路的动态特性。

Behavioral descriptions express topology in many ways, such as the algorithmic descriptions of Fig. 1.18(d). Hardware-description languages provide convenient shorthand tools, such as ways of aggregating individual signals into integers and buses. Also common are iteration constructs and macros that allow similar behavior patterns to be expressed concisely. Of course, the behavioral description should be able to handle the dynamic nature of a circuit.

行为描述可以以绝对或相对的方式表达时间。绝对事件规范是从活动开始时测量的。一个例子是声称在时间零时，电路处于给定状态，而在时间t时，电路处于其他状态。更常见的是相对事件规范，因为它们很容易组合。一个例子是移位单元，其当前时间周期的输出是根据某个前一个时钟周期的输入值定义的。

Behavioral descriptions can express time in absolute or relative ways. Absolute event specification is measured from the start of an activity. An example is the claim that at time zero, the circuit is in a given state and at time t, the circuit is in some other state. More common are relative event specifications because they combine easily. An example is a shift cell the output of which at the present time cycle is defined in terms of the input value during some previous clock cycle.

时间关系可以用具有形式属性的逻辑运算符以行为方式表达。通过用这些运算符表达事件和状态，设计人员可以指定精确的时间顺序。例如，一元运算符最终意味着某事将在未来发生，二元运算符先决条件 意味着一个事件必须在另一个事件之前发生，或作为另一个事件的先决条件。以经过验证的方式组合这些运算符允许从子组件的规范中得出整体电路分析。这种静态分析是一些模拟器和时序验证器的基础。

Temporal relationships can be expressed behaviorally with logic operators that have formal properties. By expressing events and state in terms of these operators, the designer can specify precise temporal order. For example, the unary operator eventually implies that something will take place in the future and the binary operator prerequisite implies that one event must occur before, or as a prerequisite to, another event. Combining these operators in proven ways allows an overall circuit analysis to be derived from the specification of subcomponents. This static analysis is the basis of some simulators and timing verifiers.

行为描述通常以文本形式指定，因为它们本质上是算法。使用这种描述性语言成为编程中的一项任务，随之而来的是调试、文档和理解等所有问题。但是，由于设计人员通常更喜欢图形布局方法，因此没有理由不以相同的方式指定行为。因此，图 1.18和1.19 中的图形表示是描述行为的流行方式。出于图形布局的好处的相同原因，图形行为描述也是很好的。此外，由于模拟是测试行为规范的常用方法，因此图形显示最适合监控该过程。这是因为电路的许多部分可能并行运行，因此只有空间显示才能有效地捕捉活动。

Behavioral descriptions are often specified textually because they are algorithmic in nature. The use of such descriptive languages becomes a task in programming, with all of the ensuing problems of debugging, documentation, and understanding. However, since designers usually prefer graphical layout methods, there is no reason why behavior should not be specified in the same way. Thus the graphical representations in Figs. 1.18 and 1.19 are popular ways of describing behavior. For the same reasons that it is good to have graphic layout, it is also good to have graphic behavioral descriptions. Furthermore, since simulation is such a common way of testing behavioral specifications, the graphic display is best suited for monitoring that process. This is because many parts of a circuit may run in parallel, so only a spatial display can effectively capture the activity.

图形行为规范的缺点与所有图形设计的缺点相同。可移植性、口头文档和参数化的缺乏都可以通过更具表现力的图形语言来克服。图形显示的费用不再像以前那么高，但考虑到图形编辑的优势，这是值得的，只能说你付出了多少就得到多少。然而，图形编程存在一个总体问题：缺乏理论或经验。大多数编程语言及其研究都是基于文本的。任何合理的图形行为语言都必须具有程序员所期望的所有功能。在这种语言出现之前，文本硬件描述语言将是最常见的。

The drawbacks of graphical behavioral specification are the same as those of all graphic design. The lack of portability, verbal documentation, and parameterization can all be overcome with more expressive graphics languages. The expense of a graphics display, which is no longer as great as it used to be, is simply worthwhile given the advantages of graphic editing and can be defended only by saying that you get what you pay for. However, there is an overall problem concerning graphic programming: the lack of much theory or experience. Most programming languages and their studies have been textually based. Any reasonable graphical behavior language must have all the facilities that programmers have come to expect. Until such a language is available, textual hardware-description languages will be the most common.

 

 

1.3.4 查看信件

1.3.4 View Correspondence

VLSI 设计系统中的一个基本问题是维护不同视图之间的对应关系。设计师很少想在最低的布局级别上工作，因此他们通常从在架构或行为视图中指定电路开始。从更抽象的描述到不太抽象的描述的转换可以通过多种方式完成；例如，通过使用硅编译器将更抽象的行为转换为不太抽象的布局。然而，一旦转换，视图之间就很少有任何联系了。

A fundamental problem in VLSI design systems is the maintenance of correspondence among different views. Designers rarely want to work at the lowest layout levels, so they often begin by specifying their circuit at the architectural or behavioral view. Conversion from more abstract descriptions to less abstract descriptions can be done in a number of ways; for example, by using silicon compilers to convert from more abstract behavior to less abstract layout. However, once converted, there is rarely any connection between the views.

图 1.19 中的示例说明了这个问题。在行为描述和反相器原理图描述之间进行转换，同时保持元件之间的对应关系，这并不是很难。但是，晶体管描述包含更多的元件，因此在保持对应关系时会出现一个复杂问题：即保持元件功能多对一映射的问题。晶体管、它们的电源和接地连接以及所有内部接线相当于原理图中的单个元件。对该原理图元件的更改必定会导致所有相应晶体管元件的更改。但是，当对单个晶体管元件进行更改时该怎么办？生成的电路可能没有等效原理图。

The example in Fig. 1.19 illustrates this problem. It is not very hard to convert between a behavioral description and the schematic description of an inverter, maintaining a correspondence between the components. However, the transistor descriptions have more components so there arises a complication in maintaining a correspondence: the problem of maintaining a many-to-one mapping of component functionality. The transistors, their power and ground connections, and all the internal wiring are equivalent to a single component in the schematic. A change to that schematic component must result in a change to all the corresponding transistor components. But what can be done when a change is made to a single transistor component? There may be no equivalent schematic for the resulting circuit.

许多 CAD 系统忽略了视图对应问题。它们要么不提供视图之间的转换（因为它们只能在一个视图中工作），要么提供转换但不提供维护或执行。一旦电路被转换为不同的视图，它实际上就是一个与前一个视图没有任何关系的新电路。对于希望调整转换后的电路但需要确保不违反原始规范的设计人员来说，这是一个问题。

Many CAD systems ignore the problem of view correspondence. Either they provide no conversion between views (because they work in only one) or they provide conversion but no maintenance or enforcement. Once the circuit has been translated to a different view, it is effectively a new circuit with no relationship to the former view. This is a problem for designers who wish to adjust their converted circuit, but need to ensure that the original specification is not being violated.

解决视图对应问题的一个方法是将所有视图转换为一个公共视图（通常是低级门描述），然后比较结果。这有许多问题，其中最主要的是执行转换和比较所需的时间。由于时间问题，这个过程必须与实际设计分开进行，因此不太方便，因为必须经常暂停和检查交互式设计过程。此外，由于原始视图和比较视图之间存在相同的对应问题，因此很难反馈错误。最后，这种视图关联方法依赖于有效转换视图的能力。在某些情况下，可能会出现转换问题，从而毁掉一切。

One solution to the problem of view correspondence is to convert all views to a common one, usually a low-level gate description, and compare the results. This has a number of problems, not least of which is the amount of time it takes to perform the conversion and comparison. Because of the time, this process must be done separately from the actual design and so is less convenient, since the interactive design process must be frequently paused and checked. Also, feedback of errors is difficult because of the same correspondence problem between the original views and the comparison view. Finally, this method of view association relies on the ability to convert views effectively. In some cases, there may be conversion problems that ruin everything.

解决视图对应问题的另一种方法是维护视图之间的映射，并抱怨​​或阻止违反映射的更改。不幸的是，这种方法过于严格，因为设计师会希望通过重新排列组件来利用给定视图的功能。例如，晶体管视图中共享的电源线和地线在原理图中没有连接。重新排列这些连接可能会导致设计系统出现虚假的对应错误。

Another solution to the problem of view correspondence is to maintain a mapping between the views and to complain about or prevent changes that violate the mapping. Unfortunately, this approach is too restrictive because designers will want to take advantage of the features of a given view by rearranging components. For example, the power and ground wires that are shared in the transistor view are not connected in schematics. Rearrangement of these connections may cause spurious correspondence errors from the design system.

目前尚未找到解决视图对应问题的通用解决方案。但是，如果硅片编译技术得到改进，设计师不再操纵低级布局，那么与该视图的对应性将变得不重要。这实际上是当今软件编译的状态，其功能足够好，大多数程序员不需要检查生成的机器代码。

No general solution to the problem of view correspondence has been found. However, if silicon compilation improves to the point at which designers no longer manipulate the low-level layout, then correspondence with that view will be unimportant. This is effectively the state of software compilation today, which functions well enough that most programmers do not need to examine the resulting machine code.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第1章：数字电子设计的特点

1.4 连接性

1.4 Connectivity

1.4.1 网络

1.4.1 Networks

设计的第三个显著特征，也是电子学特有的第一个特征，是连通性。由于电子学涉及电荷的移动，因此所有组件都被视为它们如何在导线上来回移动信号。所有组件都有连接到导线的位置，这些导线与其他组件上的其他此类位置建立连接。因此，VLSI 设计的一个隐含约束是一切都是连接的，并且连接携带有关组件关系的信息（见图 1.23）。这表明网络非常适合表示电路。网络仅仅是通过弧连接的节点的集合。对于许多 VLSI 设计系统，网络的节点是组件，网络的弧是连接线。一些系统将其反转，将导线上的信号值视为网络节点，将信号变化组件视为网络弧。还有另一种变化是将导线和组件都视为节点，使用网络弧来表示连通性 [Ebeling 和 Zajicek]。无论以何种方式实现，网络都是电路的有用表示。
图 1.23 由连通元件构成的电路。

一般而言，除了电路设计之外，连通性用处不大。大多数物理对象的表示都是通过体积、多边形和其他空间对象的组合来完成的。这些对象没有输入或输出，因此不相互连接。但是，如果物理结构的表示不需要连通性，那么物理行为通常就需要连通性。流体流动设计是机械连通性的典型示例。事实上，流体模型经常用于解释电路连通性和行为（见图 1.24）。
图 1.24 晶体管的流体模型：（a）电气形式（b）栅极关闭（闭合）的流体模型（c）栅极打开（打开）的流体模型。

许多 IC 设计系统在工作时都没有明确提到连通性。布局采用一种绘画风格创建，该风格仅使用没有电连接的多边形来描述电路。当两个多边形相邻或重叠时，则假定它们是相连的（见图 1.25）。在这些设计环境中，系统必须根据多边形重叠的性质来推导出连接。这种困难且耗时的操作称为节点提取。此步骤对于模拟或静态分析集成电路是必不可少的。它还可用于确保布局几何确实在应连接的地方连接并且没有短路。鉴于基于几何的 IC 设计系统不了解连通性，节点提取步骤非常重要。
图 1.25 三个多边形形成一条电线：重叠和相邻表示电连通性。

在大多数原理图设计系统和一些 IC 设计系统中，连接性对于布局至关重要。必须将组件连接在一起才能形成完全连接的电路。一个重要的概念是网络，它是电路中在所有点上具有相同值的单一电气路径。任何在组件之间传输相同信号的电线集合都是网络。如果组件允许信号不加改变地通过（例如端子的情况），则网络会在随后连接的电线上继续。但是，如果组件修改了信号（例如晶体管或逻辑门的情况），则网络会在该组件处终止，并在另一端开始新的网络。

In most schematic design systems and some IC design systems, connectivity is essential to layout. Components must be wired together to form a completely connected circuit. An important concept is that of a net, which is a single electrical path in a circuit that has the same value at all of its points. Any collection of wires that carries the same signal between components is a net. If the components allow the signal to pass through unaltered (as in the case of a terminal), then the net continues on subsequently connected wires. If, however, the component modifies the signal (as in the case of a transistor or a logic gate), then the net terminates at that component and a new net begins on the other side.

图 1.26 说明了网络的概念。图中显示了三个组件：两个有源组件（它们会修改信号）和一个无源组件（它们不会修改信号）。有源组件是左侧的 NAND 门和中间的 NOT 门。无源组件是右侧的终端连接（blob）。该图还包含三个网络。其中两个已贴上标签：In 和 Out。第三个网络是没有名称的内部网络。这个未命名的网络将 NAND 的输出连接到 NOT 门的输入。请注意，Out 网络从 NOT 门的输出一直延伸回 NAND 门的输入。
图 1.26 三个组件和三个网络。

1.4.2 网络的重要性

1.4.2 The Importance of Nets

网络概念在设计、分析和制造的许多步骤中都很重要。设计人员通常希望看到整个网络，以便他们能够看到给定信号的路径。然后，该路径将识别信号的来源以及使用该信号作为输入的组件。尽管某些设计风格要求只有一个组件可以输出到网络，但是在许多设计风格中多个组件可以输出到单个网络。在某些情况下，多个输出在逻辑上组合以产生复合网络信号（称为线或或线与，取决于源的组合方式）。在其他情况下，计划电路时序，以便在任何给定时间只有一个组件输出到网络，而其他组件将具有非活动输出。因此，通过网络可视化电路的能力对于理解组件之间的路径非常重要。

The notion of a net is important in many steps of design, analysis, and fabrication. Designers often want to see an entire net so that they can see the path of a given signal. This path will then identify the origin of the signal and those components that use the signal as an input.
