Although some design styles mandate that only one component may output to a net, there are many in which multiple components may output to a single net. In some cases, the multiple outputs combine logically to produce a composite net signal (called a wired-or or a wired-and, depending on how the sources combine). In other cases, the circuit timing is planned so that only one component will output to the net at any given time, and the other components will have inactive outputs. The ability to visualize a circuit by nets is therefore important in understanding the paths between components.

网络也用于仿真，因为从抽象的角度来看，电路只是门控元件及其连接的集合。网络列表（称为网络表）忽略了无源元件和电路布局的实际几何形状。因此，如果模拟器不关心精确的时序，而只关心一般功能，那么网络和有源元件的集合就是模拟器所需的唯一信息。这类模拟器比考虑时序和布局的模拟器运行速度更快。

Nets are also used in simulation because, viewed abstractly, a circuit is merely a collection of gating components and their connections. A list of nets (called a netlist) ignores the passive components and the actual geometry of the circuit layout. Therefore, if the simulator is concerned not with exact timing but only with the general functionality, then the collection of nets and active components is the only information that the simulator needs. Such simulators run faster than do those that consider timing and layout.

 

 

1.4.3 层次连接

1.4.3 Hierarchical Connectivity

在存在层次结构的情况下，必须正确处理电路连接。当将单元实例放置在电路中时，其内容必须能够连接到该实例周围的其他组件。连接单元实例有两种方式，具体取决于它们的放置方式。当实例直接相邻时，它们通过完全由单元内部电线位置决定的组合规则进行链接 。相反，当实例由包含互连电线的通道分隔时，它们通过实例外部布局指定的 连接规则进行链接。

Circuit connectivity must be handled properly in the presence of hierarchy. When a cell instance is placed in a circuit, its contents must be able to connect to other components surrounding that instance. There are two ways to connect cell instances, depending on how they are placed. When the instances abut directly, they are linked by composition rules determined entirely by the location of wires inside of the cells. Conversely, when instances are separated by a channel that contains interconnecting wires, they are linked by connection rules specified by the layout outside of the instances.

实现组合规则有两种方式：隐式和显式。在那些仅支持几何而不支持显式连接的 IC 设计环境中，层次连接是通过确保单元定义中的布局与层次结构中较高级别的对象在空间上连接来隐式建立的（见图 1.27）。这引发了连接对齐是否准确的问题，当没有声明的连接点时，很难自动检查这个问题。不过，大多数 VLSI 设计系统都理解显式连接点的概念，这种连接点在单元定义中声明，然后可用于层次结构中较高级别的单元实例（如图1.11所示）。这种连接方式类似于编程语言中子程序参数的概念，因为其范围仅适用于层次结构的直接较高级别。如前所述，VLSI 设计和编程之间的相似之处非常显著，而且经常出现。
图 1.27 多边形邻接暗示的细胞实例连接。

 

 

1.4.4 约束规范的连接性

1.4.4 Connectivity for Constraint Specification

连接的另一个重要用途是在设计约束的编程中。许多约束指定了对象之间的关系，因此将这些约束实现为连接到电路中的特殊组件很方便。例如，假设设计人员希望在布局中连接两个晶体管，并确保这些晶体管始终保持在同一水平面上。图 1.28(a) 使用两个 MOS 晶体管和一条连接线说明了这种布局。除了布局组件及其连接之外，该图还显示了一个附加组件：称为“水平”的约束。它与晶体管的连接方式与晶体管相互连接的方式非常相似，唯一的区别是晶体管与扩散线连接，而约束与“约束”线连接。因此，该图显示了三个组件（两个晶体管和一个约束）和三个连接（两个约束和一条线）。

Another important use of connectivity is in the programming of design constraints. Many constraints specify relationships among objects, so it is convenient to implement these constraints as special components that are connected into the circuit. As an example, suppose that a designer wishes to connect two transistors in a layout and to ensure that these transistors always stay on the same horizontal level. Figure 1.28(a) illustrates this layout using two MOS transistors and a connecting wire. In addition to the layout components and their connectivity, this figure shows an additional component: a constraint called "horizontal." It is connected to the transistors in much the same way that the transistors are connected to each other, the only difference being that the transistors are connected with a diffusion wire and the constraint is connected with a "constraining" wire. Thus the figure shows three components (two transistors and a constraint) and three connections (two constraints and a wire).

约束的内容如图 1.28(b) 所示。此“布局”的元素访问数据值、做出决策并采取与更新数据值相关的操作。正是此约束与图 1.28(a) 中的布局之间的连接使其内容能够访问和操作该设计。第8 章“可编程性”将详细介绍这种约束规范样式。

The contents of the constraint are shown in Fig. 1.28(b). The elements of this "layout" access data values, make decisions, and take actions concerning the updating of data values. It is the connection of this constraint to the layout in Fig. 1.28(a) that enables its contents to access and manipulate that design. More detail of this style of constraint specification will be given in Chapter 8, Programmability.

图 1.28 图形布局约束：（a）布局（b）约束内容。

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第1章：数字电子设计的特点

1.5 空间维数

1.5 Spatial Dimensionality

VLSI 设计的最后一个重要特征是其空间几何结构没有深度。电路总是以二维形式指定，而不是制成实体模型。与这种无深度特征相矛盾的两种观点是时间和多个电路层的问题。时间是一些电路分析工具必须考虑的额外维度。但是，时间并不表示为一个完整的额外维度，因为那样会非常浪费内存。此外，电路结构不会随时间而变化，因此无需将其显示为物理关系。相反，时间是电路的抽象视图，如前所述。

The last important characteristic of VLSI design is that it has no depth in its spatial geometry. Circuits are always specified in two dimensions and are not made into solid models. Two possible contradictory views to this depth-free characteristic are the issues of time and multiple circuit layers. Time is the extra dimension that must be considered by some circuit-analysis tools. However, time is not represented as a full extra dimension because that would be very memory-inefficient. Also, circuit structure does not change with time so there is no need to show it as a physical relation. Rather, time is an abstract view of a circuit, as was discussed previously.

多层电路层为电路增加了唯一真正的额外空间维度。IC 设计必须适应制造工艺的多层，印刷电路通常使用多层板来允许导线交叉。但是，电路在第三维度上的延伸程度不如在前二维中那么大。即使是探索集成电路新分层组合的工艺设计师，也必须限制设计可能使用的晶圆上方的空间。有些人关心真正的三维集成电路的可能性，其中信号在三维空间中任意延伸，形成设计体积而不是设计平面 [Koppelman 和 Wesley]。制造此类设计的能力还不远，因此本文不考虑完整的三维设计方法。

Multiple circuit layers add the only true extra spatial dimension to circuitry. IC design must accommodate the multiple layers of the fabrication process, and printed circuitry often uses multilayer boards to allow wires to cross. However, circuitry does not extend in the third dimension to the extent that it exists in the first two. Even process designers, who explore new layering combinations for integrated circuits, must limit the space above the wafer that a design may use. Some people have concerned themselves with the possibility of truly three-dimensional integrated circuits in which signals extend arbitrarily far in three-space, forming a design volume rather than a design plane [Koppelman and Wesley]. The ability to manufacture such designs is not a near prospect so full three-dimensional design methods are not considered here.

人类进行三维设计的能力还受到大多数人机界面设备无深度特性以及人类无法跟踪复杂的三维交互的限制。请注意，即使在建筑设计中，建筑师也只使用从上方（称为平面图）、从侧面（称为立面图）和从固定角度（称为透视图）绘制的二维草图。尽管图形显示、绘图和输入设备的限制似乎比人类感知能力的限制更为严重，但它仍然是人类的限制，使我们无法有效地使用三维设备。因此，即使有能力制造真正的三维电路，人们仍然会发现使用二维交互并以可以互连的切片进行设计的 CAD 系统。目前，可以假设第三维（多层）是多个平行平面的伪维度。这不仅仅是二维，而且有许多简化，使其比三维更简单。

The ability of a human to do three-dimensional design is additionally limited by both the depth-free nature of most human interface devices and the inability of a human to keep track of complex three-dimensional interactions. Notice that even in the design of buildings, architects use only two-dimensional sketches from above (called the plan view), from the side (called the elevation view), and from fixed angles (called perspective views). Although the limitation of graphic displays, plots, and input devices seems to be more serious than that of the ability of human perception, it is still a human limit that keeps us from being able to use three-dimensional devices effectively. Therefore, given the ability to fabricate true three-dimensional circuits, one would still find CAD systems using two-dimensional interaction and designing in slices that could be interconnected. For the present, it can be assumed that the third dimension--that of multiple layers--is a pseudodimension of multiple parallel planes. This is more than two-dimensional, but has many simplifications that make it less complicated than three-dimensional.

这种设计环境（使用一组有限的二维平面）可以在一个非常不同的领域中找到：卡通动画。背景是最深的平面，每个动画角色在背景前都有一个单独的平面。这些平面之间没有复杂的相互作用：最近平面中的对象总是会遮挡较深平面中的对象。在动画行业中，这种图形风格被称为 二维半，该术语非常适用于 VLSI 设计。

This same environment of design, (using a limited set of two-dimensional planes) can be found in a very different field: that of cartoon animation. The backdrop is the deepest plane and each animated character has a separate plane in front of the backdrop. There are no complex interactions between these planes: Objects in the closest plane always obscure those in deeper planes. In the animation business, this style of graphics is referred to as two-and-one-half-dimensional and the term applies well to VLSI design.

二维半图形相对于全三维图形的优势在于许多显示算法更简单、更快速。事实上，许多彩色显示器都是为二维半图形构建的，可以高效地实现不相交的平面。 第 9 章“图形”讨论了可以在此类硬件上使用的算法。

The advantages of two-and-one-half-dimensional graphics over full three-dimensional graphics are that many display algorithms are simpler and faster. In fact, many color displays are built for two-and-one-half-dimensional graphics and efficiently implement nonintersecting planes. Chapter 9, Graphics, discusses algorithms that can be used on such hardware.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第1章：数字电子设计的特点

1.6 总结

1.6 Summary

本章介绍了 VLSI 设计过程及其特点，为理解 CAD 系统奠定了基础。层次结构是设计中的一个重要考虑因素，因为很难正确指定。此外，层次结构设计的许多方面对 CAD 系统提出了很高的要求。在所有设计中，使用不同的视图都很重要。这些视图应统一处理，以便结构与行为相关。与此相关的是视图之间的转换和对应问题。电路设计特有的一个重要特性是连通性，它与网络概念有关。连通网络不仅在电路中很重要，而且连通约束有助于使设计过程更加灵活。最后，电路基本上是二维的，这是另一个应该被认识到对 VLSI 设计很重要的特性。了解这些问题为本书中描述的计算机辅助设计工具奠定了基础。

This chapter has described the VLSI design process and the characteristics of such design as a foundation for understanding CAD systems. Hierarchy is a major consideration in design because it is difficult to specify properly. In addition, there are many aspects of hierarchical design that place heavy demands on CAD systems. The use of differing views is important in all design. These views should be handled uniformly so that structure can be related to behavior. Coupled with this are the problems of conversion and correspondence between views. An important characteristic, specific to circuit design, is connectivity, which is related to the notion of nets. Not only are connected nets important in circuitry, but connected constraints help make the design process more flexible. Finally, the basically two-dimensional nature of circuits is another characteristic that should be recognized as important to VLSI design. An understanding of these issues sets the stage for the computer-aided design tools described in this book.

问题

Questions

  1. 说出一些除 VLSI 之外的二维半设计环境。
  2. Name some two-and-one-half-dimensional design environments other than VLSI.
  3. 使用层次结构的最重要的原因是什么：（a）节省内存空间，（b）允许人类更有效地设计电路，（c）实现多人项目，（d）通过绘制边界框来加快显示速度。
  4. What is the most important reason for the use of hierarchy: (a) to save space in memory, (b) to allow humans to design circuits more effectively, (c) to enable multiperson projects, (d) to speed display by drawing bounding boxes.
  5. 设计当两个对应层次不同时视图对应方案。
  6. Design a scheme for view correspondence when the two corresponding hierarchies are different.
  7. 网络与电线有何不同？
  8. How does a net differ from a wire?
  9. 描述单元格定义与单元格的层次内容不同的情况。
  10. Describe a situation in which a cell definition would be different from the cell's hierarchical contents.
  11. “计算机辅助工程”一词的含义是什么？它是如何产生的？
  12. What is the meaning of the term "computer-aided engineering"? How did it arise?
  13. 列出一些 VLSI 设计中没有的机械设计属性。
  14. List some attributes of mechanical design that are not found in VLSI design.

References

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 2 章：设计环境

Chapter 2: Design Environments

2.1 简介

2.1 Introduction

2.1.1 原语和环境

2.1.1 Primitives and Environments

设计有两个基本方面：方法和材料。方法是创造性地使用时可实现结果的技术，材料是使用方法的媒介。例如，作家通过将句法、语法和语义的方法应用于单词、字母和标点符号来设计文学作品。雕塑家将记号笔、锤子和凿子的方法应用于木材、大理石和冰。更贴近生活，工程师通过将综合和分析的方法应用于门、电线和硅层来设计电路。

Design has two fundamental aspects: its methods and its materials. Methods are the techniques that when used creatively, achieve a result, and materials are the medium on which the methods are used. For example, writers design literature by applying the methods of syntax, grammar, and semantics to the materials called words, letters, and punctuation. Sculptors apply the methods of marker, hammer, and chisel to the materials wood, marble, and ice. Closer to home, engineers design circuits by applying the methods of synthesis and analysis to the materials called gates, wires, and silicon layers.

尽管本书的大部分内容涉及 VLSI 设计方法的自动化，但本章将重点介绍材料。构建电路的方法有很多种，每种方法的材料集合都略有不同。对于特定类型的电路，这些材料集合形成了一种半导体工艺技术。此外，在给定的技术中，存在多种电路设计风格和多种制造技术变体。这些风格和制造方法的变化产生了大量VLSI 设计环境。每个环境都有自己的一组材料，称为 原始组件。本章介绍了许多 VLSI 设计环境，并说明了每种环境中的原语。

Although most of this book is concerned with the automation of VLSI design methods, this chapter focuses on the materials. There are many different ways to construct a circuit, and each has a somewhat different collection of materials. The collection, for a particular type of circuit, forms a semiconductor process technology. In addition, there are many styles of circuit design and many variations of fabrication techniques, all within a given technology. These variations of style and manufacturing methodology give rise to a large number of environments for VLSI design. Each environment has its own set of materials, called primitive components. This chapter describes a number of environments for VLSI design and illustrates the primitives in each.

人们可能认为，电路的二维特性使得所有环境都可以简单地用点、线和多边形来描述。然而，好的设计系统会扩展这个有限的集合，以便可以进行更有用的布局。给定一组适合特定设计风格的良好基元，就可以构建任何电路，通常是通过分层聚合组件来实现的。如果基元集较弱，则生成的电路的复杂性和清晰度会受到限制。因此，正确选择设计基元是设计系统编程的一个重要方面。

One might think that the two-dimensional nature of circuits allows all environments to be described simply with points, lines, and polygons. However, good design systems extend this limited set so that more useful layout can be done. Given a good set of primitives for a particular style of design, any circuit can be built, usually by aggregating the components hierarchically. With a weak set of primitives, the resulting circuits are limited in complexity and clarity. Therefore the proper selection of design primitives is a significant aspect of the programming of a design system.

原始组件的选择对设计风格的影响之一是它确定了电路最低级别的粒度。鉴于对象可以无限细分，选择非常小的对象作为原始组件是没有意义的。由太过基本组件组成的设计将具有很大的复杂性，可能具有非常深的层次描述。例如，使用质子、中子和电子作为原始组件来设计 IC 芯片是没有意义的。相反，半导体材料区域更有意义。甚至更好的方法是使用执行特定电路操作的半导体材料的更高级别的组合。但是，选择太高的级别的组件会限制设计的灵活性。如果原始组件太复杂，当现有组件不适合给定任务时，设计人员将被迫定制特殊的组件。一组最佳的原始组件允许轻松且不受限制地进行设计，而不会引入分散注意力的细节。

One effect that the selection of primitive components has on the design style is that it establishes the granularity of the lowest levels of the circuit. Given that objects can be infinitely subdivided, it is not interesting to select very tiny objects as primitives. A design made of components that are too elemental will have great complexity, possibly characterized by a very deep hierarchical description. For example, it is nonsensical to design an IC chip by using protons, neutrons, and electrons as the primitive components. Instead, areas of semiconducting material make more sense. Even better than that would be to use higher-level combinations of the semiconducting material that perform specific circuit operations. However, a selection of components at too high a level will restrict design flexibility. If the primitives are too complex, the designer will be forced to tailor special ones whenever the existing components are inappropriate for a given task. An optimal set of primitives allows easy and unrestricted design without introducing distracting detail.

除了为设计提供合理的构建模块之外，原始组件的选择还决定了设计人员与设计之间的交互性质。当指定电路时，原始组件提供基本接口。如果组件与设计人员对所构建电路的概念不匹配，交互就会变得紧张。

In addition to providing sensible building blocks for design, the selection of primitive components determines the nature of the interaction between the designer and the design. When a circuit is specified, it is the primitive components that provide the fundamental interface. If the components do not match the designer's notions of the circuit being built, the interaction will become strained.

为了正确满足设计师的期望，应该了解设计师有几种不同的类型。每个设计师都需要一组略有不同的原语来匹配他或她的心理模型。例如，电路设计师通常关心电路的逻辑交互，而不太关心其物理布局。另一方面，掩模设计师负责物理布局，可能不了解电路的整体性质。机器架构师是不关心逻辑或物理布局细节的设计师。此人只对大型系统的抽象平面图感兴趣。现代 VLSI 工具和技术已合并所有这些设计功能，以便一个人可以指定机器、其结构和布局。此人是 VLSI 设计师。重要的是，每种类型的设计师都对设计环境的原语感到满意。

To provide properly for the designer's expectations, it should be understood that there are several different kinds of designers. Each designer requires a somewhat different set of primitives in order to match his or her mental model. For example, a circuit designer is usually concerned with the logical interactions of a circuit and is less concerned with its physical layout. A mask designer, on the other hand, is responsible for the physical layout and may be unaware of the overall nature of the circuit. A machine architect is a designer who is not concerned with the details of logical or physical layout. This person is interested in only the abstract floor-plan of large systems. Modern VLSI tools and techniques have merged all these design functions so that one person can specify a machine, its structure, and its layout. This person is the VLSI designer. It is important that each type of designer feel comfortable with the primitives of the design environment.

举例来说，假设 MOS 设计的原始组件是金属、多晶硅和扩散的矩形区域。那么，MOS 晶体管可以看作是扩散原始组件和多晶硅原始组件的重叠（见图 2.1a）。在这样的环境下，VLSI 或电路设计人员可能不会注意到对一个原始组件的更改会影响整个设备（见图 2.1b）。这些设计人员需要一个实现晶体管的单一、不可分割的组件，因为他们从这种晶体管的角度来考虑电路。掩模设计人员可以使用多晶硅和扩散原始组件，因为他们对电路的看法是不同材料层上的多边形之一。但是，即使是掩模设计人员也可以从单一晶体管原始组件中受益，只要它足够灵活，可以描述所有必要的几何形状。
图 2.1 不正确的基元使设计变得困难：（a）由两个基元元件组成的 MOS 晶体管（b）一个基元的运动会破坏隐含的晶体管。

另一个与 VLSI 或电路设计者心智模型不相符的原始组件示例是不使用连通性的组件。电路总是相互连接的这一事实已得到证实，因此 VLSI 设计的原始组件应反映这一事实。提供布局材料未连接区域的系统不如区分组件和连接线的系统直观。前者无法像后者那样捕捉网络，而且对许多设计者来说不太容易使用。因此，原始组件集必须与设计者自己对构建电路的正确方法的想法相匹配。

Another example of primitive components that fail to match a VLSI or circuit designer's mental model are ones that make no use of connectivity. It has already been established that circuits are always interconnected, so the primitive components for VLSI design should reflect this fact. A system that provides unconnected regions of layout material is not as intuitive as one that distinguishes between components and connecting wires. The former system will not be able to capture networks as well as the latter system and will be less easy to use for many designers. Thus the set of primitives must match the designer's own ideas of the proper way to build a circuit.

最后要考虑的是，原始组件的数量应保持较少。这样设计师才能学习和有效使用整个集合。任何太大的原始集合都不会被统一使用，这会降低设计质量。此外，如果每个设计师都熟悉并使用不同的原始组件子集，多设计师电路的各部分将无法很好地匹配。

As a final consideration, the number of primitive components should be kept small. This allows the entire set to be learned and used effectively by the designer. Any collection of primitives that is too large will not be used uniformly, which can degrade the quality of designs. Also, the pieces of multidesigner circuits will not match well if each designer has become familiar with, and used, a different subset of the primitive components.

总之，一个好的基元集合必须满足许多条件。对于电路设计，必须有可以连接的基元组件。组件集必须足够灵活，以生成任何电路，但又不能太过通用，以免布局中出现令人分心的细节。组件还必须以设计人员可以理解的术语来表达电路的性质。最后，集合必须足够小，以便完全学习和正确使用。本章将介绍在 VLSI 设计的各个领域中为满足这些标准而开发的不同基元组件集。

In summary, a good collection of primitives must satisfy a number of conditions. For circuit design, there must be primitive components that can connect. The set of components must be flexible enough to generate any circuit without being so general that the layout has distracting detail. The components must also express the nature of the circuit in terms understandable to the designer. Finally, the collection must be small enough to be learned completely and used properly. This chapter will illustrate different sets of primitive components that were developed to meet these criteria in various areas of VLSI design.

2.1.2 环境空间

2.1.2 Space of Environments

存在许多设计环境，每个环境在电路生产领域都有不同的用途，并且每个环境对必要的基元集有不同的要求。有些环境被认为是非常高级的，因为它们的基元由较低级别的环境进一步定义。有时会有相似但不完全相同的环境系列。一个系列内环境的激增可能是由新的设计方法、某些组件的共性或制造工艺的变化引起的。

There are many design environments, each having different purposes in the realm of circuit production, and each making different demands on the necessary set of primitives. Some environments are considered to be very high level because their primitives are further defined by lower-level environments. Sometimes there are families of similar but not identical environments. The proliferation of environments within a family can be caused by new design methodologies, commonalities of some components, or variations in manufacturing processes.

所有不同的电路设计环境形成一个可以以多种方式组织的空间（图 2.2 中显示了一种方式）。设计环境没有正确的顺序，但一般认为较高级别更抽象，最低级别更特定于制造。算法环境任意位于系统和组件环境之间，但它们代表真正跨越所有级别的不同类。环境系列也出现在此图表中。例如，MOS（金属氧化物半导体）系列包括 nMOS（n通道 MOS）和CMOS（互补 MOS），它们的功能不同，但具有许多共同的设计属性。

All the different circuit design environments form a space that can be organized in many ways (one way is shown in Fig. 2.2). There is no correct ordering of design environments, but there is a general idea that the higher levels are more abstract and the lowest levels are more manufacturing-specific. Algorithmic environments are arbitrarily located between system and component environments, but they represent a different class that really spans all levels. Environment families also appear in this chart. For example, the MOS (metal oxide semiconductor) family includes nMOS (n-channel MOS) and CMOS (complementary MOS), which function differently but share many design attributes.

等级
环境
部分
系统经前综合症处理器、内存、链接
   
算法示意图与、或、否定
时序逻辑从此以后，最终
流程图测试、计算、I/O
数据流选择、合并、功能
   
成分  寄存器传输  控制、算术、记忆
互联网服务提供商寄存器、ALU
   
布局金属氧化物半导体金属、多晶硅、扩散、晶体管
双极基极、发射极、集电极
套餐SSI、MSI、LSI
艺术品矩形、直线、样条线
图 2.2电气设计环境。

本章的其余部分将概述一些典型的 VLSI 设计环境，并描述每个环境的一组基本组件。这将说明这些环境的性质，并说明如何对 CAD 系统进行编程以处理它们。

The rest of this chapter will outline some typical VLSI design environments and will describe a set of primitive components for each. This will illustrate the nature of the environments and also will indicate how a CAD system can be programmed to deal with them.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 2 章：设计环境

2.2 系统级

2.2 System Level

抽象程度最高的环境处于系统级。这些环境将设计视为大型功能单元的集合。这些单元可以任意复杂，它们通常构成计算机系统的主要组件（见图 2.3）。这些设计中的连接也可以任意复杂，携带使用未指定协议的未指定数量的信号。原因是，在系统级，设计是由机器架构师完成的，因此确切的通信方法并不重要。重要的是特定功能块是否连接到另一个功能块。有时会指定连接的抽象性质，例如它是携带数据还是控制。然而，系统级环境通常仅用于显示设计拓扑，而不会提供过多的细节。

The environments with the greatest abstraction are at the system level. These environments view designs as collections of large functional units. The units can be arbitrarily complex, and they typically form the major components of a computer system (see Fig. 2.3). Connections in these designs also can be arbitrarily complex, carrying unspecified numbers of signals that use unspecified protocols. The reason for this is that, at a system level, the design is done by machine architects, so the precise method of communication is not important. All that matters is whether or not a particular function block connects to another. Sometimes the abstract nature of a connection is specified, such as whether it carries data or control. Often, however, a system-level environment exists only to show design topology without providing excessive detail.

图 2.3 系统设计。主要组件以非正式方式绘制和连接。

2.2.1 PMS 环境

2.2.1 PMS Environment

系统级环境的最佳示例是 PMS [Bell and Newell]。PMS 代表“处理器-内存-开关”，是此环境中的三个组件（见图 2.4）。除了处理器、内存和开关之外，此环境还具有用于链路、数据操作、传感器和控制单元的组件。实线用于紧密连接两个组件，而虚线表示次要的控制连接。可以通过定义由现有组件集合而成的新组件来使用层次结构。以下段落描述了 PMS 环境的七个原语。

The best example of a system-level environment is PMS [Bell and Newell]. PMS stands for "processor-memory-switch," three of the components in this environment (see Fig. 2.4). In addition to processors, memories, and switches, this environment has components for links, data operations, transducers, and control units. Solid lines are used to connect two components tightly, whereas dashed lines indicate secondary, control connections. Hierarchy can be used by defining new components that are collections of existing ones. The following paragraphs describe the seven primitives of the PMS environment.

铂​处理器，名称为“t”
吨​  记忆，自然是“t”
年代转变
大号关联
德数据操作
頁面​换能器，性质为“t”
钾控制
图 2.4 PMS 组件。

处理器组件 (P) 用于表示计算机的中央处理元件。这包括指令提取、解码和执行，但不包括指令或数据内存，也不包括任何输入/输出 (I/O) 设备。这种区分可能很困难，因为某些处理器具有用于堆栈、缓存或微指令集的内置内存，在这些情况下，内存被视为处理器组件的一部分。此外，所有内部状态（例如机器寄存器和状态位）都是处理器的一部分。目的是封装通常不可分割且在任何不太抽象的环境中都相同的组件。

The processor component (P) is used to represent the central processing element of a computer. This includes the instruction fetch, decode, and execution but does not include the instruction or data memory, nor any of the input/output (I/O) devices. This distinction can be difficult because some processors have built-in memory for stacks, caches, or microinstruction sets and, in these cases, the memory is considered to be part of the processor component. Also, all internal state such as machine registers and status bits are part of the processor. The intention is to encapsulate a component that is typically indivisible and the same in any less abstract environment.

内存组件 (M) 通常连接到处理器。虽然不需要指定确切的内存量，但内存的性质会作为组件字母的下标给出。例如，M p表示主内存，这可能将其与辅助内存、快速内存、双端口内存或给定 PMS 图中任何其他方案区分开来。

Memory components (M) are generally connected to processors. Although the precise amount of memory need not be specified, the nature of the memory is given as a subscript on the component letter. For example, Mp indicates primary memory, which might distinguish it from secondary memory, fast memory, double-ported memory, or any other scheme in a given PMS diagram.

开关 (S) 是用于以可控方式连接多个对象的通用组件。开关可用于在处理器上的多个 I/O 设备、多个内存甚至多个处理器组件之间进行选择。它们出现在 PMS 图中表示可以选择使用连接组件。

A switch (S) is a general component for joining multiple objects in a controllable fashion. Switches can be used to select among multiple I/O devices on a processor, multiple memories, or even multiple processor components. Their presence in a PMS diagram indicates that there is a choice in the use of the connecting components.

链路 (L) 用于表示不寻常的连接配置。例如，两个独立处理器之间的连接通常使用某种跨物理距离传输信息的链路。总线、网络和电话线都是链路。某些处理器不需要链路进行通信，例如，如果它们共享内存或直接与公共内部状态相连。

The link (L) is used to indicate an unusual connection configuration. For example, the connection of two separate processors is frequently done with some sort of link that moves information across physical distances. Buses, networks, and telephone lines are all links. Some processors do not need links to communicate if, for example, they share memory or are directly connected with common internal state.

数据操作 (D) 是生成数据的任何功能块。该类别包括处理器，但实际上旨在涵盖执行输入的设备，例如数字化器和键盘。数据操作的对立面是传感器 (T)，它获取数据并将其转换为其他用途。所有输出设备都是传感器，包括打印机、显示器和机器人。

A data operation (D) is any functional block that generates data. The category includes processors but is really meant to cover those devices that perform input, such as digitizers and keypads. The opposite of a data operation is a transducer (T), which takes data and transforms them for some other use. All output devices are transducers, including printers, displays, and robots.

PMS 环境的最后一个基本组件是控制单元 (K)。控制单元是使另一个组件运行的单元。因此，要使传感器或数据操作工作，需要一个控制单元。处理器是唯一具有控制权的其他组件，因此它们可以在需要更多智能的情况下取代这些控制单元。

The final primitive component of the PMS environment is the control unit (K). A control unit is one that causes another component to function. Thus, to make a transducer or data operation work, a control unit is needed. Processors are the only other components that have control and so they can replace these control units in situations that demand more intelligence.

PMS 符号已用于描述计算机系统的配置 [Bell and Newell；Siewiorek, Bell and Newell]。它在描述计算机网络时特别有用，因为它可以简明扼要地显示组件。图 2.5 显示了图 2.3 中计算机网络的 PMS 图。请注意非正式使用下标来限定组件，使用上标来表示重复。
图 2.5 图 2.3 中计算机网络的 PMS 描述。下标表示组件属性，上标表示重复。

PMS 是系统级环境的正式示例。许多不太正式的环境用于系统描述，例如图 2.3 中的示例。还有能够表达抽象结构描述的文本硬件描述语言 [VanCleemput]。系统级环境的重要方面是设计独立于物理布局，描述总体功能，并且可用于轻松捕获整个 VLSI 系统。

PMS is a formal example of a systems-level environment. Many less formal environments are used for system description, such as the example in Fig. 2.3. There are also textual hardware-description languages that are able to express abstract structural descriptions [VanCleemput]. The important aspect of systems level environments is that design is independent of physical layout, describes gross functionality, and can be used to capture easily entire VLSI systems.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 2 章：设计环境

2.3 算法层面

2.3 Algorithm Level

在从布局专用到系统通用的一系列环境中，有一组环境比前面描述的机器架构更详细，但没有与之相关的电路布局。这些环境指定了设计的精确功能或算法，但没有提供算法如何实现的指示。

Somewhere in the continuum of environments that ranges from layout-specific to system-general are a set of environments that are more detailed than are the previously described machine architectures, but that have no circuit layout associated with them. These environments specify the precise function or algorithm of a design without providing an indication of how the algorithm is realized.

最流行的算法级环境是原理图，它使用逻辑组件来实现布尔函数。时间逻辑是标准逻辑的扩展，特别适合电子电路规范。指定算法的另一种方法是使用流程图，该流程图传递控制流或数据流。当然，指定算法的最常见方法是使用编程语言。但是，文本语言总是可以通过流程图以图形方式实现。因此，出于本讨论的目的，编程语言不会与控制流和数据流环境分开考虑。

The most popular algorithm-level environment is the schematic, which uses logic components to implement Boolean functions. Temporal logic is an extension of standard logic that is particularly well suited to electronic circuit specification. Another way to specify an algorithm is with a flowchart that passes either flow of control or flow of data. Of course, the most common way of specifying algorithms is with programming languages. However, textual languages can always be implemented graphically by flowcharting them. Therefore, for the purposes of this discussion, programming languages will not be considered separately from the control-flow and dataflow environments.

2.3.1 原理图环境

2.3.1 Schematic Environment

原理图 是电子电路的简笔画。绘制原理图的过程有时称为 原理图捕获，因为它以图形方式表示电路。它非常灵活和抽象，许多电路设计都是以这种方式开始的，随后被转换成其他特定于布局的环境进行制造。综合工具（在第 4 章中描述）可以将原理图转换成布局，从而生成印刷电路、集成电路等。最终，这些工具将能够可靠地从高级输入（例如系统级环境）转换为低级布局（优化电路，而不是高度规则的布局）。在此之前，原理图环境将非常流行。

A schematic is a stick-figure drawing of an electronic circuit. The process of drawing a schematic is sometimes called schematic capture because it graphically represents the circuit. It is so flexible and abstract that many circuit designs start this way and are subsequently translated into some other layout-specific environment for manufacturing. Synthesis tools (described in Chapter 4) can translate a schematic into layout, producing printed circuits, integrated circuits, and more. Eventually, these tools will be able to translate reliably from higher-level input (for example system-level environments) into lower-level layout (optimized circuitry as opposed to highly regular layout). Until such time, the schematic environment will be very popular.

在数字电子设计中，原理图元件严格为布尔型，连接这些逻辑元件的线路带有真值。对于每个可以进行原理图设计的 CAD 系统，设计师可以使用一组不同的逻辑门。在纯逻辑中有四种运算：NOT（¬）、AND（）、OR（）和 IMPLICATION（），但常见的做法还包括 EXCLUSIVE OR（）。这些运算在图 2.6 的真值表中显示。

In digital electronic design, the schematic components are strictly Boolean and the wires that connect these logical elements carry truth values. For every CAD system that can do schematic design, there is a different set of logic gates available to the designer. In pure logic there are four operations: NOT (¬), AND (), OR (), and IMPLICATION (), but common practice also includes EXCLUSIVE OR (). These operations are presented in a truth table in Fig. 2.6.

和
或者
  含义  
  否定  
  排他或  
 一个 
 乙 
  乙​  
  乙​  
乙​
¬A
乙​
F
F
F
F
电视
电视
F
F
电视
F
电视
电视
电视
电视
电视

F
电视
F
F
电视
电视
电视
电视

F
图 2.6真值表。

设计人员经常将这些功能组合成更复杂的符号，这些符号被视为原始组件。例如，NAND（）只是 AND 的 NOT（结果被否定，而不是输入项）。图 2.7 显示了一些典型的逻辑符号及其变体。请注意，原理图环境中只有一个连接：布尔值，它带有true或false。

Designers often combine these functions into more complex symbols that are treated like primitive components. For example, NAND () is simply the NOT of AND (the result is negated, not the input terms). Figure 2.7 shows some typical logic symbols and their variations. Notice that there is only one connection in the schematic environment: the Boolean that carries either true or false.

图 2.7 逻辑门。

在某些情况下，不同逻辑门的数量太多，最好通过用少数几个来表示所有逻辑门来减少组件的数量。例如，仅使用一个组件（NAND 门），就可以推导出所有先前的逻辑运算：

In some situations, the number of different logic gates is too great and it is desirable to reduce the number of components by expressing all of them in terms of a few. For example with just one component, the NAND gate, all the previous logical operations can be derived:

¬一个一个 ​
乙 ​（a b）（a b）
乙 ​（a a）（b b）
乙 ​一个 （b b）
乙 ​（a （a b））（b （a b））

这些操作由一组等价规则辅助，这些规则解释了一个逻辑符号如何用另一个逻辑符号来表达。为了证明这些逻辑等价性，数学家们开发了一组 公理。只要这些公理为真，就可以进行任何逻辑操作。例如，无论a、b或c的值如何，以下九条公理始终为真[Bell and Slomson]：

These manipulations are aided by sets of equivalence rules that explain how one logic symbol can be expressed in terms of another. To prove these logical equivalences, mathematicians have developed sets of axioms. Given these axioms as truths, any logical manipulations can be done. For example, the following nine axioms are always true, regardless of the values of a, b, or c [Bell and Slomson]:

一个（乙）​
（a（bc ））(( a b ) ( a c ))
（¬a¬b ）​​（乙 ） ​
（一二）​一个
（一二）​b
（一二）​(( a c ) ( a ( b c )))
一个（一二）​
b（一二）​
（一二）​(( c b ) (( a c ) b ))

这些表达式足以定义所有逻辑，因为任何真实语句都可以被操纵成其中之一。

These expressions are sufficient to define all logic because any true statement can be manipulated into one of them.

除了逻辑门之外，还必须有一些用于存储数据的空间。 图 1.11(b)显示了使用 AND、OR、NOT 和 NAND 门设计的触发器。该电路可以用电子方式构建，以便正确存储单个数据位。通过添加这样的存储设施，可以完成任何功能设计。

In addition to logic gates, there must be some accommodation for storage of data. Figure 1.11(b) shows the design of a flip-flop using AND, OR, NOT, and NAND gates. This circuit can be built electronically so that it correctly stores a single bit of data. With the addition of such a memory facility, any functional design can be done.

图 2.8 示意图的军用标准图形。

对于 CAD 工具的构建者来说，知道如何绘制所有这些原理图元素是很有用的。美国政府在一份名为《军用标准806B》[国防部]的文件中对绘图样式进行了标准化。该标准提供了图形的适当比例，并解释了当输入行很多时如何扩展符号（见图 2.8）。此外，该标准还提供了缩写的含义（C 表示“清除”，FF 表示“触发器”，RG 表示“寄存器”等等）以及注释在主体上的适当位置（顶行表示功能，中间行表示硬件类型，底行表示物理位置；见图 2.9）。尽管这项标准并未得到严格遵循，并且在某些方面并不完善，但它确实为原理图系统程序员提供了一个起点。
图 2.9 原理图主体上的军用标准注释位置。

 

 

2.3.2 伪布局环境

2.3.2 Pseudolayout Environments

尽管原理图提供了一种抽象指定电路的好方法，但布局必须在某个时候完成。为了帮助转换，有许多设计环境具有原理图的感觉，但更接近布局。这些环境通常针对布局的某些方面进行具体说明，而对其余方面进行抽象说明。

Although schematics provide a good way of abstractly specifying a circuit, layout must be done at some time. To help with the conversion, there are a number of design environments that have the feel of schematics yet are much closer to layout. These environments are typically specific about some aspect of layout while abstract about the rest.

sticks 环境对于元件的相对位置有明确的规定，但对于元件的大小和确切尺寸却很抽象 [Williams]。晶体管被画成带有无尺寸连接线的火柴人形（见图 2.10）。这种设计比原理图具体得多，因为不允许使用抽象逻辑门。相反，只存在那些可以直接在硅片中实现的元件。要将此环境转换为实际布局，需要将元件扩展为适当的尺寸，为导线提供实际的硅层，并调整距离以符合设计规则。sticks 环境必须针对特定类型的布局进行定制。虽然大多数用于 MOS 布局，但也有一些用于双极设计 [Szabo、Leask 和 Elmasry]。
图 2.10 Sticks nMOS 反相器布局。“N”为下拉晶体管，“P”为耗尽型晶体管；“X”为触点。

用于布局的另一种抽象环境是虚拟网格 [Weste]。与条状物一样，只能使用最终布局中出现的那些元件。但是，虚拟网格会绘制具有标称尺寸的所有元件，尽管这些元件的尺寸与最终尺寸不符，但确实能给人一种几何感（见图 2.11）。虚拟网格设计的另一个重要特征是，在生成真实布局时会保留相对间距。因此，水平或垂直排列的两个晶体管即使没有连接，也会保持成一线。这是因为转换为布局只是一个将实际坐标分配给虚拟网格坐标的过程。这使得转换非常简单，同时保留了设计环境的抽象性质。
图 2.11 虚拟电网 nMOS 反相器布局。

另一个伪布局环境是SLIC [Gibson and Nance]，它使用文本字母描述布局组件的放置。这些字母的数组显示在视频终端上，显示组件的放置和连接线。特殊字母区分水平线和垂直线，并允许指定正确的连接性。

Yet another pseudolayout environment is SLIC [Gibson and Nance], which describes layout component placement using text letters. An array of these letters, displayed on a video terminal, shows component placement and connecting wires. Special letters distinguish horizontal from vertical wires, and allow correct connectivity to be specified.

 

 

2.3.3 时序逻辑环境

2.3.3 Temporal Logic Environment

传统逻辑的一个问题是它本身不以任何方式处理时间。一种解决方案是使用当前时间参数化逻辑值，从而得到如下表达式：

One problem with traditional logic is that it does not inherently deal with time in any way. One solution is to parameterize logic values with the current time, resulting in expressions like:

W(t) I(t) O(t + 1)

这意味着“如果在时间t工作，并且输入在时间t可用 ，那么在时间t + 1会有输出。”但是，由于这种结构使用起来可能很不方便，最近的工作已转向使用时间逻辑，这是一种模态逻辑，其运算符应用于随时间变化的状态序列。虽然已经使用了许多时间逻辑公式，但本节将讨论一种已应用于电子电路描述的方法 [Malachi 和 Owicki]。

which means "if working at time t, and inputs are available at time t, then there will be outputs at time t + 1." However, because this structure can be awkward to use, recent work has turned to using temporal logic, a modal logic that has operators applying to sequences of states over time. Although many formulations of temporal logic have been used, this section will discuss one method that has been applied to electronic circuit descriptions [Malachi and Owicki].

可以使用四个基本运算符来描述随时间变化的状态属性。符号表示“最终”，它在表达式“ p ”中的使用表示p将在未来的某个时间点为真（或在现在为真）。符号表示“从今以后”，表示其操作数现在和将来的所有时间点都为真。符号表示“下一个”，表示其操作数将在下一时刻为真。最后，符号U表示“直到”，在双操作数意义上使用“ p U q ”，表示从现在开始直到q第一次为真， p始终为真。

Four basic operators can be used to describe state properties over time. The symbol means "eventually" and its use in the expression "p" means that p will be true at some future time (or is true in the present). The symbol means "henceforth" and indicates that its operand is true now and at all future times. The symbol means "next" and indicates that its operand will be true in the very next moment of time. Finally, the symbol U means "until" and is used in a two-operand sense "p U q" to mean that p is true at all times from now until the first instance that q is true.

与纯逻辑一样，一组公理将这些运算符联系起来，并展示它们如何相互定义。例如，

As with pure logic, a set of axioms relate these operators and show how they are used to define each other. For example,

嗯嗯嗯嗯​​

表示“从今以后” p意味着p现在、在下一个间隔以及从此以后在该间隔之后都必须为真。时间逻辑的一个更简单的同义反复是：

states that "henceforth" p implies that p must be true now, at the next interval, and henceforth beyond that interval. A simpler tautology of temporal logic is:

芫 ​​​

除了基本运算符之外，定义从原始集合派生的新运算符也很常见。这些新运算符更适合电路设计，因为它们的行为方式对设计人员来说更直观。因此，“锁存同时”运算符定义为：

In addition to basic operators, it is common to define new operators that are derived from the original set. These new operators are better suited to circuit design because they behave in ways that are more intuitive to designers. Thus the "latched while" operator is defined as:

p LW q p (p U ¬q)

这意味着，当p为真时，只要 q保持为真，它就会保持这种状态。另一个在定义系统活性方面很重要的派生运算符是“蕴涵”（）：

meaning that, when p is true, it will remain that way as long as q remains true. Another derived operator that is important in defining the liveness of a system is "entails" ():

qq​ ​ ​

这意味着p 的真实性要求q的最终真实性。

meaning that the truth of p demands the eventual truth of q.

时序逻辑非常适合描述数字电路随时间的变化。这是因为它可以描述单个组件或一组并行活动的行为。事实上，只要指定了电路的行为，就可以找到某种形式的时序逻辑。基本时序逻辑的变体可以提高其表达能力。例如，区间时序逻辑概括了基本方案，以便可以方便地描述时间子区间 [Moszkowski]。

Temporal logic is well suited to the description of digital circuits over time. This is because it can describe the behavior of a single component or a collection of parallel activities. In fact, some form of temporal logic can be found wherever the behavior of circuits is specified. Variations on basic temporal logic exist to improve its expressiveness. For example interval temporal logic generalizes the basic scheme so that subintervals of time can be conveniently described [Moszkowski].

 

 

2.3.4 流程图环境

2.3.4 Flowcharting Environment

流程图是一种通用算法环境，通常用于以图形方式表示文本语言。通常，流程图的组件对数据进行操作，流程图中的连接表示控制流。流程图中的每个组件都可以任意复杂，因为它包含对其操作的英语描述。但是，通常只有一组有限的组件执行不同类别的操作。

Flowcharting is a general-purpose algorithm environment that is often used to represent textual languages graphically. Typically, the components of a flowchart operate on data and the connections in a flowchart indicate flow of control. Each component in a flowchart can be arbitrarily complex because it contains an English-language description of its operation. Typically, however, there are a limited set of components that perform distinct classes of operations.

图 2.12 显示了最常用于基于控制的流程图的四个基本原语。计算组件用于所有数据操作，实际功能写在框中。决策组件用于进行任意测试和修改控制流。I/O 组件表示对设备的控制。连接器组件用于特殊的控制流情况，例如多页设计中需要的情况或程序终止的情况。图 2.17中的布局（本章后面显示）是基于控制的流程图规范的一个示例，但它没有区分组件类型，因为它是一个不同的环境（寄存器传输）。

Figure 2.12 shows the four basic primitives that are most often used to do control-based flowcharting. The computation component is used for all data manipulations, with the actual function written in the box. The decision component is used to make arbitrary tests and modify the flow of control. The I/O component indicates control of devices. The connector component is used for special control flow cases such as are necessary in multipage designs or for program termination. The layout in Fig. 2.17 (shown later in this chapter) is an example of a control-based flowchart specification, but it does not differentiate the component types because it is a different environment (register transfer).

图 2.12 控制流组件。

控制流规范的一种略有不同的样式是使用状态图。状态图的组件执行可能改变全局状态的操作。组件之间的每个连接都标有状态，这样只有一个连接会匹配并将控制权指向另一个组件。状态图是一种非常正式的表达算法的方式，与流程图相反，流程图对操作和测试的规则不精确。

A somewhat different style of control-flow specification is the use of state diagrams. The components of a state diagram perform actions that may alter a global state. The connections between components are each labeled with a state, such that only one connection will match and direct the control to another component. State diagrams are a very formal way of expressing an algorithm, as opposed to flowcharting, which has imprecise rules for actions and tests.

 

 

2.3.5 数据流环境

2.3.5 Dataflow Environment

数据流编程是常用流程图技术的一种变体，因为组件之间的连接携带数据值而不是控制调用 [Rodriguez]。这意味着并行活动更容易指定，并且算法的操作由数据的存在而不是“启动”信号驱动。

Dataflow programming is a twist on the commonly used flowcharting technique because the connections between components carry data values rather than control invocation [Rodriguez]. This means that parallel activity is easier to specify and that the operation of an algorithm is driven by the presence of data rather than a "start" signal.

数据流程序的组件称为参与者[Dennis]，可以使用的参与者有很多。图 2.13 显示了一组典型的数据流参与者 [Davis and Drongowski]。数据流参与者仅在一组预定的输入行有数据值等待时才起作用。这组输入称为触发集。当触发集可用时，参与者执行并为其他参与者生成输出值。保证任何输入行上待处理的数据值不超过一个的数据流网络是安全的[Patil]。
图 2.13 数据流原语。当数据在正确的输入线上准备好时，活动就开始发生。

以下段落概述的七个参与者足以描述任何计算。事实上，其中一些是多余的，纯粹是为了方便而存在的。

The seven actors outlined in the following paragraphs are sufficient to describe any computation. In fact, some of them are redundant and exist purely for convenience.

并行计算的启动只需将一个参与者的输出传送到多个其他参与者的输入即可。然后，所有接收输入数据的参与者开始运行，从而创建并行执行序列。这些并行路径的同步由“同步”参与者完成，该参与者等待其所有输入都有数据，然后同时将每个输入值传递给输出值。因此，该参与者同步在不同时间完成的并行数据路径。

The initiation of parallel computation is done simply by having one actor's output go to the input of multiple other actors. Then all the actors that receive input data begin operation, creating parallel execution sequences. Synchronization of these parallel paths is done with the "synch" actor that waits for all of its inputs to have data and then passes each input value to an output value at the same time. Therefore this actor synchronizes parallel data paths that complete at different times.

“运算符”参与者是一个通用函数原语，可以执行任何算术或逻辑运算。当将操作名称放在参与者符号内并使用正确数量的输入和输出时，运算符将以正确的方式运行。例如，具有三个输入和一个输出的“+”参与者将等待所有三个数据值都存在，然后在输出上产生它们的总和。

The "operator" actor is a general-purpose function primitive that can perform any arithmetic or logical operation. When the operation name is placed inside the actor symbol and the correct number of inputs and outputs are used, the operator functions in the proper manner. For example, the "+" actor with three inputs and one output will wait for all three data values to be present and then produce their sum on the output.

“过程”参与者与“运算符”参与者类似，不同之处在于它用于程序员定义的函数。数据流子程序的名称放在符号内，表示当出现适当的输入时将运行此代码。此参与者和“运算符”参与者都是子程序调用，但前者用于高级过程，而后者用于低级库函数。

The "procedure" actor is similar to the "operator" actor except that it is used for programmer-defined functions. The name of a dataflow subroutine is placed inside the symbol as an indication that this code is to be run when the appropriate inputs appear. Both this actor and the "operator" actor are subroutine calls, but the former is for higher-level procedures whereas the latter is for low-level library functions.

“distribute”actor 用于根据索引值在多个输出路径中进行选择。当输入和索引行都有数据时，此actor 将输入值发送到索引值指定的输出行。此actor 有点像传统编程语言中的“case”语句，也用于更简单的“if”类​​型分支。

The "distribute" actor is used to select among multiple output paths according to an index value. When the input and the index lines have data, this actor sends the input value to the output line specified by the index value. This actor is somewhat like a "case" statement in traditional programming languages and is also used for simpler "if"-type branching.

“选择”和“仲裁”参与者在概念上与“分配”相反，因为它们以受控的方式将多个输入值减少为单个输出值。在“选择”参与者的情况下，使用索引来确定将使用哪个输入。当索引和索引输入存在时，该输入将传递到输出。“仲裁”不需要任何特定输入；相反，只要出现任何输入，它就会执行，生成输入及其索引作为输出。“选择”和“仲裁”都将多个输入减少为单个输出：一个需要预先确定的输入选择，另一个报告自己的选择。

The "select" and "arbiter" actors are conceptually the opposite of "distribute" because they reduce multiple input values to a single output value in a controlled manner. In the case of the "select" actor, an index is used to determine which input will be used. When the index and the indexed input are present, that input is passed to the output. The "arbiter" does not need any particular input; rather, it executes as soon as any input appears, generating both the input and its index as outputs. Both "select" and "arbiter" reduce many inputs to a single output: One requires a predetermined choice of inputs and the other reports its own choice.

此特定数据流环境的最后一个参与者是“门”，用于循环控制。此参与者有三个输入和一个输出。条件输入充当开关，用于在初始输入和反馈输入之间进行选择。当循环未处于活动状态时，条件为假，这会导致初始值传递到输出。一旦将此初始值传递到输出，循环就会被激活。活动的“门”参与者会忽略初始值并将反馈值传递到输出。当条件输入为真时，此过程将继续。当此条件变为假时，循环终止，反馈值将被忽略，并等待新的初始值以重新启动循环。

The final actor of this particular dataflow environment is the "gate," which is used for loop control. This actor has three inputs and an output. The condition input acts as a switch to select between the initial input and the feedback input. When the loop is not active, the condition is false, which causes the initial value to be passed to the output. Once this initial value is passed to the output, the loop is activated. Active "gate" actors ignore the initial value and pass the feedback value to the output. This continues while the condition input is true. When this condition becomes false, the loop terminates, the feedback values are ignored, and a new initial value is awaited to restart the loop.

这里描述的数据流参与者可用于编写任意复杂的算法。图 2.14 中的设计显示了以递归和并行方式计算斐波那契数。请注意，此子例程从底部开始，输入参数，然后过滤到顶部，返回函数值。此布局仅使用“运算符”、“过程”、“选择”和“分发”参与者，因此不使用环境中可用的强大并发控制。尽管如此，图形指定的数据流对于设计串行和并行算法来说都是有用的环境。
图 2.14 斐波那契数列的数据流布局。数据流从底部开始，然后向上过滤。

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 2 章：设计环境

2.4 组件级别

2.4 Component Level

定义一类设计环境的下一个抽象级别是组件级别。此类环境通常由执行少量算术或逻辑运算的原语组成。例如，加法器或一小块内存是可接受的组件级原语，但整个处理器或完全接口的内存组通常不是。

The next level of abstraction that defines a class of design environments is the component level. Environments of this type are usually composed of primitives that perform a small number of arithmetic or logical operations. For example, an adder or a small block of memory are acceptable component-level primitives, but an entire processor or a fully interfaced bank of memory are generally not.

组件级存在许多不同的环境。 寄存器传输是一种用于描述处理器设计的环境。ISP 是一种用于描述计算机指令集及其实现方式的语言。即使是集成电路封装，尽管其功能变化很大，也形成了一个常用的组件级环境。然而，这也是一个布局环境，因此稍后将对其进行讨论 。

A number of different environments exist at the component level. Register transfer is an environment that is used to describe the design of processors. ISP is a language that is used to describe the instruction set of a computer and how those instructions are implemented. Even integrated-circuit packages, although quite variable in their functionality, form a component-level environment in common use. However, this is also a layout environment and so it will be discussed later.

2.4.1 寄存器传输环境

2.4.1 Register-Transfer Environment

第一个感兴趣的组件级环境是寄存器传输 [Bell、Grason 和 Newell]。在此环境中，组件是控制和数据的特定硬件操作，其连接显示所需算法的流程。此环境可用于描述计算机的指令集，因为它显示了影响机器操作的处理器中的控制流。它在算法设计中也很有用。这些组件的实际实现用于向大学生教授硬件设计。

The first component-level environment of interest is register transfer [Bell, Grason and Newell]. In this environment, the components are specific hardware manipulations of control and data with connections showing the flow for the desired algorithm. This environment can be used to describe the instruction set of computers because it shows the flow of control in a processor that effects the machine's operation. It is also useful in the design of algorithms. Actual implementations of these components were used to teach hardware design to university students.

寄存器传输环境的组件以 PMS 环境的组件命名。它们的细节程度更高，对组件内容的假设更少。例如，寄存器传输没有处理器，而是通过控制、内存和数据操作构建一个处理器。

图 2.15 显示了寄存器传输组件集。组件分为四类：控制 (K)、内存 (M)、数据/内存 (DM) 和传感器 (T)。控制和内存组件与 PMS 环境中的对应组件类似。数据/内存组件与 PMS 处理器类似，但功能要弱得多。传感器组件结合了 PMS 传感器和 PMS 数据操作的功能。

The set of register transfer components is shown in Fig. 2.15. There are four classes of components: control (K), memory (M), data/memory (DM), and transducers (T). The control and memory components are similar to their counterparts in the PMS environment. The data/memory component is similar to the PMS processor, although much less powerful. The transducer component combines the functions of the PMS transducer and the PMS data operation.

此列表中缺少两个 PMS 组件：交换机和链路。交换机是寄存器传输中的一种控制组件，我们将在后面讨论。由于连接的区别，链路未出现在寄存器传输环境中。寄存器传输不是根据物理距离来描述连接，而是根据连接的内容来区分连接。

Two PMS components are missing from this list: the switch and the link. The switch is a type of control component in register transfer, as will be discussed. The link does not appear in the register-transfer environment because of the connection distinctions. Rather than describe a connection in terms of physical distance, register transfer distinguishes connections by their contents.

图 2.15 寄存器传输环境的组件。“K”表示控制；“D”表示数据；“M”表示内存；“T”表示输入/输出。

寄存器传输在组件之间有四种类型的连接：总线、控制、布尔和杂项。总线是一种通用数据和控制连接，用于在组件之间传递同步信息。控制连接用于链接控制组件，也用于调用其他组件中的活动。布尔连接是专用信号，通过将条件与决策控制组件联系起来，有助于执行流程。最后，杂项连接用于将这些寄存器传输组件与外部设备连接起来。

Register transfer has four types of connections between components: bus, control, Boolean, and miscellaneous. The bus is a general-purpose data and control connection that passes synchronized information between components. Control connections are used to link the control components and also to invoke activity in other components. Boolean connections are special-purpose signals that aid the flow of execution by linking conditions with decision-making control components. Finally, miscellaneous connections exist to link these register-transfer components with external devices.

每个寄存器传输设计都只有一个 K总线组件。它控制所有其他组件的总线连接，是将设计与外界联系起来的初始和终端控制源。在学生硬件实验室中，寄存器传输模块使用最多，该组件为正在运行的电路提供手动接口。

Every register-transfer design has exactly one Kbus component. This controls the bus connections for all other components and is the source of initial and terminal control that links the design with the outside world. In student hardware laboratories, where register-transfer modules were used most, this component provides the manual interface to the running circuit.

控制流由四个组件完成：K b、K sub、K sm和 K pm。K b组件根据布尔输入执行分支。两个输出连接中只有一个将被调用，从而导致该控制模块接下来执行。K sub组件通过调用第一个模块、等待返回行上的完成信号，然后调用下一个顺序控制组件来执行控制模块的子例程。K sm执行串行合并，当任何一个输入行出现时调用下一个控制组件。这在多个执行路径进入单个控制流的循环中很有用。它对于并行执行控制也很有用。如果单个控制调用行连接到多个控制组件，就会出现这种情况。然后可以使用 K sm或 K pm组件完成这些控制路径的同步。K pm执行并行合并，等待所有输入行被调用后才生成自己的输出。

Flow of control is done with four components: Kb, Ksub, Ksm, and Kpm. The Kb component does a branch, conditional on a Boolean input. Only one of the two output connections will be invoked, causing that control module to execute next. The Ksub component executes a subroutine of control modules by invoking the first module, awaiting a completion signal on the return line, and then invoking the next sequential control component. The Ksm does a serial merge, invoking the next control component when any one input line is raised. This is useful in loops where multiple execution paths enter a single control stream. It is also useful for parallel execution control. Such a situation can exist if a single control-invocation line connects to multiple control components. Then the synchronization of these control paths can be accomplished with the Ksm or the Kpm components. The Kpm does a parallel merge that waits for all input lines to be invoked before it generates its own output.

所有这些控制组件都用于构建寄存器传输设计中的执行流程。但是，它们都不会导致任何数据被操纵。所有数据操作都由调用组件 K e控制。K e就像对数据组件的子程序调用：它启动数据操作，等待完成，然后调用下一个顺序控制组件。所有数据组件在总线上相互通信，并通过布尔连接与控制组件通信。

All of these control components are used to construct a flow of execution in a register-transfer design. However, none of them cause any data to be manipulated. All data operations are controlled with the evoke component, Ke. The Ke acts like a subroutine call to a data component: It initiates the data operation, awaits completion, and then invokes the next sequential control component. All data components communicate between each other on the bus and communicate back to the control components via Boolean connections.

有两个内部数据组件：DM gpa和 M。DM gpa或“通用算术”组件能够执行最简单的算术和逻辑运算。它拥有两个寄存器，可以移动、加、减、求补、逻辑与、逻辑或和移位。它生成指示数字测试结果的布尔信号。此组件是寄存器传输环境中任何算法的主力。M 是另一个内部组件，它存储内存。要使用它，内存地址和数据值都必须在单独的控制周期上通过总线传递。布尔输出信号用于较慢的内存中以指示操作的完成。这允许其他工作与内存访问并行进行。内存的大小和速度各不相同，从而产生这些组件的子类。

There are two internal data components: the DMgpa and the M. The DMgpa, or "general-purpose-arithmetic" component, is able to perform the simplest of arithmetic and logical operations. It holds two registers that it can move, add, subtract, complement, logically AND, logically OR, and shift. It generates Boolean signals that indicate numeric test results. This component is the workhorse of any algorithm done in the register-transfer environment. The M is the other internal component and it stores memory. To use it, both a memory address and a data value must pass across the bus on separate control cycles. The Boolean output signal is used in slower memories to indicate the completion of the operation. This allows other work to proceed in parallel with the memory access. The size and speed of the memory varies, yielding a subclass of these components.

传感器组件用于在总线数据和模拟信号之间进行转换以供外部使用。输入传感器可以处理模拟输入、开关组感应和键盘。输出传感器可以打印、绘图和生成一般模拟信号。

Transducer components are used to convert between bus data and analog signals for external use. Input transducers can handle analog input, switch bank sensing, and keyboards. Output transducers can print, plot, and produce general analog signals.

图 2.16 显示了对浮点数进行规范化的寄存器传输布局示例。两个 DM gpa组件存储和操作三个值：一个称为 Flag 的符号标志、尾数 (Man) 和指数 (Exp)。前六个组件设置符号标志并确保尾数为正。随后，尾数被移位，直到其高位为“1”（规范化的分数介于二分之一和一之间）。尾数的每次移位都需要指数增加一个增量，以保持整体值正确。当数字已规范化时，符号标志用于恢复负值。
图 2.16 用于规范浮点数​​的寄存器传输布局。图中显示完整的总线连接（粗线）和数据调用线（虚线）。

总线控制组件连接数据总线并控制算法的执行。许多寄存器传输设计都是在没有明确显示数据和 K总线组件或任何总线连接的情况下完成的。图 2.17 显示了没有这些数据路径复杂性的相同算法。这使得设计更简单，而不会牺牲此环境的细节，因为可以从控制组件推断出数据组件及其连接。
图 2.17 用于规范化浮点数的寄存器传输布局。图中未显示总线或数据调用连接。

除了作为算法规范的有用环境之外，寄存器传输设计还可以在硬件中构建。环境中的每个组件都有可以连接在一起的相关电子模块。因此，可以直接从这些设计构建一个可工作的寄存器传输机。虽然这些寄存器传输模块不再使用，但此环境中的概念仍然有效，并且可以通过其他实现方法实现。

In addition to being a useful environment for algorithm specification, register-transfer designs are able to be built in hardware. Every component in the environment has associated electronic modules that can be wired together. Thus a working register-transfer machine can be built directly from these designs. Although these register-transfer modules are no longer used, the concepts in this environment are still valid and can be realized with other implementation methods.

许多硬件描述语言以文本方式捕获与寄存器传输环境相同的信息。有一种语言将数据结构与控制分开 [Baray and Su]，类似于寄存器传输中的区分。

Many hardware-description languages textually capture the same information as the register-transfer environment does. One language separates data structure from control [Baray and Su], similar to the distinction made in register transfer.

 

 

2.4.2 ISP 环境

2.4.2 ISP Environment

Bell 和 Newell 还定义了用于描述计算机的组件级环境 [Bell 和 Newell]。ISP 或指令集处理器是一种用于描述处理器中的指令及其实现方式的语言。提供了符号来指定机器组织、操作机器寄存器以及指定并行或流水线执行。例如，语句：

Bell and Newell also defined a component-level environment for describing computers [Bell and Newell]. ISP, or instruction-set processor, is a language for describing the instructions in a processor and how they are implemented. Notation is provided to specify the machine organization, to manipulate machine registers, and to specify parallel or pipelined execution. For example, the statement:

（OP = 1） （M[OPERAND] AC；AC 0）；

 

 

表示如果 OP 等于 1，则两个操作将同时发生：累加器寄存器 AC 的值将存放在内存位置 OPERAND 中，并且累加器将被清除。此语句处理“存放和清除累加器”指令的解码和执行。在执行此类语句之前，必须定义每个术语的含义。例如，OP 字段可以定义为：

OP := M[PC]<0:2>

 

 

这意味着内存位置 PC 的三个高位定义了该字段。同样，PC、AC 甚至内存 M 的含义也必须明确定义。因此，ISP 类似于一种编程语言，包含声明和可执行语句。

非并行排序用“next”子句指定，如下例所示：

Nonparallel sequencing is specified with the "next" clause, as in the following example:

（AC AC + T；下一个 M[D] AC）

 

 

这确保在将结果存储在内存位置 D 之前完成 T 与 AC 的加法。确定何时可以并行执行操作取决于处理器的架构。此架构由各种 ISP 组件及其可执行的操作隐式指定。

ISP 通常用于描述计算机指令集。它是一个高度算法化的环境，这让人相信它不应该是一个组件级环境。然而，ISP 语句与实现它们的机器寄存器之间存在直接关联，因为文本可用于推断目标机器的图表。因此，ISP 是组件级环境的另一个示例。这些环境说明了详细的电子设计，但没有完全精确的规范。

ISP is often used to describe computer instruction sets. It is a highly algorithmic environment, which leads one to believe that it should not be a component-level environment. However, there are direct associations between ISP statements and the machine registers that implement them because the text can be used to infer a diagram of the target machine. Thus ISP is another example of a component-level environment. These environments illustrate detailed electronic design without completely precise specification.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 2 章：设计环境

2.5 布局层次

2.5 Layout Level

布局级环境主要用于生成最终制造规范。这些环境中的每个组件都有精确的尺寸，并且其在设计中的位置与其在制造电路中的最终位置完全对应。虽然一些布局级环境包含有关更高级别设计的信息，但这些信息并非强制性的。例如，nMOS 设计可以包括连接信息、行为描述以及与其他环境中的等效电路的链接。但最终，重要的是布局的几何形状，因此 nMOS 环境仅包含矩形作为基元是可以接受的。设计人员的需求决定了这些布局环境的复杂性。

Layout-level environments exist primarily for the generation of final manufacturing specifications. Every component in these environments has precise dimensions, and its location in the design corresponds exactly to its final position in the manufactured circuit. Although some layout-level environments have information about higher levels of design, this information is not mandatory. For example, nMOS design can include connectivity information, behavioral descriptions, and links to equivalent circuits in other environments. Ultimately, however, all that matters is the geometry of the layout, so it is acceptable for the nMOS environment to contain only rectangles as primitives. The needs of the designer determine the complexity of these layout environments.

这里值得一提的是三种不同类型的布局环境。首先，集成电路领域包括 MOS、双极、砷化镓和其他微硅环境。MOS 器件最近作为构建大型系统的理想媒介而受到广泛关注 [Glasser 和 Dobberpuhl]。其次，宏观电子环境包括印刷电路板设计、绕线板设计和其他类似设计。这些环境多年来一直用于构建大型系统。最后，纯艺术环境用于生成图形，而不是电子元件，它本身就很有用，与电路布局结合使用也很有用。

Three different types of layout environments are worth mentioning here. First, the integrated-circuit domain includes the MOS, bipolar, gallium arsenide, and other microsilicon environments. MOS devices have received much attention lately as a desirable medium in which to build large systems [Glasser and Dobberpuhl]. Second, the macro electronic environments include printed-circuit-board design, wire-wrap-board design, and others of that ilk. These environments have been used to build large systems for many years. Finally, the pure artwork environment exists for the generation of graphics, not electronics, and is useful in its own right as well as in combination with circuit layout.

除了提供不同的布局环境外，良好的设计系统还应允许这些组件混合使用。混合环境设计对于工艺试验非常有用，因为在工艺试验中，新结构正在组合在一起。当部分布局与原理图或其他非特定组件一起使用时，它们在设计中也很有价值。最后，混合环境在需要互连许多来源不统一的组件的大型系统设计中非常有用。

Besides providing different layout environments, a good design system should allow these components to be intermixed. Mixed environment designs are useful for process experimentation, in which new structures are being combined. They are also valuable in design when partial layout is used with schematics or other nonspecific components. Finally, mixed environments are useful in large system designs that demand interconnection of many components that are not of uniform origin.

2.5.1 nMOS 环境

2.5.1 nMOS Environment

n沟道金属氧化物半导体环境是将要讨论的两种 MOS 环境之一。MOS 的显著特征是使用 场效应晶体管进行开关。在这种类型的晶体管中，开关元件在开关线上运行，导致在交叉点产生场（见图 1.18b）。该场有条件地抑制开关线中的电流流动。在 MOS 环境中可以实现已简化为逻辑门集合的算法。这是因为所有逻辑运算都可以使用这些晶体管的组合来实现。

The n-channel metal oxide semiconductor environment is one of two MOS environments that will be discussed. The distinguishing characteristic of MOS is its use of a field-effect transistor to do switching. In this type of transistor, the switching element runs over the switched line, causing a field to be produced at the intersection (see Fig. 1.18b). This field conditionally inhibits the flow of current in the switched line. An algorithm that has been reduced to a collection of logic gates can be implemented in the MOS environments. This is because all logical operations can be implemented with combinations of these transistors.

有多种导电和半导体材料层可用于实现 nMOS。切换层是多晶硅，本书将其标记为红色。切换层是扩散层，标记为绿色。这两层不能交叉，否则会形成一个组件：晶体管或直接接触。为了建立不干扰其他层的通用连接，有一个金属层（标记为蓝色），它可以穿过多晶硅或扩散层而不连接。但是，可以使用特殊接触将金属连接到其他层。

There are different layers of conducting and semiconducting material that are available for the implementation of nMOS. The switching layer is polysilicon and is colored red in this book. The switched layer is diffusion and is colored green. These two layers cannot cross each other without forming a component: either a transistor or a direct contact. To make general-purpose connections that do not interfere with other layers, there is a metal layer, colored blue, which can cross polysilicon or diffusion without connecting. Special contacts can be used, however, to connect metal to the other layers.

这三层是 nMOS 电路中布线的唯一方式，尽管有些制造工艺会额外增加一层金属或多晶硅。但是，还有许多其他层可用于制造芯片。在晶体管的开关区域上方使用黄色的植入区，以将其永久设置为“开启”。这种替代类型的晶体管可用于获得实现逻辑功能所需的适当电压水平。金属、多晶硅和扩散之间的直接连接使用中间层，例如接触切割层和 埋入接触 层。整个芯片通常覆盖一层称为覆盖玻璃的保护涂层，必须在焊盘处将其去除，以便芯片进行外部布线。更复杂的是，一些 nMOS 制造工艺具有特殊层，例如轻植入层、硬增强层或轻增强层和二次接触层，这些层在布局过程中很少使用，甚至从未使用过。

These three layers are the only ways to run wires in an nMOS circuit, although some fabrication processes have an extra layer of metal or polysilicon. There are, however, many other layers that are used to make a chip. An implant region, colored yellow, is used over the switching area of a transistor to set it permanently "on." This alternate kind of transistor is useful for obtaining the appropriate voltage levels needed to implement logical functions. The direct connections between metal, polysilicon, and diffusion use intermediate layers such as the contact-cut and the buried-contact layers. The entire chip is typically covered with a layer of protective coating called overglass, which must be removed at the bonding pads to allow the chip to be externally wired. And to make things even more complicated, some nMOS fabrication processes have special layers, such as light implant, hard or light enhancement, and secondary contact, which are rarely, if ever, used during layout.

鉴于存在许多层，并且几何形状是唯一重要的结果，人们倾向于为 nMOS 环境提供一组纯几何的设计组件。事实上，任何没有用于在所有层上指定任意形状的组件的 nMOS 环境实现都可能无法满足设计人员的需求。但是，可以提供更复杂的组件，这将使设计阶段的大部分工作变得更容易。如果这些组件在某个更高的设计级别上形成一致的 nMOS 视图，那么进出此环境的转换问题将会减少。此外，如果这些组件包括连接性，布局环境将能够满足电路设计人员的需求。

Given that there are many layers and that geometry is the only important result, one is tempted to provide a purely geometric set of design components for the nMOS environment. In fact, any implementation of the nMOS environment that does not have components for specifying arbitrary shapes on all the layers is likely to fall short of the designer's needs. However, it is possible to provide more complex components that will make much of the design phase easier. If these components form a consistent view of nMOS at some higher level of design, then the problems of conversion in and out of this environment will be lessened. Also, layout environments will be able to cater to circuit designers if these components include connectivity.

图 2.18 nMOS 环境的基本元件。左侧为晶体管和层内引脚；中间为层间接触；右侧为基本层元件。

图 2.18 显示了一组可用于 nMOS 设计的高级基元。这些由电气系统（见第 11 章）使用的组件已足以用于中型到大型 IC 的布局。当然，这种环境中有两种类型的晶体管：增强型（正常的多晶硅扩散）和耗尽型（带有注入层）。此外，还有四种基本的层间接触：金属-多晶硅、金属-扩散、三层对接接触和多晶硅-扩散埋层接触。为了连接这些组件，有可以在所有三层中运行的导线。这些导线可以与三个引脚组件形成连接。最后，右侧包含可用于制作任何几何结构的基本层组件。使用这些基元设计的反相器如图 2.19 所示。
图 2.19 nMOS 反相器的分解图和正常视图。

为了鼓励使用，这些 nMOS 基元必须比图 2.18 中显示的更灵活。例如，晶体管元件应能够在任一维度上正确缩放，甚至可以弯曲（见图 2.20）。此外，触点应可用于其他配置，方法是使用额外的基元元件或参数化现有的元件。
图 2.20 nMOS 晶体管的不同配置。

在布局级环境中使用高级设计组件（例如 nMOS）不会妨碍可构建电路的灵活性。电路和 VLSI 设计人员更喜欢处理这样一组基元，因为它符合他们以连接为导向的电路观点。对于掩模设计人员来说，可以忽略晶体管和接触基元，这样就可以仅使用几何组件进行设计。然而，许多掩模设计人员对电路有足够的了解，能够理解这些更高级的基元。事实上，一些设计人员更喜欢使用具有更高级基元的单元库来执行复杂的电路功能 [Newkirk and Mathews]。任何设计人员所需要的只是一组小而强大的组件，它们可以生成正确的布局，同时提供与手头任务相关的信息。

The use of advanced design components in a layout-level environment such as nMOS does not hinder the flexibility of circuits that can be built. Circuit and VLSI designers prefer to deal with such a set of primitives because it agrees with their connectivity-oriented view of circuitry. For mask designers, the transistor and contact primitives can be ignored so that design can be done solely with geometric components. However, many mask designers understand enough about circuitry to appreciate these higher-level primitives. In fact, some designers prefer to use cell libraries with even-higher-level primitives that perform complex circuit functions [Newkirk and Mathews]. All that is needed for any designer is a small but powerful set of components that produces correct layout while providing information relevant to the task at hand.

 

 

2.5.2 CMOS 环境

2.5.2 CMOS Environment

互补金属氧化物半导体 (CMOS) 环境与前面讨论的n沟道 MOS 器件非常相似。与所有 MOS 环境一样，CMOS 环境使用的场效应晶体管非常简单，只需几个元件即可建模。此外，与所有 MOS 环境一样，CMOS 环境有一个多晶硅层，用于控制扩散层，以及一个或多个可在任何地方运行的金属层。此外，CMOS 环境还有接触结构、特殊植入层、可选的附加多晶硅层和用于保护芯片的玻璃层。然而，在其他方面，CMOS 和 nMOS 却截然不同。

The complementary metal oxide semiconductor (CMOS) environment is very similar to the n-channel MOS devices previously discussed. As in all MOS environments, a field-effect transistor is used that is simple enough to be modeled with a few components. Also, as in all MOS environments, there is a polysilicon layer that gates a diffusion layer, and one or more metal layers that can run anywhere. There are also contact structures, special implant layers, optional additional polysilicon layers, and an overglass layer for chip protection. In other respects, however, CMOS and nMOS are quite dissimilar.

CMOS 设计是一种完全不同的电路思维方式 [Weste 和 Eshraghian]。在 nMOS 中，增强晶体管是一个门，而耗尽晶体管用于获得“弱”逻辑高电平或通过接地变为逻辑低电平。因此，nMOS 设计以使信号变弱或变强为低电平的操作为中心。这种不对称意味着某些转换需要更长的时间才能完成（将信号设置为高电平比将其设置为低电平花费的时间更长），并且某些状态需要更多的功率（将信号保持在低电平会消耗更多的功率）。nMOS 设计中使用的空间量很小，但功率和速度特性却受到限制。

CMOS design is a wholly different way of thinking about circuits [Weste and Eshraghian]. In nMOS, the enhancement transistor is a gate and the depletion transistor is used to obtain a "weak" logical high or becomes logically low by being gated to ground. Thus nMOS design centers around the operations that make a signal either weakly high or strongly low. This asymmetry means that certain transitions take longer to complete (setting a signal high takes longer than setting it low) and that certain states take much more power (holding a signal low consumes more power). The amount of space used in an nMOS design is small, but the power and speed characteristics are limiting.

CMOS 中有两个晶体管，它们在打开时打开栅极，在关闭时打开栅极。没有弱真值，因此任何操作的速度都与最快的 nMOS 操作一样快。功耗要求也较低。唯一的问题是必须重复每个操作，这会占用更多空间。幸运的是，空间成本并不总是主要问题，而且存在可以减少面积的动态设计风格 [Weste 和 Eshraghian]。由于所有这些原因，CMOS 正迅速成为最受欢迎的集成电路环境。

In CMOS there are two transistors that either open the gate when on, or open the gate when off. There are no weak truth values and so the speed of any operation is as fast as the fastest nMOS action. Power requirements are also lower. The only problem is that every operation must be duplicated and this uses larger amounts of space. Fortunately, the space costs are not always of major concern and there are dynamic design styles that reduce the area [Weste and Eshraghian]. For all these reasons, CMOS is rapidly becoming the most popular integrated-circuit environment.

由于两个 CMOS 晶体管执行逻辑上相反的功能，因此它们及其所有连接扩散线都必须包裹在决定功能意义的植入区域中。因此，CMOS 设计师不仅必须考虑金属、多晶硅和扩散，还必须考虑植入区域：阱和/或 原生衬底。

Because the two CMOS transistors perform logically opposite functions, they and all of their connecting diffusion wires must be enveloped in implant areas that dictate the sense of the function. The CMOS designer must therefore consider not only metal, polysilicon, and diffusion, but also implant regions: well and/or native substrate.

图 2.21 CMOS 环境的组件。上面两行是注入敏感组件。下面一行包含基本层组件。
设计 CMOS 环境可以采取多种方式。除了为掩模设计人员提供一组几何图元外，该环境还可以为芯片设计人员提供触点和晶体管。然而，鉴于所有扩散路径都对植入敏感，这些高级晶体管和触点图元将无法完成布局，因为植入区域必须用低级图元指定。如图 2.21 所示，解决方案是为两个植入区域定义两组与扩散相关的图元。这意味着，除了有两个晶体管外，还有两种类型的扩散线、两个用于扩散的线结引脚和两个金属到扩散触点。这使得设计无需过多考虑植入区域，因为这些层中的大多数将作为使用适当组件和线的副产品出现。图 2.22 显示了由这些组件制成的 CMOS 反相器。
图 2.22 CMOS 反相器的分解图和正常视图。

CMOS 说明了层数过多而难以方便操作的问题。在典型环境中，设计非常混乱，因此需要制作一组标准单元并将其用于所有布局，从而避免处理此环境的复杂性 [Feller]。标准单元封装通过提供高级原语改变了设计环境的性质。此外，它们可以强加自己的设计方法，从而完全重新定义布局任务的性质 [Schediwy]。但是，通过将设计组件简化为一组可管理且一致的组件，仍然可以实现直接 CMOS 布局，从而减少混乱并使设计更容易完成。

CMOS illustrates the problem of having too many layers to manipulate conveniently. In typical environments, the design is so confusing that a set of standard cells is made and used for all layout, thus avoiding the need to deal with the complexities of this environment [Feller]. Standard-cell packages change the nature of the design environment by providing high-level primitives. In addition, they can impose their own design methodologies that totally redefine the nature of the layout task [Schediwy]. However, direct CMOS layout can still be accomplished by simplifying the design components to a manageable and consistent set, so that confusion is reduced and design is more easily done.

 

 

2.5.3 双极环境

2.5.3 Bipolar Environments

双极环境形成一个家族，与 MOS 家族非常相似。该家族的成员之间可以共享许多概念，并且许多方面是不同的。一个共同点是双极环境的基本开关是结型晶体管，它具有基极、发射极和集电极。这种晶体管的结构与 MOS 中使用的场效应晶体管有很大不同，而且更复杂（见图 2.23）。此外，双极环境很少使用半导体材料进行组件连接：通常只使用金属线。
图 2.23 典型的npn双极晶体管。

图 2.24 显示了双极环境示例。晶体管是一个空的注入区，基极、发射极和集电极元件可以放置在其中。这些元件周围有金属，因为金属是建立连接的唯一方式。但是，并未显示精确指定双极电路所需的许多其他层，因为它们可以从这些更简单的元件中自动派生出来 [Szabo、Leask 和 Elmasry]。此处显示的双极环境有两层金属，因此需要两个金属引脚和一个金属间接触（称为通孔）。一些双极环境还具有多晶硅或第三层金属。
图 2.24 双极设计的组成部分。

设计定制晶体管、电阻器和二极管的灵活性正是双极环境中所需要的。MOS 中可用的晶体管数量有限，这远远不够。相反，必须将晶体管分解成基本组件才能满足设计人员的要求。但请注意，可以进行一些合理的层组合，例如基极、发射极、集电极和通孔的情况。通过坚持晶体管的所有组件都连接到晶体管植入区，设计系统仍然可以将晶体管视为单个对象，并为电路设计人员捕获更多信息。因此，即使在这种非常低级的环境中，也可以提供不仅仅是纯几何设计基元的信息。

The flexibility of designing custom transistors, resistors, and diodes is exactly what is needed in a bipolar environment. The limited set of transistors available in MOS is not sufficient. Instead, the transistor must be broken down into its basic components in order to satisfy the designer. Note, however, that some sensible combinations of layers can be made as in the case of the bases, emitters, collectors, and the via. By insisting that the components of a transistor all connect to the transistor implant area, the design system can still treat transistors as single objects and capture more information for the circuit designer. Thus even in a very low-level environment such as this, it is possible to provide more than purely geometric design primitives.

 

 

2.5.4 集成电路封装环境

2.5.4 Integrated-Circuit-Packages Environment

集成电路 ( IC ) 封装是当今首选的组件级环境。大多数算法设计都转换为此封装以实现，因为这是常用的介质。标准化电压水平允许这些封装直接互连，标准引脚间距允许它们物理连接。

Integrated-circuit (IC) packages are the component-level environment of choice today. Most algorithm design is converted to this for implementation, because this is the medium that is commonly available. Standardized voltage levels allow these packages to be directly interconnected and standard pin spacings allow them to be physically connected.

典型的 IC 封装在塑料或陶瓷体两侧有两排导线（见图 2.25）。这些芯片称为双列直插式封装（DIP），其导线间距始终为 0.1 英寸或其倍数。DIP 的引脚数最少为 2 个，但通常为 14 或 16 个，偶尔也会超过 100 个。有些封装只有一排引脚，称为 单列直插式封装。最近，出现了四面都有引脚的封装，称为 四面封装。此外，还有底部引脚间距均匀的封装，称为引脚栅格阵列。
图 2.25 74-00 四双输入 NAND 门封装。

封装连接取决于封装所附着的表面。绕线板是一侧带有插针插座、另一侧带有长接线柱的电路板。IC 插入带有插座的电路板一侧，导线在另一侧的接线柱之间穿行。

Package connections depend on the surface to which the packages are attached. A wire-wrap board is one that has pin sockets on one side attached to long terminal posts on the other. The ICs plug into the side of the board with sockets and the wires run between the terminals on the other side.

印刷电路板是一种不太灵活的连接 IC 封装的方法，因为它们更持久。封装焊接到电路板上，线路沿电路板表面蚀刻，使所有更改都变得困难。由于印刷电路板更持久，因此它们用于不需要调试但需要低成本生产的生产设计中。许多印刷电路板包含多层线路路径。这允许复杂的连接而不会出现路径交叉的问题。简单的多层板在两面都有线路，但有些印刷电路板有六层或更多层。

Printed-circuit boards are a less flexible method of connecting IC packages because they are more permanent. The packages are soldered to the board and the wiring is etched along the board surface, making all changes difficult. Because they are more permanent, printed-circuit boards are used in production designs that need no debugging, but do need to be produced inexpensively. Many printed-circuit boards contain multiple layers of wire paths. This allows complex connectivity without the problems of path crossing. Simple multilayer boards have wiring on two sides but some printed-circuit boards have six or more layers.

集成电路封装的复杂程度范围很广。早期的封装被称为SSI，即小规模集成。这意味着可以将少量的门级组件内置到单个封装中。例如，图 2.25 中封装的内容属于 SSI 复杂度。电源和接地引脚必须连接到标准电压（TTL 设计分别使用 +5v 和 0v），逻辑门引脚上的电平也使用标准电压（高于阈值为真，低于阈值为假）。这个特定的 SSI 封装有四个 NAND 门，每个门都有两个输入。通常，任何具有多达 40 个逻辑门的东西都属于 SSI 范畴。

The integrated-circuit packages have a wide range of complexity. Early packages were called SSI, or small-scale integration. This meant that a handful of gate-level components could be built into a single package. For example, the contents of the package in Fig. 2.25 is of SSI complexity. The power and ground pins must be connected to standard voltages (TTL designs use +5v and 0v respectively) and the levels on the logic gate pins also use standard voltages (higher than a threshold for true, lower for false). This particular SSI package has four NAND gates, each with two inputs. Typically, anything with up to 40 logic gates is within the realm of SSI.

更先进的封装属于MSI系列（中规模集成）。图 1.11中的逻辑图是 MSI 封装复杂性的典型代表。在这个系列中，复杂性极限约为 500 个门，尽管这个数字和所有其他系列的区别都有些随意。

More advanced packages are in the MSI family (medium-scale integration). The logic diagram in Fig. 1.11 is typical of the complexity of MSI packages. In this family, the complexity limit is about 500 gates, although this number and all other family distinctions are somewhat arbitrary.

更复杂的集成电路是LSI，即大规模集成电路。单个 LSI 芯片的功能包括存储器（一个封装中有 100 万位）、乘法器（16 位并行乘法）和处理器（Z80 或 MC68000 单芯片处理器）。LSI 芯片的复杂程度可达 100 万门。

Even more complex integrated circuits are LSI, or large-scale integration. The capabilities of a single LSI chip include memories (one million bits in a package), multipliers (16-bit parallel multiplication), and processors (Z80 or MC68000 single-chip processors). LSI chips can be as complex as one million gates.

LSI 之后是VLSI（超大规模集成电路）和ULSI（超大规模集成电路）的前景。这种芯片包含的信息量如此之多，以至于它们的设计管理对某些设计系统来说非常困难。目前，复杂的系统正在WSI （晶圆级集成）中构建，其中数百个集成电路在单个晶圆上互连。整个架构级描述可以体现在单个 VLSI 系统中，这导致了集成电路封装处于设计组件级这一概念的悖论。这只能证实试图对环境进行分类是徒劳的：对于一个设计师来说，整个架构对于另一个设计师来说可能只是布局中的一个组件。

Beyond LSI is VLSI (very-large-scale integration) and the promise of ULSI (ultra-large-scale integration). Such chips have so much information that the management of their design presents difficulty for some design systems. Currently, complex systems are being built in WSI (wafer-scale integration), in which hundreds of integrated circuits interconnect on a single wafer. Entire architecture-level descriptions can be embodied in a single VLSI system, causing a paradox in the notion that integrated-circuit packages are at the component level of design. This only confirms the futility of trying to categorize environments: What is an entire architecture to one designer is merely a component in a layout to someone else.

 

 

2.5.5 艺术品环境

2.5.5 Artwork Environment

艺术品不是电气的。艺术品环境只是一组用于设计任意图形的组件。这些图形可用于修饰电路布局（这在 PC 板和芯片布局中很常见），也可以独立于电子设备使用；例如，为论文和幻灯片制作图形。无论如何，艺术品环境必须能够进行任何类型的布局，因此第一个反应是让这个环境具有一些基本的几何组件，例如一条线、一个多边形、一个圆和一些文本。

Artwork is not electrical. An artwork environment is simply a set of components for the design of arbitrary graphics. These graphics can be used to embellish circuit layouts (which is common in PC-board and chip layout) or they can be used independently of electronics; for example, to make figures for papers and slides. In any case, an artwork environment must be able to do any kind of layout, so a first reaction is to make this environment have a few basic geometric components such as a line, a polygon, a circle, and some text.

然而，查看任何 Sketchpad 编辑器都会发现，通常会为艺术家提供复杂的图元。箭头、三角形、样条线和许多其他形状出现在设计菜单中。甚至可以找到电路和其他科学符号。因此，此环境与此处描述的其他电子环境结合使用是有益的，因为所有环境中的组件都可以混合在一个设计中。由于 CAD 系统必须提供图形人机界面、I/O、数据库设施和设计图元，因此它也可以加入一些纯图形组件，并真正发挥作用。

A look at any sketchpad editor, however, will reveal that complex primitives are often provided to the artist. Arrowheads, triangles, splines, and many more shapes appear in design menus. Even circuit and other scientific symbols can be found. Thus the existence of this environment in conjunction with the other electronic environments described here can be beneficial, given that components from all environments can be mixed in a single design. Since a CAD system must provide the graphical human interface, I/O, database facilities, and design primitives, it may as well throw in a few purely graphical components and be truly useful.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 2 章：设计环境

2.6 总结

2.6 Summary

本章介绍了可用于数字电子设计的各种环境。每个环境都由基本组件及其连接组成。重要的是，环境要模拟设计人员的电路概念，并提供与设计系统进行通信的舒适方式。环境存在于许多规范级别，以帮助从机器架构师到 IC 掩模设计师的设计人员。甚至有些环境与电子无关。总之，应该看到，一组精心规划的组件可以极大地帮助设计，并且一组良好的环境可以协同工作以提供强大的设计功能。

This chapter has illustrated a wide range of environments that can be provided for digital electronic design. Each environment consists of primitive components and their connections. It is important that an environment model the designer's notions of circuitry and provide a comfortable means of communication with the design system. Environments exist at many levels of specification to help designers from the machine architect to the IC mask designer. There are even some environments that have nothing to do with electronics. All together, it should be seen that a well-planned set of components can be a great aid to design, and a good collection of environments can work together to provide a powerful design facility.

问题

Questions

  1. 您将如何修改 PMS 以适应现代计算机架构？
  2. How would you modify PMS for modern computer architectures?
  3. 从数据流转换为控制流最困难的方面是什么？
  4. What is the most difficult aspect of translating from dataflow to control flow?
  5. 提出一种与图 2.2 不同的设计环境组织方式。
  6. Propose an alternative organization of design environments to the one in Fig. 2.2.
  7. 如何改变原理图环境以包含具有多条信号的线路（例如总线或传输线）？
  8. How would you change the schematics environment to include wires with multiple signals (such as buses or transmission lines)?
  9. 棍棒环境与原理图环境有何不同？
  10. How does the sticks environment differ from the schematics environment?
  11. 您如何图形化地描述 ISP 环境？
  12. How would you graphically describe the ISP environment?
  13. 为什么CMOS设计比nMOS更困难？
  14. Why is CMOS design more difficult than nMOS?
  15. 仅使用 NOR 将 AND、OR、NOT 和 IMPLICATION 转换为等效逻辑。
  16. Convert the AND, OR, NOT, and IMPLICATION to equivalent logic using only NOR.

参考

  • Newkirk, John and Mathews, Robert, The VLSI Designer's Library, Addison-Wesley, Reading, Massachusetts, 1983.

  • Patil, Suhas S., "An Asynchronous Logic Array," Project MAC tech memo TM-62, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, May 1975.

  • Schediwy, Richard R., A CMOS Cell Architecture and Library, Masters thesis, University of Calgary Department of Computer Science, 1987.
  • Siewiorek, Daniel P.；Bell, C. Gordon；及 Newell, Allen，《计算机结构：原理与实例》，麦格劳-希尔出版，纽约，1982 年。
  • Siewiorek, Daniel P.; Bell, C. Gordon; and Newell, Allen, Computer Structures: Principles and Examples, McGraw-Hill, New York, 1982.

  • Szabo, Kevin S. B.; Leask, James M.; and Elmasry, Mohamed I., "Symbolic Layout for Bipolar and MOS VLSI," IEEE Transactions on CAD, CAD-6:2, 202-210, March, 1987.

  • VanCleemput, W. M., "An Hierarchical Language for the Structural Description of Digital Systems," Proceedings 14th Design Automation Conference, 377-385, June 1977.
  • Weste，Neil，“虚拟网格符号布局”，第 18 届设计自动化会议论文集，225-233，1981 年 6 月。
  • Weste, Neil, "Virtual Grid Symbolic Layout," Proceedings 18th Design Automation Conference, 225-233, June 1981.
  • Weste, Neil 和 Eshraghian, Kamran，《CMOS VLSI 设计原理》，Addison-Wesley，马萨诸塞州雷丁，1985 年。
  • Weste, Neil and Eshraghian, Kamran, Principles of CMOS VLSI Design, Addison-Wesley, Reading, Massachusetts, 1985.
