本章将介绍 VLSI 设计的多种综合工具。这些技术都基于电路由单元及其互连组成的前提。一些工具生成和操纵单元的内容（PLA 生成器、门阵列生成器、门矩阵生成器、压缩器）；一些工具处理单元外部的布局（布线器、放置系统、焊盘框架生成器）；一些工具处理单元及其环境的相互关系（对准器、间距匹配器）。当然，有些硅编译器将这些技术结合起来，以生成单元和完整的系统，以供制造。最后，还有一些综合工具，可帮助将完成的布局转换为适合制造的形式（补偿、掩模图形生成器）。这些只是良好设计系统应提供的一些工具。

This chapter will illustrate a number of synthesis tools for VLSI design. These techniques are all based on the premise that a circuit consists of cells and their interconnection. Some tools generate and manipulate the contents of cells (PLA generators, gate-array generators, gate-matrix generators, compacters); some tools work with the layout external to cells (routers, placement systems, pad-frame generators); and some tools work with the interrelation of the cells and their environment (aligners, pitch matchers). Of course, there are silicon compilers that combine these techniques to produce cells and complete systems, ready for fabrication. Finally, there are synthesis tools that help to convert completed layout into suitable form for manufacturing (compensation, mask-graphics generators). These are just some of the tools that should be provided by a good design system.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 4 章：综合工具

4.2 细胞内容的生成和操作

4.2 Cell Contents Generation and Manipulation

要讨论的第一类综合工具是在芯片单元内局部工作的工具。这些工具根据单元功能的更抽象规范生成单元布局。为了完成此任务，布局通常必须限制为某种规则模式，原始规范可以映射到该模式中。因此，PLA 设计具有刚性的晶体管 AND 和 OR 平面，门阵列具有固定的晶体管对，门矩阵具有与可切换互连行交叉的门控材料列。

The first type of synthesis tool to be discussed are those that work at a local level, within the cells of a chip. These tools generate the cell layout from a more abstract specification of the cell's functionality. To accomplish this task, the layout must typically be restricted to some regular pattern into which the original specification can be mapped. Thus PLA designs have rigid AND and OR planes of transistors, gate-arrays have fixed transistor pairs, and gate matrices have columns of gating material crossing rows of switchable interconnect.

所有单元设计都有规律性；即使是人类进行的布局也会利用设计师头脑中复杂但有规律的模式，将功能转化为布局。这些模式在布局过程中为设计师提供指导，并帮助确定设计何时完成。一些人工智能系统试图将这些规则编纂成法典 [Kim, McDermott and Siewiorek; Kowalski and Thomas; Kollaritsch and Weste; Mitchell, Steinberg and Schulman; Simoudis and Fickas]，但结果往往有明显的模式，并不比传统生成器使用的常规布局方法更好。这只是表明手动设计处于布局方法连续体的远端，用于根据高级功能规范构建电路。本节的其余部分将讨论目前可用于单元综合的几种常规布局样式。

All cell design has regularity; even layout produced by humans makes use of complex but regular patterns in the designer's mind that translate function to layout. These patterns guide the designer during layout and help to determine when the design is complete. Some artificial intelligence systems have attempted to codify these rules [Kim, McDermott and Siewiorek; Kowalski and Thomas; Kollaritsch and Weste; Mitchell, Steinberg and Schulman; Simoudis and Fickas], but the results often have noticeable patterns that are no better than the regular layout methods used by traditional generators. This simply shows that manual design is at the far end of a continuum of layout methods, used to build circuits from high-level functional specifications. The remainder of this section discusses a few of the regular styles of layout that are available today for cell synthesis.

4.2.1 生物伦理委员会

4.2.1 PLAs

本节由凯斯西储大学的 Sundaravarathan R. Iyengar 贡献。

This section was contributed by Sundaravarathan R. Iyengar, Case Western Reserve University.

组合电路元件是任何数字设计的重要组成部分。实现组合块的三种常用方法是 随机逻辑、只读存储器( ROM ) 和可编程逻辑阵列( PLA )。在随机逻辑设计中，电路的逻辑描述直接转换为硬件结构，例如 AND 门和 OR 门。这种方法的难点在于布局和互连成本很高。在大型系统中，这种成本可能会高得令人望而却步。ROM 对于几乎没有规律性的表格数据很有用，但对于可以通过算法得出的数据来说，它非常浪费空间。PLA 结合了其他两种方法的特点，允许设计人员使用逻辑阵列上的编程抽头实现组合设计。

Combinational circuit elements are an important part of any digital design. Three common methods of implementing a combinational block are random logic, read-only memory (ROM), and programmable logic array (PLA). In random-logic designs, the logic description of the circuit is directly translated into hardware structures such as AND and OR gates. The difficulty in this method is that the placement and interconnection cost is high. In a large system, this cost could be prohibitive. The ROM is useful for tabular data that has little regularity, but it is very wasteful of space for data that could be algorithmically derived. The PLA combines features of both other methods by allowing the designer to realize combinational design with programming taps on a logic array.

PLA 由一个AND 平面和一个OR 平面 组成。AND 平面产生由编程抽头选择的输入变量的乘积项，OR 平面产生由另一组编程抽头选择的这些乘积项的总和。编程抽头放置位置的符号表示称为PLA 的个性矩阵。图 4.1 显示了编程这些逻辑函数的 PLA 的通用结构：

f = (a b (¬ c)) ((¬ b) (¬ a))

g = (a c) ((¬ a) (¬ c))

g = (a c) ((¬ a) (¬ c))



图 4.1 PLA 为示例方程：X 标记编程水龙头。

由于互连线空间减少，PLA 在硅片上占用的面积更小；但是，它可能比纯随机逻辑慢。PLA 还可以用作紧凑型有限状态机，方法是将其部分输出反馈到输入并为两侧提供时钟。通常，对于高速应用，PLA 实现为两个 NOR 阵列。输入和输出被反转以保留 AND-OR 结构。

The PLA occupies less area on the silicon due to reduced interconnection wire space; however, it may be slower than purely random logic. A PLA can also be used as a compact finite state machine by feeding back part of its outputs to the inputs and clocking both sides. Normally, for high speed applications, the PLA is implemented as two NOR arrays. The inputs and outputs are inverted to preserve the AND-OR structure.

PLA 之所以流行，是因为其生成可以自动化，从而使设计人员不必花费宝贵的时间来创建随机逻辑门。由于 PLA 生成器固定了 PLA 的物理结构，因此出现了满足设计人员特殊要求（如果有的话）的问题。第一个要求是减少 PLA 占用的面积。通常，个性矩阵非常稀疏，以至于将矩阵直接映射到硅片上会导致硅片面积浪费。相反，PLA 被折叠以减少物理实现所需的面积。PLA 可以分成更多的 AND 和 OR 平面，而不是一个 AND 平面和一个 OR 平面。此外，输入和输出列可以移动和折叠，这样一列就有两列，而不是通常的一列。行也可以类似地移动和折叠。已经发表了许多折叠算法 [Hachtel、Newton 和 Sangiovanni-Vincentelli]。

PLAs are popular because their generation can be automated, which frees the designer from spending valuable time creating random-logic gates. Since the PLA generator fixes the physical structure of the PLA, there arises the problem of accommodating the designer's special requirements, if any. The first requirement would be to reduce the area occupied by the PLA. Usually the personality matrix is so sparse that a straightforward mapping of the matrix to the silicon will result in wasted silicon area. Instead, the PLA is folded to reduce the area required for the physical implementation. Instead of having one AND plane and one OR plane, the PLA can be split into many more AND and OR planes. Also, the input and output columns can be moved and folded such that there are two to a column instead of the usual one. The rows can be similarly moved and folded. There have been many folding algorithms published [Hachtel, Newton, and Sangiovanni-Vincentelli].

第二个重要要求是操作速度。开关速度受寄生电容以及输入和上拉级的驱动能力影响。改变这些级的驱动能力的选项将是 PLA 生成器的一个方便的补充。这将涉及估计寄生电容和自动调整驱动晶体管的大小。

The second important requirement is speed of operation. Switching speed is affected by parasitic capacitance and the driving capacities of input and pullup stages. Options to change the driving capacities of these stages would be a convenient addition to the PLA generator. This would involve estimating the parasitic capacitance and automatically sizing the driver transistors.

编程器可以为用户提供更多选项。例如，可以选择纠正电气问题，例如 PLA 电源线和接地线上的电压累积。有时，由于周围电路的互连要求，将 PLA 的输入和输出入口点放在布局的不同侧面可能会有所帮助。例如，在 MOS PLA 中，将输出放在 PLA 的顶部而不是底部非常简单。

There are several more options that a programmer can provide for the user. For instance, there could be an option to correct electrical problems such as voltage buildups on the power and ground lines of the PLA. Sometimes, due to the interconnection requirements of the surrounding circuitry, it might be helpful to have the input and output entry points for the PLA appear on different sides of the layout. In a MOS PLA, for example, it is very simple to provide the outputs at the top of the PLA instead of at the bottom.

当 PLA 用作有限状态机时，输入和输出级需要使用两个不同的相位或两个不同的时钟边沿进行时钟控制。因此，提供一个在需要时生成时钟控制的输入和输出级的选项会很方便。时钟关闭时，只会阻止相应级加载。无论时钟使用情况如何，最好通过 PLA 估算最坏情况延迟（请参阅第 5 章中的时序验证）。由于时钟相位的时序对于 PLA 的正常运行至关重要，因此此功能非常重要。

When a PLA is used as a finite-state machine, the input and output stages need to be clocked using two different phases or two different edges of the clock. Thus it is convenient to provide an option that generates clocked input and output stages when required. The clock, when off, would simply prevent the corresponding stages from loading. Regardless of clock usage, it is good to estimate the worst-case delay through the PLA (see Timing Verification, in Chapter 5). Since the timing of the clock phases is critical for proper operation of the PLA, this feature is important.

总之，PLA 生成器是一种有用的工具，是许多硅编译器的重要组成部分。给定 PLA 的高级代数或真值表描述，它会生成可以直接制造的掩模级描述。由于生成器使用预定的结构进行布局，因此能够通过高级参数对其进行修改非常重要。参数化的生成器比仅支持刚性结构的生成器更有用。使用参数实现 PLA 生成器的一种简单方法是首先在一张纸上（或在屏幕上）绘制一个示例 PLA，并确定主要构建块。通常有输入和输出阶段、上拉电阻、编程抽头以及将平面连接在一起的连接原语。参数化每个块可以提供更多高级选项。

In conclusion, a PLA generator is a useful tool that forms an important part of many silicon compilers. Given a high-level algebraic or a truth-table description of the PLA, it generates the mask-level description, which can be fabricated directly. Since the generator uses a predetermined structure for the layout, it is important to be able modify it through high-level parameters. A parameterized generator is more useful than one that supports only a rigid structure. A simple way to implement the PLA generator with parameters is to first draw a sample PLA on a piece of paper (or on the screen) and to identify major building blocks. Typically there are input and output stages, pullups, programming taps, and the connection primitives that connect the planes together. Parameterizing each of these blocks allows more high-level options to be provided.

 

 

4.2.2 门阵列

4.2.2 Gate-Arrays

门阵列 是一种用于设计 IC 芯片的流行技术。与 PLA 一样，它包含一个未完成布局的固定网格，必须对其进行定制才能产生最终电路。然而，门阵列功能更强大，因为网格内容的结构化程度较低，因此互连选项更灵活。门阵列有多种形式和名称；例如， 非指定逻辑阵列[Ramsay] 和主切片[Freeman and Freund]。

The gate-array is a popular technique used to design IC chips. Like the PLA, it contains a fixed mesh of unfinished layout that must be customized to yield the final circuit. Gate-arrays are more powerful, however, because the contents of the mesh is less structured so the interconnection options are more flexible. Gate-arrays exist in many forms with many names; for example, uncommitted logic arrays [Ramsay] and master-slice [Freeman and Freund].

典型的门阵列由包含未连接的晶体管对的块构成，尽管任何简单的组件都可以。这些块与 I/O 焊盘相结合的阵列形成完整的集成电路，并提供广泛的数字电子选项（见图 4.2）。这些块通过连接组件来内部定制，以形成各种逻辑运算符，例如 AND、OR、NOT 等。这些块也在外部连接以产生整个芯片。
图 4.2 典型的门阵列。块位于中心，焊盘位于外围。

使用门阵列设计电路包括指定内部和外部连接要求，然后布线以生成布局。有一些高级语言可以帮助生成这些连接。在这些语言中，可以通过将多个块聚合到更大的功能单元（称为宏）中来轻松指定设计。这类似于编程语言中的宏，它为门阵列设计提供了层次结构。除了这些宏之外，一些门阵列还具有专用电路，例如存储单元，因此可以更有效地实现这些常用功能。

Designing a circuit using gate-arrays consists of specifying the internal and external connection requirements and then routing wires to produce the layout. There are high-level languages that help with the production of these connections. In these languages, designs can be easily specified by aggregating multiple blocks into larger functional units called macros. This is similar to macros in programming languages and it gives a semblance of hierarchy to the gate-array design. In addition to these macros, some gate-arrays have special-purpose circuitry, such as memory cells, so that these popular functions can be implemented more efficiently.

为了便于连接，通常在门阵列块之间留有布线空间。无通道阵列可实现更高的密度，这种阵列不留布线空间，然后使用“蚀刻”层消除电路并在需要的地方创建空间。节省块间空间的另一种方法是保留一层额外的金属层，专门用于互连。这样布线就可以跨块进行，而不必绕过它们。但是，这些连接只能在可以更改层的块间区域中相互交叉。

To aid in making connections, wire routing space is typically left between the gate-array blocks. Greater density is achieved in channel-less arrays, which leave no wiring space and then using an "etching" layer to eliminate circuitry and create space where it is needed. Another way to save the space between blocks is to have an extra layer of metal that is reserved exclusively for interconnect. This lets routing run across blocks rather than having to work around them. However, these connections can cross each other only in the area between blocks where it is possible to change layers.

门阵列生成是硅片编译的另一种形式，因为可以生产完整的芯片而无需考虑布局环境。高级语言根据逻辑功能指定电路，然后计算机将其转换为门阵列连接。此外，由于块和焊盘与互连位于不同的层上，因此可以快速制造门阵列。这样可以生成更少的制造掩模：每个新门阵列只需要一个或两个互连掩模。这些互连层通常也是制造过程中处理的最后层，因此可以将它们放置在预先准备好的几乎完成的晶圆之上。门阵列的另一个优点是它们可以利用生产高速部件的特殊制造工艺。

Gate-array generation is another form of silicon compilation because a completed chip can be produced without any concern for the layout environment. Higher-level languages specify a circuit in terms of logic functions and the computer translates it into gate-array connections. Also, gate-arrays can be fabricated quickly because the blocks and pads are on a different layer than the interconnect. This results in many fewer fabrication masks to generate: Only one or two interconnect masks are needed for each new gate-array. These interconnect layers are also usually the last layers processed during fabrication, so they can be placed on top of nearly completed wafers that have been prepared in advance. Another advantage of gate-arrays is that they can take advantage of special manufacturing processes that produce high-speed parts.

门阵列的缺点是它们并不是任何任务的最佳选择。有些块永远不会被使用，而其他块供应不足。由于块的放置是提前完成的，因此互连布线会变得复杂，而由此产生的长线会降低电路速度。此外，由于块间间距是固定的，以满足最坏情况下的布线需求，因此设计不会紧凑。有人估计，门阵列的效率比自定义布局低三到六倍 [Heller]。

The disadvantage of gate-arrays is that they are not optimal for any task. There are blocks that never get used and other blocks that are in short supply. Since block placement is done in advance, interconnect routing can become complex and the resulting long wires can slow down the circuit. Also, the design will not be compact since interblock spacing is fixed to allow worst-case routing needs. One estimate is that gate-arrays are three to six times less efficient than a custom layout [Heller].

 

 

4.2.3 门矩阵

4.2.3 Gate Matrices

门矩阵 （不要与门阵列混淆）是从高级规范自动生成布局的下一步发展 [Lopez and Law]。与 PLA 一样，这种布局没有固定的大小；门矩阵根据其复杂性而增长。与所有常规布局形式一样，这种布局有其固定方面和可定制方面。在门矩阵布局中，固定设计由多晶硅栅极材料的垂直列组成。可定制部分是水平延伸的金属和扩散线，用于与列互连并形成栅极。

The gate matrix (not to be confused with the gate-array) is the next step in the evolution of automatically generated layout from high-level specification [Lopez and Law]. Like the PLA, this layout has no fixed size; a gate matrix grows according to its complexity. Like all regular forms of layout, this one has its fixed aspects and its customizable aspects. In gate matrix layout the fixed design consists of vertical columns of polysilicon gating material. The customizable part is the metal and diffusion wires that run horizontally to interconnect and form gates with the columns.

布局由晶体管和连接这些晶体管的导线组成，这是个简单的事实。Weinberger 观察到，对于 MOS 电路，可以转置这些晶体管，使它们位于连接导线的顶部 [Weinberger]。这是因为 MOS 中的多晶硅导线也是晶体管的栅极。将电路转换为这种形式可以节省空间并实现规则性。Weinberger 阵列将每列视为单个 NOR 门，并要求将所有逻辑简化为该元素的组合。

It is a simple fact that layout is composed of transistors and the wires that connect these transistors. Weinberger observed that for MOS circuitry it is possible to transpose these transistors so that they reside on top of the connecting wires [Weinberger]. This is because the polysilicon wire in MOS is also the gate of a transistor. Converting a circuit to this form saves space and achieves regularity. The Weinberger array treats each column as a single NOR gate and requires all logic to be reduced to combinations of this element.

门矩阵还假设许多垂直多晶硅线形成公共电路元件，但逻辑门的类型未指定（见图 4.3）。例如，通过在线路顶部放置负载并在底部接地，每条垂直线都可以成为 nMOS 中的 NAND 门。然后，列上的每个门都充当下拉电路，这些下拉电路串联组合以形成多输入 NAND 功能。CMOS 还可以相当容易地实现 NAND 门矩阵 [Weste 和 Eshraghian]。有自动系统可以根据高级电路描述生成门矩阵 [Liu；Wing、Huang 和 Wang]。刘的系统从逻辑门开始，将它们转换为 NAND，减少一些冗余逻辑，并生成 CMOS 布局（见图 4.4）。将晶体管分配给列的最后一步容易导致效率低下，因为不正确的放置会导致水平互连线很长，而这些线太多会导致门矩阵速度慢且体积大。
图 4.3 门矩阵：（a）示例电路（b）视为门和互连（c）放置在互连上的门。

图 4.4 门矩阵生成：（a）原始逻辑（b）转换为 NAND 门（c）NAND 门的优化（d）门矩阵布局。

Wing、Huang 和 Wang 已分两步解决了晶体管布局问题。首先对每列进行排序，使其晶体管直接连接到相邻的两列。这本质上是贪婪算法[Balraj 和 Foster]。可以为此任务构建并遍历一个简单的连接图。相邻之间肯定会有间隙，但这个初始布局在第二步中得到改进，第二步检查每个晶体管并计算其连接的列范围。此范围用于重新排序列，以便每个晶体管更接近其活动中心。然后根据互连需求确定实际的列和行间距。重新排列行以获得完整的布线，如果需要更多空间，则加宽列。

Wing, Huang, and Wang have solved the transistor-placement problem in two steps. Each column is first ordered such that its transistors connect directly to both adjoining columns. This is essentially the greedy algorithm [Balraj and Foster]. A simple connectivity graph can be built and traversed for this task. There will certainly be gaps in the adjacency, but this initial placement is refined in the second step, which examines each transistor and computes the range of columns to which it is connected. This range is used to reorder the columns so that each transistor is closer to the center of its activity. The actual column and row spacing is then determined according to the interconnect needs. Rows are rearranged to obtain complete wiring and columns are widened if more space is needed.

另一种用于门矩阵优化的自动系统使用高级规则来指导该过程 [Kollaritsch 和 Weste]。这些规则检查电路、重新排列组件并进行压缩。与所有基于规则的系统一样，该系统可以轻松调整以在特殊情况下提供更好的结果。

Another automatic system for gate matrix optimization uses high-level rules to guide the process [Kollaritsch and Weste]. These rules examine the circuit, rearrange components, and compact. As with all rule-based systems, this one can be easily adjusted to provide better results in unusual cases.

 

 

4.2.4 其他正则形式

4.2.4 Other Regular Forms

除了门矩阵，还有许多其他方法可以根据更高级别的规范自动生成布局。 扩散线跟踪是一种将 MOS 设计的晶体管串联在一起的方法，尽可能将源极连接到漏极，然后布线剩余的多晶硅和金属连接 [Nogatch 和 Hodges]。存储/逻辑阵列[Goates、Harris、Oettel 和 Waldron] 是一种增强型 PLA，其中包含存储元件，因此可以在内部捕获状态，而不必绕着阵列外部循环。Tpack 系统允许设计人员根据个性矩阵 [Mayo] 识别将重复的小布局区域。这使得可以轻松设计大型但规则的电路。其他用于构造布局的方法不断被发明。随着这些方法的改进，它们将接近手工布局的质量，并成为硅编译的关键组成部分。

In addition to gate matrices, there are many other ways to generate layout automatically from higher-level specifications. Diffusion line tracing is a method that strings together the transistors of a MOS design, connecting sources to drains as far as possible, and then routing the remaining polysilicon and metal connections [Nogatch and Hodges]. The storage/logic array [Goates, Harris, Oettel, and Waldron] is an enhanced PLA that contains memory elements so that state can be captured internally rather than having to loop around the outside of the array. The Tpack system allows designers to identify areas of a small layout that will be repeated according to a personality matrix [Mayo]. This allows large but regular circuits to be easily designed. Other methods are constantly being invented for the construction of layout. As these methods improve, they will approach the quality of hand layout and earn their place as the key component of silicon compilation.

 

 

4.2.5 压缩

4.2.5 Compaction

在单元内容处理类别下要讨论的最后一个综合工具是压缩，它通过将所有内容移动到允许的最近距离来从设计中移除不必要的空间。此步骤可以在完成的芯片上完成，但通常是逐个单元地完成，以尽快恢复未使用的空间。

The last synthesis tool to be discussed under the category of cell contents manipulation is compaction, which removes unnecessary space from a design by moving everything to its closest permissible distance. This step can be done on a completed chip but is usually done on a cell-by-cell basis to recover unused space as soon as possible.

最简单的压缩方法称为一维压缩，其工作原理是先沿x轴压缩空间，然后沿y轴压缩空间。此过程重复进行，直到无法再恢复空间 [Williams; Hsueh and Pederson; Weste; Entenman and Daniel]。一维压缩操作简单，运行速度相当快，并且可以恢复大部分可节省空间。更先进的技术尝试通过慢速布线或移动组件来节省更多空间；因此，它们可以同时执行布局、布线和压缩。这些方法需要进行组合工作，并且产生的结果仅比简单压缩方法略好。

The simplest compaction method, called one-dimensional compaction, works by squeezing space along the x axis and then along the y axis. This is repeated until no more space can be recovered [Williams; Hsueh and Pederson; Weste; Entenman and Daniel]. One-dimensional compaction is simple to do, runs fairly quickly, and will recover most of the savable space. More advanced techniques attempt to save additional space by jogging wires or moving components; thus they are performing placement, routing, and compaction all at once. These methods have combinatorial work to do and produce only slightly better results than simple compaction methods.

一维压缩使用有关组件及其连接线的信息。垂直于压缩方向的线将一组组件链接到将一起调整的单个轨道中。组件和轨道通常用显示可移动对象及其移动限制的图表表示。例如，在图 4.5 中，当x轴压缩完成时，带有组件 A、B 和 C 的轨道将一起移动，带有组件 E、F 和 G 的轨道也将一起移动。虽然轨道可能贯穿整个单元的长度或宽度，但它也可以被视为布局的局部连接部分。这允许设计的所有未连接部分正确压缩，独立于可能源自同一行或列的其他布局。

One-dimensional compaction uses information about components and their connecting wires. The wires that run perpendicular to the direction of compaction link a set of components into a single track that will adjust together. Components and tracks are typically represented with a graph that shows the movable objects and their movement limitations. For example, in Fig. 4.5 the track with components A, B, and C will move together when x-axis compaction is done, as will the track with components E, F, and G. Although a track may run for the entire length or width of the cell, it may also be treated as a locally connected piece of layout. This allows all unconnected parts of the design to compact properly, independent of other layout that may originate in the same row or column.

图 4.5 一维压缩（沿x轴）：（a）布局（b）最小间距矩阵（c）最小间距图。

压缩是通过调整每条轨道的坐标来完成的。然而，当使用虚拟网格设计样式时，初始间距都在无量纲网格上，因此压缩过程变成了为轨道分配真实坐标的过程 [Weste；Entenman 和 Daniel]。无论初始坐标系如何，一维压缩都必须确定布局中两条轨道之间的最小距离。这可以通过扫描两条轨道中所有组件组合并计算必要的最大设计规则间距来完成。例如，在图 4.5 中，基于 3 个单位的最小扩散间距，晶体管 A 和 G 必须从中心线到中心线相距 7 个单位；A 的中心线与其扩散边缘之间相距 3 个单位；G 的中心线与其扩散边缘之间相距 1 个单位。

Compaction is done by adjusting the coordinates for each track. However, when virtual grid design styles are used, the initial spacings are all on a dimensionless grid, so the compaction process becomes one of assigning real coordinates to the tracks [Weste; Entenman and Daniel]. Regardless of the initial coordinate system, one-dimensional compaction must determine the minimum distance between two tracks of layout. This can be done by scanning all combinations of components in both tracks and computing the greatest design-rule spacing that is necessary. In Fig. 4.5, for example, transistors A and G must be 7 units apart from centerline to centerline, based on a 3-unit minimum diffusion spacing; 3 units between the centerline of A and its diffusion edge; and 1 unit between the centerline of G and its diffusion edge.

每个组件都必须与其相邻组件保持特定距离，并且该距离约束集合可在图中找到。可以通过连接信息增强图的构建，以便允许电气等效组件接触或重叠 [Do and Dawson]。图中还可以有加权因子来解决非几何考虑因素，例如希望保持扩散线较短 [Mosteller]。该图具有每个组件的节点和每个间距规则的弧，可用于快速确定两个轨道的允许间隔。晶体管 A 不会与对象 E 和 F 交互，因为它们不在同一水平。尽管如此，仍有必要检查对角线间隔的对象，因为它们可能会交互。扫描这两列的其余部分显示 7 个单位的间距是最坏情况，因此定义了压缩的极限。

Each component must remain at a particular distance from its neighboring components, and this collection of distance constraints is found in the graph. Construction of the graph can be augmented by connectivity information so that electrically equivalent components are allowed to touch or overlap [Do and Dawson]. There can also be weighting factors in the graph to address nongeometric considerations such as the desire to keep diffusion lines short [Mosteller]. The graph, which has nodes for each component and arcs for each spacing rule, can be used to determine quickly the allowable separation of two tracks. Transistor A does not interact with objects E and F because they are not on the same level. Nevertheless, it is necessary to check for objects that are diagonally spaced because they may interact. Scanning the rest of these two columns shows that the 7-unit spacing is the worst case and thus defines the limit of compaction.

前面的例子也可以用来说明重复应用一维压缩的必要性。第一次x压缩将两列相距 7 个单位，这受到晶体管 A 和 G 的位置限制。然而，在y压缩期间，晶体管 G 可能会向下移动，但晶体管 A 不会，这是由于其他限制。然后，第二遍x压缩将使两列相距 6 个单位，由导线 B 和晶体管 G 之间的最小距离定义。一维压缩通常足够快，可以连续进行，直到任何一个方向都没有改进。

The previous example can also be used to illustrate the need for repeated application of one-dimensional compaction. The first x compaction places the two columns 7 units apart which is limited by the location of transistors A and G. It is possible, however, that during y compaction transistor G will move down but transistor A will not, due to other constraints. Then, the second pass of x compaction will bring the two columns to 6 units apart, defined by the minimum distance between wire B and transistor G. One-dimensional compaction is usually fast enough to be done continuously until there is no improvement made in either direction.

虽然这种方法看起来很简单，但必须注意一些陷阱。Weste 观察到，在压缩时仅检查下一个相邻轨道是不够的。在某些环境中发现的病态情况导致两个轨道之外的布局比紧邻轨道中的布局呈现更严重的约束 [Weste]。因此，约束图的构建必须超出组件轨道形成的边界，并且必须评估所有对象组合之间的最坏情况间距。

Although this method seems simple, there are pitfalls that must be observed. Weste observed that it is not sufficient to check only the next adjacent track when compacting. Pathological cases found in some environments cause layout two tracks away to present more severe constraints than does the layout in the immediately adjacent track [Weste]. Therefore the construction of the constraint graph must extend beyond the boundary formed by tracks of components, and must evaluate the worst-case spacing among all combinations of objects.

在一维压缩过程中，交替轴可能出现的另一个问题是，沿一个轴的运动会阻碍沿另一个轴的更重要的运动。在交互式系统中，可以通过让设计人员指定压缩区域和方向来控制这个问题 [Williams; Scott and Ousterhout; Mori]。一些系统允许设计人员使用自己的约束来扩充间距图 [Do and Dawson; Mosteller]。当这些额外的用户约束造成过度约束的情况时，Do 和 Dawson 会保持布局不压缩，希望正交压缩阶段能够消除阻碍。他们的交互式系统提供的另一个功能是围栏的概念，设计人员可以放置围栏来防止不必要的组件混合。无论交互灵活性如何，问题仍然存在，即一维压缩没有全局信息来帮助其实现最佳结果。需要的是一种关联 x和y约束的方法，以便过程的排序能够使用所有可用信息。

Another problem that can arise in alternating axes during one-dimensional compaction is that motion along one axis can block more significant motion along the other. With an interactive system, this can be controlled by having the designer specify areas and directions of compaction [Williams; Scott and Ousterhout; Mori]. Some systems allow designers to augment the spacing graph with their own constraints [Do and Dawson; Mosteller]. When these additional user constraints create an overconstrained situation, Do and Dawson leave the layout uncompacted with the hope that the orthogonal compaction phase will remove the blockage. Another feature that their interactive system provides is the notion of a fence that designers place to prevent unwanted mingling of components. Regardless of interaction flexibility, the problem remains that one-dimensional compaction has no global information to help it achieve the best results. What is needed is a way to relate the x and y constraints so that the sequencing of the process uses all of the available information.

可以将x轴和y轴约束 合并到单个网络中，以实现更全局的压缩 [Watanabe]。这个网络在所有可能在压缩期间相互作用的组件之间都有弧。这些弧被标记以指示它们是可以单独作用还是可以与沿垂直方向运行的双重约束一起工作。这种双重约束的概念使对角线间隔的组件可以在任一方向上压缩。例如，两个必须保持 3 个单位相距的接触可以在x方向上保持 3 个单位的距离，或者在y方向上保持 3 个单位的距离，但是当它们放在对角线上时，没有必要强制执行这两个约束。这是因为对角线约束的间距比实际需要的要远。

Both x- and y-axis constraints can be incorporated into a single network to enable more global compaction [Watanabe]. This network has arcs between all components that may interact during compaction. These arcs are tagged to indicate whether they can act alone or can work in conjunction with a dual constraint that runs in a perpendicular direction. This notion of a dual constraint enables diagonally spaced components to compact in either direction. For example, two contacts that must remain 3 units apart can stay 3 units away in x, or 3 units away in y, but when they are placed on a diagonal it is not necessary to enforce both constraints. This is because diagonal constraints are spaced farther apart than is actually necessary.

优化双轴约束网络涉及 分支定界技术，该技术迭代地找到任一方向上的最长路径，并移除一半的对偶约束以缩短该路径。这在大型网络上可能需要花费大量时间，因此尽可能减小初始图形大小很有用。Watanabe 发现了一种有助于减小此网络的非压缩布局属性：如果将每个组件视为一个顶点，将每条线视为一条边，则初始设计将形成一个不间断的多边形区域。如果这两个组件不与同一个多边形接壤，则这两个组件之间的约束是不必要的。

Optimizing a two-axis constraint network involves a branch-and-bound technique that iteratively finds the longest path in either direction and removes one-half of a dual constraint to shorten that path. This can take much time on a large network, so it is useful to reduce the initial graph size as much as possible. Watanabe found a property of uncompacted layout that helps to reduce this network: If every component is viewed as a vertex and every wire as an edge, the initial design forms an uninterrupted area of polygons. A constraint between two components is not necessary if those components do not border on the same polygon.

人类通常通过弯曲导线来压缩元件，以便元件可以塞进最狭窄的空间。这可以通过在潜在的弯曲点处分割导线来自动完成，这样两半导线就可以独立移动。一个观察结果是，当两根平行导线通过正交导线连接时，会出现良好的弯曲点 [Dunlop]。正交导线可以弯曲以节省空间（见图 4.6）。当然，弯曲点可以放置在任何地方，最通用的弯曲插入技术是移除所有导线并重新布线 [Maley]。布线方法将在本章后面讨论。
图 4.6 压实过程中的点动插入：（a）之前（b）之后。

最后，可以使用模拟退火作为压缩模型 [Sechen and Sangiovanni-Vincentelli]。这种技术对许多合成任务都很有用，它在开始时对布局进行严格调整，然后减弱其作用以进行较小的更改，从而模仿冷却分子的退火过程 [Metropolis et al. ]。通过在压缩过程中改变组件的位置和方向，可以看到每个变化对压缩都有帮助或有害。首先尝试进行重大更改，以便可以建立整体布局配置。最后进行微小更改，以尝试节省小块空间。这种方法耗费大量时间，但效果非常好。

As a final consideration, it is possible to use simulated annealing as a model of compaction [Sechen and Sangiovanni-Vincentelli]. This technique, which is useful for many synthesis tasks, makes severe adjustments to the layout at the beginning and subsequently damps its action to make smaller changes, thus mimicking the annealing process of cooling molecules [Metropolis et al.]. By making component placement and orientation changes between compaction passes, each change can be seen either to help or to hurt the compaction. Major changes are tried first so that the overall layout configuration can be established. The minor changes are made last, in an attempt to save the small bits of space. This method consumes vast amounts of time but achieves very good results.

压缩中一个更全局的问题是如何在分层环境中进行压缩。通常，首先压缩叶单元，然后调整组合单元以挤压叶实例周围的空间 [Ackland and Weste]。当叶单元压缩重新调整连接点时，这可能会导致问题，从而导致单元间连接断开。虽然分层布局约束系统（如Electric中的系统 ，参见第 11 章）将保证这些连接的安全，但大多数系统必须进行间距匹配（本章后面将讨论），以确保分层压缩将产生有效的结果 [Weste；Entenman and Daniel]。

A more global issue in compaction is how to do it in a hierarchical environment. Typically, leaf cells are compacted first and then composition cells are adjusted to squeeze space around the leaf instances [Ackland and Weste]. This can cause problems when leaf-cell compaction realigns connection points, causing intercell connections to be broken. Although a hierarchical-layout constraint system, such as that in Electric (see Chapter 11), will keep these connections safe, most systems must do pitch matching (discussed later in the chapter) to ensure that hierarchical compaction will produce valid results [Weste; Entenman and Daniel].

压缩有助于提高生产率，因为它使设计人员无需担心适当的间距。使用任何压缩器（即使是简单的一维压缩器），布局最初都可以以粗间距进行，以便更好地可视化电路。设计人员可以专注于电路，而不必浪费时间仔细检查布局中未使用的空间。此外，压缩器的存在使生成单元内容生成器变得更加容易，因为可以推迟精确的布局问题。最后，压缩器可用于将布局从一组几何设计规则转换为另一组几何设计规则 [Schiele]。

Compaction is useful in improving productivity because it frees the designer from worries about proper spacing. With any compacter--even a simple one-dimensional compacter--layout can initially be done with coarse spacing so that the circuit can be better visualized. The designer is free to concentrate on the circuit and need not waste time scrutinizing the layout for unused space. Also, the existence of a compacter makes it easier to produce cell-contents generators because precise layout issues can be deferred. Finally, a compacter can be used to convert layout from one set of geometric design rules to another [Schiele].

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 4 章：综合工具

4.3 单元格外布局生成器

4.3 Generators of Layout Outside the Cells

下一类综合工具处理单元外部的布局。由于大多数有源电路都在单元内部，因此这些工具处理单元间布线（布线）、单元放置和焊盘布局的任务。由于布线可能非常复杂，并且占用的面积可能比实际单元还要大，因此提前规划连接非常重要。虽然正确的单元规划和放置可以使布线更简单，但能够自动执行此操作的工具却很少。

The next class of synthesis tools deals with layout external to the cell. Since most active circuitry is inside the cells, these tools handle the tasks of intercell wiring (routing), cell placement, and pad layout. Since routing can be very complex and can consume more area than the actual cells do, it is important to plan the connections in advance. Although proper cell planning and placement can make the routing simpler, tools that do this automatically are rare.

4.3.1 路由器

4.3.1 Routers

布线器会获得未连接单元上必须连接的点集。这些单元之间的空间可以像矩形一样简单，也可以像迷宫一样复杂（见图 4.7）。当布线空间为矩形且在两个相对的侧面包含连接点时，它被称为 通道。当在矩形区域的四个侧面进行布线时，它被称为 开关盒。更复杂的布线区域通常必须分解为 通道 和 开关盒 。存在许多不同的布线技术，具体取决于要运行的电线数量、布线空间的复杂性以及可供交叉的层数。

A router is given sets of points on unconnected cells that must be connected. The space between these cells can be as simple as a rectangle or as complex as a maze (see Fig. 4.7). When the routing space is rectangular and contains connection points on two facing sides, it is called a channel. When routing is done on four sides of a rectangular area, it is called a switchbox. More complex routing areas usually must be decomposed into channels and switchboxes. Many different techniques exist for routing, depending on the number of wires to run, the complexity of the routing space, and the number of layers available for crossing.

图 4.7 路由区域。

迷宫路由

Maze Routing

迷宫布线是最简单的布线方式，因为它每次只考虑一条线路。给定连接点和一组障碍物，迷宫布线器就会找到一条路径。障碍物可能是单元、无法跨越的触点或已经布线的线路。

Maze routing is the simplest way to run wires because it considers only one wire at a time. Given the connection points and a set of obstacles, the maze router finds a path. The obstacles may be cells, contacts that cannot be crossed, or wires that have already been run.

第一种迷宫布线技术是基于导线要经过的网格点 [Moore; Lee]。现在称为Lee-Moore 算法，其工作原理是围绕起点增加单调递增值的同心环。当环到达端点时，通过向下计数环来定义路径（见图 4.8）。此方法非常简单，因此已构建了硬件实现 [Blank]。它还可以采用以大于 1 递增的加权因子，并在两条路径合并时使用最低值。这可以防止导线在可以进入区域时从区域外进入。
图 4.8 Lee-Moore 路由算法：从“S”开始，整数向“F”辐射；最短路径从末尾向后数。

Lee-Moore 路由的一个问题是它需要一个非常大的工作数组。Moore 观察到整数 0、1 和 2 可以循环使用，因为相邻的值总是正一或负一。但是，即使是两位工作数组也可能非常大。为了避免这个问题，迷宫路由可以使用传统的迷宫求解技术来完成，即沿着障碍墙行走。图 4.9 说明了这种技术：路由器从起点向终点移动，直到碰到障碍物。然后它选择向左行走（尽管它可以选择向右行走，只要它保持一致）。当障碍物被清除后，它会前往终点——但再次遇到障碍物，这次是电线。沿着这些障碍物向左爬行会使路径绕过整个单元到达终点。请注意，可以优化电线障碍物附近的额外循环，以便只有七个转弯而不是九个。 Hightower路由器是迷宫技术的一种变体，它从两端构建路径，直到它们相交并完成连接 [Hightower]。

One problem with Lee-Moore routing is that it demands a work array that is very large. Moore observed that the integers 0, 1, and 2 can be used cyclically since the adjacent values are always plus or minus one. However, even a two-bit work array can be very large. To avoid this problem, maze routing can be done with traditional maze-solving techniques that walk along the obstacle walls. Figure 4.9 illustrates this technique: The router moves from the starting point toward the finish until it hits an obstacle. It then chooses to walk to the left (although it could choose to walk to the right, so long as it is consistent). When the obstacle is cleared, it heads for the endpoint--but once again hits an obstacle, this time a wire. Crawling along these obstacles to the left makes the path go all the way around the cell to get to the endpoint. Note that the extra loop made near the wire obstacle can be optimized away so that there are only seven turns rather than nine. The Hightower router is a variation of the maze technique that constructs paths from both ends until they intersect and complete a connection [Hightower].

图 4.9 迷宫路线。

如图所示，基本迷宫路由器无法胜任许多任务。例如，如果路由器在遇到障碍物时选择向右而不是向左行走，那么它将快速返回其起点。这表明它应该改变方向并重新开始。如果路由器在向左和向右行走后第二次返回，则无法布线。这是图 4.9 中尝试将“start”连接到“aux”时的情况。在这种情况下，唯一的解决方案是更改层，以便电线可以穿过其他电线障碍物。

The basic maze router is inadequate for many tasks, as the figure illustrates. For example, if the router chooses to walk to the right instead of to the left when it hits an obstacle, then it will quickly loop back to its starting point. This is an indication that it should change directions and start again. If the router then returns for the second time after walking both to the left and to the right, the wire cannot be routed. This is the case in Fig. 4.9 when an attempt is made to connect "start" to "aux." The only solution in such a situation is to change layers so that the wire can cross other wire obstacles.

多层布线显然是这项基本技术的扩展。通常，导线换层的长度仅足以桥接形成障碍的其他导线。有些方案有一层水平布线和另一层垂直布线 [Doreau 和 Koziol；Kernighan、Schweikert 和 Persky]。在每一层上布线并不困难，因为所有导线都是平行的，因此唯一的问题是如何排列平行路径集。由于水平和垂直路径已知，因此可以固定层触点的位置，这样剩下的问题就是如何在它们之间布线。这可以通过交换导线直到它们都穿过可用空间并绕过层触点来完成。该方案采用约束网络，指示有多少条导线可以在任何两个障碍之间通过。该网络简化了导线宽度和设计规则间距的计算。它确保导线永远不会形成障碍，但它会产生大量的层触点。

Multilayer routing is an obvious extension to this basic technique. Typically the wire changes layers only long enough to bridge other wires that form an obstacle. Some schemes have one layer that runs horizontally and another layer that runs vertically [Doreau and Koziol; Kernighan, Schweikert, and Persky]. Routing on each layer is not difficult because all wires are parallel, so the only question is how to order sets of parallel paths. Since horizontal and vertical paths are already known, the location of layer contacts can be fixed so that the remaining problem is how to wire between them. This is done by swapping wires until they all fit through the available spaces and around the layer contacts. This scheme employs a constraint network that indicates how many wires can pass between any two obstacles. The network simplifies the computation of wire width and design-rule spacing. It ensures that wires will never form obstacles, but it creates a large number of layer contacts.

进行多层布线时，还必须考虑其他事项。最重要的是尽量减少层切换次数。与其他层的接触会占用两层的空间，并对其他线路形成障碍。此外，过多的层切换会延迟最终电路中的信号。因此，布线器应通过拒绝进行不必要的更改来优化层切换，如果更改不是避障所必需的。在多层布线中，一个有用的选项是，可能需要不同的起始层和结束层来布线，这样，一旦进行层切换，线路就可以保留在切换到的层中。当然，切换层的另一种方法是绕过障碍物的外部，这会占用大量空间。为了实现这一点而不走荒谬的弯路，一些布线器具有参数，可以在额外的运行长度和额外的层切换之间进行选择，以避开障碍物 [Doreau 和 Koziol]。

Other considerations must be addressed when doing multilayer routing. The most important is to minimize the number of layer changes. Contacts to other layers take up space on both layers and form obstacles for other wires. Also, excessive layer switching can delay a signal in the final circuit. Therefore the router should optimize the layer switches by refusing to make a change if it is not necessary for obstacle avoidance. A useful option to consider in multilayer routing is that there may be different starting and ending layers desired for a wire so that, once a layer change is made, the wire can remain in the layer to which it was switched. Of course, an alternative to switching layers is to route around the outside of an obstacle, which can consume much space. To allow for this without making absurd detours, some routers have parameters to choose between extra run length and extra layer changes for obstacle avoidance [Doreau and Koziol].

另一个多层布线考虑因素是层的优先级。由于并非所有层都相同，因此给定层上的信号速度应该会影响该层的使用。此外，某些信号仅限于某些层。在 IC 布局中，电源线和地线必须始终在金属层上运行 [Keller]。当这些线与其他信号交叉时，另一个信号必须换层。确保这一点的一种方法是先运行电源线和地线；但是，仍然必须有特殊代码来确保这些线的正确放置。PI 系统使用旅行商技术来找到一条以最佳距离仅穿过每个单元一次的路径 [Rivest]。由于这条路径从不与自身相交，它将布局分为两侧，电源和地线可以在两侧不相交的情况下运行。

Another multilayer-routing consideration is the priority of layers. Since not all layers are the same, the speed of signals on a given layer should bias that layer's use. Also, some signals are restricted to certain layers. In IC layout, the power and ground wires must always run on metal layers [Keller]. When these wires cross other signals, it is the other signal that must change layers. One way to ensure this is to run the power and ground wires first; however, there must still be special code to ensure the correct placement of these wires. The PI system uses a traveling-salesman technique to find a path that runs through each cell only once in an optimal distance [Rivest]. Since this path never crosses itself, it divides the layout into two sides on which power and ground can be run without intersecting.

在印刷电路布线中，有些信号必须在特定层上运行。例如，在电路板测试中很重要的那些线路必须在外层上运行，以便于探测。因此，多层布线器必须允许对某些线路路径提出特殊请求。

In printed-circuit routing, there are some signals that must run on specific layers. For example, those wires that are important in board testing must run on outside layers so that they can be probed easily. Therefore the multilayer router must allow special requests for certain wires' paths.

多线路由

Multiple-Wire Routing

一次布置一条完整的电路可能很困难，因为每条线路的布置都没有考虑随后可能布置的其他线路。没有这种全局考虑，很难实现完全的一致性。在某些情况下，预先排列要布置的线路可能会有所帮助。例如，如果按长度对线路进行排序，并从最短的线路开始放置，那么简单直接的布线将毫无困难地完成，较长的线路将绕过它们。或者，如果先布置最长的线路，那么它们将保证能够完成，而短连接将不得不努力完成电路。另一种解决方案是首先在最拥挤的区域布置线路 [Doreau 和 Koziol]。这是一个不错的选择，因为它最有效地避免了无法完成所有布线的问题。

Routing an entire circuit one wire at a time can be difficult, because each wire is run without consideration for others that may subsequently be routed. Without this global consideration, total consistency is hard to achieve. Preordering of the wires to be routed can help in some circumstances. For example, if the wires are sorted by length and are placed starting with shortest, then the simple and direct wiring will get done without trouble and the longer wires will work around them. Alternatively, if the longest wires are run first, then they will be guaranteed to run and the short connections will have to struggle to complete the circuit. Another solution is to run wires in the most congested areas first [Doreau and Koziol]. This is a good choice because it most effectively avoids the problem of being unable to complete all the wiring.

布线多条线路时，另一种选择是使用替代的线路。如果将布线的每条线路都保存在堆栈中，那么当无法布线新线路时，可以使用此信息进行备份。通过备份堆栈并撤消导致阻塞的有问题线路的线路，可以创建一条替代路径，以便后续线路可以拥有更好的不同环境（参见图 4.10）。 必须将这种布线更改的性质保存在堆栈中，以便当路由器第二次回溯到该点时不会再次做出相同的选择。如果反复回溯以重做一条线路耗尽了该线路的可能性，则回溯必须越过有问题的线路，到达允许更多可能性的较早线路。这个过程可能非常耗时，因为它会一次重复布线一条线路。只需进行少量记账，就可以节省大量计算，以便更快地布线回溯后重新布线的线路。尽管如此，并不能保证对这些线路进行递归处理就能得到好的解决方案。提高布线成功率的一种方法是搜索可能的线路路径空间，以便只放置那些保证不会增加空间的线路 [Kernighan、Schweikert 和 Persky]。

Another option when routing many wires is the use of alternative routes for a wire. If each wire that is routed is kept on a stack, then this information can be used to back up when a new wire cannot be run. By backing up through the stack and undoing wires up to the offending wire that causes the blockage, an alternate path can be made so that subsequent wires can have a different environment that may be better (see Fig. 4.10). The nature of this routing change must be saved on the stack so that the same choice will not be made again if the router backtracks to that point a second time. If repeated backtracking to redo a wire exhausts the possibilities for that wire, backtracking must then go beyond the offending wire to an earlier one that allows even more possibilities. This process can be extremely time consuming as it repeatedly routes wires one at a time. With a little bookkeeping, much of the computing can be saved so that wires that reroute after a backtrack are routed faster. Nevertheless, there are no guarantees that recursive juggling of these wires will result in a good solution. One way to improve the chances for routing is to search the space of possible wire paths so that only those wires that promise no space increase are placed [Kernighan, Schweikert, and Persky].

图 4.10 布线中的回溯：（a）首次尝试布线网络 2；（b）回溯重新布线网络 1。

操纵单个路径以获得全局一致性的另一种方法是使用压缩中使用的模拟退火技术 [Kirkpatrick、Gelatt 和 Vecchi；Sechen 和 Sangiovanni-Vincentelli]。通过对布线质量进行全局衡量并进行随机更改，可以看到每个更改是帮助还是阻碍布线。首先尝试的重大更改建立了整体布线配置；最后进行小更改以确保布线细节正确。这种方法也耗费大量时间，但效果非常好。

Another way to manipulate single paths to obtain global consistency is with the simulated-annealing technique used in compaction [Kirkpatrick, Gelatt, and Vecchi; Sechen and Sangiovanni-Vincentelli]. Having a global measure of routing quality and making random changes allows each change to be seen either to help or to hinder the routing. Major changes, which are tried first, establish the overall routing configuration; minor changes are done last to get the details of the wiring correct. This method also consumes vast amounts of time, but achieves very good results.

频道和开关盒路由

Channel and Switchbox Routing

单线布线的替代方法是通道布线，即一次布置通道中的所有电线。该技术本质上是扫描布线区域，将所有电线延伸到其最终目的地。虽然这种布线方法可能会卡在通道末端，无法完成许多电线，但它在扫描过程中会进行全局考虑，因此结果通常比迷宫布线更好。此外，它的速度更快，因为它并行考虑所有电线，只检查一次布线区域，并避免回溯。那些可以处理布线区域所有侧面连接的路由器称为交换盒路由器[Soukup]，它们的工作方式通常与通道路由器相同。如果布线区域不是矩形，则必须将其分成多个矩形，并沿分界线分配连接点（见图 4.11）。此步骤称为全局布线或 松散布线[Lauther]。
图 4.11 全局路由：(a) 之前 (b) 之后。

通道和开关盒布线通常假设导线在固定间距网格上运行，而不管导线宽度或触点大小如何。所有触点也都位于这些网格位置上。尽管这可能会因为需要使用最坏情况设计规则而消耗额外空间，但始终可以在后处理步骤中压缩该区域。如果新线对于成功完成布线是必要的，某些布线器能够在初始行和列之间创建新的网格线 [Luk; Lauther]。

Channel and switchbox routing typically make the assumption that wires run on a fixed-pitch grid, regardless of wire width or contact size. All contact points are also on these grid locations. Although this may consume extra space because of the need to use worst-case design rules, the area can always be compacted in a postprocessing step. Some routers are able to create new grid lines between the initial rows and columns if the new lines are necessary to complete the wiring successfully [Luk; Lauther].

尽管有许多通道和开关盒路由器 [Deutsch；Rivest 和 Fiduccia；Doreau 和 Koziol]，但本文仅讨论其中一种；它结合了许多其他路由器的优点 [Hamachi 和 Ousterhout]。此路由器与包含连接点、障碍物和障碍物的开关盒配合使用，并使用两层电线进行连接（见图 4.12）。 障碍物是只能在某些层上穿过的区域。 障碍物会阻挡所有层，迫使路由器绕过它们工作。

Although there are many channel and switchbox routers [Deutsch; Rivest and Fiduccia; Doreau and Koziol], only one will be discussed; it combines good features from many others [Hamachi and Ousterhout]. This router works with a switchbox that contains connection points, obstacles, and obstructions and makes connections using two layers of wire (see Fig. 4.12). Obstructions are those areas that can be crossed only on certain layers. Obstacles block all layers, forcing the router to work around them.

图 4.12 交换盒布线：（a）初始配置（b）布线后。

布线任务如下：每个网络位于特定的水平轨道中，最终必须到达不同的水平轨道才能完成布线。布线一次一列，从左侧开始，扫过整个区域。在每一列，都有规则来确定哪些网络将切换轨道。当扫描到达区域的右侧时，布局完成，所有网络都已布线。

The routing task is viewed as follows: Each net is in a particular horizontal track and must eventually get to a different horizontal track to complete its wiring. The wiring is run one column at a time, starting from the left and sweeping across the area. At each column, there are rules to determine which nets will switch tracks. When the sweep reaches the right side of the area, the layout is complete and all nets have been routed.

为了在开关盒中实现此模型，必须将顶部和底部连接的网络引入第一个水平轨道，并且任何不在轨道中心的网络连接都必须移动到正确的位置。一旦所有网络都在水平轨道上，就可以开始布线了。

In order to implement this model for switchboxes, the nets connected at the top and bottom must be brought into the first horizontal track, and any connections to nets that are not on track centers must jog to the correct place. Once the nets are all on horizontal tracks, routing can begin.

在处理每一列时，优先考虑那些可能使网络崩溃的垂直布线。图 4.12 左侧第一列就是这种情况，它使网络 2 崩溃。请注意，在运行垂直导线时，层会发生变化。这样，垂直和水平轨道就可以交叉，而不必担心连接。为了防止过度的层切换，后处理步骤会消除不必要的开关并移动触点，以最大限度地利用首选层（如果有）。

As each column is processed, priority is given to those vertical wirings that can collapse a net. This is the case with the first column on the left in Fig. 4.12 that collapses net 2. Notice that the layer changes when running vertical wires. This allows vertical and horizontal tracks to cross without fear of connection. To prevent excessive layer switching, a postprocessing step eliminates unnecessary switches and moves contacts to maximize use of the preferred layer (if any).

处理列的下一个优先事项是将轨道移向目的地。图中的网络 3 在越过障碍物后立即向下移动，以便接近目的地。同样，网络 4 立即向下移动至其正确轨道。必须使用特殊规则来处理通道的右侧；否则，像网络 5 这样的线路将无法知道它们的目的地，直到为时已晚。这些规则保留了适当数量的列来布线右边缘。

The next priority in processing a column is to shift tracks toward a destination. Net 3 in the figure makes a downward jog as soon as it has cleared the obstacle so that it can approach its destination. Similarly, net 4 jogs down to its correct track immediately. Special rules must be used to handle the righthand side of the channel; otherwise wires like net 5 will not know their destination until it is too late. These rules reserve an appropriate number of columns to route the right edge.

除了这些基本规则外，还有更复杂的规则，规定何时建立接触、何时在预期出现障碍物时腾出轨道、何时分割网络以准备多个终端连接。当按照正确的顺序遵循规则时，通道布线就可以实现。

In addition to these basic rules, there are much more complex ones that dictate when to create a contact, when to vacate a track in anticipation of an obstruction, and when to split a net in preparation for multiple end connections. When the rules are followed in the proper order, channel routing is achieved.

河流路线

River Routing

在某些情况下，布线需求是专门的，由于问题的限制，可以更容易地解决。河流布线就是这样一种简化的技术，它连接许多保证不交叉而是彼此平行的电线。河流布线可用于连接两个间距和对齐不正确的单元 [Wardle et al. ]。河流布线的问题是如果一端比另一端宽，如何正确调整间距。一种方法是串行运行总线的电线，并在每根电线后构建避让区域 [Tompa]。图 4.13 显示了这个过程：虚线是放置电线后创建的避让区域。诸如此类的特殊方法可以满足电路布线中所有不寻常的布线需求。
图 4.13 河流布线。虚线表示引导后续布线的避让区域。

 

 

4.3.2 放置

4.3.2 Placement

布局（有时也称为平面规划）是将单元定位为能够良好连接且不浪费空间的过程。因此，自动布局工具需要知道每个单元的大小和完整的布线要求。由于此信息与布线器所需的信息相同，因此两者通常被认为是同一过程的两个部分。事实上，布局和布线是自动印刷电路板布局中的一个步骤。然而，两者通常是独立的，并且由不同的算法驱动。此外，它们必须分别发挥作用，因为每个都会产生另一个所需的结果：首先，布局确定单元的初始位置；接下来，布线连接单元，并通过其成功程度来指示对布局的更改如何有所帮助。重复该过程，直到产生合适的布局。虽然理想的布局和布线系统会统一执行这些任务，但目前尚不存在这样的系统。所需要的是能够在通用数据结构中共享布局和布线目标，以便系统可以在优先级发生变化时在两者之间交替。

Placement, or floor-planning as it is sometimes called, is the process of positioning cells such that they connect well and do not waste space. Automatic placement tools therefore need to know the size of each cell and the complete set of routing requirements. Since this information is the same as what is required of routers, the two are often thought of as two parts of the same process. In fact, placement and routing comprise a single step in automatic printed-circuit-board layout. However, the two are often independent and have different algorithms driving them. Also, they must function separately as each produces results needed by the other: First, placement establishes an initial location of cells; next, routing connects the cells and indicates, by its success, how changes to the placement can help. The process is repeated until suitable layout is produced. Although an ideal placement and routing system would do these tasks uniformly, no such systems exist today. What is needed is to be able to share the placement and the routing goals in a common data structure so that the system can alternate between the two as the priorities change.

有一种系统确实通过将整体布局和布线任务划分为交替调用的较小部分来实现这种统一 [Supowitz 和 Slutz]。该系统观察到，T 形布线区域的垂直下部通道需要在水平上部区域之前布线。此 T 形布线区域由左侧、右侧和顶部的三个单元创建。布线垂直下部通道可使左侧和右侧的单元正确放置。然后可以布线上部区域并正确放置顶部单元。假设已经进行了粗略的布局，因此布局和布线步骤可以简单地连接起来，同时微调单元位置。另一个假设是 T 形布线区域没有循环，这会妨碍布局和布线步骤的良好排序。

One system does approach this unification by dividing the overall placement and routing task into smaller pieces that are invoked alternately [Supowitz and Slutz]. This system observes that the vertical, lower channel of a T-shaped routing area needs to be routed before the horizontal, upper area. This T-shaped routing area is created by three cells on the left, right, and top. Routing the vertical, lower channel allows the cells on the left and right to be placed correctly. Then the upper area can be routed and the top cell can be placed correctly. The assumption is that a crude placement has already been done so that the placement and routing step can simply connect while fine-tuning the cell locations. Another assumption is that there is no cycle of T-shaped routing areas, which would prevent a good ordering of the placement and routing steps.

自动布局之所以困难，是因为它必须解决极其复杂的问题。例如，如果忽略布线而只考虑布局，那么任务就只是以最佳方式平铺一个区域，这是 NP 完全问题 [Garey and Johnson]。这意味着紧密排列单元的程序可能需要花费不合理的时间才能完成。如果将布线考虑因素添加到此任务中，那么提出的每种单元布局组合也将需要大量时间进行布线。由于这些问题，布局无法以最佳方式完成；相反，它采用启发式方法，在很短的时间内产生相当好的结果。

Automatic placement is difficult because of the extremely complex problems that it must satisfy. For example, if the wiring is ignored and only placement is considered, the task is simply one of tiling an area optimally, which is NP-complete [Garey and Johnson]. This means that the program for packing cells tightly can take an unreasonable amount of time to complete. If wiring considerations are added to this task, then every combination of cell placements that is proposed will also require seriously large amounts of time in routing. Because of these problems, placement cannot be done optimally; rather, it is done with heuristics that produce tolerably good results in small amounts of time.

自动布局的一种启发式方法是最小切割[Breuer]。该技术将未布局的单元分成两组，分别位于芯片的相对两侧。每侧进一步细分，直到形成一个正确组织所有单元的树形结构图。最小切割划分的确定基于单元之间的布线。最小切割的目标是划分单元，以切割最少的布线（见图 4.14）。单元数量应大致分为两部分，使得每一半都具有大量内部连接，而两半之间的互连最少。

One heuristic for automatic placement is min-cut [Breuer]. This technique divides the unplaced cells into two groups that belong on opposite sides of the chip. Each side is further subdivided until a tree-structured graph is formed that properly organizes all cells. Determination of the min-cut division is based on the wiring between the cells. The goal of min-cut is to make a division of cells that cuts the fewest wires (see Fig. 4.14). The number of cells should be divided approximately in two, such that each half has a high amount of internal connectivity and the two halves are minimally interconnected.

图 4.14 最小切割布局方法。目标是找到一种单元划分方法，使线切割次数最少。

最小割技术不能完成整个放置工作。它既不考虑单元大小，也不考虑单元组内单元的相对方向。但是，它是通过将问题分解为较小的子问题来减小问题规模的一种方法。另一种做同样事情的方法称为自下而上 [Rivest；Heller、Sorkin 和 Maling]，从概念上讲，它与最小割方法相反，因为它会增加簇而不是减少簇。

The min-cut technique cannot do the whole job of placement. It considers neither cell sizes nor the relative orientation of cells within a group. However, it is one method of reducing the size of the problem by breaking it up into smaller subproblems. Another way of doing the same thing, called bottom-up [Rivest; Heller, Sorkin, and Maling], is conceptually the opposite of the min-cut method because it grows clusters rather than cutting them down.

自下而上的自动布局方法假定所有单元都是不同的，必须根据其需要进行分组。加权函数用于指示两个单元的匹配程度。此函数与最小切割函数类似，计算通过对两个单元进行聚类可以消除的导线数量。它还可以考虑单元大小和其他权重。然后，聚类继续对越来越多的单元进行分组，直到进一步的工作无法节省成本。图 4.15 说明了这种技术。最初，有四个不相关的单元。自下而上的规划通过消除最多的导线来找到最适合在一起的两个单元。除了考虑单元外部的布线外，还需要检查簇内布线的复杂性。如果不这样做，那么最佳的自下而上的聚类将是一个包含所有单元且没有外部导线的单个簇。
图 4.15 自下而上的放置方法：（a）之前（b）之后。

一旦最小切割或自下而上方法将单元格组织成相对方向，就需要更精确的放置。这可以通过将放置图转换为包含位置的对偶图来实现 [Kozminski 和 Kinnen]。该方法递归地挑选原始图的边缘成员并创建一个具有位置和大小信息的新图。通过按邻接顺序进行，新图以“砖砌”风格构建。

Once min-cut or bottom-up methods have organized the cells into their relative orientations, a more precise placement is needed. This can be done by converting the placement graph into a dual graph that includes position [Kozminski and Kinnen]. The method recursively picks off edge members of the original graph and creates a new graph with position and size information. By proceeding in adjacency order, the new graph is built in a "brickwork" style.

将布局图转换为更精确的布局的另一种方法是在构建初始布局图时计算此信息。在一个系统中，初始布局被视为一个正方形，每个最小切割分割将正方形按切割两侧单元格面积的比例进行划分 [Lauther]。完成最小切割后，正方形会显示正确的面积和位置，但纵横比不正确。然后，问题就是将实际单元格放入正方形的理想区域中。使用了许多近似方法，包括旋转单元格和展开区域。由于布线要求可能会进一步扩展布局，因此这种近似不会造成损害。

An alternative to converting the placement graph into a more precise placement is to compute this information as the initial placement graph is built. In one system, the initial layout is seen as a square, and each min-cut division divides the square proportionally to the area of cells on each side of the cut [Lauther]. When min-cut is done, the square indicates proper area and position, but incorrect aspect ratio. The problem then is to fit the actual cells into the idealized areas of the square. A number of approximate methods are used, including rotating cells and spreading open the area. Since routing requirements may spread the layout further, this approximation is not damaging.

除了最小切割和自下而上的方法之外，那些与行为方式相似的物理系统相似的方法也可用于布局。例如，如果将电路视为电阻网络，其中每个单元都是一个恒定电压节点，而每个单元间导线集合都是一个电阻器，那么问题就变成了找到正确电压的问题。接近的电压值表示应该靠近的单元。为了实现这种技术，导线长度的平方成为使用矩阵技术 [Cheng 和 Kuh] 求解的目标函数。然后可以使用已经描述的技术将生成的图形调整为实际布局。

Besides min-cut and bottom-up methods, those that find analogies to physical systems that behave in similar ways also can be used to do placement. For example, if a circuit is viewed as a resistive network, in which each cell is a constant voltage node and each collection of intercell wires is a resistor, then the problem becomes one of finding the correct voltage. The voltage values that are close indicate cells that should be near. To implement this technique, the square of the wire lengths becomes the objective function that is solved with matrix techniques [Cheng and Kuh]. The resulting graph can then be adjusted into actual placement using the techniques already described.

用于布局的另一种物理仿真是模拟退火[Kirkpatrick、Gelatt 和 Vecchi；Sechen 和 Sangiovanni-Vincentelli]。该方法已被证明在压缩和布线中很有用，因此它也适用于布局也就不足为奇了。给定初始平面图，退火器会进行重大更改并评估结果。更改的严重程度会逐渐降低，直到只需要调整细节。与其他退火任务一样，这种方法会耗费大量时间，但会产生良好的效果。

Another physical emulation that is used for placement is simulated annealing [Kirkpatrick, Gelatt, and Vecchi; Sechen and Sangiovanni-Vincentelli]. This method was shown to be useful in compaction and routing, so it should be no surprise that it also works for placement. Given an initial floor-plan, the annealer makes severe changes and evaluates the results. The severity of the changes decreases until there is nothing but detail to adjust. Like the other annealing tasks, this method consumes large amounts of time but produces good results.

可以使用其他信息来产生更智能的单元布局。例如，可以使用特殊代码来检测对齐良好且应放置在一起的单元。这可以在通用布局开始之前完成。惯用的平面规划器可以识别这些特殊情况并在每种情况下使用适当的算法 [Deas and Nixon]。通过检查布线需求并应用识别数组、树、复杂开关盒等的专门规则来确定布局中存在哪些惯用方法。

Other information can be used to produce more intelligent cell placement. For example, there can be special code to detect cells that align well and should be placed together. This can be done before the general-purpose placement begins. An idiomatic floor-planner is one that recognizes these special situations and uses appropriate algorithms in each case [Deas and Nixon]. Determining which idioms exist in the layout is done by examining the routing needs and applying specialized rules that recognize arrays, trees, complex switchboxes, and so on.

一旦找到基本布局，就可以使用其他方法来微调布局。布线结果将指示通道利用率，以便可以调整单元间距。此信息可用于控制另一次布局迭代，或者可以简单地指示最终布局是否需要压缩。研究表明，通过在最小切割分割的每个步骤之后进行布线，可以缩短布局和布线周期 [Burstein、Hong 和 Pelavin]。布线结果再次有助于后续布局。

Once a basic placement has been found, it is possible to use other methods to fine-tune the layout. The results of routing will indicate the amount of channel utilization so that the cell spacing can be adjusted. This information can be used to control another iteration of placement or it can simply indicate the need for compaction of the final layout. It has also been shown that the placement and routing cycle can be shortened by having routing take place after every step of min-cut division [Burstein, Hong and Pelavin]. Once again, the results of routing help with subsequent placement.

除了布线之外，还可以使用其他工具来帮助改善布局结果。一个系统甚至集成了时序信息来帮助布局和布线迭代 [Teig、Smith 和 Seaton]。这种时序分析（在第 5 章中有更详细的描述）可以找到最坏情况的电路延迟，以便放置的模块和布线可以优化该路径。

Besides routing, other tools can be used to help improve the results of placement. One system even integrates timing information to help placement and routing iterations [Teig, Smith, and Seaton]. This timing analysis, described more fully in Chapter 5, finds the worst-case circuit delay so that the placed modules and routed wires can optimize that path.

自动布局是一个尚未得到很好解决的难题。然而，这是手工设计优于机器设计的少数任务之一，因此值得尝试解决。有了良好的布局，自动布局就可以成为有用的现实。在此之前，这些系统将提供可供设计师选择的替代布局。

Automatic placement is a difficult problem that has not yet been solved well. However, it is one of the few tasks in which hand design excels over machine design, so it is worth trying to solve. With good placement, automatic layout can become a useful reality. Until such time, these systems will provide alternative layouts from which a designer can choose.

 

 

4.3.3 焊盘布局

4.3.3 Pad Layout

集成电路芯片的焊盘是大面积的金属，没有玻璃层保护，因此可以连接到 IC 封装的引线。虽然与其他电路元件相比焊盘很大，但焊盘非常小，难以在其上接合连接线。自动引线接合机可以进行精确连接，但必须针对每种焊盘配置进行编程。芯片设计师需要一种能够帮助解决焊盘各个方面问题的工具。

The pads of an integrated-circuit chip are large areas of metal that are left unprotected by the overglass layer so they can be connected to the leads of the IC package. Although large compared to other circuit elements, the pads are very small and make a difficult surface on which to bond connecting wires. Automatic wire-bonding machines can make accurate connections, but they must be programmed for each pad configuration. The chip designer needs a tool that will help with all aspects of bonding pads.

许多设计师对自动焊盘布局的直接反对意见是他们希望手动放置焊盘。鉴于焊盘占用了很大的面积，设计师通常希望完全控制布局，以防止浪费空间。芯片通常没有太多焊盘，因此手动技术不会浪费太多时间。

The immediate objection of many designers to the offer of automatic pad layout is that they want to place the pads manually. Given that pads consume large areas, the designer often wants total placement control to prevent wasted space. Chips have not typically had many pads anyway, so manual techniques do not consume much time.

对这些反对意见的回答是，任何任务，无论多么简单，都必须在完整的设计系统中实现自动化。随着专用芯片数量的增加和其生产量的减少，自动化设计将比以最佳空间进行设计更为重要。此外，如果焊机不直接与 CAD 系统相连，其编程可能会成为瓶颈。现代芯片中可能有数百个焊盘；手动放置它们会导致乏味和混乱。最后，在进行焊盘布局时，只需牢记一些注意事项，这些注意事项可以轻松实现自动化。

The answer to such objections is that any task, no matter how simple, must be automated in a complete design system. As the number of special-purpose chips increases and their production volume decreases, it will be more important to design automatically than to design with optimal space. Also, the programming of the bonding machine can become bottlenecked if it is not directly linked to the CAD system. In modern chips there can be hundreds of pads; placing them manually will lead to tedium and confusion. Finally, there are only a few considerations that must be kept in mind when doing pad layout and these can be easily automated.

在放置焊盘时需要考虑的一个问题是焊盘应靠近芯片的边缘。如果焊盘必须伸入芯片中心，焊盘可能会溅出金属并损坏电路。有些制造工艺甚至要求焊盘外不放置任何有源电路。然而，其他制造工艺允许焊盘位于芯片的任何地方。将焊盘放置在边缘的另一个原因是防止焊线交叉。焊盘必须从芯片外部呈现出整洁的视野。

One consideration in pad placement is that the pads should be near the perimeter of the chip. The bonding machine may spatter metal and do damage to the circuitry if it has to reach into the center. Some fabrication processes even require that no active circuitry be placed outside of the pads. Others, however, allow pads anywhere on the chip. Another reason to place pads on the edge is to keep the bonding wires from crossing. The pads must present an uncluttered view from the outside of the chip.

除了位于芯片的边缘之外，焊盘还应均匀放置。这意味着四个边缘上的焊盘数量必须大致相同，并且它们必须沿每个边缘均匀分布。在具有矩形布局的特殊芯片上，焊盘可能仅沿两个边缘均匀分布。相等的间距使自动键合更容易，而均匀的焊盘密度可防止键合线杂乱并可能造成短路。还必须考虑焊盘间距的适当限制（目前中心间距不小于 200 微米 [Keller]）。

In addition to being located on the edge of the chip, pads should also be placed uniformly. This means that there must be approximately the same number of pads on all four edges and that they must be spaced evenly along each edge. On special chips that have rectangular layout, the pads may be evenly spaced along only two edges. Equal spacing makes automatic bonding easier, and uniform pad density keeps the bonding wires from cluttering and possibly shorting. The proper limitations of pad spacing must also be taken into consideration (currently no less than 200 microns between centers [Keller]).

一种用于放置焊盘的算法称为旋转布线[Johannsen]。该技术首先将焊盘按与芯片中连接点相同的循环顺序排序。然后将焊盘以均匀的间距放置在芯片周围，并旋转到所有位置。使用使焊盘总导线长度最小化的一个位置。

One algorithm for pad placement is called roto-routing [Johannsen]. This technique starts by sorting the pads into the same circular sequence as are their connection points in the chip. The pads are then placed into a uniform spacing around the chip and rotated through all positions. The one position that minimizes overall wire length to the pads is used.

正确焊盘布局的另一个考虑因素是电源和接地焊盘的位置。虽然某些应用需要多个电源和接地焊盘以实现高功耗，但通常每个焊盘只有一个，并且它们通常应该位于芯片的相对侧，因为它们通常与封装相对侧的引线粘合在一起。此外，它们必须正确连接到其他焊盘才能获得正确的电源和接地分配。图 4.16 显示了电源、接地和焊盘的一种配置。接地在焊盘外部运行，因为它的重要性低于电源轨，电源轨就在内部运行。这种布置使每个焊盘都可以轻松访问其正常工作所需的电源电压。但是，为了将这些电压传送到芯片，内部电源轨中必须有一个间隙。
图 4.16 显示电源和接地轨的焊盘框架。

使用标准开关盒技术可以自动将焊盘信号路由到主芯片电路。重要的是尽量将焊盘放置在靠近目的地的位置，以便信号线不会延伸到芯片的长度和宽度。自动将焊盘分配给信号的技术可以同时考虑线长和信号时序的重要性。例如，从外部引入的两相时钟应放置在与有源电路距离相似的两个焊盘上。

Routing of pad signals to the main chip circuitry can be done automatically with standard switchbox techniques. It is important to try to place the pads close to their destination so that signal wires do not run the length and width of the chip. Techniques for automatically assigning pads to signals can take into account both wire length and the importance of that signal's timing. For example, a two-phase clock brought in from outside should be placed on two pads that have similar distances to the active circuit.

尽管焊盘布局只是集成电路设计中的一个小方面，但它却是任何优秀 CAD 系统的必要组成部分。不断变化的设计方法需要能够完成所有工作并防止小疏忽演变成重大故障的工具。焊盘布局有详细的限制，未能遵守其中任何一个都可能导致芯片完全失效。

Although bonding-pad placement is a minor aspect of integrated-circuit design, it is a necessary part of any good CAD system. Changing design methodologies call for tools that can do all the work and prevent minor oversights from turning into major failures. There are detailed constraints in pad layout, and failure to observe any one of them can cause the chip to fail totally.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 4 章：综合工具

4.4 细胞及其环境

4.4 Cells and Their Environment

下一类综合工具处理单元的一般环境。这些工具不关心显式布局，而是确保布局得到正确使用。此类别包括对齐和间距匹配工具。

The next class of synthesis tools deals with the general environment of cells. These tools do not concern themselves with explicit layout, but rather ensure that the layout is properly used. Included in this category are alignment and pitch matching tools.

4.4.1 对准和间距匹配

4.4.1 Alignment and Pitch Matching

当完成的单元被放在一起形成电路时，它们可以通过两种方式连接：通过组合规则隐式邻接或通过连接规则显式邻接。邻接假设单元的内容经过精确设计，使得它们彼此靠近即可形成连接线。这样做的好处是单元之间浪费的空间更少，因为不需要复杂的布线。缺点是，为了将电线放到正确的位置，单元内部可能会损失一些空间。这种正确对齐电线以进行外部连接的过程是间距匹配的一部分。

When completed cells are placed together to form a circuit, there are two ways that they can connect: implicitly by abutting with composition rules or explicitly by connection rules. Abutment presupposes that the contents of the cells are precisely designed so that their mere presence near each other forms connecting wires. This has the advantage that less space is wasted between the cells because no complex routing of wires is needed. The disadvantage is that some space may be lost inside the cells in order to get the wires to the right place. This process of properly aligning wires for external connection is part of pitch matching.

间距匹配实际上是单元的拉伸和收缩，以便它们的边界框对齐。例如，如果要从求反单元和加法单元构建一个多位并行减法单元，则两个单元的纵横比应进行间距匹配，以便两者具有相同的高度（或宽度，取决于它们的堆叠方式）。由于加法比求反更复杂，因此可能需要拉伸求反单元才能进行间距匹配。为了正确执行此操作，还需要了解每个单元的所有进出连接。

Pitch matching is actually the stretching and shrinking of cells so that their bounding boxes line up. For example, if a multibit parallel subtraction unit is to be built from negation and addition cells, the aspect ratio of the two cells should be pitch matched so that both have the same height (or width, depending on how they are stacked). Since addition is more complex than negation, the negation unit will probably have to be stretched in order to pitch match. It is also necessary to know all of the connections into and out of each cell in order to do this properly.

间距匹配有多种方法。手动方法要求首先设计最复杂的单元，以便确定最大尺寸。后续单元布局将根据单元连接的方式从固定宽度或高度开始。单元设计的顺序将在很大程度上取决于芯片的平面图，每个新设计的单元都遵循沿一个轴的尺寸规则，并沿另一个轴为后续单元形成新尺寸。缺陷是显而易见的：任何单一变化都可能破坏所有这些精心的规划，并需要重新设计芯片的主要部分。所有这些手动工作的优势在于，每个必须满足一个尺寸的新设计的单元都可以在另一个尺寸上进行优化。

Pitch matching can be done in a number of ways. The manual method requires that the most complex cell be designed first so that the largest dimensions are established. Subsequent cell layout will start with a fixed width or height according to the way in which the cells adjoin. The order of cell design will depend heavily on the floor-plan of the chip, with each newly designed cell obeying the dimension rules along one axis and forming new dimensions along the other axis for subsequent cells. The pitfall is obvious: Any single change can destroy all this careful planning and require redesign of major portions of the chip. The advantage of all this manual effort is that each newly designed cell that must meet one dimension can be optimized in the other.

自动间距匹配不仅要求设计系统知道所有连接点的位置，还要求它了解如何在这些点之间拉伸布局。实现此目的的一种方法是设计可拉伸或虚拟网格 [Weste]。以这种方式完成的布局必须将导线视为特殊的可拉伸实体，可以在其特定设计规则内进行调整。通常，只能使用曼哈顿导线，因为单元具有矩形形状并且必须沿这些轴拉伸。

Automatic pitch matching requires not only that the design system know the location of all connection points, but also that it understand how to stretch the layout between these points. One way this can be done is by designing on a stretchable or virtual grid [Weste]. Layout done in this style must acknowledge wires as special stretchable entities that can be adjusted within their particular design rules. Typically, only Manhattan wires can be used, since cells have rectangular shape and must stretch along these axes.

当设计系统明确知道可拉伸导线时，两个单元的间距匹配就很简单，因为连接点和单元边缘可以调整到最大的公共间距。为了节省空间，可以将这两个匹配单元产生的布局压缩在一起（见图 4.17）。这将使每个单独的单元在其连接约束的限制范围内缩小到最小的布局。如果压缩效果好，则两个单元中都不会浪费太多空间。
图 4.17 音高匹配和对齐：（a）初始布局（b）音高匹配和对齐（A 上 2 比 3 拉伸；B 上 3 比 4 拉伸）（c）整体布局紧凑。

自动对准和间距匹配的优点是可以轻松处理设计变更。缺点是无法对面积消耗进行微调。但是，随着压缩和平面规划工具的改进、制造工艺的提高以及设计越来越复杂，自动化技术将变得非常有吸引力。

The advantage of automatic alignment and pitch matching is that changes to the design can be handled easily. The disadvantage is that fine-tuning of area consumption cannot be done. However, given better tools for compaction and floor-planning, more efficient fabrication processes, and ever more complex designs, automatic techniques become very attractive.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 4 章：综合工具

4.5 硅编译器

4.5 Silicon Compilers

随着 CAD 工具的进步，“硅编译器”一词的含义多年来一直在变化。最初，它意味着一个美好的梦想，即为普通的编程语言编译器指定一些额外的开关，例如，它将FORTRAN转换为布局，而不是目标代码。然而，很快，这个梦想就被简化为使用常规方法将逻辑转换为布局，例如本章开头讨论的方法。虽然这些方法不使用传统的编程语言作为输入，但它们确实将与布局无关的结构或行为规范转换为完整的电路，因此被称为“硅编译器”。

The meaning of the term "silicon compiler" has changed over the years as advances in CAD tools have been made. Initially it implied a glorious dream of specifying some extra switch to a normal programming language compiler so, for example, it would translate FORTRAN into layout, rather than into object code. Soon, however, this dream was reduced to the use of regular methods for converting logic into layout, such as those discussed at the beginning of this chapter. Although these methods do not use conventional programming languages as input, they do translate from a layout-independent structural or behavioral specification into complete circuitry and therefore are called "silicon compilers".

目前对硅编译的兴奋始于一个名为Bristle Blocks [Johannsen] 的系统的研究。这个系统可以采用处理器的高级描述（ISP描述，参见第 2 章）并生成通常手工完成的复杂 MOS 布局。尽管该系统从未生产出完全可用的芯片，但后来的芯片却做到了 [Southard]，它们为硅编译器赋予了新的含义：从高级语言构建自定义布局的系统。PLA 生成器再也不能被正式称为硅编译器了。

The current excitement about silicon compilation began with the work on a system called Bristle Blocks [Johannsen]. Here was a system that could take a high-level description of a processor (an ISP description, see Chapter 2) and produce complex MOS layout of the type often done by hand. Although the system never produced completely working chips, those that followed did [Southard], and they sparked a new meaning for silicon compilers: systems that construct custom layout from high-level languages. No longer can a PLA generator be seriously called a silicon compiler.

Bristle Blocks 成功的秘诀在于其规则性在于平面布局。该系统没有采用定制的小型规则结构，而是采用定制的处理器平面布局（见图 4.18）。ISP 语言的所有方面都可以映射到此处理器的各个部分：数据要求指定硬件数据路径，控制要求指定 PLA 微码解码器的结构。数据路径由在总线之间传输数据的等宽单元列组成。每列都是定制组装的，以执行指定的处理器功能之一。特殊参数化单元以文本形式描述，以便它们可以调整其宽度和连接以正确堆叠。这些单元都设计为使用两相时钟来同步数据传输和处理。
图 4.18 Bristle Blocks 架构。

现代硅编译器将结构描述转换为 IC 布局，使用的步骤与传统语言编译器相同。前端解析器读取输入描述并将其转换为结构表示，例如 Bristle Blocks 使用的处理器平面图。一些更先进的系统可以处理更高级别的行为描述，并将其降低到结构级别，然后再生成布局 [Mitchell、Steinberg 和 Schulman]。然后，后端分两个阶段生成布局。首先，调用一组程序定义的单元来生成用于数据操作的大部分电路。控制序列通常使用传统的 PLA 技术构建。其次，路由器在主要结构组件之间建立必要的连接。甚至可以调用优化过程来压缩布局。

Modern silicon compilers translate structural descriptions into IC layout using many of the same steps as do traditional language compilers. A front-end parser reads the input description and converts it to a structural representation such as the processor floor-plan used by Bristle Blocks. Some more advanced systems can handle higher-level behavioral descriptions and reduce them to the structural level before producing layout [Mitchell, Steinberg, and Schulman]. The back end then produces layout in two phases. First, a set of procedurally defined cells are invoked to produce the bulk of the circuitry for data operations. Control sequences are often built with traditional PLA techniques. Second, routers make the necessary connections between the major structural components. There are even optimization passes that can be invoked to compact the layout.

大多数硅编译器专门用于生成一种设计。例如，FIRST总是为信号处理应用构建位串行芯片 [Denyer、Murray 和 Renshaw]。在专用硅编译器中，输入语言可以非常高级，允许非程序员根据自己的特定需求指定芯片 [Kahrs]。另一个专用硅编译器Miss Manners将路径表达式编译为同步电路活动所需的布局 [Balraj 和 Foster]。

Most silicon compilers are specialized to produce one type of design. For example, FIRST always builds bit-serial chips for signal-processing applications [Denyer, Murray and Renshaw]. In specialized silicon compilers, the input language can be very high level, allowing nonprogrammers to specify chips for their own particular needs [Kahrs]. Another specialized silicon compiler, Miss Manners, compiles path expressions into the necessary layout for synchronizing circuit activity [Balraj and Foster].

一些硅编译器有多种架构可供选择 [Pope、Rabaey 和 Brodersen]，但它们都仅限于将特定输入语言映射到特定布局样式。最通用的商业编译器只是有一组更大的架构可供选择 [SCI；Seattle Silicon；Buric and Matheson；VTI]。Ayres 描述了一种通用语言，可用于构建架构、单元生成器，甚至硅编译器的分析方案 [Ayres]。

Some silicon compilers have multiple architectures available to them [Pope, Rabaey and Brodersen], but they all are restricted to mapping a specific input language to a particular style of layout. The most generalized commercial compilers simply have a larger set of architectures available to them [SCI; Seattle Silicon; Buric and Matheson; VTI]. Ayres describes a general-purpose language that can be used to construct architectures, cell generators, and even analysis schemes for silicon compilers [Ayres].

提高硅编译器灵活性的一种方法是让它们自动从输入规范中选择正确的架构。更难的是按照规范的需要自动生成架构。如果硅编译器可以接受通用硬件描述语言并始终生成合理的布局，那么它就实现了其辉煌的初始目标。

One way to improve the flexibility of silicon compilers is to have them automatically select the correct architecture from the input specification. Even harder would be to generate the architecture automatically according to the needs of the specification. If a silicon compiler could accept a general-purpose hardware-description language and always produce a reasonable layout, then it would have achieved its glorious initial goal.

4.5.1 专家系统

4.5.1 Expert Systems

提高硅片编译灵活性的另一种方法是使用专家系统，它是高级规则的集合，这些规则相互作用以产生智能结果。每条规则都表示为一个 if-then 对，显示先决条件和要采取的行动。专家系统不断扫描规则列表以查找并执行适用的规则。通常有两种规则：控制和 设计。控制规则指导整体任务，例如：

Another approach to flexibility in silicon compilation is the use of expert systems, which are collections of high-level rules that interact to produce intelligent results. Each rule is expressed as an if-then pair that shows a precondition and an action to take. The expert system continuously scans the list of rules to find and execute those that are applicable. Typically, there are two kinds of rules: control and design. Control rules direct the overall task, for example: 

    如果需要逆变器那么
        创建上拉，
        创建下拉菜单，
        连接上拉至下拉。

    if need-an-inverter then
        create-pullup,
        create-pulldown,
        connect-pullup-to-pulldown.
设计规则更加具体，并产生最终结果： 
    如果创建上拉则
        寻找最近功率，
        放置耗尽型晶体管，
        连接栅极至漏极，
        将源连接至电源。

    if creating-pullup then
        find-closest-power,
        place-depletion-transistor,
        connect-gate-to-drain,
        connect-source-to-power.
规则可以任意复杂，并且可能以不明显的方式相互作用。但是，只要有足够的规则和正确的前提条件，就可以描述相当智能的活动。

由于将行为转换为布局的 过程非常复杂，大多数专家系统只能处理一个部分。Vexed 系统将行为转换为逻辑门，寻求结构组织，而无需尝试完整的布局 [ Mitchell、Steinberg 和 Schulman]。通过存储实际行为和所需规范，系统知道何时生成了合适的设计。Talib 是一个专家系统，它通过将逻辑门转换为 nMOS 布局来完成设计任务 [Kim、McDermott 和 Siewiorek]。

Because the process of converting behavior to layout is so vast, most expert systems tackle only one piece. The Vexed system translates behavior to logic gates, seeking a structural organization without attempting complete layout [Mitchell, Steinberg, and Schulman]. By storing both actual behavior and required specifications, the system knows when an adequate design has been produced. Talib is an expert system that finishes the design task by translating logic gates to nMOS layout [Kim, McDermott, and Siewiorek].

有些专家系统专门用于特定任务。Hephaestus系统有生成 PLA 和环形振荡器布局的规则 [Simoudis 和 Fickas]。该系统的有趣之处在于它能够跟踪每个设计决策，并在之后解释解决方案是如何实现的 。

Some expert systems are specialized for particular tasks. The Hephaestus system has rules for producing PLA and ring-oscillator layouts [Simoudis and Fickas]. What makes this system interesting is its ability to track each design decision and later to explain how a solution was achieved.

专家系统也可专门用于控制功能，指导其他专家或非专家系统工具。此类系统试图模仿人类设计师分层组织电路所采取的总体步骤。在Cadre系统中，多位专家合作完成布局任务 [Ackland等]。从相对单元位置的结构规范开始，系统在层次结构中上下移动以获得良好的布局。首先调用单元生成专家 [Kollaritsch 和 Weste]。接下来，制定平面图，评估专家确定是否应调整单元或平面图。管理专家控制此迭代，直到产生令人满意的布局。在其他专家系统中也发现了在层次结构中上下移动的概念 [Gajski]。

Expert systems may also be used exclusively for their control functions, directing other expert or nonexpert system tools. Such systems attempt to mimic the overall steps taken by human designers who hierarchically organize their circuit. In the Cadre system, multiple experts cooperate in the layout task [Ackland et al.]. Starting with a structural specification of relative cell locations, the system moves up and down the hierarchy to obtain a good layout. A cell-generation expert is invoked first [Kollaritsch and Weste]. Next, a floor-plan is made and an evaluation expert determines whether the cells or the floor-plan should be adjusted. The manager expert controls this iteration until a satisfactory layout is produced. The notion of moving up and down the hierarchy is also found in other expert systems [Gajski].

硅编译器令人兴奋，因为它们提高了设计的水平。不再需要在布局中操纵晶体管。规范处于更高的水平，通常是结构性的。硅编译器必须发展到可以处理任何抽象描述、将其转换为布局的水平，并且足够高效，以防止设计人员想要修改该布局。然后将开发用于模拟和分析高级描述的工具，以便所有设计活动都可以在与 IC 布局相距较远的地方进行。

Silicon compilers are exciting because they raise the level at which design is done. It is no longer necessary to manipulate transistors in a layout. The specification is at a much higher level, generally structural. Silicon compilers must advance to the level at which they can handle any abstract description, convert it to layout, and be efficient enough to keep the designer from wanting to modify that layout. Tools will then develop for simulating and analyzing the high-level descriptions so that all design activity can take place at a comfortable distance from IC layout.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 4 章：综合工具

4.6 布局后生成器

4.6 Postlayout Generators

设计完成后必须进行制造，否则它就只是一张墙纸而已。这个过程包括通过压平电路来消除层次结构、根据制造需要修改布局图形、为每一层制作模板或掩模、制造实际电路，然后将其封装以供使用。这里要讨论的综合工具集与此过程中必须进行的布局修改有关。

Once a design is complete it must be manufactured or else it will remain just so much wallpaper. This process involves removing hierarchy by flattening the circuit, modifying the layout graphics for the manufacturing needs, making a template or mask for each layer, fabricating the actual circuit, and then packaging it for use. The set of synthesis tools to be discussed here is concerned with the layout modifications that must be done for this process.

4.6.1 补偿

4.6.1 Compensation

在制造电路时，掩模数据和真实电路之间会产生差异。例如，接触切割涉及从先前的层中去除材料，并且由于所用化学品的性质，去除的面积比掩模上指示的面积大。为了在最终工件上获得正确的尺寸，必须补偿掩模尺寸，在这种情况下通过收缩。

When a circuit is fabricated, differences are introduced between the mask data and the true circuit. For example, contact cuts involve the removal of material from previous layers, and because of the nature of the chemicals used, more area gets removed than is indicated on the mask. In order to get the correct dimensions on the final artifact, the mask dimensions must be compensated, in this case by shrinking.

补偿高度依赖于工艺——远比设计规则更是如此。例如，大多数 MOS 工艺都有设计规则，防止多晶硅线之间的距离小于宽度，但一种工艺会通过缩小几何形状来补偿多晶硅，而另一种工艺则会使其膨胀。补偿方向如此多变的一个原因是，有些掩模是负的，有些是正的，因此永远无法确定某一层的产生是蚀刻掉不需要的材料的结果，还是保护了需要的材料。

Compensation is highly process-dependent--much more so than design rules. For example, most MOS processes have design rules that prevent polysilicon lines from being closer together than they are wide, but one process will compensate polysilicon by shrinking the geometry, whereas another process will bloat it. One reason that the direction of compensation is so variable is that some masks are negative and some positive, so it is never clear whether a layer's creation is the result of etching away unwanted material or protecting what is wanted.

最终电路的缩小表明需要在掩模上膨胀，这称为正补偿。当掩模需要缩小时，这就是负补偿。这种补偿通常在掩模创建之前立即进行，因此永远不会显示给设计师。

Shrinking on the final circuit indicates the need to bloat on the mask, which is called positive compensation. When the mask is to be shrunk, that is negative compensation. This compensation is typically performed immediately prior to mask creation and is therefore never displayed to the designer.

正向补偿非常简单：每个多边形都按指定量变大。这是通过将所有坐标移离多边形中心来实现的。当两个多边形由于各自增大而重叠时，可能无需移除冗余。这是因为掩码生成过程在写入之前对所有多边形进行排序，并且可以轻松合并重叠部分。

Positive compensation is quite simple: Every polygon is made larger by the specified amount. This is done by moving all coordinates away from the center of the polygon. When two polygons overlap because they have each grown, there may be no need to remove the redundancy. This is because the mask-generation process sorts all the polygons prior to writing them and can merge overlaps easily.

负补偿更困难，因为收缩的两个相邻多边形将不再相邻。因此，与同一层上的其他多边形接壤的多边形边不能收缩。这要求负补偿过程花费大量时间探索每个多边形的邻域。一旦找到共同的边界，可能需要将一条边分成多条边，以便在收缩的同时保持连通性（见图 4.19）。
图 4.19 负补偿：(a) 之前 (b) 之后（虚线表示之前）。
