                       - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
图 6.1 电路级模拟输出。

由于不可能在电路级模拟整个复杂设计，因此有两种分析大型设计的替代方法。第一种方法是将设计分解成多个较小的部分，然后在电路级模拟每个部分。这种技术在实践中被广泛使用，当设计的某些部分在多个地方使用时尤其有用（例如，输出缓冲器、算术逻辑单元的一部分）。可以通过划分设计并在接口处进行模拟，或通过其他方式（包括手动模拟）来验证子部分是否正确交互。第二种方法是在更粗略的细节级别模拟设计的较大部分；例如，只接受逻辑级别 0、1 和 X（未定义），而不是完整的模拟波形。如后面几节所述，模拟器将电路视为由开关、门或更复杂的单元组成。通常，在电路复杂度相同的情况下，与更详细的近似相比，可以在更短的计算时间内实现行为的更粗略近似。

Since it is impossible to simulate entire complex designs at the circuit level, two alternatives exist for analyzing large designs. The first is to break the design into a number of smaller pieces and to simulate each piece at the circuit level. This technique is widely used in practice and is particularly useful when some parts of the design are used in several places (for example, an output buffer, a slice of an arithmetic-logical unit). Verification that the subpieces interact correctly can be achieved by dividing the design and simulating at the interfaces, or by other means, including hand simulation. The second method is to simulate a larger portion of the design at a coarser level of detail; for example, accepting only the logical levels 0, 1, and X (undefined) instead of full analog waveforms. As described in subsequent sections, simulators exist that view circuits as composed of switches, gates, or even more complex units. Generally, coarser approximations of behavior can be achieved in less computation time than is used for more detailed approximations, given a circuit of the same complexity.

以下各节简要概述了每种主要类型的模拟器，然后仔细研究了构建模拟器时感兴趣的一些问题。

The following sections give brief overviews of each of the main types of simulators, followed by a closer look at some issues of interest in building simulators.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 6 章：动态分析工具

本章由 Cadence Design Systems Inc. 的 Robert W. Hon 撰写。

6.2 电路级模拟器

6.2 Circuit-Level Simulators

电路级模拟器确定设计中特定节点的模拟波形 [Nagel]。电路元件被建模为晶体管、电阻器和电线，其传播延迟由其几何结构和底层技术决定。这些模拟器依赖于基本物理原理，因此可以高度准确和通用。

Circuit-level simulators determine the analog waveforms at particular nodes in the design [Nagel]. Circuit elements are modeled as transistors, resistors and wires with propagation delays determined by their geometric structure and the underlying technology. These simulators rely on basic physical principles and thus can be highly accurate and general.

电路级模拟器提供了设计节点波形的精细细节，但速度较慢，因此无法在合理的时间内处理非常大的设计。通常，电路级仿真用于检查设计的关键部分，而整体仿真则留给更高级别的模拟器。电路级模拟器提供详细的时序信息（例如，最坏情况下的输入到输出延迟），并深受设计实现技术的影响。

Circuit-level simulators provide fine-grain detail about the waveforms at nodes in a design, at the expense of being slow and therefore unable to process very large designs in a reasonable amount of time. Generally, circuit-level simulation is used to check critical parts of a design, whereas overall simulation is left to a higher-level simulator. Circuit-level simulators provide detailed timing information (for example, worst-case input-to-output delays) and are profoundly affected by the design-implementation technology.

电路级仿真实际上始于静态分析的节点提取阶段。节点提取器必须为仿真器提供设计中包含的导线、晶体管和电阻器的电容和电阻，以便准确确定延迟（请参阅后面的延迟建模部分）。这些参数的值由技术和结构的几何特性决定。一旦确定了连接性、电阻和电容参数，电路级仿真器就会将此信息与内置或用户提供的设备模型相结合。

Circuit-level simulation actually begins in the node-extraction phase of static analysis. The node extractor must provide the simulator with the capacitance and resistance of the wires, transistors, and resistors that the design comprises so that the delays can be accurately determined (see the later section, Delay Modeling). The values of these parameters are determined by the technology and the geometric properties of the structures. Once the connectivity, resistance, and capacitance parameters are determined, the circuit-level simulator combines this information with built-in or user-supplied device models.

器件模型是对实际器件行为的功能近似。例如，图 6.2 显示了SHIELD模拟器中使用的 MOS 晶体管的典型模型 [Grundmann]。
图6.2 MOS晶体管模型。

所有这些信息结合在一起，形成了一个必须求解的耦合非线性微分方程组。通常使用所谓的直接法，该方法基于牛顿法、稀疏矩阵技术和数值积分 [Nagel；IBM]。在每个时间步骤中，都会根据前一个时间步骤的值对节点值进行初始猜测。通过迭代改进此猜测，直到满足某个预定的误差容限，此时系统记录这些值并转到下一个时间步骤。直接法的优点是它可用于模拟任何电子电路。其主要缺点是大型电路的计算时间较长。

All this information is combined to produce a system of coupled, nonlinear differential equations that must be solved. Often, a so-called direct method is used, which is based on Newton's method, sparse-matrix techniques, and numerical integration [Nagel; IBM]. At each time step an initial guess at the node values is made based on the values at the previous time step. This guess is improved by iteration until some predetermined error tolerance is met, at which point the system records the values and moves on to the next time step. The direct method has the advantage that it can be used to simulate any electronic circuit. Its primary disadvantage is that the computation time is long for large circuits.

已经开发了其他方法来减少计算时间，但牺牲了通用性。一个关键的观察结果是，电路通常可以划分为几个部分，这些部分之间的相互作用不大，或者相互作用有限。利用这一观察结果和特定技术的特性，开发了一类基于 松弛技术而不是牛顿法的电路模拟器。松弛法的优势在于它们通常比直接法需要的计算更少，但它们仅适用于 MOS 电路，并且在设计中有反馈的情况下，速度可能比直接法慢得多 [Saleh、Kleckner 和 Newton；Newton 和 Sangiovanni-Vincentelli；Hennion 和 Senn]。

Other methods have been developed to decrease the computation time at the expense of generality. One key observation is that a circuit often may be partitioned into several sections that do not interact very much, or that interact in a limited fashion. Exploiting this observation and properties of particular technologies has led to the development of a class of circuit simulators based on relaxation techniques instead of on Newton's method. Relaxation methods have the advantage that they generally require less computation than does the direct method, but they are of use only for MOS circuits and can be significantly slower than the direct method where there is feedback in the design [Saleh, Kleckner, and Newton; Newton and Sangiovanni-Vincentelli; Hennion and Senn].

无论选择哪种方法，系统中的每个节点都会在每个时间步骤执行这种相对昂贵的计算。这解释了电路级模拟器相对较长的运行时间。

Regardless of method chosen, this relatively expensive computation is performed for each node in the system at each time step. This accounts for the relatively long running times of circuit-level simulators.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 6 章：动态分析工具

本章由 Cadence Design Systems Inc. 的 Robert W. Hon 撰写。

6.3 逻辑级模拟器

6.3 Logic-Level Simulators

逻辑级模拟器用三个值 0、1 和 X（未定义）代替电路级模拟器的模拟波形。电路元件被建模为简单的开关或门，通过传输延迟通常为零的电线连接。逻辑级模拟器能够模拟比电路级模拟器更大的设计，但会牺牲细节。逻辑级模拟器可以在设备级或门级进行模拟。

Logic-level simulators replace the analog waveforms of circuit-level simulators with the three values 0, 1, and X (undefined). Circuit elements are modeled as simple switches or gates connected by wires the propagation delay of which is typically zero. Logic-level simulators provide the ability to simulate larger designs than circuit-level simulators can, at the expense of detail. Logic-level simulators may simulate at the device level or at the gate level.

6.3.1 交换机级模拟器

6.3.1 Switch-Level Simulators

开关级模拟器 [Bryant] 将电路建模为晶体管和电线的集合，并且必须提供连接信息。此信息由晶体管和电线列表组成，它们相当于设计的示意图。晶体管被建模为简单的开关，电线被建模为理想的零延迟导体。通常，简单的延迟模型会合并到晶体管模型中；例如，切换中的单位延迟。如果可用，可以合并其他延迟信息，例如在先前的电路模拟中得出的晶体管延迟。

Switch-level simulators [Bryant] model circuits as a collection of transistors and wires, and must be provided with connectivity information. This information consists of a list of transistors and wires, which provide the equivalent of a schematic of the design. Transistors are modeled as simple switches and wires are modeled as idealized, zero-delay conductors. Usually a simple delay model is incorporated into the transistor model; for example, unit-delay in switching. Other delay information such as transistor delays derived in a previous circuit simulation, may be incorporated if available.

处理是基于近似电路理论求解简化方程的问题。在简化模型的限制范围内，可以得到被监控节点的基本时序信息。尽管涉及近似，但时序信息可能足以确定整体系统参数，例如最坏情况延迟和最大时钟速率。

Processing is a matter of solving simplified equations based on approximate circuit theory. Rudimentary timing information, within the limits of the simplified model, is available for the nodes being monitored. In spite of the approximations involved, the timing information may be sufficient to determine overall system parameters such as worst-case delays and maximum clock rates.

 

 

6.3.2 门级模拟器

6.3.2 Gate-Level Simulators

门级模拟器使用与开关级模拟器相同的逻辑值，但电路元件是在门级而不是晶体管级建模的。门级模拟器可用于模拟逻辑值方面更大的设计。但是，由于它们基于门模型，因此无法轻松建模一些常见的 VLSI 结构（例如，传输晶体管、三态总线结构）。

Gate-level simulators use the same logic values as switch-level simulators use, but circuit elements are modeled at the gate rather than the transistor level. Gate-level simulators can be used to simulate still larger designs in terms of logic values. However, since they are based on a model of gates, they cannot easily model some common VLSI structures (for example, pass transistors, tri-state bus structures).

门级模拟器的输入是逻辑门（例如，NAND、OR、D 触发器）和线路的电路原理图。每个门都会有一些延迟。通常，原理图可以直接从用于绘制设计的原理图输入系统获得。真值表（扩展为包括未定义的逻辑值）可用于对每个门进行建模。图 6.3 显示了双输入 AND 门的真值表。
输入1   In2   出去
000
010
0十0
100
111
1十十
十00
十1十
十十十
图 6.3双输入与门的真值表。

处理过程与开关级模拟器类似，但由于计算元素更复杂，因此通常可以模拟更大的设计。此外，晶体管模型中缺少某些结构，这降低了计算的复杂性。

Processing is similar to that in switch-level simulators, although larger designs can often be simulated because the computational elements are more complex. In addition, the lack of certain constructs available in a transistor-based model reduces the complexity of the computation involved.

 

 

6.3.3 多状态模拟器

6.3.3 Multiple-State Simulators

为了获得比值 0、1 和 X 提供的更完整的信息，同时又保留能够处理复杂设计的优势，一些逻辑级模拟器通过一组更大的逻辑级增强 [VLSI]。市面上出售的模拟器具有十几个或更多的状态，这并不罕见。添加状态是为了更精细地解决节点冲突；例如，当电阻上拉与驱动相同输出为低的输出相反时，或者当三态总线处于高阻抗状态时。组件行为由大型真值表指定，就像在更简单的三态模拟器中一样。

In order to obtain more complete information than is provided by the values 0, 1, and X, and yet retain the advantage of being able to handle complex designs, some logic-level simulators are augmented by a larger set of logic levels [VLSI]. It is not uncommon to find commercially offered simulators with a dozen or more states. States are added to provide finer resolution of conflicts at nodes; for example, when a resistive pullup is in opposition to an output that is driving the same output low or when a tri-state bus is in a high-impedance state. Component behavior is specified by large truth tables, as in the simpler three-state simulators.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 6 章：动态分析工具

本章由 Cadence Design Systems Inc. 的 Robert W. Hon 撰写。

6.4 功能和行为级模拟器

6.4 Functional- and Behavioral-Level Simulators

功能级和行为级模拟器允许使用复杂的数据和控制表示。此类模拟器提供最高的性能，但最终出现的与实现的联系并不总是显而易见的，甚至很少自动生成。功能级模拟器可能使用与逻辑级模拟器相同的逻辑值，或者可能允许更复杂的数据表示（例如整数）。电路元件被建模为与架构的硬件功能块相对应的功能块。行为级模拟器允许复杂的数据表示，并且仅对设计的行为进行建模。将行为划分为各个部分可能无法直接映射到可隔离的硬件功能单元。

Functional- and behavioral-level simulators allow the use of sophisticated data and control representations. This class offers the highest performance but the connection to the implementation that ultimately emerges is not always obvious and is even more rarely automatically generated. Functional-level simulators may use the same logic values as logic-level simulators, or may allow more sophisticated data representations (such as integers). Circuit elements are modeled as functional blocks that correspond to the architecture's hardware functional blocks. Behavioral-level simulators allow sophisticated data representations and model only the behavior of a design. The partitioning of the behavior into pieces may not directly map to isolatable hardware functional units.

功能级和行为级模拟器类似，主要区别在于功能级模拟器将功能单元映射到实际硬件单元上 [Insinga；Lathrop and Kirk；Frey；Lightner等]。在这两种方法中，设计都由设计者指定的行为的多个单元组成。

Functional- and behavioral-level simulators are similar, differing chiefly in that functional-level simulators map functional units onto actual hardware units [Insinga; Lathrop and Kirk; Frey; Lightner et al.]. In both approaches the design consists of a number of units that have behavior that is specified by the designer.

在功能级模拟器中，每个单元的行为结构（哪些单元连接到哪些其他单元，进入和离开单元的信号）都复制了预期的硬件结构。行为级模拟器试图模仿预期设计的行为，但不一定与硬件实现的行为完全相同。功能级模拟器可能被认为是门级模拟器的泛化，其中设计可以包含用户定义的门（功能框）。有时允许使用高级数据表示；例如，将整数显示为单个实体而不是位的集合。

In a functional-level simulator, the structure of the behavior (what units are connected to what other units, the signals entering and leaving a unit) of each unit duplicates the intended hardware structure. Behavioral-level simulators seek to mimic the behavior of the intended design, but not necessarily in precisely the same way that the hardware will implement it. Functional-level simulators might be thought of as the generalization of gate-level simulators, where the design can contain user-defined gates (the function boxes). Sometimes high-level data representations are allowed; for example, ones that show integers as single entities rather than as a collection of bits.

此类模拟器中的计算单元行为通常采用类似于现代编程语言的模拟语言来指定。该技术性能良好且易于实验，但与实际硬件实现相差甚远，因此无法捕获许多类型的低级错误。

Often the behaviors of computational units in this class of simulator are specified in a simulation language that is similar to a modern programming language. This technique offers good performance and ease of experimentation, but is also far from the actual hardware implementation and therefore cannot catch many types of low-level errors.

在更高抽象层次上进行模拟通常可以在给定的计算时间内包含更多的设计。这使设计师对整个设计的正确性充满信心。缺点是由于缺乏细节，可能会错过细微的错误；例如，竞争条件可能只能通过电路级模拟才能检测到。这是因为随着模拟进入更高的抽象层次，与底层实现技术的联系逐渐减弱。

Simulating at a higher level of abstraction usually allows the inclusion of more of the design for a given amount of computation time. This gives the designer confidence in the correctness of the design as a whole. The drawback is that subtle errors can be missed because of the lack of detail; for example, race conditions may well be detectable only by a circuit-level simulation. This is a consequence of the fact that the link to the underlying implementation technology becomes progressively weaker as the simulation moves to higher levels of abstraction.

能够在不同的抽象级别上模拟设计的部分或全部是很有用的。为此，已经开发了几种 多级模拟器，允许在不同级别上模拟设计的不同部分 [Insinga]。有时，模拟级别可以在同一次模拟运行过程中混合使用；例如，缓冲器的 49 个实例可能在开关级别进行模拟，而第 50 个实例则在电路级别进行模拟。据推测，所有实例都会产生相同的行为，这样就避免了详细模拟 49 个实例的开销。

It is useful to be able to simulate part or all of a design at varying levels of abstraction. For this reason, several multilevel simulators have been developed that allow different parts of the design to be simulated at different levels [Insinga]. Sometimes the level of simulation can intermixed in the course of the same simulation run; for example, 49 of the instances of a buffer might be simulated at the switch level, whereas the fiftieth is simulated at the circuit level. Presumably, all instances would produce the same behavior so that the expense of simulating 49 of the instances in detail is avoided.

其他模拟器将两种或两种以上的计算技术混合在同一个抽象层次上 [Chen et al. ; Lathrop and Kirk]。这些混合模式模拟器通过动态、明智的算法选择实现了更高的性能。

Other simulators mix two or more computational techniques at the same level of abstraction [Chen et al.; Lathrop and Kirk]. These mixed-mode simulators achieve improved performance by the dynamic, judicious choice of algorithms.

无法详尽地模拟设计意味着验证过程的质量最终受到设计人员的耐心和可用的计算机时间的限制。

The impossibility of exhaustively simulating a design means that the quality of the verification process is ultimately limited by the designer's patience and the available computer time.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 6 章：动态分析工具

本章由 Cadence Design Systems Inc. 的 Robert W. Hon 撰写。

6.5 模拟问题

6.5 Simulation Issues

无论选择何种抽象程度进行仿真，都必须解决一些关键问题。需要某种形式的输入，其内容可能随抽象程度而变化。输入包括要仿真的电路或系统的规范、实现技术的信息（例如，所用特定 CMOS 工艺的特性）以及要应用于输入的逻辑或电压值。基本仿真过程使用此信息来确定经过一定时间的仿真后一组输出的值。最后，必须在模拟器中整合某种显示仿真结果的方法。

Regardless of the level of abstraction chosen for simulation, a number of key issues must be addressed. Some form of input is required, and the content may change with level of abstraction. Input includes a specification of the circuit or system to be simulated, information about the implementation technology (for example, characteristics of the particular CMOS process used), and logic or voltage values to apply to inputs. The basic simulation process uses this information to determine the values on a set of outputs after some amount of simulated time has passed. Finally, some means of displaying the results of the simulation must be incorporated in the simulator.

6.5.1 输入要求

6.5.1 Input Requirements

第 5 章 中描述的任务之一是 节点提取，即从布局的几何表示中识别电路元件及其连接的过程。电路和逻辑级模拟器使用此信息以及有关用于实现电路的技术的一些基础信息来确定电路的行为。电路级模拟器需要有关结构电容的附加信息，以便准确计算延迟。节点提取器的工作是从电路布局中计算出这些附加信息（请参阅后面的部分“延迟建模”）。

One of the tasks described in Chapter 5 was node extraction, which is the process of identifying circuit elements and their connectivity from a geometric representation of the layout. This information, along with some underlying information about the technology used to implement the circuit, is used by circuit- and logic-level simulators to determine a circuit's behavior. Circuit-level simulators require additional information regarding the capacitance of structures so that delays may be accurately calculated. It is the node extractor's job to calculate this additional information from the circuit layout (see the later section, Delay Modeling).

门级模拟器需要设计示意图，以通过线路连接的标准逻辑门表示。功能级和行为级模拟器对输入进行操作，这些输入通常与标准编程语言非常相似，特定框的行为以子程序结构给出。在功能级模拟器中，连接性可以通过功能单元之间传输信号的线路明确显示，也可以通过功能单元调用（以子程序的方式）其他带参数的功能单元来隐式显示。在行为级模拟器中，连接性通常通过调用结构隐式显示。

Gate-level simulators require a schematic of the design, expressed as standard logic gates connected by wires. Functional- and behavioral-level simulators operate on input that often closely resembles standard programming languages, with the behavior of a particular box given in a subroutinelike construct. In functional-level simulators, connectivity may be explicitly shown by wires carrying signals between functional units, or implicitly shown by functional units calling (in the manner of subroutines) other functional units with parameters. In behavioral-level simulators, connectivity is usually shown implicitly by call structure.

由于每种类型的模拟器都需要不同类型的设计规范，因此保持设计的几种表示之间的一致性是设计辅助系统的主要问题。大多数系统将保持一致性表示（即确保电路的几何表示确实与功能描述相匹配）的问题留给人类用户。其他系统则试图自动保持一致性。自动方案在较低的抽象层次上最为成功；例如，用于从门级原理图自动编译几何布局。

As each type of simulator requires a different type of design specification, maintaining consistency between the several representations of the design is a major problem in design-aid systems. Most systems leave the problem of maintaining consistent representations (that is, making sure that the geometric representation of a circuit does indeed match the functional description) up to the human user. Others attempt to maintain consistency automatically. Automatic schemes have been the most successful at the lower levels of abstraction; for example, for automatically compiling geometric layout from a gate-level schematic.

测试输入

Test Inputs

模拟结果可用于在实施之前验证设计的正确性，以及诊断设计的实施。大多数设计都非常复杂，不可能系统地尝试所有输入组合并验证产生的行为是否正确。需要提供范围更窄的测试作为模拟器的输入。 测试输入用于指定在模拟期间的某些时间应应用于一组输入的值集。测试输入可以用三元组列表表示，其中每个元组由（输入值时间）组成。 输入是电路中将被设置为在指定时间 由值给出的逻辑值或电压的位置。

Simulation results can be useful in verifying the correctness of a design before implementation, as well as for diagnosing implementations of a design. Most designs are sufficiently complex that it is not possible to try all combinations of inputs systematically and to verify that the resulting behavior is correct. A much narrower range of tests needs to be provided as input to the simulator. Test inputs are used to specify the set of values that should be applied to a set of inputs at certain times during the simulation. Test inputs can be represented by a list of three-tuples, where each tuple consists of (input value time). Input is the location in the circuit that will be set to the logic value or voltage given by value at the time specified.

确定一组足以测试设计的测试输入并非易事。大多数情况下，测试输入都是由熟悉设计的人手动生成的。手动生成测试输入的优势在于可以利用人类对设计中棘手或关键部分的了解。当然，人类错过或未完全测试设计的一部分是很常见的，尤其是当该人是设计创建者时。

It is a nontrivial task to determine a set of test inputs that will sufficiently test a design. Most often test inputs are generated by hand by someone who is familiar with the design. Hand generation of test inputs has the advantage of exploiting a human's knowledge of the tricky or critical sections of the design. Of course, it is quite common for a human to miss or to test incompletely part of a design, particularly when the human is the same person who created the design.

为了在这种情况下最大限度地减少人为偏见和错误，人们进行了大量研究，以寻找可以系统地应用于设计以发现错误的算法。D算法[Roth] 就是一个例子。D 算法最初设计用于测试门级组合逻辑设计，但其他人扩展了该算法（例如，请参阅 [Jain and Agrawal] 以了解其在开关级模拟中的应用）。

So that human bias and error can be minimized in such situations, a good deal of research has gone into finding algorithms that can be systematically applied to a design in order to find errors. One example is the D-algorithm [Roth]. The D-algorithm was originally designed to test gate-level combinational logic designs, but other people have extended the algorithm (see, for example, [Jain and Agrawal] for an application to switch-level simulations).

给定一个包含组合逻辑的设备，该设备具有一组输入和一组输出，D 算法的目标是找到输入值的分配，以便通过检查输出值来检测特定的内部故障。在 D 算法中，假设存在两台机器 - “好机器”和“故障机器”。好机器运行正常，而故障机器的某些特定内部输入卡在特定逻辑值（例如，AND 门的输入卡在零）。错误的存在导致好机器和故障机器在某些输入值上的行为存在差异。D 算法提供了一种系统地分配输入值的方法，以便将这种差异驱动到输出，在那里可以观察到并检测到它。换句话说，D 算法提供了应用于设计的测试输入。将输出值与预期输出值进行比较，任何差异都表明存在测试输入专门设计用于查找的特定内部故障（有关 D 算法的良好教程介绍以及其他几种常用测试技术的概述，请参阅 [Miczo]）。

Given a device that contains combinational logic with some set of inputs and some set of outputs, the goal of the D-algorithm is to find an assignment of input values that will allow the detection of a particular internal fault by examining the output values. In the D-algorithm, the existence of two machines-the "good machine" and the "faulty machine"-is hypothesized. The good machine works perfectly, whereas the faulty machine has some specific internal input stuck at a particular logic value (say, an input to an AND gate stuck at zero). The existence of the error causes a discrepancy between the behaviors of the good machine and the faulty machine for some values of inputs. The D-algorithm provides a means of systematically assigning input values so that this discrepancy is driven to an output, where it may be observed and thus detected. In other words, the D-algorithm provides a test input that is applied to a design. The output values are compared to the expected output values and any discrepancy indicates the presence of the particular internal fault that the test input was specifically designed to find (see [Miczo] for a good tutorial introduction to the D-algorithm as well as an overview of several other commonly used testing techniques).

 

 

6.5.2 时间

6.5.2 Time

模拟器处理时间的方法会密切影响其性能。处理时间的主要方法有两种；有时也会使用结合这两种方法的混合技术。

The method by which a simulator handles time can intimately affect its performance. There are two primary methods of handling time; sometimes hybrid techniques that combine the two methods are used.

第一种方法将模拟作为一系列固定长度的时间步骤运行。这些增量时间模拟器将模拟时钟推进固定的时间量，然后在时间步骤结束时计算设计中所有节点的值。时间步骤通常由用户控制，并且经过选择，以便不会错过最细粒度的感兴趣事件。有时，电路级模拟器使用由方程的收敛特性控制的可变时间步骤。

The first method runs the simulation as a series of fixed-length time steps. These incremental-time simulators advance the simulation clock a fixed amount of time, then calculate the values for all of the nodes in the design at the end of the time step. The time step is usually controllable by the user and is selected so that the finest-grain events of interest are not missed. Sometimes, circuit-level simulators use a variable time step that is controlled by the convergence properties of the equations.

第二种方法将模拟视为一系列事件，其中事件是节点的更改。保留按时间顺序排列的事件优先级队列；模拟器运行时，它按以下方式处理事件：

The second method views the simulation as a series of events, where an event is a change to a node. A time-ordered priority queue of events is kept; when the simulator is running it processes events in the following way:

  1. 从队列中删除在下一个时间t发生的所有事件。每个事件都表示为时间t时输入的变化。
  2. Remove from the queue all events that occur at the next time t. Each event is expressed as a change to an input at time t.
  3. 注意相应节点处的每个输入变化。
  4. Note each input change at the appropriate node.
  5. 根据新的输入，计算每个受影响节点的输出的新值。
  6. Calculate a new value for the output of each affected node, based on the new inputs.
  7. 为连接到上一步中发生变化的输出节点的每个节点创建一个事件。在时间t +延迟时将其插入优先级队列，其中延迟由通过节点的传播时间决定。延迟的计算可以基于物理模型，也可以简单到假设每个节点有一个单位延迟。
  8. Create an event for each node that is connected to an output node that changed in the previous step. Insert it into the priority queue at time t + delay, where delay is determined by the propagation time through the node. Calculation of delay may be based on a physical model, or may be as simple as assuming a unit delay per node.
模拟器重复此循环，直到达到用户指定的时间，或者事件队列为空。

在这两种方法中，计算节点的新值可能非常昂贵，具体取决于所需的精度。通常，计算涉及迭代，直到感兴趣的节点在连续迭代之间不发生变化。

In both methods the calculation of a new value for a node can be quite expensive, depending on the accuracy desired. Typically, the calculation involves iteration until the nodes of interest do not change between successive iterations.

每种方法都有优点和缺点。增量时间算法相对容易实现，并且可以明确控制模拟的时间粒度。不幸的是，在模拟过程中可能会有很长的一段时间，在此期间很少有节点发生变化，但增量时间方法会继续进行检查许多节点的昂贵过程。最简单的增量时间方法通常会处理从前一个时间步骤到当前时间步骤没有变化或无法变化的节点。已经开发了各种方案来识别不活跃的节点或子电路，因此不需要重新计算。事件驱动算法试图通过仅在实际发生变化时才工作来避免这个问题；它们的主要缺点是它们本质上具有可变的时间步骤，因此可能会处理许多不重要的细粒度事件。

Each method has advantages and disadvantages. Incremental-time algorithms are relatively simple to implement and offer explicit control of the time grain of the simulation. Unfortunately, there may be long periods in the simulation during which few nodes change, yet the incremental-time method continues the expensive process of checking many nodes. In its simplest form, the incremental-time method often processes nodes that do not or cannot change from the previous time step to the current one. Various schemes have been developed to identify nodes or subcircuits that are inactive and therefore do not need to be recalculated. Event-driven algorithms attempt to avoid this problem by doing work only when something actually changes; their chief disadvantage is that they inherently have a variable time step and therefore may process many fine-grain events that are of no importance.

值得注意的是，大多数模拟器没有内置时间概念。其基本属性是时间是一个非递减的数字序列。当指定组件行为时，模拟时间单位与实时单位的关系由用户隐式确定。例如，在门级模拟中，以纳秒为单位而不是 0.000000001 秒为单位给出延迟很方便。在开关级模拟中，基本反相器延迟单位可能比较合适。

It is worth noting that most simulators have no built-in notion of time. The essential property is that time is a nondecreasing sequence of numbers. The relation of simulation-time units to real-time units is implicitly determined by the user when the component behaviors are specified. For example, in a gate-level simulation, it is convenient to give delays in units of nanoseconds rather than 0.000000001 seconds. In a switch-level simulation, units of basic inverter delay might be appropriate.

延迟建模

Delay Modeling

电路设计人员主要关心两种类型的延迟：通过“有源元件”的延迟和通过线路的延迟。有源元件的确切定义随模拟级别而变化——对于开关级模拟，它可能是一个晶体管；对于功能模拟，它可能是一个完整的 ALU。

There are primarily two types of delay that are of concern to circuit designers: delay through "active components" and delay through wires. The exact definition of active component varies with the level of simulation--it might be a single transistor for a switch-level simulation, or it might be an entire ALU in a functional simulation.

电路级模拟器本身会计算有源元件和线路延迟，因为它们通常会在求解的方程式中被考虑在内。为了提高效率，逻辑级模拟器通常会假设一个简化的延迟模型，可能使用通过有源元件的单位延迟并假设通过线路的延迟为零。

Circuit-level simulators inherently calculate active-component and wire delay, since they are normally taken into account in the equations that are solved. For efficiency, logic-level simulators often assume a simplified model of delay, perhaps using a unit delay through active components and assuming zero delay through wires.

可能存在许多变化。例如，功能模拟器可能使用各种功能块的延迟表。如果合适，该表可以基于实际观察到的现成组件的延迟。另一类模拟器称为时序 模拟器 [Terman；Chawla、Gummel 和 Kozak]，其功能略优于电路级模拟器。时序模拟器使用相对复杂（与大多数逻辑级模拟器相比）的延迟模型，并结合假设一组固定的逻辑级所提供的简化。例如，RSIM [ Terman] 使用晶体管的线性模型来确定每个节点的延迟和最终逻辑值。该模型考虑了每个节点的电容和驱动能力，并针对每种技术进行了精心调整，以获得准确的结果。

Many variations are possible. For example a functional simulator might use a table of delays for various functional blocks. The table could be based on actual observed delays for off-the-shelf components, if appropriate. Another class of simulator, called timing simulators [Terman; Chawla, Gummel, and Kozak], fits just above circuit-level simulators. Timing simulators use relatively complex (compared to most logic-level simulators) delay models combined with the simplification provided in assuming a fixed set of logic levels. For example, RSIM [Terman] uses a linear model of transistors to determine delay and final logic values for each node. The model takes into account the capacitance at each node and the drive capabilities, and is carefully tuned for each technology so that accurate results are obtained.

在使用简单延迟模型（例如单位延迟或表驱动方法）的情况下，模拟器只需要电路的连接性和每个节点的类型。然而，模拟的大部分价值在于能够准确确定电路延迟。当需要此细节时，使用更复杂的延迟模型。

In cases in which a simple delay model, such as a unit-delay or table-driven approach, is used, the simulator needs only the connectivity of the circuit and the type of each node. However, much of the value of simulation lies in the ability to determine circuit delays accurately. When this detail is required, a more complex delay model is used.

这些延迟模型近似于节点和线路的细粒度行为。线路改变状态（例如从接近 0 伏到接近 5 伏）所需的时间由线路的电阻R和电容C决定。延迟与乘积RC呈指数关系（有关更详细的解释，请参阅 [Mead and Conway]）。因此，除了设备类型和连接信息外，还必须为模拟器提供每个节点和线路的电阻和电容。

These delay models approximate the fine-grain behavior of nodes and wires. The time that it takes a wire to change state, say from near 0 volts to near 5 volts, is determined by the resistance R and capacitance C of the wire. The delay depends exponentially on the product RC (for a more detailed explanation, see [Mead and Conway]). Thus, the simulator must be given the resistance and capacitance of each node and wire, in addition to device type and connectivity information.

RC信息是在设计分析的节点提取阶段计算的。考虑一条采用 MOS 技术的多晶硅制成的导线。导线的电阻由其体积（= 长度 × 宽度 × 深度 ）和多晶硅的电阻决定。由于材料电阻和导线深度对于特定的实现过程是固定的，因此节点提取器只需要计算导线的长度和宽度，然后乘以一个常数就可以确定其电阻。同样，导线的电容取决于其面积、与底层基板的距离以及将其与基板分开的绝缘体的介电常数。分离距离和介电常数对于实现过程是固定的，因此可以根据导线的长度和宽度确定电容[ C =（介电常数×长度×宽度）/分离]。

The RC information is calculated in the node-extraction phase of design analysis. Consider a wire made of polysilicon in a MOS technology. The resistance of the wire is determined by its volume (= length × width × depth) and the resistance of the polysilicon. Since the resistance of the material and the depth of the wires is fixed for a particular implementation process, the node extractor need only calculate the length and width of the wire and multiply by a constant in order to determine its resistance. Similarly, the capacitance of the wire depends on its area, its separation from the underlying substrate, and the permittivity of the insulator that separates it from the substrate. The separation distance and the permittivity are fixed for the implementation process, and therefore the capacitance can be determined from the length and width of the wire [C = (permittivity × length × width) / separation].

通常，这种简单的延迟模型足以近似时序行为。在无法近似的情况下，可以进行更精确的电阻和电容计算，并使用更复杂的延迟方程 [Glasser 和 Dobberpuhl]。双极等非平面技术也可能需要复杂的计算来确定节点和线路的电阻和电容。通常，成本就是时间。

Often this simple delay model suffices for approximating timing behavior. In cases for which it does not, more accurate calculation of resistance and capacitance can be performed and more complex delay equations used [Glasser and Dobberpuhl]. Nonplanar technologies such as bipolar may also require complex calculations to determine the resistance and capacitance of nodes and wires. As usual, the cost is time.

 

 

6.5.3 设备模型

6.5.3 Device Model

器件模型的选择会影响模拟的准确性和速度。最准确的器件模型（通常由电路级模拟器使用）是分析性的，需要对一组方程进行迭代求解。这种类型的模型可以近似地近似器件的模拟行为，但需要大量的计算时间。

The choice of device model affects the accuracy and the speed of the simulation. The most accurate device models, often used by circuit-level simulators, are analytical and require an iterated solution to a set of equations. This type of model provides a close approximation to the analog behavior of the device, but requires a great deal of computation time.

逻辑级模拟器通常使用简单的表格驱动模型；例如，门的行为可以存储在简单的真值表中，一旦知道输入，就可以查找其输出。设备延迟可以假定为单个时间单位，也可以从考虑实际设备几何形状的延迟模型中计算出来。

Logic-level simulators often use simple table-driven models; for example, the behavior of a gate can be stored in a simple truth table and its output can be looked up once the inputs are known. Device delay can be assumed to be a single time unit, or can be calculated from a delay model that takes the actual device geometry into account.

表驱动模型的效率可用于使用多种逻辑状态的模拟器，通过为每个未定义或过渡状态添加术语来扩充真值表。

The efficiency of table-driven models can be used in simulators that use multiple logic states by augmenting the truth tables with terms for each undefined or transition state.

功耗

Power Consumption

随着技术的发展，芯片上可以安装更多设备，散发产生的热量变得越来越困难。在高密度、高速技术中，散热所需的特殊物理封装很容易使系统价格翻倍，并可能导致相关问题，例如连接到电路板进行调试时的问题。因此，设计人员通常对其芯片消耗的电量很感兴趣。

As advancing technology allows more devices to be placed on a chip, it becomes increasingly difficult to dissipate the heat generated. In high-density, high-speed technologies, the exotic physical packaging required to remove heat can easily double the price of a system and can lead to attendant problems, for example in connecting to circuit boards for debugging. Thus, designers are often interested in the amount of power that their chips consume.

在 nMOS 设计中，大部分功率消耗在拉低的耗尽负载中。如第 5 章所述，可以通过确定可以拉低多少负载来静态估计功耗。这可能是不必要的悲观估计，因为不太可能同时拉低所有负载。动态分析可用于提供更准确的功耗估计，并且还可以考虑实际的开关频率。

In nMOS designs, most of the power is consumed in depletion loads that are pulled low. As outlined in Chapter 5, a static estimation of power consumption can be made by determining how many loads can be pulled down. This may be needlessly pessimistic, since it is unlikely that all of the loads are pulled down simultaneously. Dynamic analysis can be used to provide a more accurate estimate of power dissipation, and can also take into account the actual switching frequencies.

在 CMOS 设计中，不需要耗尽负载，因为n型和 p型晶体管都可用。如图 6.4 中的 CMOS 反相器所示，当输入为零时，n型晶体管关闭，并且很容易看出，当输入为 1 时，p型晶体管关闭。这意味着当电路在输入为零或 1 时稳定时，总有一个晶体管关闭，因此 V dd和 V ss之间没有连接。唯一耗散的功率来自漏电流，通常很小。
图 6.4 理想化的 CMOS 反相器。

当输入从零快速变为一时， p型晶体管关闭，而n型晶体管打开。在它们完成切换之前，V ss通过变化电阻（两个晶体管串联）连接到 V dd，因此会耗散一些功率。此外，无论连接到输出端的电容是什么，充电都会消耗功率。如 [Weste and Eshraghian] 所示，这些转换期间消耗的功率 ( P ) 如下式所示：

When the input makes a relatively rapid transition from zero to one, the p-type transistor turns off while the n-type transistor turns on. Until they finish switching, Vss is connected to Vdd through a changing resistance (the two transistors in series), and so some power is dissipated. In addition, power is consumed in charging whatever capacitance is connected to the output. As shown in [Weste and Eshraghian], the power (P) consumed during these transitions is given by:

P = C负载× V dd 2 × f

 

 

其中，C load是负载电容，f 是开关频率。

总功率是稳定时消耗的功率与切换时消耗的功率之和。同样，由于实际切换频率是已知的，动态分析可以提供比静态分析更准确的估计。

The total power is the sum of the power consumed while stable and the power consumed while switching. Once again, dynamic analysis can provide a more accurate estimate than can static analysis since the actual switching frequencies are known.

 

 

6.5.4 输出

6.5.4 Output

模拟器的输出至少是一个文本列表，其中包含受监控节点上随时间变化的值。这种类型的输出有几个明显的缺点：

The output of simulators is at least a textual listing containing the values present on the monitored nodes as a function of time. This type of output has several significant disadvantages:

  1. 由于呈现的信息量巨大，区分错误行为与正确行为非常困难
  2. Separating errors from correct behavior is difficult because of the sheer bulk of information presented
  3. 由于文本呈现的不连续性，很难发现数据中的趋势
  4. Spotting trends in the data is difficult because of the discontinuous nature of the textual presentation
  5. 将错误与设计中经常发生错误的位置联系起来很不方便
  6. Relating an error to the place in the design where it occurred often is inconvenient

图 6.1 显示了输出的下一步，其中提供了波形的粗略图形近似值。图形工作站的最近普及使得模拟输出能够以近乎模拟的形式呈现，这使得理解结果变得更加容易。将模拟器结果与设计输入系统集成在一起，可以进一步以图形方式精确定位节点。

The next step up in output is exemplified in Fig. 6.1, where a rough graphical approximation to the waveforms is provided. The recent proliferation of graphics workstations enables simulation output to be presented in near-analog form, which makes comprehending the results much easier. Integration of the simulator results with the design-entry system further allows nodes to be graphically pinpointed.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 6 章：动态分析工具

本章由 Cadence Design Systems Inc. 的 Robert W. Hon 撰写。

6.6 事件驱动模拟

6.6 Event-Driven Simulation

本节给出了一个简单示例，说明门级事件驱动模拟如何在图 6.5 中的交叉耦合 NOR 门上运行。
图 6.5 交叉耦合的或非门。

6.6.1 示例

6.6.1 Example

为了模拟电路的行为，需要每个门的行为模型。在门级模拟中，如图 6.6 所示的真值表是合适的。给定电路及其功能行为，只需要一个测试向量和一个延迟模型即可开始模拟。合理的假设是每个门需要一个时间单位的延迟，并且线路具有零个时间单位的延迟。在时间 0 时，所有输入和输出都为逻辑值 X。在某个时间 t时，输入 A 更改为逻辑值 1，输入 D 更改为 0。

In order to simulate the behavior of the circuit, a model of the behavior of each gate is needed. In simulating at the gate level, a truth table as shown in Fig. 6.6 is appropriate. Given the circuit and its functional behavior, only a test vector and a delay model are required to begin the simulation. Reasonable assumptions are that each gate requires a delay of one time unit, and that wires have a delay of zero time units. At time 0, all inputs and outputs are at logic value X. At some time t, input A is changed to logic value 1 and input D to 0.

然后，模拟器开始执行前面给出的算法，该算法在这里重复：

The simulator then begins the algorithm given previously, which is repeated here:

  1. 从队列中删除下次时间t发生的所有事件。
  2. Remove all events from the queue that occur at the next time t.
  3. 注意相应节点处的每个输入变化。
  4. Note each input change at the appropriate node.
  5. 为每个受影响节点的输出计算一个新值。
  6. Calculate a new value for the output of each affected node.
  7. 为连接到受影响节点输出的每个节点创建一个事件，并在时间 t +延迟时将其插入队列，其中延迟由通过节点的传播时间决定。
  8. Create an event for each node that is connected to the output of the affected node and insert it into the queue at time t + delay, where delay is determined by the propagation time through the node.

输入1   In2   出去
001
010
0十十
100
110
1十0
十0十
十10
十十十
图 6.6或非门的真值表。

应用测试向量会将两个事件放入队列：

Applying the test vector places two events on the queue:

（A 1 吨）（D 0 吨）

 

 

在执行算法时，在时间t，顶门的输入为 1X，这会导致事件 (E 0 t +1) 的创建。由于输入 C 连接到输出 E，因此也会创建事件 (C 0 t +1)。底门的输入为 X0，这会导致事件 (FX t +1) 和 (BX t +1)的创建。在算法第一次迭代结束时，表示时间 t 时的电路，事件队列包含：

（E 0 t+1）（C 0 t+1）（FX t+1）（BX t+1）

 

 

继续执行步骤 1，删除事件 (E 0 t +1)。对输出 E 的此更改不需要任何操作，只需通过打印或绘图报告值即可。在考虑事件 (BX t +1) 时，观察到该事件不会改变顶门的输入。因此，不会为该门创建新事件。（模拟器可以选择在考虑事件 [BX t +1] 时不检查 B 输入的先前值，并将结果事件 [E 0 t +2] [C 0 t +2] 输入队列。这不会影响模拟的正确性，但会导致大量不必要的计算。）底门的输入现在是 00，因此事件 (F 1 t +2) (B 1 t +2) 被添加到队列中。在时间t +1结束时，队列包含：

（F 1 t+2）（B 1 t+2）

 

 

在时间t +2 时，顶门的输入为 11，因此事件 (E 0 t +3) (C 0 t +3) 被添加。在时间t +2结束时，队列包含：

（E 0 t+3）（C 0 t+3）

 

 

在处理这些事件时，输入不会发生变化，因此不需要将新事件添加到空队列中。此时算法终止。

 

 

6.6.2 讨论

6.6.2 Discussion

此示例重点关注模拟中的几个重要问题。为该模拟选择了中等抽象级别。这种选择意味着什么？在模拟此电路时，处理了大约 10 个事件。即便如此，仍要小心避免处理对电路没有影响的几个事件。在具有几千个门的电路中，可能会处理数十万个事件。因此，重要的是模拟器的实现要高效，并且不处理不必要的事件。

This example focuses several important issues in simulation. A medium level of abstraction was chosen for this simulation. What are the implications of that choice? In simulating this circuit, about 10 events were processed. Even so, care was taken to avoid processing several events that had no affect on the circuit. In a circuit with several thousand gates, many hundreds of thousands of events might be processed. So it is important that the simulator is implemented efficiently, and that unnecessary events are not processed.

避免不必要的事件处理的一种方法是使用更抽象的电路元件进行模拟。例如，我们可以用一个双输入、双输出逻辑块替换交叉耦合的 NOR 门，该逻辑块的行为由真值表指定。表中的一行表示输入 10 在两个时间单位的延迟后产生输出 01。使用这个新的逻辑块进行模拟将导致仅处理四个事件（两个用于测试向量，两个输出事件）。这可以加快模拟速度，但会丢失一些信息。

One way to avoid unnecessary event processing is to simulate with more abstract circuit elements. For example, we could replace the cross-coupled NOR gates with a two-input, two-output logic block the behavior of which is specified with a truth table. One line in the table indicates that inputs of 10 gives outputs of 01 after a delay of two time units. Simulating with this new logic block would result in only four events being processed (two for the test vector and two output events). This gives a faster simulation, but some information has been lost.

NOR 门仿真表明输出实际上是独立稳定的：E 在时间t + 1 时变为 0，而 F 直到时间t + 2才变为 1。此信息可能具有重要意义，具体取决于电路的其余部分，但在使用更抽象的电路进行仿真时不可用。输出的独立稳定是由于在电路中加入反馈而引起的，这是一种常见的电路设计技术。反馈可能导致许多微妙的时序问题，包括竞争条件和振荡。正如刚才所证明的，抽象级别的选择不当或不走运可能会掩盖这些问题。

The NOR-gate simulation showed that the outputs actually settled independently: E changed to 0 at time t + 1, whereas F did not change to 1 until time t + 2. This information might have important implications, depending on the rest of the circuit, yet was not available when simulating with the more abstract circuit. The independent settling of the outputs is caused by the inclusion of feedback in the circuit, which is a common circuit-design technique. Feedback can cause many subtle timing problems, including race conditions and oscillations. As just demonstrated, the improper or unlucky choice of abstraction level can mask such problems.

同样，NOR 门仿真无法模拟某些类型的行为。众所周知，同时改变门输入会导致亚稳态行为。本仿真中使用的简单模型无法检测到此类行为。更详细的时序仿真或电路级仿真可能会发现此类问题，但会耗费时间。

Similarly, the NOR-gate simulation cannot model some types of behavior. It is well known that the simultaneous changing of gate inputs can lead to metastable behavior. The simple models used in this simulation cannot detect such behavior. A more detailed timing simulation or circuit-level simulation would be likely to find this type of problem, at the expense of time.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 6 章：动态分析工具

本章由 Cadence Design Systems Inc. 的 Robert W. Hon 撰写。

6.7 硬件与仿真

6.7 Hardware and Simulation

实际硬件以两种方式融入设计的动态分析：首先作为所选模拟器运行的计算引擎；其次作为设计、验证和构建过程的目标。

Actual hardware fits into the dynamic analysis of designs in two ways: first as the computing engine on which the simulator of choice runs, and second as the goal of the design, verification, and construction process.

6.7.1 模拟机

6.7.1 Simulation Machines

已经描述了几种解决模拟器所施加的计算负担的硬件解决方案的例子[Denneau；Wang；Abramovici、Levendel 和 Menon]。

Several examples of hardware solutions to the computational burden imposed by simulators have been described [Denneau; Wang; Abramovici, Levendel, and Menon].

Yorktown 模拟引擎 [ Denneau] 是一种专用架构，旨在模拟多达 200 万个门，速度超过每秒 30 亿次门计算。该机器由 256 个逻辑处理器组成，这些处理器通过交换机互连。每个处理器都有自己的指令和数据内存以及能够评估逻辑函数的功能单元。在使用中，门级模拟被分为几个门网络。每个网络都加载到一个逻辑处理器上。通过处理器间交换机实现网络间通信。这样，可以使用并行硬件快速模拟所提出的设计。预期硬件和模拟之间存在清晰的映射。

The Yorktown Simulation Engine [Denneau] is a special-purpose architecture designed to simulate up to two million gates at a rate exceeding three billion gate computations per second. The machine consists of 256 logic processors interconnected by a switch. Each has its own instruction and data memory and a functional unit capable of evaluating logic functions. In use, a gate-level simulation is divided into several networks of gates. Each network is loaded onto one logic processor. Internetwork communication is achieved through the interprocessor switch. In this way, parallel hardware is used to simulate the proposed design rapidly. There is a clear mapping between the intended hardware and the simulation.

Wang 提出了一种不同的解决方案：使用直接法解决非线性微分方程组的并行硬件支持 [Wang]。这将为比目前可以处理的设计更大的设计提供快速的电路级仿真。

Wang proposes a different solution: parallel hardware support for solving systems of nonlinear differential equations using the direct method [Wang]. This would provide rapid circuit-level simulation of designs larger than those that currently can be processed.

其他中间解决方案也是可行的。例如，简单地添加浮点协处理器或矢量处理器可以加速模拟计算的内循环。

Other, intermediate solutions are also possible. For example, the simple addition of a floating-point coprocessor or a vector processor can speed the inner loops of the simulation calculations.

 

 

6.7.2 测试原型硬件

6.7.2 Testing Prototype Hardware

精心模拟的副作用是产生一组用于调试设计的测试向量。这些向量可用于测试原型硬件，并将模拟结果与从真实部件获得的结果进行比较。

A side effect of a careful simulation effort is a set of test vectors that are used to debug the design. Those vectors can be used to test the prototype hardware, and simulation results can be compared to the results obtained from the real part.

设计、验证和构建过程的最终目标是使硬件能够正常工作。多级仿真系统的出现使得将硬件用作大型系统仿真的一部分成为可能。例如，如果 ALU 芯片面世，则可将其用于替代整个系统中的 ALU 仿真。这既可作为新硬件部分的试验台，又可作为提高整个仿真性能的手段。一些商业供应商销售的产品允许混合使用模拟器和原型硬件 [VLSI]。

The ultimate goal of the design, verification, and construction process is working hardware. The advent of multilevel simulation systems brings about the possibility of using hardware as part of the simulation of a large system. For example, if an ALU chip became available it might be used to replace the simulation of the ALU in the overall system. This would serve both as a testbed for the new hardware part and as a means of improving the performance of the simulation as a whole. Several commercial vendors market products that allow the intermixing of simulator and prototype hardware [VLSI].

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 6 章：动态分析工具

本章由 Cadence Design Systems Inc. 的 Robert W. Hon 撰写。

6.8 总结

6.8 Summary

最先进的技术要求设计师在设计规模和模拟细节水平之间做出妥协。性能最佳的模拟器可以模拟大型设计，但细节不足以捕捉到在仍涉及大量低级设计的过程中可能出现的细微错误。电路级模拟器可以提供设计师可能需要的所有细节，但无法处理大型设计。

The state of the art demands that designers make compromises in size of design versus level of detail in simulation. The best performing simulators can simulate large designs, but not in sufficient detail to catch subtle errors of the type likely to occur in a process that still involves a great deal of low-level design. Circuit-level simulators can provide all the detail that a designer is likely to need, but cannot process large designs.

一种特别有效的方法是使用详细（电路级）仿真来检查关键功能或时序路径，并使用不太详细的仿真来检查设计的其余部分。关键部分可以通过人工洞察力来确定，也可以通过使用识别设计中潜在问题的更高级别的仿真来确定。

A particularly effective approach is to use detailed (circuit-level) simulation to check critical functional or timing paths, and less-detailed simulation for the remainder of the design. The critical sections can be determined using human insight, or through the use of higher-level simulations that identify potential problems in the design.

尽管全面的静态分析技术不断涌现，但它们仍然无法取代调试设计时使用数据的实际作用。因此，仿真在 CAD 系统中仍然非常重要。仿真工具必须跟上设计环境快速变化的需求，无论是在功能上还是在使用方式上。

Although thorough static-analysis techniques proliferate, they still do not replace the actual use of data in debugging a design. Simulation is therefore of continued importance in a CAD system. Simulation tools will have to keep up with the rapidly changing needs of design environments, both in their capabilities and in their style of use.

问题

Questions

  1. 发明一个更抽象的逻辑块，用于替代事件驱动仿真 部分示例中的交叉耦合或非门。给出其扩展的真值表。
  2. Invent a more abstract logic block that could replace the cross-coupled NOR gates of the example in the section, Event-Driven Simulation. Give its extended truth table.
  3. 显示在与之前相同的假设（单元门延迟、零线延迟）下模拟逻辑块所产生的事件队列。
  4. Show the event queue that results from simulating your logic block under the same assumptions as before (unit gate delay, zero wire delay).
  5. 构建一个包含四种状态的“与”门真值表：0、1、X 和 Z（电阻上拉高）。
  6. Build a truth table for an AND gate that includes the four states: 0, 1, X, and Z (resistive-pullup high).
  7. 模拟双向MOS管时会出现什么问题？如何解决？
  8. What problems occur when simulating bidirectional MOS transistors? How can these be overcome?
  9. 更精确的时间模型如何提高仅关注节点逻辑值（而非时间）的模拟质量？
  10. How can more accurate models of time improve the quality of simulation that is concerned only with logic values at nodes (and not time)?
  11. 层次结构如何帮助模拟？
  12. How can hierarchy aid in simulation?

参考

References

  • Hennion, B. and Senn, P., "A New Algorithm for Third Generation Circuit Simulators: The One-Step Relaxation Method," Proceedings 22nd Design Automation Conference, 137-143, June 1985.
  • IBM，高级统计分析程序 (ASTAP)，IBM 公司数据产品部，出版物 SH20-1118-0，纽约州怀特普莱恩斯。
  • IBM, Advanced Statistical Analysis Program (ASTAP), IBM Corporation Data Products Division, Publication SH20-1118-0, White Plains, New York.
  • Insinga, Aron K.，“结构逻辑模拟器中的行为建模”， ICCAD '84，42-44，1984 年 11 月。
  • Insinga, Aron K., "Behavioral Modeling in a Structural Logic Simulator," ICCAD '84, 42-44, November 1984.
  • Jain, Sunil K. 和 Agrawal, Vishwani D.，“MOS 电路的建模和测试生成算法”，IEEE 计算机学报，C-34:5，426-433，1985 年 5 月。
  • Jain, Sunil K. and Agrawal, Vishwani D., "Modeling and Test Generation Algorithms for MOS Circuits," IEEE Transactions on Computers, C-34:5, 426-433, May 1985.
  • Lathrop, Richard H. 和 Kirk, Robert S.，《可扩展面向对象混合模式功能仿真系统》，第 22 届设计自动化会议论文集，630-636，1985 年 6 月。
  • Lathrop, Richard H. and Kirk, Robert S., "An Extensible Object-Oriented Mixed-Mode Functional Simulation System," Proceedings 22nd Design Automation Conference, 630-636, June 1985.
  • Lightner, MR; Moceyunas, PH; Mueller, HP; Vellandi, BL; 和 Vellandi, HP，《CSIM：从功能模拟器到行为级模拟器的演变：实施问题和性能测量》， ICCAD '85，350-352，1985 年 11 月。
  • Lightner, M.R.; Moceyunas, P.H.; Mueller, H.P.; Vellandi, B.L.; and Vellandi, H.P., "CSIM: The Evolution of a Behavioral Level Simulator from a Functional Simulator: Implementation Issues and Performance Measurements," ICCAD '85, 350-352, November 1985.
  • Mead, C. 和 Conway, L.，《VLSI 系统简介》，Addison-Wesley，马萨诸塞州雷丁，1980 年。
  • Mead, C. and Conway, L., Introduction to VLSI Systems, Addison-Wesley, Reading, Massachusetts, 1980.
  • Miczo, Alexander，《数字逻辑测试和模拟》，第 2 章：“组合逻辑测试”，Harper and Row，纽约，1986 年。
  • Miczo, Alexander, Digital Logic Testing and Simulation, Chapter 2: "Combinational Logic Test," Harper and Row, New York, 1986.
  • Nagel，LW，《Spice2：模拟半导体电路的计算机程序》，加州大学伯克利分校，ERL-M520，1975 年 5 月。
  • Nagel, L. W., "Spice2: A Computer Program to Simulate Semiconductor Circuits," University of California at Berkeley, ERL-M520, May 1975.
  • Newton, Arthur Richard 和 Sangiovanni-Vincentelli, Alberto L.，《基于松弛的电气仿真》，IEEE CAD 汇刊，CAD-3:4，308-331，1984 年 10 月。
  • Newton, Arthur Richard and Sangiovanni-Vincentelli, Alberto L., "Relaxation-Based Electrical Simulation," IEEE Transactions on CAD, CAD-3:4, 308-331, October 1984.
  • Roth，JP，《自动机故障诊断：一种微积分和一种方法》， IBM 研究与开发杂志，10:4，278-291，1966 年 7 月。
  • Roth, J.P., "Diagnosis of Automata Failures: A Calculus and a Method," IBM Journal of Research and Development, 10:4, 278-291, July 1966.
  • Saleh, Resve A.；Kleckner, James E.；以及 Newton, A. Richard，《Splice1 中的迭代时序分析》，ICCAD '83，139-140，1983 年 9 月。
  • Saleh, Resve A.; Kleckner, James E.; and Newton, A. Richard, "Iterated Timing Analysis in Splice1," ICCAD '83, 139-140, September 1983.
  • Terman, Christopher J.“RSIM-A 逻辑级时序模拟器”，IEEE 国际计算机设计会议论文集，437-440，1983 年 10 月。

  • VLSI 系统设计人员，《1986 年逻辑模拟器调查》，VLSI 系统设计，VII:2，32-40，1986 年 2 月。

  • Wang, Paul KU，“电路仿真硬件加速方法”，IEEE 国际计算机设计会议论文集，724-726，1985 年 10 月。

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 7 章：设计辅助工具的输出

Chapter 7: The Output of Design Aids

7.1 简介

7.1 Introduction

计算机辅助设计系统必须能够与制造和测试电路的机器进行通信。这似乎是显而易见的，而且经常被视为理所当然；然而，如果没有与这些设备的良好连接，整个设计系统就会变成无用的玩具。显示屏的内容不是可接受的制造输入，壁纸比例图也不是。这些仅用于帮助设计师可视化电路。制造和测试机器有自己的描述格式，所有 CAD 系统都必须能够生成这些格式。

Computer-aided design systems must be able to communicate with the machines that manufacture and test circuits. This may seem obvious and is often taken for granted; without a good connection to such devices, however, the entire design system becomes a useless toy. The contents of the display screen are not acceptable input to manufacturing, nor are wallpaper-scale plots. These are strictly meant to help the designer visualize a circuit. Manufacturing and testing machines have their own descriptive formats, which all CAD systems must be able to generate.

制造机器 种类繁多，其中大多数使用截然不同的输入格式。造成这些不同格式的原因有多种。首先，规范格式往往针对制造的工件类型进行优化，从集成电路掩模到印刷电路和绕线板。其次，专利保护和其他市场因素往往使标准化变得不可取和不切实际。最后，技术发展速度如此之快，以至于机器及其界面很快就会过时。

There are many different manufacturing machines, most of which use vastly different input formats. There are several reasons for these different formats. First, specification formats tend to be optimized for the type of artifact being manufactured, ranging from integrated-circuit masks to printed-circuit and wire-wrap boards. Second, patent protection and other marketing factors often make standardization undesirable and impractical. Finally, technology is evolving at such a rate that machines and their interfaces are rapidly made obsolete.

测试器传统上是独立于设计系统进行编程的，很少考虑集成。尽管有些测试器的设计是为了模仿模拟器，但输入格式很少标准化或与设计过程正确连接。

Testers have traditionally been programmed independently of design systems, with little thought given to integration. Although some testers are designed to mimic simulators, the input formats are rarely standardized or properly connected to the design process.

除了能够以所有必要的制造和测试格式进行通信之外，一个好的 CAD 系统还应该能够理解许多交换格式，以便与其他 CAD 系统交换设计。这些交换格式不仅允许设计信息的自由流动，而且还允许其他系统访问部分 CAD 系统可以理解的模糊制造样式。

Besides having the ability to communicate in all the necessary manufacturing and test formats, a good CAD system should be able to understand the many interchange formats that allow it to exchange designs with other CAD systems. These interchange formats not only allow free flow of design information, but also enable obscure manufacturing styles, understandable by a subset of CAD systems, to be accessible from other systems.

制造、测试和交换格式的一个共同特点是它们根本无法被人类阅读。这些规范有时被设计为二进制位流，但更常见的是高度缩写的文本。期望设计师能够处理这种文本是不切实际的，因为它包含了太多关于电路的确切几何形状、拓扑结构和功能的细节。这种过多的数字正是设计系统试图避免的。如果设计师满足于以本章中描述的方式指定电路，那么就不需要这些系统了。然而，由于 CAD 系统比比皆是，这些格式一定不是为人类设计的，而只能用于机器间通信。

One common characteristic of manufacturing, testing, and interchange formats is that they are fundamentally unreadable to humans. These specifications are occasionally designed as binary bit streams, but more commonly as highly abbreviated text. It is unreasonable to expect designers to be able to manipulate this sort of text because it contains way too much detail about the exact geometry, topology, and functionality of the circuit. This overabundance of numbers is exactly the thing that design systems seek to avoid. There would be no need for these systems if designers were content to specify circuits in the manners described in this chapter. However, since CAD systems abound, these formats must not be intended for humans and remain to be used for only intermachine communication.

本章将讨论制造不同类型电子电路的接口。第一部分电路板讨论了绕线机、印刷电路和电路板钻孔机的格式。集成电路部分涵盖交换格式和制造格式。本章的最后一部分描述了 VLSI 电路的实现问题，包括测试器格式和 MOSIS 实现服务的概述。本章中提到的格式的完整详细信息可在附录 A至E中找到。

This chapter will discuss interfacing for the manufacturing of different types of electronic circuits. The first section on circuit boards discusses formats for wire-wrap, printed circuitry, and board drilling machines. The Integrated Circuit section covers interchange formats and manufacturing formats. The last section of the chapter describes implementation issues for VLSI circuits, including tester formats and a look at the MOSIS implementation service. Full details of the formats mentioned in this chapter can be found in Appendixes A through E.

图 7.1 是一个表格，总结了本章所述格式的功能。一些格式用于 CAD 系统之间的交换，一些用于测试，一些用于制造机器直接读取。值得注意的是，交换格式都支持分层描述，而制造格式都不支持。该表显示，一些格式是人类可读的文本，而另一些格式则是纯二进制的。还显示了所表示数据的性质 - 它们对拓扑、几何或行为的支持程度。最后，显示了允许的几何类型 - 它们处理线、多边形、圆、任意曲线或文本的能力。以下部分提供了该表的详细信息。

Figure 7.1 is a table that summarizes the capabilities of the formats described in this chapter. Some formats are meant as interchange between CAD systems, some are for testing, and some are intended to be read directly by manufacturing machines. It is interesting to note that the interchange formats all support hierarchical description, whereas none of the manufacturing formats do. The table shows that some formats are in human readable text and others are purely binary. Also shown is the nature of the represented data-the extent to which they support topology, geometry, or behavior. Finally, the allowable types of geometry are shown--their ability to handle lines, polygons, circles, arbitrary curves, or text. The following sections provide detail for the table.

绕线
