超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 7 章：设计辅助工具的输出

7.2 电路板

7.2 Circuit Boards

7.2.1 绕线板的格式

7.2.1 Format of the Wire-Wrap Board

在制造印刷电路板之前，许多设计师会在绕线板上制作原型。绕线是一种将电线紧紧缠绕在引脚上的技术。电气连接良好，但更改也很容易。

Before manufacturing a printed-circuit board, many designers build a prototype on a wire-wrap board. Wire-wrapping is the technique by which wires are attached to pins by being tightly wrapped around them. The electrical connection is good and yet changes are easily made.

绕线板的一侧有网格状的插针，另一侧有插座 。IC 封装插入插座，并在插针侧进行互连。由于 IC 上的引线通常相距 0.1 英寸，IC 封装通常宽度为 0.3 英寸或其倍数，绕线板上的插针和插座通常以 0.1 英寸为间隔排列，每列相距 0.3 英寸。通常在板的边缘附近有额外的插针和插座，以便连接板外连接器。

Wire-wrap boards have a mesh of pins on one side connected to sockets on the other. IC packages are plugged into the sockets and interconnection is done on the pin side. Since the leads on ICs are typically 0.1 inch apart and since IC packages are often 0.3 inch wide or multiples thereof, the pins and sockets on a wire-wrap board are usually spaced 0.1 inch apart in columns spaced 0.3 inch apart. Additional pins and sockets are often found near the edge of the board to enable wiring of off-board connectors.

由于包裹的电线是绝缘的，它们可以任意交叉。因此不存在布线问题，也不需要特定的线路几何形状。重要的是封装的位置和连接的端点。本质上，它是一个网络表，就像提供给交换机级模拟器的一样。

Since the wrapped wires are insulated, they can cross each other arbitrarily. Thus there is no routing problem, and the specific geometry of wire paths is not needed. All that matters is the location of the packages and the endpoints of connections. Essentially it is a netlist such as is given to switch-level simulators.

虽然这些信息没有严格的标准，但应该遵循某些惯例。绕线板通常用字母列和数字行来标识其引脚。左上角的引脚是 A01，其右侧的引脚是 B01。由于列间距比行间距大，因此列较少，单个字母通常足以列举它们。但是，Z 列之后是 AA、BB 列，依此类推。要列出板上的组件，必须提供以下信息：

Although there are no rigid standards for this information, certain conventions should be followed. Wire-wrap boards typically identify their pins with alphabetic columns and numeric rows. The upper-left pin is A01 and the pin to its right is B01. Since the columns are spaced wider apart than are the rows, there are fewer columns and single letters often suffice to enumerate them. However, after column Z comes column AA, BB, and so on. To list the components on the board it is necessary to give the following information: 

    包裹名称
    封装方向
    引脚 1 的位置

    Package name
    Package orientation
    Location of pin 1
例如，一行文字说明7404 1 M15将垂直放置 74-04 芯片（方向编号 1），芯片的第一个引脚位于电路板的 M15 位置。为了进行双重检查，可能还会要求提供其他信息： 
    封装上的引脚数
    包装宽度
    电源插针的位置
    接地插针的位置

    Number of pins on the package
    Package width
    Location of the power pin
    Location of the ground pin
然后通过列出要连接的坐标对来完成封装的布线。例如，该线C14 D25将放置一条从 C 列第 14 行到 D 列第 25 行的导线。

某些绕线格式允许定义信号名称，以便可以给出符号引脚位置并使用颜色协调的电线。其他选项包括需要两个源引脚和两个目标引脚的 双绞线布线规范。

Some wire-wrap formats allow definition of signal names so that symbolic pin locations can be given and color-coordinated wires can be used. Other options include the specification of twisted-pair wiring that requires two source and two destination pins.

指定电线顺序时应小心谨慎。由于绕线机在从一个引脚移动到另一个引脚时必须进行物理移动，所以最好将一根电线的起点靠近前一根电线的终点。这样可以加快绕线时间并节省成本。人们很容易使用菊花链，即下一根电线从前一根电线的结束引脚开始，因为按顺序指定时效率最高。但是，为了便于调试，任何电线都不应被进一步覆盖的其他电线覆盖，因为那样需要多次拆除才能进行更正。最好的顺序是将每隔一根电线放在一条线上，然后将奇数根电线绕在最上面。

Care should be taken when specifying the order of wires. Since wire-wrapping machines must make a physical movement when traveling from pin to pin, it is best to keep the start of one wire close to the end of the previous wire. This speeds wrapping time and saves money. It is tempting to use daisy chains, in which the next wire begins on the ending pin of the previous wire, since these are most efficient when specified in sequence. However, for ease of debugging, no wire should be covered by other wires that are further covered, because that will require too many removals to make a correction. The best order is to place every second wire in a run, and then to wrap the odd ones on top.

要制作最有用的绕线电路板，请考虑其现有用途。绕线是一个原型阶段，这意味着设计师将要对电路进行更改。每次更改都需要拆除并重新绕线。如果最后绕线最不稳定的电线，它们将位于顶部，这将使它们更容易更改。电源线和地线很少改变，因此应首先指定它们。长线应放在后面，这样它们就不会被短线夹住，短线更容易拆除。在制定绕线规范时，甚至应该允许用户指示波动性。

To generate the most useful wire-wrap boards, consider their purpose for existing. Wire-wrapping is a prototyping stage, which means that the designer will want to make changes to the circuit. Each change requires removal and rewrapping of wires. If the most volatile wires are wrapped last, they will be on top, which will make them easier to change. Power and ground wires rarely change so they should be specified first. Long wires should be placed later so they do not become trapped by short wires, which are more easily removed. User indication of volatility should even be allowed as a consideration when producing a wire-wrap specification.

 

 

7.2.2 印刷电路板的格式

7.2.2 Format of the Printed-Circuit Board

印刷电路板是一块非导电材料（通常是玻璃纤维）的薄片，上面铺设有扁平电线。这些电线穿过电路板上的孔，元件将连接到这些孔中。大多数印刷电路板都是多层板，两面都有电线，甚至夹在板内的各层上都有电线。

A printed-circuit board is a sheet of nonconducting material, usually fiberglass, that has flat wires laid onto it. These wires run between holes in the board into which components will be attached. Most printed-circuit boards are multilayer boards that have wires on both sides and even on layers sandwiched inside the board.

印刷电路板的每一层都是通过照相工艺制造的，该工艺使用一张胶片来遮盖电线的位置。该胶片可以手工制作，也可以根据 CAD 系统输出自动制作。一种流行的自动化技术是使用光绘机，它获取 CAD 系统的输出并制作用于印刷电路制造的胶片（见图 7.2）。

Each layer of a printed-circuit board is manufactured in a photographic process that uses a sheet of film to mask the location of wires. This film can be produced by hand or automatically from CAD system output. One popular automatic technique is the use of a photoplotter, which takes the output of a CAD system and produces film to be used in printed-circuit manufacturing (see Fig. 7.2).

图 7.2 印刷电路板的制造步骤。

最流行的光刻机控制格式称为 Gerber 格式，专为 Gerber 科学仪器公司机器 [Gerber] 创建。如今，其他公司的机器也接受 Gerber 格式，使其成为行业标准。

The most popular format for photoplotter control is called Gerber format, created for Gerber Scientific Instrument Company machines [Gerber]. Today other companies' machines accept Gerber format, making this an industry standard.

附录 A 给出了 Gerber 格式的详细信息。本质上，Gerber 文件是 ASCII 命令和参数值的集合。这些命令控制在胶片上移动的虚拟笔，绘制点、线、曲线和文本。模式命令设置状态，坐标命令控制实际绘制。例如，一旦设置了线条绘制模式，后续的坐标命令将绘制线条；当设置了三次样条模式时，后续的坐标命令将被视为曲线的拐点。虚拟笔可以抬起或放下以在绘制和移动之间切换。

Appendix A gives the details of Gerber format. Essentially, a Gerber file is a collection of ASCII commands and parameter values. The commands control a virtual pen that moves about the film drawing points, lines, curves, and text. Mode commands set state, and coordinate commands control the actual drawing. For example, once line-drawing mode is set, subsequent coordinate commands draw lines; when cubic-spline mode is set, subsequent coordinate commands are taken as inflection points for a curve. The virtual pen can be raised or lowered to switch between drawing and moving.

Gerber 格式没有层次结构；绘图命令按执行顺序列出。因此，在生成这些文件时，一个重要的考虑因素是局部性。光绘图仪需要时间来移动笔的位置，因此绘图顺序应遵循设计中的最小空间路径以降低成本。一些制造公司甚至有程序来重新排序绘图文件，以减少机器时间。但是，好的 CAD 系统第一次就能把事情做好。

There is no hierarchy in Gerber format; the drawing commands are listed in the order to be performed. Thus an important consideration in producing these files is locality. Photoplotters take time to move the pen position, so the order of plotting should follow a minimal spatial path through the design to keep costs down. Some manufacturing companies even have programs to reorder plotting files so that the machine time is reduced. However, a good CAD system does things right the first time.

除了印刷电路板布线的规格外，还应提供另外两种类型的信息：图形（非电子） 图稿和钻孔说明。图形图稿是一个可选步骤，将非导电油墨涂在印刷电路板上。此图形包含有用的信息，例如零件号和连接名称，可帮助电路板的最终生产和调试。指定和制造此图稿的方法与印刷布线相同：Gerber 文件。钻孔说明是必需的，因为它们会为芯片引线钻孔。这些规格与布线和图稿规格有很大不同，下一节将对此进行说明。

In addition to specifications for the wiring of a printed-circuit board, two other types of information should be available: the graphic (nonelectronic) artwork and the drilling instructions. Graphic artwork is an optional step that puts nonconducting ink on the printed-circuit board. This graphics contains helpful messages such as part numbers and connection names, which aid in the final production and debugging of the board. The methods for specifying and manufacturing this artwork are the same as for printed wiring: a Gerber file. Drilling instructions are necessary because they make the holes for the chip leads. These specifications are very different from wiring and artwork specifications, as the next section will illustrate.

 

 

7.2.3 钻孔机

7.2.3 Drilling Machines

如图 7.2 所示，印刷电路板不仅要布满导线，还要钻孔。钻孔既可用于连接元件，也可用于 通孔连接电路板的不同层。这些孔由数控( NC ) 钻孔机钻孔，而数控钻孔机采用另一种文件格式。

As Fig. 7.2 shows, a printed-circuit board must not only be covered with wires, but also be drilled. The holes are used either for component connections or as through holes to connect different layers of the board. These holes are made by numerically controlled (NC) drilling machines, which take yet another format of file.

数控钻床是非常简单的设备。它们有一个可切换的钻头，可以自动从一组工具中进行选择，还有一个可移动的工作台，可以将板的任何部分放在钻头下面。因此，数控钻床只有两个命令：

Numerically controlled drilling machines are very simple devices. They have a switchable drilling head that can automatically select from a set of tools, and they have a movable table that can place any part of the board under the head. Thus there are only two commands to an NC drilling machine:

Tdd

 

 

切换到工具dd，例如01。此工具切换需要时间，因此应尽量少用。第二条命令通过提供以下形式的坐标来使工具发挥作用：

XdddddYddddd

 

 

其中ddddd值是五位坐标，通常以英寸为单位，前两位数字后带有隐含的小数点 ( dd.ddd )。由于不知道电路板在钻孔机上的放置位置，因此坐标系的原点应可调整，以便电路板上的任何点都可以设置为 (0, 0)，其他坐标将随之滑动。对于数控钻孔以及所有格式，最好要求制造公司指定其期望的精确样式。

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 7 章：设计辅助工具的输出

7.3 集成电路

7.3 Integrated Circuits

集成电路是在称为 晶圆的大型硅片上制造的。一组大约 20 块这样的晶圆称为一个船载（boatload），一起制造的大量船载称为一个批次（run） 或一个批（batch）。晶圆是圆形的，直径为 3 到 6 英寸，一侧是平的（见图4.21）。尽管晶圆上可以包含数百个不同的 IC芯片，但通常只有一种类型的芯片，并且除了少数芯片位置外，其他所有芯片都会复制。一些原型制作操作将多个芯片芯片组合在单个晶圆上，或将多个 IC 设计放入单个芯片中。此外，偶尔也会在晶圆上的各个位置插入测试芯片。将不同的芯片放置在原本统一的掩模版上称为插入（drop-in）。整个生产过程如图 7.3 所示。

Integrated circuits are manufactured on large disks of silicon called wafers. A group of about 20 of these wafers is called a boatload and a large collection of boatloads manufactured together is called a run or a batch. A wafer is round, from 3 to 6 inches in diameter, and has one side flattened (see Fig. 4.21). Although it can contain hundreds of different IC dies, there is typically only one type of chip on a wafer and it is replicated in all but a few of the die locations. Some prototyping operations combine multiple chip dies on a single wafer, or place multiple IC designs into a single die. Also, there are occasional test dies inserted at various locations on the wafer. The placement of a different die on an otherwise uniform mask is called a drop-in. The entire production process is illustrated in Fig. 7.3.

图7.3 芯片制造步骤。

晶圆由多层导电和半导体材料组成。每层都配有一个掩模，用于在制造过程中控制材料的沉积或蚀刻。掩模是通过光学或电子束技术生产的，并且始终在计算机控制下。在某些原型设计情况下，不使用掩模，而是由电子束设备直接在晶圆上写入。无论使用何种掩模技术，控制格式都是相同的。

A wafer consists of multiple layers of conducting and semiconducting material. Each layer is specified with a mask that controls the deposition or etching of material during fabrication. Masks are produced either optically or by electron-beam techniques, and always under computer control. In some prototyping situations, the mask is not used and an electron-beam device writes directly on the wafer. Regardless of the masking technology, the controlling formats are the same.

虽然有许多掩模制造格式和针对掩模制造的交换格式，但这里将讨论一些标准。Caltech 中间格式 (CIF) 和 Calma GDS II 流格式是众所周知的交换标准，而电子设计交换格式 (EDIF) 较新且不太流行，但其广泛的应用可能会使其得到广泛认可。电子束曝光系统 (EBES) 格式是一种实际的机器规范，就像 Gerber 格式一样。

Although there are many mask-manufacturing formats and interchange formats targeted at mask making, there are a few standards that will be discussed here. Caltech Intermediate Format (CIF) and Calma GDS II Stream Format are well-known interchange standards, whereas Electronic Design Interchange Format (EDIF) is newer and less popular, but its vast extent may carry it to a wide acceptance. The Electron Beam Exposure System (EBES) format is an actual machine specification, like the Gerber format.

7.3.1 加州理工学院中级格式

7.3.1 Caltech Intermediate Format

加州理工学院中间格式( CIF ) 是一种描述集成电路的简单方法 [Hon and Sequin]。CIF 的目标是简洁、易于人类和机器阅读，最重要的是保持不变，以便可以将其作为标准来依赖。它的作者允许“用户扩展”，但不允许更改基本命令。 附录 B详细描述了 CIF。

Caltech Intermediate Format (CIF) is a simple method for describing integrated circuits [Hon and Sequin]. The goals of CIF are to be concise, to be readable by humans and machines, and most of all to remain constant so that it can be relied on as a standard. Its authors have allowed "user extensions," but permit no change to the basic commands. Appendix B describes CIF in detail.

CIF 文件是一组用于设置层并在其上绘图的文本命令。CIF 仅描述 IC 掩模上的几何形状：矩形、多边形、线和圆形焊盘。没有更高级的图形操作，例如文本或曲线。但是，由于具有层次结构，因此 CIF 易于生成并可用于构建复杂的图形。此外，该语言的结构允许将多个 CIF 文件轻松聚合为一个更大的文件，以便可以指定多项目芯片。CIF 的唯一缺点是它无法被任何掩模制造机读取，因此必须进一步处理才能用于制造。

A CIF file is a set of textual commands to set layers and draw on them. CIF describes only the geometry that is found on IC masks: rectangles, polygons, wires, and circular pads. There are no higher-level graphics operations such as text or curves. There is hierarchy, however, which makes CIF easy to generate and can be used to build complex graphics. In addition, the language is structured to allow multiple CIF files to easily be aggregated into a single larger file so that multiproject chips can be specified. The only drawback of CIF is that it is not readable by any mask-making machines and thus must be further processed before it can be used in fabrication.

 

 

7.3.2 Calma GDS II 流格式

7.3.2 Calma GDS II Stream Format

Calma GDS II 流格式比 CIF 更老，使用更广泛 [Calma]。它早期进入市场，导致后续供应商出于兼容性原因接受它；因此它成为标准。除了表示掩模几何形状外，它还具有用于拓扑信息和任意其他属性的功能。原因是 GDS II 是 Calma CAD 系统的完整数据库表示，而不仅仅是掩模制作的输出规范。因此它包括文本、数组、结构和层次结构（参见附录 C）。

Calma GDS II Stream Format is older than CIF and is more widely used [Calma]. Its early entry in the market caused subsequent vendors to accept it for compatibility reasons; thus it became a standard. In addition to representing mask geometry, it also has facilities for topological information and arbitrary other attributes. The reason for this is that GDS II is the complete database representation for Calma CAD systems, and not just the output specification for mask-making. Thus it includes text, arrays, structures, and hierarchy (see Appendix C).

随着新结构的引入，GDS II 多年来一直在变化。尽管如此，它仍保持了向后兼容性，这使得该格式仍然是行业标准。与 CIF 一样，这是一种中间格式，必须先转换才能将其转换为掩码。GDS II 的另一个缺点是它是二进制的，这使得它无法被人类阅读。有些人会认为这些格式不适合人类，二进制可以提供更多的数据压缩。然而，CAD 程序员确实喜欢可读的格式，就压缩而言，简洁的文本语言（如 CIF）不会占用太多空间。

GDS II has changed over the years as new constructs have been introduced. Nevertheless, backward compatibility has been maintained, which has allowed the format to remain the industry standard. Like CIF, this is an intermediate format that must be converted before it can be made into a mask. The other drawback of GDS II is that it is binary, which makes it not readable by humans. Some would argue that these formats are not meant for humans and that binary provides more compaction of data. However, the CAD programmer does appreciate a readable format and, as far as compaction is concerned, a concise text language such as CIF does not use much more space.

 

 

7.3.3 电子设计交换格式

7.3.3 Electronic Design Interchange Format

最新的 VLSI 交换格式是电子设计交换格式( EDIF )，由电子公司联盟 [EDIF 委员会] 提出。人们希望这种格式能够取代其他格式成为标准，因为它功能强大、易于解析，并且仍然对 CAD 系统的未来需求开放。此外，许多 CAD 供应商已承诺其产品将兼容 EDIF [VLSI 设计]。该格式在附录 D中进行了描述。

The most recent VLSI interchange format is the Electronic Design Interchange Format (EDIF), which was proposed by a consortium of electronics companies [EDIF Committee]. There is hope that this format will replace others as the standard, because it is so powerful, easy to parse, and still open to the future needs of CAD systems. Additionally, many CAD vendors have promised EDIF compatibility in their products [VLSI Design]. The format is described in Appendix D.

EDIF 是一种类似于LISP编程语言的文本格式 [McCarthy等]。每个语句都括在括号中，首先是关键字，然后是其参数。此外，整个 EDIF 文件的结构使得所有语句都是其他语句的参数。这意味着 EDIF 文件只有一个语句：

EDIF is a textual format that resembles the LISP programming language [McCarthy et al.]. Each statement is enclosed in parentheses and has a keyword first, followed by its parameters. Also, the entire EDIF file is structured so that all statements are parameters to other statements. This means that an EDIF file has only one statement:

(edif ediffile)

 

 

其中ediffile是其他语句的列表，例如：

(library name libcontents)

 

 

并且libcontents包括如下单元格语句

(cell name cellcontents)

 

 

等等。括号语句的嵌套使解析变得简单，并允许在 EDIF 语言中包含任意复杂性。不用说，EDIF 文件可以是分层的，它们可以包含任何形式的信息，包括拓扑、几何和行为。几何可以描述圆圈、文本等等。

尽管 EDIF 雄心勃勃地试图涵盖 CAD 系统所需的一切，但该规范在许多方面并不完善，甚至 EDIF 委员会也承认这一点。人们对行为和约束的理解甚少，因此该规范仅提到需要这些信息，而没有提出如何实现。此外，冗长和过度规范也存在明显问题。语法的某些顺序设置为标识符在首次声明之前使用（例如，关联单元不同视图的部分必须位于视图之前）。这使得解析更加困难。如果某些长关键字（例如）有破折号或连字符来帮助分隔组成它们的各个单词，那么 viewmapEDIF 所谓的人机可读性也可以得到改善。portimplementation

Although EDIF ambitiously attempts to include everything of interest to a CAD system, the specification is imperfect in a number of areas, as even the EDIF committee acknowledges. Behavior and constraints are poorly understood, so the specification merely mentions the need for this information without suggesting how it can be done. Also, there is a definite problem with wordiness and overspecification. Some of the ordering of the syntax is set so that identifiers are used before they are first declared (for example, the viewmap section, which associates different views of a cell, must come before the views). This makes parsing more difficult. Even the so-called human readability of EDIF could be improved if some of the long keywords such as portimplementation had dashes or hyphens to help separate the individual words that compose them.

对于此类信息，更简洁、更完整的方案是 SHIFT [Liblong]，它较早被提出但未被选为标准。这种交换格式具有明确规定的行为和约束，以及描述拓扑和几何结构的能力。值得注意的是，SHIFT 在结构和意图上与 EDIF 非常相似。它甚至具有类似 LISP 的语法。

A cleaner and more complete scheme for this kind of information is SHIFT [Liblong], which was proposed earlier but was not selected as a standard. This interchange format has well-specified behavior and constraints as well as the capability of describing topology and geometry. It is remarkable that SHIFT is so similar to EDIF in structure and intent. It even has LISPlike syntax.

EDIF 确实提供了非标准转义机制，以便可以包含附加信息。例如，当指定 EDIF 中尚不支持的非曼哈顿单元实例方向时，这可能很有用。由于该标准公开承认它不完整，这些扩展将很快被接受。但是，CAD 系统设计师必须小心谨慎，确保这些扩展得到适当协调和深思熟虑，否则 EDIF 将会偏离并无法成为标准。

EDIF does provide nonstandard escape mechanisms so that additional information can be included. This could be useful, for example, when specifying non-Manhattan orientations of cell instances that are not yet supported in EDIF. Since the standard openly admits that it is incomplete, these extensions will soon be accepted. However, care must be exercised by the CAD system designer to ensure that these extensions are properly coordinated and well thought out, or else EDIF will diverge and fail to be a standard.

 

 

7.3.4 电子束曝光系统格式

7.3.4 Electron Beam Exposure System Format

CAD 系统迟早必须生成可被掩模制造机读取的芯片描述。随着当今 IC 特征的缩小，电子束光刻方法明显优于光学技术。在电子束设备领域，一种非常流行的格式是贝尔实验室开发的电子束曝光系统( EBES) [Gross、Raamot 和 Watkins]。

Sooner or later the CAD system must produce a chip description that can be read by a mask-making machine. With today's smaller IC features, it is becoming clear that the electron-beam lithography methods are preferable to optical techniques. Within the domain of electron-beam devices, a very popular format is EBES, the Electron Beam Exposure System developed at Bell Laboratories [Gross, Raamot, and Watkins].

许多不同的掩模制作机器都可以直接读取 EBES，这解释了为什么它不允许分层。尽管这些机器中装有计算机，但它们却把所有时间都花在驱动电子束上，无法接受复杂的输入格式。事实上，只有三种不同的图形可以绘制：矩形、平行四边形和梯形。其他所有图形都必须由这三种图形组成。尽管有些机器允许对 EBES 进行扩展，例如数组和扩展寻址，但原始格式是唯一有保证的标准。

EBES is readable directly by a number of different mask-making machines and this explains why it allows no hierarchy. Although these machines have computers in them, they spend all their time driving the electron beam and cannot accept a complex input format. In fact, there are only three different figures that can be drawn: rectangles, parallelograms, and trapezoids. Everything else must be composed from these. Although some machines have allowed extensions to EBES such as arrays and extended addressing, the original format is the only guaranteed standard.

EBES 格式的主要缺点是它是二进制的，而二进制字长对于现代任务来说太小了。由于只有 16 位字，一个完整的芯片必须用边长只有 65,536 个单位的正方形来描述。这曾经是一个很大的领域，但今天很容易就超过了，迫使芯片被描述为多个相邻的芯片。如附录 E所示，EBES 的另一个问题是必须对几何图形进行排序，以便按空间顺序将其呈现给电子束机器。必须将此几何图形剪裁成条纹，然后必须按y坐标对所有碎片进行排序。圆形图形必须用多边形来近似，复杂的多边形必须分解为四边形图形。再加上缺乏层次结构，这些问题导致 EBES 文件很大且生成速度很慢。

The major drawback of EBES format is that it is binary and that the binary word size is restrictively small for modern tasks. With only 16-bit words, a complete chip must be described in a square of only 65,536 units on a side. This used to be a large field but it is easily exceeded today, forcing chips to be described as multiple abutting dies. Another problem with EBES, as Appendix E shows, is that the geometry must be sorted so that it is presented to the electron-beam machine in spatial order. This geometry must be clipped into stripes and then all the pieces must be sorted by y coordinate. Rounded figures must be approximated by polygons and complex polygons must be broken into four-sided figures. Combined with a lack of hierarchy, these problems cause EBES files to be large and slow to produce.

 

 

7.3.5 粘合机

7.3.5 Bonding Machines

在讨论 IC 制造规范时，讨论最后的步骤：封装和键合是合适的。 封装是选择 IC 芯片并将其连接到具有金属引线的塑料或陶瓷芯片主体上 [Johnson and Lipman]。 键合是将导线从芯片主体的引线连接到芯片上的 IC 焊盘的步骤。这两个步骤都属于 CAD 系统，尽管它们通常都是手工完成的。

In this discussion of IC manufacturing specification, it is appropriate to discuss the final steps: packaging and bonding. Packaging is the selection and attachment of the IC die to a plastic or ceramic chip body that has metal leads [Johnson and Lipman]. Bonding is the step that runs wires from the chip body's leads to the IC pads on the die. Both of these steps belong in a CAD system although they are more commonly done by hand.

IC 的封装选项经常变化，因此如果 CAD 系统维护一个封装数据库，其中显示引脚数、外部引脚排列、芯片内部腔体尺寸和其他物理封装属性，将会很有帮助。然后，系统可以帮助选择最适合当前任务的封装。

Packaging options for ICs change very often so it would be helpful if the CAD system maintained a database of packages showing the number of pins, the external pin arrangement, the internal cavity size for the die, and other physical package properties. The system could then help to select the most appropriate package for the task at hand.

可编程焊接机确实存在，用于将集成电路焊盘连接到芯片封装引线。然而，它们通常以交互式学习模式工作，需要操作员先完成一个芯片的焊接，然后机器才能完成更多工作。然后，会自动检查后续芯片，以找到特殊的基准标记，以便处理方向差异。将 CAD 系统与这台机器连接起来肯定是合理的，这样它就知道所有焊盘的位置，不需要人工指导。

Programmable bonding machines do exist to wire integrated-circuit pads to the chip package leads. However, they typically work in an interactive-learning mode that requires an operator to bond one chip completely before the machine can do more. Subsequent chips are then automatically inspected to locate special fiducial marks so that variances in orientation can be handled. It would certainly be reasonable to link the CAD system with this machine so that it knows the placement of all of the pads and needs no human instruction.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 7 章：设计辅助工具的输出

7.4 实施问题

7.4 Implementation Issues

除了电路本身的规格外，在制造电路时还需要考虑许多其他因素。可能需要进行数据转换以在交换格式之间进行转换。必须进行测试以验证电路并剔除制造不良的设备。此外，还有许多标准程序可用于加速设计和制造过程。本节讨论与 VLSI 系统实施相关的这些附带问题。

There are many other considerations in the manufacturing of a circuit besides its mere specification. Data conversion may be required to translate between interchange formats. Testing must be accommodated to verify a circuit and to weed out badly manufactured devices. Also, there are many standard procedures that may be available to speed the design and manufacturing process. This section discusses these side issues that relate to the implementation of VLSI systems.

7.4.1 数据转换

7.4.1 Data Conversion

正如本章前面提到的，交换格式不仅用于在 CAD 系统之间交换电路，而且也是一种制造途径，即从一种格式转换为另一种格式。因此，一个重要的实现功能就是在格式之间进行转换的能力。当为了制造而这样做时，只需要转换几何信息，因为拓扑和行为不用于制造。然而，一个完整的转换系统应该尝试保留尽可能多的信息，以防以后需要这些数据来重建原始文件。

As this chapter mentioned earlier, interchange formats exist not only to exchange circuits between CAD systems, but also as a path to manufacturing, by converting from one format to another. Therefore one important implementation facility is the ability to translate between formats. When doing so for the purpose of manufacturing, only geometric information needs to be converted, because topology and behavior is not used in fabrication. Nevertheless, a complete conversion system should attempt to retain as much information as possible, in case those data are needed later to reconstruct the original file.

大多数几何格式转换都很简单，可以逐个图形地完成。CIF 通过给出其中心点、大小和旋转来指定一个框；GDS II 用四个角坐标来描述它。这种转换需要最简单的算法。

Most geometric format conversion is straightforward and can be accomplished on a figure-by-figure basis. CIF specifies a box by giving its center point, size, and rotation; GDS II describes it with four corner coordinates. Such conversion demands the simplest of algorithms.

当其他格式中没有等效图形时，转换会稍微困难一些。因此，Gerber TEXT 命令在 CIF 中没有等效命令，可能需要完整的字体描述才能生成适当的几何图形。将弯曲对象转换为直线对象时也会出现同样的问题。

A somewhat more difficult conversion occurs when there is no equivalent figure in the other format. Thus the Gerber TEXT commands have no equivalent in CIF and may require a full typeface description so that appropriate geometry can be produced. The same problem arises when converting curved objects to rectilinear ones.

格式转换中一种有用的技术是使用第三种表示作为中间形式。这样可以在生成任何输出之前完全读取输入文件，以便在处理之前考虑所有数据。例如，转换为 CIF 需要在选择 CIF 单元的比例因子之前检查所有坐标值。使用中间表示的另一个优点是它可以根据输出格式的需求进行定制。因此，在生成 EBES 文件时，中间光栅表示在处理非直线形状（例如曲线或文本）方面有很大帮助。这些图形在光栅数组中近似，任何重叠都会自动合并。此外，需要对生成的 EBES 文件进行排序，当数据已经在矩阵中时，这会容易得多。

A useful technique in format conversion is to use a third representation as an intermediate. This allows the input file to be read completely before any output is generated, so that all the data can be considered before processing. For example, conversion to CIF needs to examine all coordinate values before choosing scale factors for the CIF cells. Another advantage of using an intermediate representation is that it can be tailored to the needs of the output format. Thus when generating EBES files, an intermediate raster representation helps immensely in handling nonrectilinear shapes such as curves or text. These figures are approximated in the raster array and any overlap is automatically merged. Also, the resulting EBES files need to be sorted and that is much easier when the data are already in a matrix.

格式转换可能会损坏数据，甚至根本无法工作。如果两个文件中的单位大小非常不兼容，则可能必须对数据进行近似。例如，将 200 个单位为微米的 EDIF 文件转换为 CIF 时，必须将其四舍五入一位，其中最小单位是百分之一微米。然而，当 CIF 单元实例旋转 45 度时，会出现更严重的问题。如果将此 CIF 文件转换为 EDIF 2.0 版或更早版本，则无法正确放置实例，因为 EDIF 单元必须出现在曼哈顿方向（此限制在 EDIF 3.0 版中得到解决）。转换程序可以分层展平单元实例并描述其所有封闭几何形状，或者它可以放弃。当转换质量下降或失败时，应告知用户问题并准确显示问题发生的位置。但是，转换必须继续进行，以免不重要的问题阻碍整个过程。

Format conversion may deteriorate the data or even fail to work at all. If the unit sizes in the two files are sufficiently incompatible, then the data may have to be approximated. For example, an EDIF file with 200 units to the micron will have to be rounded by one bit when converted to CIF, in which the smallest unit is one-hundredth of a micron. An even more severe problem, however, arises when a CIF cell instance is rotated by 45 degrees. If this CIF file is converted to EDIF version 2.0 or earlier, there will be no way to place the instance correctly, since EDIF cells must appear at Manhattan orientations (this limitation was addressed in EDIF version 3.0). The conversion program can hierarchically flatten the cell instance and describe all its enclosing geometry, or it can simply give up. When conversion degrades or fails, the user should be told of the problem and shown exactly where it has occurred. Conversion must then continue, however, so that unimportant problems do not block the overall process.

 

 

7.4.2 测试格式

7.4.2 Testing Formats

测试与模拟相同，只是测试使用的是真实部件而不是软件模拟。有些模拟器允许在部分流程中使用实际部件，而有些测试仪则在部分操作中使用软件模型。因此，测试仪格式通常与模拟器格式相同也就不足为奇了。事实上，大多数测试机制造商都会设计模拟已知模拟器的输入规范。

Testing is the same as simulating, only it uses real parts rather than software emulation. Some simulators allow actual components to be used for parts of the process, and some testers make use of software models for part of their operation. Therefore it is not surprising that tester formats are often the same as simulator formats. In fact, most testing-machine manufacturers design input specifications that mimic known simulators.

不幸的是，无论是模拟器命令还是测试仪规范都没有标准。EDIF 考虑了测试仪描述的可能性，但是它没有用于该目的的完整语言。EDIF 的后续产品是刺激数据交换格式( SDIF )，它具有类似的语法并试图填补 EDIF 的空白 [Pieper]。另一个可能的测试仪标准是CADDIF [Factron]，它已经向公众发布以期获得广泛认可。CADDIF 是一种没有控制结构的二进制表示：它仅列出要应用的刺激值和要监视的预期值。但是，SDIF 具有 EDIF 和LISP的完整表达能力，因此它能够描述循环和其他简洁的测试控制。SDIF 的文本外观比 CADDIF 的二进制结构更灵活，后者有时会将字段限制为 8 位，因此无法表达较大的值。

Unfortunately, there are no standards either in simulator commands or in tester specifications. EDIF considers the possibility of tester description but it does not have a complete language for that purpose. A follow-on to EDIF is the Stimulus Data Interchange Format (SDIF), which has similar syntax and attempts to fill the gap in EDIF [Pieper]. Another possible tester standard is CADDIF [Factron], which has been released to the public in an attempt to receive wide acceptance. CADDIF is a binary representation with no control structures: It merely lists the stimulus values to be applied and the expected values to watch. SDIF, however, has the full expressibility of EDIF and LISP, so it is able to describe loops and other concise testing control. SDIF's textual appearance is more flexible than CADDIF's binary structure, which sometimes limits fields to 8 bits and thus cannot express large values.

由于可以对电路进行广泛的测试，测试器接口格式也各不相同。必须处理数字和模拟设备，并具有可用的容差来捕获所有必要的值。对于数字电路，必须根据高、低、阈值、浮动和其他概念的离散值对电压进行分类，这些概念以数字方式描述但不断进行分析。因此，测试器语言必须以合适的风格与所有设计人员交流。一些测试器语言甚至能够接受来自模拟器的波形作为刺激和响应数据。

Tester-interface formats are also variable because of the wide range of testing that can be done to a circuit. Both digital and analog devices must be handled, with tolerances available to capture all the necessary values. For digital circuits, the voltages must be classified according to discrete values of high, low, threshold, floating, and other notions that are digitally described but continuously analyzed. The tester language must therefore speak to all designers in a suitable style. Some tester languages are even able to accept waveforms from the simulator as stimulus and response data.

随着测试仪处理器变得越来越复杂，它们将能够接受更广泛的测试规范。这将为突破制造商限制的标准测试仪格式提供可能性。

As the processors in testers grow more sophisticated, they will be able to accept a wider range of test specifications. This will open up the possibility of standard tester formats that cut across manufacturer's limitations.

 

 

7.4.3 VLSI芯片标准

7.4.3 Standards on the VLSI Chip

另一个值得考虑的实施问题是在 VLSI 芯片上使用标准化结构以简化与外界的接口。最常见的标准结构是焊盘，它为每种设计环境提供。使用这种焊盘不仅可以让设计人员免于考虑焊盘层和间距等焊盘问题。这些标准焊盘通常具有必要的电路，用于静电保护、TTL 驱动以及芯片其他地方不需要的所有模拟考虑。因此，数字设计人员可以通过使用标准部件作为非数字接口，以纯粹的逻辑意义看待 VLSI 系统。

Another implementation issue that is worthy of consideration is the use of standardized structures on the VLSI chip to ease interface with the outside world. The most common standard structures are the bonding pads, which are provided for each design environment. Use of such pads does more than relieve the designer from bonding considerations such as pad layers and spacing. These standard pads often have necessary circuitry for static protection, TTL driving, and all the analog considerations that are not needed elsewhere on the chip. Thus the digital designer can view VLSI systems in a purely logical sense by using standard parts for the nondigital interface.

人们甚至可以更进一步提供片上标准。例如，可以为芯片设计人员提供已放置并连接到电源和接地的标准焊盘框架。然后，VLSI 设计人员可以使用这些焊盘，而不必担心芯片尺寸或正确的焊盘组织。为了获得最大的灵活性，焊盘框架可以是一个简单的模板，在其上放置真正的焊盘。这允许输入、输出和双向焊盘以适当的数量和位置出现。电源和接地焊盘仍然可以作为框架的一部分固定，因为它们的位置通常很关键，并且它们的重新排列对于芯片设计来说不是必要的。

One can go even further in providing on-chip standards. For example, it is possible to provide the chip designer with a standard frame of pads, already placed and connected to power and ground. The VLSI designer can then use these pads without worrying about die size or proper pad organization. For maximum flexibility, the pad frame can be a simple template on which real pads are placed. This allows the input, output, and bidirectional pads to appear in appropriate number and location. Power and ground pads can still be fixed as part of the frame, since their locations are often critical and their rearrangement is not necessary to the chip design.

最终的片上标准是包含焊盘、时钟线和完全接口的 I/O 的设计框架[Borriello等]。设计人员将看到一个内部芯片区域和一组沿框架的连接点。除了芯片上的标准框架外，芯片外部还有一个标准电路板，可以正确连接到计算机总线。这样的方案非常适合教学目的，还可以为原型电路的制造和测试提供快速的周转时间。不同设计框架的库对于任何 CAD 系统来说都是有价值的补充。

The ultimate on-chip standard is the design frame that includes pads, clock lines, and fully interfaced I/O [Borriello et al.]. The designer is presented with an inner chip area and a set of connection points along the frame. Besides a standard frame on the chip, there is also a standard circuit board outside the chip that correctly interfaces to the bus of a computer. A scheme such as this is excellent for instructional purposes and also provides rapid turnaround for the manufacture and test of prototype circuits. A library of different design frames would be a valuable addition to any CAD system.

 

 

7.4.4 制造标准：MOSIS

7.4.4 Standards of Fabrication: MOSIS

这里要讨论的最后一个实施问题是使用标准化服务来制造 VLSI 系统。本书前面的部分指出，在许多情况下，必须要求制造商提供适当的掩模图形、补偿和其他电路生产规范。然而，由于我们高度专业化和服务导向的社会，有“经纪人”可以处理这些细节。一个这样的经纪人是MOS 实施服务( MOSIS )，它基于施乐帕洛阿尔托研究中心 [Conway、Bell 和 Newell] 开发的方法，对集成电路和印刷电路板进行快速原型设计 [MOSIS]。

The final implementation issue to be covered here is the use of standardized services for the manufacturing of VLSI systems. Earlier sections of this book noted that, in many situations, the manufacturer must be asked to supply the proper mask graphics, compensation, and other specifications for circuit production. However, thanks to our highly specialized and service-oriented society, there are "brokers" that can take care of these details. One such broker is the MOS Implementation Service (MOSIS) which does rapid prototyping of integrated circuits and printed-circuit boards [MOSIS], based on methods developed at Xerox Palo Alto Research Center [Conway, Bell, and Newell].

MOSIS 是一项由美国政府资助的服务，可供那些获得美国国家科学基金会 (NSF) 或国防高级研究计划局 (DARPA) 资助的人使用。这项服务在美国大学中被广泛用于实施学生 VLSI 项目和教师研究项目。它也可供其他愿意付费的客户使用。其他国家也有类似的服务，特别是加拿大 [CMC] 和澳大利亚 [Hellestrand et al. ]。许多公司提供部分此类服务，称自己为 硅晶圆代工厂。

MOSIS is a service funded by the U.S. government that is available to those people who have received grants from the National Science Foundation (NSF) or the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA). This service is widely used in American universities for implementation of student VLSI projects and faculty research projects. It is also available to other clients who are willing to pay. There are similar services active in other countries, particularly Canada [CMC] and Australia [Hellestrand et al.]. A number of firms offer portions of these services, calling themselves silicon foundries.

MOSIS 可以接受 CIF 或 GDS II 描述。与 MOSIS 的所有通信均通过电子邮件进行。在互联网上，请使用地址“mosis@mosis.org”或访问其网页“http://www.mosis.org”。

MOSIS can accept either CIF or GDS II descriptions. All communication with MOSIS is done by electronic mail. On the Internet, use the address "mosis@mosis.org" or check their web page at "http://www.mosis.org".

MOSIS 制造的芯片将根据焊盘要求放入不同大小的封装中。MOSIS 鼓励使用标准焊盘框架，以简化封装，并提供多芯片模块以组合小型项目。该服务包括掩模制作、制造、封装、粘合和交付芯片以及运行的SPICE参数。每次运行时报告 SPICE 参数的原因很简单，因为 MOSIS 是许多制造公司的经纪人，并且事先不知道芯片将在哪里制造。用户可以放心高制造标准，因为原型芯片不能容忍低产量。除了芯片之外，印刷电路板还可以按照 CIF 规格制造。

Fabricated chips from MOSIS will be placed into varying-sized packages, depending on the pad requirements. MOSIS encourages the use of standard pad frames to make packaging easier, and offers multi-chip modules for combining small projects. This service includes mask-making, fabricating, packaging, bonding, and delivery of chips along with SPICE parameters for the run. The reason that the SPICE parameters are reported with each run is simply that MOSIS is a broker for many fabrication firms and does not know in advance where a chip will be built. Users are assured of high fabrication standards because prototype chips cannot tolerate a low yield. In addition to chips, printed-circuit boards can be manufactured from CIF specifications.

提交给 MOSIS 的 CIF 文件必须满足某些限制才能顺利制造。不能使用Definition Delete ( DD) 语句。幸运的是，这通常是安全的，因为该语句仅存在于 MOSIS 等实现者中，并且几乎从未由 CAD 系统生成。多边形必须至少有三个点，圆形闪光必须具有非零直径。不用说，焊盘必须存在于 CIF 文件中，因为它们的位置和数量有助于自动对芯片进行分类。作为实现的辅助，建议使用“XP”层来复制焊盘几何形状。

CIF files submitted to MOSIS must meet certain restrictions to enable smooth fabrication. The Definition Delete (DD) statement may not be used. Fortunately, this is usually safe because the statement exists only for implementors such as MOSIS and is almost never generated by a CAD system. Polygons must have at least three points, and round flashes must have a nonzero diameter. Needless to say, pads must be present in the CIF file, because their location and number helps to classify the chip automatically. As an aid to implementation, it is suggested that the "XP" layer be used to duplicate pad geometry.

提交用于制造的 GDS II 文件必须包含顶层单元的名称，因为该信息不是数据的一部分。应提醒用户，NODE、BOX和 PLEX 将被忽略，ELFLAGS 和 ELKEY 记录中的信息也将被忽略。

GDS II files submitted for fabrication must include the name of the top-level cell, since that information is not part of the data. Users should be cautioned that NODEs, BOXs, and PLEXs will be ignored as will the information in ELFLAGS and ELKEY records.

如前所述，与 MOSIS 的大多数对话都可以通过电子方式进行。自动邮件阅读器知道如何以正确的格式响应消息，因此许多请求无需人工干预即可处理。用户可以获得文档、焊盘框架描述，甚至包含焊盘、PLA 元素等的单元库。只需与 MOSIS 的自动邮件阅读器交谈，也可以提交芯片进行制造。当然，在提供服务之前必须建立适当的会计制度。

As it was mentioned before, most conversation with MOSIS can take place electronically. Automatic mail readers know how to respond to messages in the right format, so many requests can be handled without human intervention. Users can obtain documentation, pad-frame descriptions, and even cell libraries containing pads, PLA elements, and so on. It is also possible to submit a chip for fabrication merely by talking to the automatic mail reader at MOSIS. Of course, proper accounting must be established before services can be rendered.

发送给 MOSIS 的电子邮件格式如下：

The format of an electronic message to MOSIS is as follows: 

    请求：关键字
    参数
    请求：结束
    REQUEST: keyword
    parameters
    REQUEST: END
每个REQUEST消息控制要采取的操作，消息以操作结束END。格式不正确的消息将引发响应，解释正确的格式并提供一些初步帮助。因此，首次使用 MOSIS 的用户只需发送包含任何随机内容的消息即可开始使用。

对 MOSIS 的请求可以是索要INFORMATION、SUBMIT索要芯片、索要人力ATTENTION等等。随着服务的扩展，选项也不断增加，因此请查阅当前 MOSIS 用户手册以了解详细信息。

Requests to MOSIS can be to ask for INFORMATION, to SUBMIT chips, to demand human ATTENTION, and more. The options are always growing as the service expands, so consult the current MOSIS user's manual for details.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 7 章：设计辅助工具的输出

7.5 总结

7.5 Summary

本章描述了制造 VLSI 电路的必要步骤。CAD 系统必须能够根据特定的设计环境生成多种不同格式的制造规范。此外，交换格式是 CAD 系统的必要组成部分，以便使其与世界上的其他系统进行通信。本章还介绍了具体的实施问题，例如格式转换、测试接口、布局标准和制造标准。CAD 系统及其用户应该了解这些问题，以便完成任务并实现设计。

This chapter has described the necessary steps for the fabrication of VLSI circuits. The CAD system must be able to generate manufacturing specifications in a number of different formats, depending on the particular environment of design. Also, interchange formats are a necessary part of a CAD system, to let it communicate with the other systems in the world. This chapter also covered specific implementation issues such as format conversion, testing interface, layout standards, and manufacturing standards. CAD systems and their users should understand these issues in order to complete their task and realize their designs.

问题

Questions

  1. 为什么绕线或印刷电路板的描述没有层次结构？
  2. Why is there no hierarchy in descriptions of wire-wrap or printed-circuit boards?
  3. 列出二进制文件格式的三个缺点。
  4. List three disadvantages of binary file formats.
  5. 任何标准输出格式的最重要的特征是什么？
  6. What is the most important feature of any standard output format?
  7. 列出在输出格式之间进行转换的两个原因。
  8. List two reasons to convert between output formats.
  9. 编程语言中与单元库和设计框架相对应的东西是什么？
  10. What is the programming-language equivalent of cell libraries? Of design frames?
  11. 哪些困难可能会阻碍 EDIF 成为标准？
  12. What difficulties may prevent EDIF from becoming a standard?
  13. 什么技术进步将消除制造格式和交换格式之间的区别？
  14. What technological advance will remove the distinction between manufacturing formats and interchange formats?

参考

References
