超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 9 章：图形

Chapter 9: Graphics

9.1 简介

9.1 Introduction

图形虽然经常被忽视，但却是许多编程工作的重要组成部分。对于 CAD 系统构建者来说，图形是必不可少的，因为即使使用纯文本规范的设计系统也必须绘制其电路。没有图形，计算机将变得非常无聊且难以使用。

Graphics, although often overlooked, is a significant part of many programming efforts. For the CAD system builder there is no escaping graphics because even design systems that use purely textual specification must also plot their circuits. Without graphics, computers would be exceedingly boring and difficult to use.

图形的两个重要因素是速度和清晰度。绘图速度可以成就或毁掉整个系统，因为它是用户遇到的第一个属性。显示速度慢的系统会立即被忽略，无论其其他突出功能如何。相反，有些系统功能很少，但显示速度非常快，用户感觉良好。交互式 CAD 系统必须能够显示复杂电路的大部分而不会失去用户的注意力，并生成硬拷贝图而不会长时间占用系统。长时间的延迟会导致沮丧、分散注意力并降低生产力。

The two important factors in graphics are speed and clarity. Drawing speed can make or break an entire system because it is the first attribute that a user encounters. Systems that display slowly are ignored immediately, regardless of their other salient features. Conversely, there are systems that do very little, but display so quickly that users feel good about them. An interactive CAD system must be able to display large parts of complex circuits without losing the user's attention, and produce hardcopy plots without tying up the system for long periods of time. Extended delays will cause frustration, encourage distraction, and cut productivity.

显示清晰度是一个广泛的问题，包括易于阅读、正确性，甚至正确的绘制顺序。要使图像的整体内容易于理解，必须区分各个部分。正确的颜色和纹理很重要，信息丰富且整洁的标签也很重要。显示的正确性比大多数人想象的更重要，因为人眼可以在完美的屏幕上检测到一个不正确的点[Catmull]。如果显示的伪像不如或比实际部分更好，设计师就会担心电路的质量。此外，在交互式显示器上，绘制顺序应该合理，以便设计师可以快速判断发生了什么。这意味着重绘应该首先覆盖当前对象，并且在系统继续绘制另一个对象之前，应该绘制整个对象或至少是对象的一个​​可区分部分。

Display clarity is a broad issue that includes ease of perusal, correctness, and even proper sequence of drawing. For the overall content of an image to be understandable, the individual parts must be distinguishable. Proper color and texture are important, as is informative and uncluttered labeling. The correctness of a display is more important than most people think because the human eye can detect one incorrect point on an otherwise perfect screen [Catmull]. If the displayed artifact is not as good or better than the actual part, the designer will fear for the circuit's quality. Also, the order of drawing should make some sense on interactive displays so that the designer can quickly tell what is going on. This means that redraw should cover current objects first and that all of an object, or at least a distinguishing portion of it, should be drawn before the system moves on to draw another object.

在这个瞬息万变的世界里，今天使用的显示设备明天还存在的可能性很小。可以轻松执行复杂图形功能的新硬件不断涌现。因此，图形编程的一个重要属性是模块化。不应有对显示系统的专用调用，所有图形控制都应位于代码的中心位置。任何不常见且不可移植的图形函数都应以高效、特定于显示的方式进行编码，并以不具备该功能的系统的替代方式进行编码。最好的方法是使用众所周知的虚拟图形协议，例如GKS [X3H3]、Core [GPSC] 或PHIGS [ANSI]。通过这样做，您可以更好地确保新显示器的控制适合现有方案，因为这些协议经过精心规划。您还可能会发现该协议已直接在某些显示器上实现，这使得移植变得非常简单。

In this everchanging world, there is little chance that the display device used today will still be there tomorrow. New hardware is constantly appearing that can perform complex graphic functions with ease. For this reason, an important attribute of graphics programming is modularity. There should be no special-purpose calls to the display system, and all graphics control should be centrally located in the code. Any graphics functions that are unusual and not portable should be coded both in their efficient, display-specific way and in an alternative way for systems without the feature. The best approach is to use a well-known virtual-graphics protocol such as GKS [X3H3], Core [GPSC], or PHIGS [ANSI]. By doing this, you are better assured that control of new displays will fit into the existing scheme, because these protocols are well planned. You may also find that the protocol has been implemented directly on some displays, which makes porting very simple.

本章讨论二维图形显示和硬拷贝绘图技术。此外，还将提到一些图形输入的基础知识。本章主要涉及实际的图形功能；这里将不强调这些功能的正确使用。第 10 章“人体工程学”将展示如何有效地运用这些技术。此外，本章主要关注与 VLSI 设计相关的图形技术。如果想获得更全面的介绍，包括三维变换、隐藏表面去除和光源着色等主题，建议读者查阅专门讨论图形的文本 [Foley and Van Dam；Newman and Sproull]。这些文本包含了足够多的 VLSI 设计系统构建信息，感兴趣的程序员会希望熟悉它们，因为它们非常有用。

This chapter discusses techniques for two-dimensional graphics display and hardcopy plotting. In addition, some of the basics of graphic input will be mentioned. The chapter is primarily concerned with actual graphics functions; proper use of these functions will not be emphasized here. Chapter 10, Human Engineering, will show how to employ these techniques effectively. Also, this chapter is focused primarily on graphics techniques that are relevant to VLSI design. For a more thorough coverage, including such subjects as three-dimensional transformations, hidden-surface removal, and light-source shading, the reader is encouraged to consult texts devoted to graphics [Foley and Van Dam; Newman and Sproull]. These texts contain more than enough information for VLSI design system construction, and interested programmers will want to be familiar with them because of their general usefulness.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 9 章：图形

9.2 显示图形

9.2 Display Graphics

当设计人员使用交互式显示器编辑电路时，该显示器通过帧缓冲器 连接到主计算机。帧缓冲器只是计算机用图像填充的一段内存。连接到帧缓冲器的是一个显示处理器，它将图像内存转换为视频信号。主计算机的控制下还可能有一个图形加速器，用于快速操作帧缓冲内存。帧缓冲器、显示处理器、图形加速器和显示器有很多不同的类型。大多数帧缓冲器都是图标式的，包含与屏幕上的每个像素或点相等量的内存。这些图标式帧缓冲器仅仅是没有其他结构的数组。

When a designer uses an interactive display to edit a circuit, that display is connected to the main computer via a frame buffer. A frame buffer is simply a section of memory that the computer fills with an image. Connected to the frame buffer is a display processor that converts the image memory into a video signal. There may also be a graphics accelerator under the control of the main computer for rapid manipulation of the frame-buffer memory. There are many different types of frame buffers, display processors, graphics accelerators, and displays. Most frame buffers are iconic, containing an equal amount of memory for each pixel, or point on the screen. These iconic frame buffers are merely arrays with no other structure.

一些帧缓冲器使用复杂的显示列表，以类似于计算机指令集的形式对图像进行编码。保存此类图像所需的内存量随图像的复杂程度而变化，但通常比图标帧缓冲器所需的内存量要少。虽然使用显示处理器显示显示列表更为复杂且成本更高，但它允许主计算机更快地处理复杂图像，因为需要修改的帧缓冲器内存更少。

Some frame buffers use complex display lists, which encode the image in a form similar to that of a computer instruction set. The amount of memory required to hold such an image varies with the complexity of the image, but it is usually less than would be required by an iconic frame buffer. Although using the display processor for display lists is more complicated and expensive, it allows the main computer to manipulate complex images more rapidly because less frame-buffer memory has to be modified to make a change.

另一个区别是显示器是光栅显示器 还是书法显示器。光栅显示器是最常见的显示器，其电子枪以固定顺序扫描整个屏幕表面。书法显示器有时也称为矢量显示器，现在越来越少见；它们的电子枪在屏幕上随机移动以绘制任何要求的内容。不用说，书法显示器从不使用图标帧缓冲区，而是由显示列表驱动。但是，书法显示列表处理器比光栅显示处理器更简单，因为它通常可以将绘图指令直接发送到电子枪。当内存昂贵时，用更复杂的显示硬件换取更少的内存是合理的；如今最昂贵的组件是书法显示管，因此它们通常用驱动连接到较便宜的光栅显示器的图标帧缓冲区的显示处理器来伪造。书法显示器的最后一个问题是它们难以填充屏幕上的实心区域，这使得它们在 IC 设计中不受欢迎。

Another distinction is whether the display is raster or calligraphic. Raster displays, which are the most common, have electron guns that sweep the entire surface of the screen in a fixed order. Calligraphic displays, sometimes called vector displays, are increasingly rare; they have electron guns that move randomly across the screen to draw whatever is requested. Needless to say, calligraphic displays never use iconic frame buffers but instead are driven from display lists. The calligraphic-display list processor is simpler than the raster-display processor, however, because it can usually send drawing instructions directly to the electron guns. When memory was expensive, this tradeoff of more complex display hardware for less memory made sense; today the most expensive component is the calligraphic display tube, so these are typically faked with display processors that drive iconic frame buffers connected to less expensive raster displays. A final problem with calligraphic displays is that they have difficulty filling a solid area on the screen, which makes them unpopular for IC design.

一旦了解了显示器的类型，就必须确定其质量。图像质量的三个主要因素是颜色的可用性、屏幕上的像素数以及每个像素的位数。第一个也是显而易见的选择是在黑白（有时称为单色 ）和彩色显示器之间。对于 IC 设计，颜色非常重要，因为必须区分许多层。原理图设计师对颜色的需求较少，但仍可以使用它来减少复杂设计的混乱。

Once the type of display is understood, the quality must be determined. The three main factors in image quality are the availability of color, the number of pixels on the screen, and the number of bits for each pixel. A first and obvious choice is between black-and-white (sometimes called monochrome) and color displays. For IC design, color is very important because there are many layers that must be distinguished. Schematics designers have less of a need for color but can still use it to reduce the clutter of complex designs.

显示质量的下一个因素是其分辨率（以像素为单位）。光栅显示器的空间分辨率（屏幕上的点数）通常低于书法显示器。光栅显示器通常有大约 500 到 1000 个像素。较便宜的显示器（例如个人电脑上的显示器）的像素数是该数字的一半，而越来越常见的高分辨率显示器的像素数是该数字的两倍。书法显示器通常可以将电子枪定位在屏幕上 4000 个或更多离散点上。

The next factor in display quality is its resolution in pixels per inch. The spatial resolution, the number of points on the screen, is usually lower for raster displays than for calligraphic displays. Raster displays typically have about 500 to 1000 pixels across and down. Less expensive displays, such as are found on personal computers, have half that number, and high-resolution displays, which are becoming more common, have twice that number. Calligraphic displays can typically position the electron gun at 4000 or more discrete points across the screen.

每个像素可用的位数决定了 强度分辨率，这与空间分辨率同样重要。许多黑白显示器只有两个强度级别，即开或关，这使它们成为双层显示器。因此，它们可以在一个内存位中存储一个完整的像素。简单的彩色显示器有八种颜色，由红、绿、蓝显示枪的双层组合决定。然而，为了有阴影，需要更多的位来描述这三原色。对于人类的观看，强度不需要超过 8 到 10 位，颜色则需要 24 到 30 位。因此，高分辨率彩色显示器可以消耗超过 3 兆字节的内存。然而，对于 VLSI 设计，每个像素只需要 8 或 9 位；这些可以均匀分布在彩色枪之间或映射到随机选择。 颜色映射将与像素相关的单个值转换为显示器的三个颜色值（见图 9.1）。在典型的映射中，8 位像素数据寻址三个表，每个表有 256 个条目。各个条目的强度可以是 8 位或更多位，从而可以产生全色域的颜色，前提是任何时候显示的不同颜色不超过 256 种。

The number of bits available for each pixel determines the intensity resolution, which is just as important as the spatial resolution. Many black-and-white displays have only two intensity levels, on or off, making them bilevel displays. They can therefore store a complete pixel in one bit of memory. Simple color displays have eight colors determined by the bilevel combinations of red, green, and blue display guns. In order to have shading, however, more bits are needed to describe these three primary colors. For viewing by humans, no more than 8 to 10 bits of intensity are needed, which becomes 24 to 30 bits in color. Thus a high-resolution color display can consume over 3 megabytes of memory. For VLSI design, however, only 8 or 9 bits per pixel are needed; these can be evenly distributed among the color guns or mapped to a random selection. Color mapping translates the single value associated with a pixel into three color values for the display (see Fig. 9.1). In a typical map, 8 bits of pixel data address three tables, each 256 entries long. The individual entries can be 8 or more bits of intensity, allowing a full gamut of colors to be produced, provided no more than 256 different colors are displayed at any time.

图 9.1 颜色映射。一个 9 位像素代表地图中的一个完整颜色值。

理想情况下，帧缓冲区的编程应该相当简单，图形加速器会完成设置单个像素的所有困难工作。在这种情况下，控制程序只需要提供矢量端点、多边形顶点和文本字符串即可绘制这些对象。然而，在不太理想的情况下，CAD 程序员可能必须编写这些算法。下一节将介绍图形加速器的典型功能，接下来的几节将讨论软件问题。

Ideally, programming a frame buffer should be fairly simple, with the graphics accelerator doing all the difficult work of setting individual pixels. When such is the case, the controlling program needs to supply only vector endpoints, polygon vertices, and text strings to have these objects drawn. However, in less ideal situations, the CAD programmer may have to code these algorithms. The next section describes typical features of graphics accelerators and the following sections discuss the software issues.

9.2.1 硬件功能

9.2.1 Hardware Functions

无论有没有图形加速器，帧缓冲区通常都可以执行一些操作。一个经常可用的功能是设置背景颜色。在颜色映射显示器上，这仅意味着设置表的条目 0 的映射值。在非映射显示器上，整个表面必须用所需的背景颜色填充，并且每次擦除对象时都必须使用该背景颜色。

There are a few operations that the frame buffer can typically do with or without a graphics accelerator. One feature that is often available is the ability to set the background color. On color-mapped displays, this simply means setting the map value for entry 0 of the table. On nonmapped displays, the entire surface must be filled with the desired background color and it must also be used whenever an object is erased.

许多光栅帧缓冲区最有用的功能之一是 写入掩码。此值用于选择在更改像素值时使用的位平面子集。例如，如果将值 255 写入 8 位帧缓冲区中的像素，而写入掩码的值为 126，则只会设置最高位和最低位，其他位将保持原样。有了此功能和颜色图，可以为 VLSI 设计的每个层分配不同的位平面，并通过屏蔽每个平面来独立修改每个平面（参见图 9.2）。层的绘制或擦除仅在专用位平面中进行，而不考虑与其他位平面中其他层的图形交互。通过正确选择颜色图条目，每个层或位平面都可以是不同的颜色，并且可以合理地着色所有层重叠组合。

One of the most useful features of many raster frame buffers is the write mask. This is a value that selects a subset of the bit-planes to use when changing the value of a pixel. For example, if the value 255 is written to a pixel in a 8-bit frame buffer and the write mask has the value 126, then only the top and bottom bits will be set and the others will be left as they were. Given this facility and a color map, one can assign a different bit-plane to each layer of a VLSI design and modify each plane independently of the others by masking them out (see Fig. 9.2). The drawing or erasing of layers takes place exclusively in the dedicated bit-plane without regard for the graphical interactions occurring with other layers in other bit-planes. With proper selection of color-map entries, each layer or bit-plane can be a different color and all combinations of layer overlap can be sensibly shaded.

图 9.2 单独的位平面控制允许按层组织显示存储器：（a）显示存储器（b）两个样本位平面的内容（c）最终显示。

对于具有图形加速器的系统，许多硬件功能都可用。光栅显示器上提供的一项非常常见的功能是能够快速移动屏幕上的数据块。此操作称为块传输（或bitblt或BLT），在许多图形应用程序中都很有用。块传输可用于填充屏幕区域并快速移动对象。复杂的图形操作可以通过块传输完成，因为它通常提供通用算术和逻辑引擎来在传输过程中操纵数据。因此，例如，图像可以在显示屏上平滑移动而不会遮挡其后面的数据。这是通过在每次更改位置时将图像与显示内容进行异或，然后在前进之前再次进行异或以将其擦除来实现的。块传输操作通常足够快，可用于平移图像，将整个屏幕朝一个方向移动并从内存中其他未显示的缓冲区填充。这种平移假定内存中的其他位置有一个大于显示图像的整体图标图像。当然，所有这些数据移动仅在光栅显示器上才是必要的，因为显示列表帧缓冲区可以平移而不需要块传输或大型图像内存。

For systems that have graphics accelerators, a number of hardware functions become available. One very common feature that is provided on raster displays is the ability to move a block of data on the screen quickly. This operation, called block transfer (or bitblt or BLT), is useful in many graphic applications. Block transfer can be used to fill areas of the screen and to move objects rapidly. Complex graphic operations can be done with the block transfer because it typically provides a general-purpose arithmetic and logical engine to manipulate the data during transfer. So, for example, an image can be moved smoothly across the display without obscuring the data behind it. This is done by XORing the image with the display contents at each change of location, and then XORing it again to erase it before advancing. The block-transfer operation is usually fast enough that it can be used to pan an image, shifting the entire screen in one direction and filling in from an undisplayed buffer elsewhere in memory. Such panning presumes that an overall iconic image, larger than what is displayed, is available somewhere else in memory. Of course, all this data moving is necessary only on raster displays, because display-list frame buffers can pan without the need for block transfer or large image memories.

块传输操作的另一个可能功能是快速显示层次结构。绘制单元格内容时，可以保存该单元格图像在屏幕上的位置，这样，如果该单元格的另一个实例出现在其他地方，就可以复制它。这种显示缓存在那些单元格的所有实例都具有相同内容和大小的 IC 设计环境中工作正常。每当在多边形内部使用填充图案时，它就会受到影响，因为当图案移到另一个位置并放置在类似图案上时，图案的相位可能不会对齐。解决此问题的方法是围绕每个单元格实例绘制轮廓，以便图案在单元格边界处干净地终止 [Newell 和 Fitzpatrick]。

Another feature possible with the block transfer operation is the rapid display of hierarchical structures. When the contents of a cell is drawn, the location of that cell's image on the screen can be saved so that, if another instance of that cell appears elsewhere, it can be copied. This display caching works correctly for those IC design environments in which all instances of a cell have the same contents and size. It suffers whenever a fill pattern is used on the interior of polygons because the phase of the pattern may not line up when shifted to another location and placed against a similar pattern. A solution to this problem is to draw an outline around each cell instance so that patterns terminate cleanly at the cell border [Newell and Fitzpatrick].

当然，由于 VLSI 系统功能的进步，目前已有许多专用图形加速器。现代光栅显示器具有绘制直线、曲线和多边形的加速器。非常先进的加速器（超出本章的范围）可处理具有隐藏面消除的三维对象。这些设备的控制与以下部分中描述的软件界面没有什么不同。

Of course, there are many special-purpose graphics accelerators in existence, due particularly to the advances in VLSI systems capabilities. Modern raster displays have accelerators that draw lines, curves, and polygons. Very advanced accelerators, beyond the scope of this chapter, handle three-dimensional objects with hidden-surface elimination. Control of these devices is no different than the software interface described in the following sections.

 

 

9.2.2 画线

9.2.2 Line Drawing

要绘制的线条始终 以一对端点 ( x1 , y1 ) 和 ( x2 , y2 )的形式呈现，它们在显示屏上定义一条线段。简单的线条绘制算法将间隔 [x1x2] 和 [y1y2] 分成相等的部分，并逐步遍历它们，放置像素。这在许多方面都有问题，包括速度低和线条质量下降。速度问题在于间隔和增量的确定需要复杂的数学运算，例如除法（在硬件中完成时尤其痛苦）。对于这种技术，线条质量也很差，因为间隔的选择可能会导致像素聚集或线条中出现间隙。如果选择间隔为最长轴上的 1 像素，则线条在视觉上是正确的，但仍然难以计算。

Lines to be drawn are always presented as a pair of endpoints, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), which define a line segment on the display. A simple line-drawing algorithm divides the intervals [x1 x2] and [y1 y2] into equal parts and steps through them, placing pixels. This is problematical in many respects, including low speed and line-quality degradation. The problem of speed is that the interval and increment determination requires complicated mathematics such as division (especially painful when done in hardware). The line quality is also poor for such a technique because the choice of interval may cause bunching of pixels or gaps in the line. If the interval is chosen to be 1 pixel on the longest axis, then the line will be visually correct but still hard to compute.

无需复杂算法即可绘制线条的解决方案是使用缩放整数值来确定像素增量。最流行的技术也根据这些缩放整数进行所有初始计算 [ Breshenham 65 ]。该算法使用一个指标，其初始值为 D = 2 y - x （其中y = y 2 - y 1 和x = x 2 - x 1），以及当前点 ( x , y )，其初始值为 ( x 1 , y 1 )。绘制该点后，x递增 1，并且 仅当D > 0时y才递增 1。如果y递增，则D会增加值 2( y - x )；否则，会增加值 2 y 。此过程持续，直到 ( x , y ) 达到 ( x 2 , y 2 )。

The solution to drawing lines without complex arithmetic is to use scaled-integer values for the determination of pixel increments. The most popular technique also does all initial calculations in terms of these scaled integers [Breshenham 65]. The algorithm makes use of an indicator that initially has the value D = 2 y - x (where y = y2 - y1 and x = x2 - x1), and a current point (x, y), which initially is (x1, y1). After plotting this point, x is incremented by 1, and y increments by 1 only if D > 0. If y increments, then D has the value 2(y - x) added to it; otherwise, it has the value 2y added to it. This continues until (x, y) reaches (x2, y2).

Breshenham 算法非常快，因为这些项可以预先计算，并且所有项只需要加减运算。所描述的版本当然适用于斜率小于 1 的线，因为x平滑增加。对于其他线，坐标项只需反转即可。

The Breshenham algorithm is very fast because the terms can be precomputed and all of them require only addition and subtraction. The version described is, of course, for lines with a slope of less than one because x increments smoothly. For other lines, the coordinate terms are simply reversed.

许多 CAD 系统需要纹理线来区分不同的对象。这些可以通过存储使用 Breshenham 计数器旋转的位模式轻松绘制，从而抑制不在模式中的像素。还可以通过偏移起点和终点来绘制粗线，以便绘制多条平行线来填充区域。但是，除非这些线非常接近，否则当相邻线的像素无法落在每个位置时，就会留下间隙。这种现象称为莫尔条纹，可以在对几何进行离散近似的任何地方发生（见图 9.3）。因此，对于非常粗的线，最好使用填充多边形。
图 9.3 莫尔条纹：(a) 三条平行线中的莫尔条纹 (b) 辐射线中的莫尔条纹。

 

 

9.2.3 多边形绘制

9.2.3 Polygon Drawing

多边形有三种样式：开放的、封闭的和填充的。前两种只是线条的集合，而第三种类型是图形学中的一个独立问题。如果填充多边形是矩形并且其边与轴平行，则很容易渲染。由于这种多边形在 VLSI 设计中很常见，因此值得进行特殊测试。此外，有些图形加速器在内置到帧缓冲区时，可以立即绘制这些矩形。一个系统在每个像素处都有一个处理器，如果其坐标与广播多边形边界匹配，则设置自身[Locanthi]。另一个系统重新设计了标准内存组织，以允许并行设置矩形区域[Whelan]。矩形填充很重要，因为它是一种基本操作，可用于加速线条绘制、复杂多边形填充等。

Polygons come in three styles: opened, closed, and filled. The first two are simply aggregates of lines but the third type is a separate problem in graphics. A filled polygon is trivially rendered if it is rectangular and has edges parallel to the axes. Since such polygons are common in VLSI design, special tests are worth making. Also, there have been some graphics accelerators that, when built into frame buffers, allow these rectangles to be drawn instantly. One system has a processor at each pixel that sets itself if its coordinate matches the broadcast polygon boundary [Locanthi]. Another system redesigns standard memory organization to allow parallel setting of rectangular areas [Whelan]. Rectangle filling is important because it is a basic operation that can be used to speed up line drawing, complex polygon filling, and more.

填充任意多边形的问题稍微困难一些。与线绘制一样，有许多方法可以产生不同质量的结果。一种方法是奇偶校验扫描技术，它扫描多边形的边界区域，寻找边缘像素。该算法的前提是每个边缘像素都会反转位于多边形内部或外部的状态。一旦进入内部，扫描仪就会填充所有像素，直到到达另一条边缘。这种方法有一个明显的问题：将边缘量化为像素可能会导致边缘上设置的像素数量不正确，从而导致奇偶校验被反转。尝试使用原始的线定义只会使数学更加复杂，并且可能仍会有一个点的顶点混淆奇偶校验。该技术的一种变体称为边缘标志[Ackland 和 Weste]，它使用临时帧缓冲区并补充多边形边缘右侧的像素。这种方法可以正常工作，因为在顶点处发生的双重补充会清除边缘位并防止奇偶校验填充失控。当所有边都输入到临时帧缓冲区后，就可以使用奇偶扫描正确填充多边形。

The problem of filling arbitrary polygons is somewhat more difficult. As with line drawing, there are many methods that produce varying quality results. One method is the parity-scan technique that sweeps the bounding area of the polygon, looking for edge pixels. The premise of this algorithm is that each edge pixel reverses the state of being inside or outside the polygon. Once inside, the scanner fills all pixels until it reaches the other edge. There is an obvious problem with this method: Quantization of edges into pixels may leave an incorrect number of pixels set on an edge, causing the parity to get reversed. Attempting to use the original line definitions will only make the mathematics more complex, and there may still be vertices of one point that confuse the parity. A variant on this technique, called edge flag [Ackland and Weste], uses a temporary frame buffer and complements the pixels immediately to the right of the polygon edges. This method works correctly because double complementing, which occurs at vertices, clears the edge bit and prevents runaway parity filling. When all edges have been entered into the temporary frame buffer, parity scan can be used to fill the polygon correctly.

另一种存在问题的多边形填充方法是种子填充。这种方法中，内部的像素以递归方式增长，直到到达边缘。检查每个像素时，都会对其进行填充，而任何尚未填充的相邻像素都会排队等待后续检查。这种方法在堆叠要填充的像素时会使用大量内存，还可能会遗漏一些狭窄的角落（见图 9.4）。此外，还有寻找内部点的问题，这比简单地选择中心要复杂得多。要确保某个点位于多边形内部，在它和外部之间构造的一条线必须与多边形边缘相交奇数次。这需要大量的计算，因为这个过程很昂贵，而且仍然没有提出一种寻找内部点的方法，而只是检查它。寻找点的技术包括 (1) 从中心开始，(2) 向顶点前进，以及 (3) 扫描多边形边界矩形中的每个点。
图 9.4 多边形种子填充遗漏了角落中的像素。

最佳多边形填充算法取决于可用的硬件。如果可以构建专用硬件，多边形几乎可以立即填充。例如，有一个硬件帧缓冲区可以并行设置一条线一侧的所有像素 [Fuchs等]。这可用于通过逻辑组合每个多边形边缘的内部状态来填充凸多边形。

The best polygon-fill algorithm is dependent on the available hardware. If special-purpose hardware can be constructed, polygons can be filled almost instantly. For example, there is a hardware frame buffer that does a parallel set of all pixels on one side of a line [Fuchs et al.]. This can be used to fill convex polygons by logically combining interior state from each polygon edge.

设置线一侧像素的硬件必须计算以下方程：


Ax + By + C=0



对于每个像素。A x和 B y 的值沿行和列向下传播到每个像素的简单加法比较单元（见图 9.5）。该像素处理器将值相加，并将结果与​​常数 (-C) 进行比较。使用侧面的树形结构求和单元可以快速计算 A x和 B y。所有算术都以位串行方式完成，以将互连保持在一条线上，并降低每个像素处理器的复杂性。
图 9.5 线条绘制的并行计算。

当没有用于边缘填充的高级硬件时，另一种方法是分析多边形并将其简化为更简单的对象。例如，可以通过在顶点处切割凸多边形将其分解为梯形。结果是一个左边缘和右边缘列表，当从上到下扫描时，它会给出水平线上要填充的起始和结束坐标（见图 9.6）。在每个水平扫描线上，每侧只有一个活动边缘，这些边缘可以用 Breshenham 线绘制遍历。边缘之间的像素可以用大小为n × 1 的矩形操作来填充。
图 9.6 水平切片将多边形分解为梯形。左边缘列表和右边缘列表界定了每个梯形。

非凸多边形必须先分解成更简单的多边形。这需要在拐点处添加切割线，以便将多边形分解成多个更简单的部分。或者，可以使用前面描述的梯形方法完成此操作，并在每条扫描线上对多个填充部分进行一些额外的记录 [Newell 和 Sequin]。

Nonconvex polygons must first be decomposed into simpler ones. This requires the addition of cutting lines at points of inflection so that the polygon breaks into multiple simpler parts. Alternatively, it can be done using the trapezoid method described previously with a little extra bookkeeping for multiple fill pieces on each scan line [Newell and Sequin].

 

 

9.2.4 剪辑

9.2.4 Clipping

裁剪是删除不需要的图形的过程。它用于许多任务，包括复杂的多边形分解、显示窗口边界和非冗余数据库几何的构建。这里将讨论两种裁剪算法：多边形裁剪和屏幕裁剪。

Clipping is the process of removing unwanted graphics. It is used in many tasks, including complex polygon decomposition, display-window bounding, and construction of nonredundant database geometry. Two clipping algorithms will be discussed here: polygon clipping and screen clipping.

在多边形裁剪中，基本操作是用一条线切割任意多边形，并在该线的两侧生成两个新多边形。图 9.7 显示了如何使用此操作来确定两个多边形的交点。多边形 A 的每条线都用于裁剪多边形 B，丢弃线外的部分。当多边形 A 的所有线都完成后，多边形 B 的剩余部分就是交点区域。
图 9.7 通过裁剪完成的多边形相交：（a）多边形 B 沿线 1 裁剪；（b）多边形 B 沿线 2 裁剪；（c）多边形 B 沿线 3 裁剪；（d）多边形 B 沿线 4 裁剪。

这里要讨论的多边形裁剪算法遍历多边形上的点，并根据裁剪线方程测试它们 [Catmull]。如前所述，线方程的形式为：

The polygon-clipping algorithm to be discussed here runs through the points on the polygon and tests them against the equation of the clipping line [Catmull]. As mentioned before, a line equation is of the form:



Ax + By + C=0



并定义一组位于直线上的 点 ( x , y )，因为它们满足方程。所有不在线上的点都将导致方程的右侧为非零值，符号表示特定侧。

裁剪器获取多边形中的每个点，并使用方程将其放置在定义两个新分割多边形的两个输出列表之一中。三个规则决定了原始多边形中的点在依次转换为两个裁剪多边形时会发生什么。这些规则使用有关原始多边形中当前点和前一个点的信息（见图 9.8）：
  1. 如果当前点与前一个点位于同一侧，则将其放置在与该侧关联的输出列表中。图中的 B、D 和 E 点就是这种情况。
  2. If the current point is on the same side as the previous point, then place it in the output list associated with that side. This happens to points B, D, and E in the figure.
  3. 如果当前点位于前一个点的另一侧，则 (a) 找到该边与剪切线的交点，(b) 将交点放在两个列表中，以及 (c) 将当前点放在与其侧关联的列表中。图中的 A 点（最后处理的点）就是这种情况。
  4. If the current point is on the other side of the previous point, then (a) find the intersection of that edge and the clipping line, (b) place the intersection point in both lists, and (c) place the current point on the list associated with its side. This happens to point A in the figure (the last point processed).
  5. 如果当前点位于剪切线上，则将其放在两个列表中。图中的 C 点就是这种情况。
  6. If the current point is on the clipping line, then place it in both lists. This happens to point C in the figure.
此剪切操作仅贯穿输入多边形一次，并在线性时间内产生两个剪切的输出多边形。
图 9.8 用线段裁剪多边形。按顺序检查原始点，构建两个分割多边形列表。

还有其他可满足不同需要的剪辑方法，最常见的是屏幕剪辑。在屏幕剪辑中，必须将矢量剪辑到矩形窗口以使其不会超出显示区域的边缘。虽然这可以通过四次多边形剪辑来实现，但是还有一种更便宜的方法。Sutherland -Cohen 剪辑算法 [Newman 和 Sproull] 首先根据窗口边界的边将空间分成九个部分（参见图 9.9）。每个部分都有一个 4 位代码，对于已越过的四个窗口边界，每个部分都设置了 1 位。中间部分的代码为 0000，是剪辑线条的实际显示区域。计算每个线条端点的代码值很简单，如果两端的代码都是 0000，则线条清晰可见。如果其他线条的两个端点的位在进行“与”运算时不为零，则线条显然不可见。无法立即根据端点代码进行分类的线需要进行简单的除法，以将端点推到窗口的一个边缘。这可能需要执行两次才能使矢量完全位于显示窗口内。
图 9.9 Sutherland-Cohen 裁剪算法的空间码。每个比特位置与中央窗口的一个边缘相关。

 

 

9.2.5 文本

9.2.5 Text

文本显示非常简单，但可能会因比例、方向和可读位置 等许多选项而变得复杂。基本操作是将预先设计的字母图像复制到显示屏上。这些字母的每个集合都是一个字体，并且可能有许多不同样式、大小和方向的字体可供选择。虽然这些字母形式的变化可能是可用于构建字体的算法的简单参数 [Knuth]，但预先计算字体更容易、更快捷。

Display of text is quite simple but can be complicated by many options such as scale, orientation, and readable placement. The basic operation copies a predesigned image of a letter to the display. Each collection of these letters is a typeface, or font, and there may be many fonts available in different styles, sizes, and orientations. Although these variations of the letter form may be simple parameters to algorithms that can be used to construct the font [Knuth], it is easier and much faster to have fonts precomputed.

当将文本放置在图形之上时，确保字母的可读性非常重要。如果能够以不同于背景图形的颜色显示文本，则可读性会大大增强。更改文本颜色的另一种方法是使用阴影，即文本周围的黑色边框（实际上仅在底部和右侧），用于区分繁杂背景中的字母。更严格的区分方法是在写文本之前擦除背景的矩形。这也可以通过复制整个字母阵列（而不仅仅是组成字母的那些像素）来实现。

When placing text on top of drawings it is important to ensure the readability of the letters. If it is possible to display the text in a different color than the background drawing, legibility is greatly enhanced. An alternative to changing the text color is to use drop shadows, which are black borders around the text (actually only on the bottom and right sides) that distinguish the letters in busy backgrounds. A more severe distinction method is to erase a rectangle of background before writing the text. This can also be achieved by copying the entire letter array instead of just those pixels that compose the letter.

当然，正确放置文本可获得最佳效果。例如，当文本附加到对象时，如果字母从对象附近开始并向外延伸，则更易于阅读。线条的文本应放置在线条上方或下方。过多的文本应被截断或缩小，以免干扰其他文本。当文本的大小大于其附加的对象时，文本就会变得过多。所有文本都应是可选的，事实上，显示系统应允许打开和关闭图像的任何部分以减少混乱。任何看过地图的人都可以证明，文本放置是一项艰巨的任务，可能会消耗大量资源以徒劳地达到完美。CAD 系统不应试图独自解决这个问题，而应提供足够的放置选项，使用户可以使显示可读。

Of course, proper placement of text gives best results. For example, when text is attached to an object, it is more readable if the letters begin near the object and proceed away. Text for lines should be placed above or below the line. Excessive text should be truncated or scaled down so that it does not interfere with other text. Text becomes excessive when its size is greater than the object to which it attaches. All text should be optional and, in fact, the display system should allow any parts of the image to be switched on and off for clutter reduction. As anyone who has ever looked at a map can attest, text placement is a difficult task that can consume vast resources in a vain attempt to attain perfection. A CAD system should not attempt to solve this problem by itself, but should instead provide enough placement options that the user can make the display readable.

 

 

9.2.6 圆曲线

9.2.6 Circular Curves

屏幕上需要绘制许多曲线符号。最简单的是圆，可以用与直线相同的方法绘制：Breshenham 算法[Breshenham 77]。该技术是只绘制一个八分圆（右上角，从十二点到一点半），并将其镜像八次以生成一个圆。为了便于算法描述，圆以 (0, 0) 为圆心，因此对于半径 R，绘制的八分圆从 (0, R) 到 (R / 2, R / 2)。对于此八分圆中的每个点 ( x , y )，还会绘制其他七个点 (- x , y )、( x , - y )、(- x , - y )、( y , x )、(- y , x )、( y , - x ) 和 (- y , - x )。

There are many curved symbols that need to be drawn on the screen. The simplest is the circle, which can be drawn with the same method as a line: Breshenham's algorithm [Breshenham 77]. The technique is to draw only one octant (the upper-right, from twelve o'clock to one-thirty) and mirror it eight times to produce a circle. For the purpose of algorithm description, the circle is centered at (0, 0) so that for a radius R the octant that is drawn is from (0, R) to (R / 2, R / 2). For each point (x, y) in this octant, the seven other points (-x, y), (x, -y), (-x, -y), (y, x), (-y, x), (y, -x), and (-y, -x) are also drawn.

Breshenham 方法的流程如下：最初从 x = 0、y = R 和D = 3 - 2R 开始。在每一步中，如果 D为 0，则增加x并有条件地减少y 。当y减少时，将 4( x - y )+10 添加到D中 ，当y不减少时，将 4 x +6 添加到D中。继续进行，直到x y绘制八分圆的点。

The Breshenham method proceeds as follows: Initially start at x = 0, y = R, and D = 3 - 2R. At each step, increment x and conditionally decrement y if D0. When y is decremented, add 4(x - y)+10 to D and when y is not decremented, add 4x+6 to D. Proceed until x y at which point the octant is drawn.

填充圆的工作原理相同，只是对于同一水平面上的每对八分圆，在点之间绘制一个n × 1 的矩形。因此，对于八分圆上的点 ( x , y )，从 (- x , y ) 填充到 ( x , y )，从 (- x , - y ) 填充到 ( x , - y )，从 (- y , x ) 填充到 ( y , x )，以及从 (- y , - x ) 填充到 ( y , - x )。

Filled circles work the same way except that for each pair of octants at the same horizontal level, an n × 1 rectangle is drawn between the points. Thus for point (x, y) on the octant, fill from (-x, y) to (x, y), from (-x, -y) to (x, -y), from (-y, x) to (y, x), and from (-y, -x) to (y, -x).

圆弧很难画，因为它们可以在任何地方开始或结束。要使用 Breshenham 方法，必须确定完整八分圆和部分八分圆的数量，并仔细跟踪以了解在哪里画圆。此外，Breshenham 代码必须能够以八分圆中间结束，或者根据圆弧的需要向后运行。如果先将圆弧转换为矢量，则可以更好地绘制圆弧。已有许多用于曲线形状矢量近似的已发表算法集 [Rogers and Adams]。

Arcs of circles are difficult to draw because they can start or end anywhere. For the Breshenham method to be used, the number of full and partial octants must be determined and carefully tracked to know where to draw. Also, the Breshenham code must be able to end in mid-octant or to run backwards as needed by the arc. Arcs can be better drawn if they are first converted to vectors. There are many published sets of algorithms for vector approximation of curved shapes [Rogers and Adams].

 

 

9.2.7 样条曲线

9.2.7 Spline Curves

非圆曲线可以用多种方式绘制，但最常用的技术是样条曲线。样条曲线是沿着一组控制点的平滑曲线。与其他曲线方法不同，样条曲线可以处理任意数量的点并生成在一阶和二阶导数上连续的曲线。样条曲线的缺点是曲线不一定经过控制点，只能在控制点附近。其他曲线方法（如Hermite和Bezier [Bezier]）具有相反的属性：它们确实经过控制点，但不能整齐地延伸到大量点。

Noncircular curves can be drawn in any number of ways, but the most common technique is the spline. The spline is a smooth curve that follows a set of control points. Unlike other curve methods, the spline can handle any number of points and produce a curve that is continuous in both the first and second derivatives. The disadvantage of the spline is that the curve does not necessarily pass through the control points, only near them. Other curve methods such as Hermite and Bezier [Bezier] have the opposite properties: They do pass through the control points but do not extend as cleanly to large numbers of points.

B样条线（不要与 Beta 样条线 [Barsky 和 ​​Beatty] 混淆）由两个函数定义：X(t)和Y(t) 。当t的值从 0 变为 1 时，这些函数描述曲线。需要将控制点分成四组，每组为X(t)和 Y(t)定义不同的方程。绘制点 1、2、3、4 的曲线后，将这些点前进一个，然后绘制点 2、3、4、5 的曲线。此过程持续到绘制点n - 3、n - 2、 n - 1、n，此时整个样条线已渲染完毕。

The B-spline (not to be confused with the Beta-spline [Barsky and Beatty]) is defined by two functions: X(t) and Y(t). As the value of t goes from 0 to 1, these functions describe the curve. It is necessary to break the control points into groups of four where each group defines a different equation for X(t) and Y(t). After the curve for points 1,2,3,4 is drawn, the points are advanced by one and the curve for points 2,3,4,5 is drawn. This continues until points n - 3, n - 2, n - 1, n are drawn at which time the entire spline has been rendered.

形式上，X(t) = T M G x和 Y(t) = T M G y ， 其中T、M、G x和 G y是矩阵。矩阵T是二次展开的简单简写：

Formally, X(t) = T M Gx and Y(t) = T M Gy where T, M, Gx, and Gy are matrices. The matrix T is a simple shorthand for quadratic expansion:

T =  [ t3t2t1  ]

 

 

矩阵G x和G y 也是定义四个感兴趣的控制点的简写：
格氏=
西​
∠i +1
十+2
十+3
       
戈瑞​=
易​
伊​
伊​
伊+3
这些矩阵是唯一会随着样条曲线在其点中前进而改变的矩阵。最后，矩阵 M 被称为混合矩阵，因为它将当前控制点组合成二次方程：

米=1/6十 -1 3-3 1
 3-6 3 0
-3 0 3 0
 1 4 1 0

将这些矩阵放在一起可产生以下函数：

Putting these matrices together produces the following functions:

X(t)= Xi ( -t3 +3t2-3t + 1)+Xi +1 (3t3-6t2 + 4 ) +Xi +2 (-3t3 + 3t2 + 3t + 1 ) +Xi + 3t3
6

Y(t)= Y i (-t 3 +3t 2 -3t+1) + Y i+1 (3t 3 -6t 2 +4) + Y i+2 (-3t 3 +3t 2 +3t+1) + Y i+3 t 3
6

帧缓冲区编程可能是一个无底洞，因为用户永远不会满足，总是想要更多。但是，必须平衡速度和功能之间的标准权衡，而具有太多可爱显示选项的 CAD 系统可能会开始变得太慢而让人感到不舒服。用户会逐渐习惯任何事情，因此显示器应该尽力而为，并保持原样。

Frame buffer programming can be a bottomless pit of effort because the user is never satisfied and always wants more. However, there is a standard tradeoff of speed and functionality that must be balanced, and the CAD system with too many cute display options may begin to be too slow for comfort. Users become accustomed to anything in time, so the display should do its best and leave it there.

 

 

9.2.8 变换

9.2.8 Transformation

变换用于在渲染坐标之前修改坐标，以便图形改变位置、大小或方向。尽管某些显示器具有内置变换功能，但程序员可能必须明确执行这些操作。位置变换只需加法即可轻松实现，而比例变换只需乘法即可实现。唯一困难的变换是旋转。

Transformations are used to modify coordinates prior to rendering them, so that the figures change position, size, or orientation. Although some displays have built-in transformation facilities, programmers may have to do these operations explicitly. Position transformations are trivially implemented with addition, and scale transformations simply require multiplication. The only difficult transformation is rotation.

要绕原点 旋转点 ( x , y ) ，请计算该点：

To rotate a point (x, y) by degrees about the origin, compute the point:

x' = x余弦

y' = y正弦

 

 

由于正弦和余弦始终返回 -1 和 +1 之间的值，因此可以使用定点整数和表查找来完成旋转。例如，正弦和余弦值可以存储在 16 位整数中，小数点右边有 14 位。左边的两位允许值 +1 和 -1（一个有效位和一个符号位）。在这个方案中，值 1.0 表示为 4000 16，值 0.5 表示为 2000 16，值 -1.0 表示为 C000 16。这些值的乘法只需移位 14 位即可完成。此外，正弦和余弦值可以存储在一个一象限表中，该表很小（1 度精度只有 90 个条目）并且易于索引。这是避免浮点运算的常用技巧。

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 9 章：图形

9.3 硬拷贝图形

9.3 Hardcopy Graphics

每个 CAD 系统都需要提供电路的硬拷贝版本。无论是纸质还是胶片，永久图像对于离线考虑和文档记录都很有用。虽然硬拷贝图形技术与显示编程中的技术基本相同，但还有其他考虑因素。首先，有必要了解这些绘图设备的性质。

Every CAD system needs to provide hardcopy versions of circuits. Whether on paper or film, the permanent image is useful for offline consideration and for documentation. Although hardcopy graphics techniques are essentially the same as those found in display programming, there are other considerations. As a first step, it is necessary to understand the nature of these plotting devices.

与显示器一样，​​绘图仪也分为两大类：光栅式和书法式。光栅式设备（例如激光打印机和喷墨打印机）覆盖页面上的每个像素，可以生成任意复杂的图像。书法式设备（例如笔式绘图仪和一些胶片记录仪）只有一个书写头，必须移动书写头才能进行绘图。

Like displays, plotters fall into two broad categories: raster and calligraphic. Raster devices such as laser and ink-jet printers cover every pixel on the page and can produce arbitrarily complex images. Calligraphic devices such as pen plotters and some film recorders have a single writing head that must be moved to draw.

与显示器不同，绘图仪的强度分辨率通常较低。许多硬拷贝设备都是严格的双层，只能绘制黑点或将点留白。彩色打印机有额外的墨水源，但仍然只能以一种强度放置墨水。笔式绘图仪有时可以通过多次绘制一个区域来伪造强度，但纸张的承受能力有限，因此这些绘图仪仍然只有几个强度级别。本质上，必须使用图案区域来伪造层外观的变化。

Unlike displays, the intensity resolution of plotters is generally low. Many hardcopy devices are strictly bilevel, able only to plot a black dot or to leave the spot white. Color printers have additional sources of ink but can still place the inks with only one intensity. Pen plotters can sometimes fake intensity by drawing over an area multiple times, but there is a limit to what the paper can endure, so these plotters still have only a few intensity levels. Essentially, the variations of layer appearance must be faked with patterned areas.

9.3.1 图案填充

9.3.1 Patterned Fill

为了呈现不同灰度的外观，可以打印黑白点图案。当需要精确的强度级别时，会使用一种称为抖动的过程 ；它可以计算这些点的正确数量和位置 [Jarvis、Judice 和 Ninke]。然而，在绘制 VLSI 电路时，拥有一组与不同层相关联的预先计算的图案就足够了。

To give the appearance of varying shades of gray, a pattern of black and white dots can be printed. When precise intensity levels are needed, a process called dithering is used; it computes the proper number and placement of these dots [Jarvis, Judice, and Ninke]. In the plotting of VLSI circuits, however, it is sufficient to have a set of precomputed patterns that are associated with the different layers.

选择图案时应确保多层重叠部分可区分。这种重叠部分通常是位的“或”运算，以产生所有图案中黑点的并集。因此，各个图案应保持稀疏，以免重叠部分变得太密集。由于 IC 工艺有十几层，而且其中多达一半可能在某一点重叠，因此最好在图案中使用大量空白。

Selection of patterns should be done in such a way that the overlap of multiple layers is distinguishable. This overlap is generally an ORing of the bits to produce the union of black dots in all patterns. Therefore the individual patterns should be kept sparse so that overlaps do not become too dense. Since there are IC processes with over a dozen layers, and since as many as half of them may overlap at a point, it is best to be generous in the use of white space in a pattern.

图案的另一个特征是其格式塔或子图像，它由图案中可识别的符号组成，有助于识别。在图 9.10 中，顶部的两个图案由子元素组成，当图案平铺在某个区域上时，这些子元素仍然不同。用户可以在图上看到这些元素并识别图层。底部的图案没有格式塔，因为它们被设计成平滑地邻接，从而产生具有特定密度的均匀场。
图 9.10 点画图案。

图案尺寸不需要很大；它们通常在一边 8 到 32 位之间。使用 2 的幂作为尺寸的优点是，对于页面上的任何坐标，可以通过屏蔽 x或y值的低位并索引图案数组来找到要使用的图案元素。这有一个副作用，即图案始终独立于多边形边界定位，以便相邻多边形中的图案可以正确合并。

Pattern sizes do not need to be very large; they typically range from 8 to 32 bits on a side. The advantage to using a power of two for the size is that, for any coordinate on the page, the pattern element to use can be found by masking the low bits of the x or y value and indexing the pattern array. This has the side effect that the pattern is always positioned independent of the polygon boundary, so that patterns in abutting polygons will merge correctly.

 

 

9.3.2 显示一致性

9.3.2 Display Consistency

硬拷贝图形中的另一个问题是绘制图表时显示内容的正确复制。硬拷贝和显示内容之间的不一致是由于图形硬件的差异造成的问题。主要有三个原因：像素大小、文本绘制和颜色。任何两个设备上的像素高度与像素宽度的比例可能不一样，因此应进行补偿以保持比例正确。此外，放置在屏幕上以使其合适显示的文本在硬拷贝上的大小可能不同，这会降低可读性。最后，鉴于显示颜色的方法不同，颜色准确性非常困难。必须解决这些问题才能产生正确的显示。

Another issue in hardcopy graphics is the correct duplication of the display when making a plot. Inconsistency between hardcopy and display is a problem that is caused by differences in graphics hardware. The three main culprits are pixel size, text drawing, and color. The ratio of pixel height to pixel width may not be the same on any two devices and compensation should be made to keep the scale right. Also, text that is placed on the screen so that it fits properly may have a different size on the hardcopy, which lessens readability. Finally, color accuracy is very difficult in light of the different methods used to show color. These problems must be solved to produce correct displays.

CAD 程序员应该知道，有些显示器没有方形像素。通常可以调整屏幕的纵横比，以挤压或拉伸任一轴并使图像呈方形。如果无法进行这种调整，软件必须缩放坐标，以使布局看起来正确。硬拷贝设备更难调整，并且可能具有矩形像素作为永久特征。如果是这种情况，那么这些设备也必须在软件中缩放。重要的是使图像与制造的工件保持一致，制造的工件始终具有均匀的x到y比率。

The CAD programmer should be aware that some displays do not have square pixels. The aspect ratio of the screen can often be adjusted to squeeze or to stretch either axis and make the image square. If this adjustment is not possible, the software must scale the coordinates so that the layout looks right. Hardcopy devices are more difficult to adjust and may have rectangular pixels as a permanent feature. If this is the case, then these devices must also be scaled in software. The important thing is to keep the image in step with the manufactured artifact, which always has uniform x-to-y ratios.

不太重要但仍然令设计师感到困扰的是显示屏上的文本和图表上的文本在外观上的差异。通常，硬拷贝注定要出版、展示或以其他方式保存，并且必须看起来最好。设计师可能会花很多时间调整显示屏上的文本以获得最大的可读性，结果却发现硬拷贝版本看起来非常不同。

Less significant but still disturbing to the designer is the difference in appearance between text on a display and text on a plot. Typically, the hardcopy is destined to be published, presented, or otherwise preserved and must look its best. The designer may spend much time adjusting the text on the display for maximum readability only to discover that the hardcopy version looks very different.

文本的问题在于，大多数显示器的字体大小有限，但图形比例却连续。这意味着当电路放大或缩小时，文本将保持相同的大小。只有PostScript系统允许真正连续的光栅文本比例，并且它们通常仅在硬拷贝设备上找到 [Adobe]。在书法显示器上，文本以矢量表示，可以连续缩放，但这些显示器如今很少使用。另一种方法是用书法描述所有文本，然后在绘制或显示之前将其转换为像素。虽然这样可以正确缩放，但看起来会很糟糕，因为在转换为光栅时必须手动清理矢量字符。

The problem with text is that most displays have a limited number of font sizes but a continuum of graphics scales. This means that as the circuit zooms in or out, the text will stay the same size. Only PostScript systems allow a true continuum of raster text scales, and they are typically found only on hardcopy devices [Adobe]. On calligraphic displays, text is represented with vectors and can scale continuously, but these displays are rarely used today. An alternative is to describe all text calligraphically and convert it to pixels before plotting or displaying. Although this will scale properly, it will look bad because vector characters must be hand cleaned when converted to raster.

最简单的解决方案是选择与每台设备尺寸对应的文本比例范围。这样可以让文本的误差保持在很小的范围内，并且每台设备看起来都很好。还要记住，有些字体的宽度是可变的，因此必须调整它们的 x轴才能获得正确的比例。一致的硬拷贝可以在关键时刻为设计师节省大量时间：设计完成并开始细节时。

The simplest solution is to choose a range of text scales on each device that correspond in size. This will keep the text right to a small margin of error, and it will look good on each device. Remember also that some fonts are variable width and so their x axis must be adjusted to get the correct scale. A consistent hardcopy can save designers much time at that critical point: when the design is done and the details begin.

 

 

9.3.3 颜色反转

9.3.3 Color Inversion

彩色显示器和彩色图之间的一个显著区别是颜色组合的性质。显示管发光，因此，当多种颜色组合时，它们会相加。三色显示原色——红色、绿色和蓝色——被称为加 色色彩空间，因为它们不存在时为黑色，而它们相加时为白色。

A significant difference between color displays and color plots is the nature of color combinations. A display tube emits light and therefore, when multiple colors combine, they are added. The three-color display primaries--red, green, and blue--are called the additive color space because their absence is black and their sum is white.

在纸上，颜色是反转的，因为墨水不发光而是吸收光。这意味着更多的墨水会变暗而不是变亮，因此两种颜色互相重叠会减色。因此，纸上绘图使用减色空间，其中原色为青色、洋红色和黄色，没有黄色则为白色，有黄色则为黑色。图 9.11 中的色轮显示了两组原色之间的关系：显示器上的绿色和蓝色会产生青色；纸上的黄色和洋红色会产生红色。请注意，这两个空间在公共空间中是相反的，因此，要转换颜色，请使用以下简单公式：

On paper, color is reversed because ink does not emit but rather absorbs light. This means that more ink darkens rather than brightens, so two colors inked over each other will subtract. Paper plots therefore use subtractive color space, in which the primaries are cyan, magenta, and yellow, the absence of which is white and the presence of which is black. The color wheel of Fig. 9.11 shows how both sets of primaries relate: Green and blue on a display will yield cyan; yellow and magenta on paper will yield red. Notice that these two spaces are inverses in a common space so, to convert colors, these simple formulas are used:

红色 = 1 - 青色

绿色 = 1 - 洋红色

蓝色 = 1 - 黄色

 

 

假设所有值的范围都是从零到一。

图 9.11 颜色空间：(a) 三维体积 (b) 轮子。

虽然这些公式似乎是解决硬拷贝和显示颜色一致性问题的简单方法，但还有更多需要解决的问题。显示器通常可以使用每种原色的全范围强度，而硬拷贝打印则全有或全无。当一个墨点打到纸上时，它会以其颜色的全部强度填充该像素。因此，要实现一定范围的强度，必须绘制具有适当比例的亮色和暗色的图案。在这种情况下，预先计算的图案不如适当的抖动技术有效。

Although these formula appear to be simple solutions to the problem of hardcopy and display color consistency, much more is necessary. Displays can typically use a full range of intensities in each primary color, whereas hardcopy printing is all or nothing. When a dot of ink hits the paper, it fills that pixel with the full intensity of its color. Thus to achieve a range of intensity, it is necessary to paint patterns that have the proper proportion of on and off color. Precomputed patterns do not work as well as proper dithering techniques in this case.

这些颜色转换方程式中的另一个障碍是需要使用纯黑色墨水，而有些绘图仪上就有这种墨水。令人遗憾的是，当青色、品红色和黄色墨水重叠时，结果不是黑色而是深棕色。由于在这种情况下需要黑色，许多纸质绘图仪都有第四种墨水，这种墨水实际上是黑色的。因此，颜色转换必须有特殊的代码来检测同时使用这三种原色并将其替换为黑色墨水。只有这种四色打印过程才能再现可接受的图像范围。

Another hitch in these color-conversion equations is the need to use a pure black ink that is available on some plotters. The sad truth is that when cyan, magenta, and yellow ink overlap, the result is not a black but a dark brown. Since black is desired in this situation, many paper plotters have a fourth ink that is really black. Thus the color conversion must have special code to detect the simultaneous use of all three primaries and replace them with black ink. It is only this four-color-printing process that can reproduce an acceptable range of images.

 

 

9.3.4 笔的运动

9.3.4 Pen Motion

当驱动书法硬拷贝设备时，书写头的运动可能令人担忧。明显的例子是笔式绘图仪，它需要时间将笔从一个点移动到另一个点。程序员必须确保图形对象内部和图形对象之间的笔运动最小。

When a calligraphic hardcopy device is being driven, the motion of the writing head may be of concern. The obvious example is the pen plotter that takes time to move the pen from one point to another. The programmer must ensure minimal pen motion both within and between the graphic objects.

减少对象内的笔移动只需按顺序指定线条即可。因此，边长为 100 且中心位于 (50,50) 的正方形应指定为 (0,0) 到 (0,100) 的线条；(0,100) 到 (100,100) 的线条；(100,100) 到 (100,0) 的线条；以及 (100,0) 到 (0,0) 的线条。虽然这看起来很明显，但在指定线条时很容易犯一个简单的错误，即颠倒“从”和“到”坐标，这将使绘制正方形所需的时间加倍。

Reducing pen motion within an object simply requires specifying lines in sequence. Thus a square that is 100 on a side and centered at (50,50) should be specified as the lines (0,0) to (0,100); (0,100) to (100,100); (100,100) to (100,0); and (100,0) to (0,0). Although this may seem obvious, it is easy to make the simple mistake of reversing the "from" and "to" coordinates when specifying the lines, which will double the time needed to draw the square.

减少对象之间的笔运动是一个更困难的问题，无法完美解决。完成一个对象后，最好绘制另一个相近的对象。尽管这种随机遍历图像的方式会在绘图的早期阶段减少笔运动，但当只有少数分散的对象未绘制时，它可能会导致接近尾声时出现长跳跃。绘图的连贯性也很重要，因为设计师可能正在观察绘图，如果由于不明显的原因跳过某些对象，他们会感到困惑。因此，作为接近度加权因子的线性顺序会产生或多或少从上到下绘制的图像。

Reducing pen motion between objects is a much more difficult problem that cannot be solved perfectly. After finishing one object, it is best to draw another that is close. Although this random walk through the image will reduce pen motion in the early stages of plotting, it may cause long jumps near the end when there are only a few scattered objects that remain unplotted. Coherence of drawing is also important because the designer may be watching the plot and will be confused if some objects are skipped for nonobvious reasons. Thus a linear order, imposed as a weighting factor on proximity, produces an image that is drawn more or less from top to bottom.

使用书法技巧填充区域时，还应考虑笔的运动。最佳运动是来回扫描该区域，留下平行线作为填充图案。为了变化，线条可以有不同的间距、以不同的角度运行，甚至可以形成交叉阴影区域。

Pen motion should also be considered when calligraphic techniques are used to fill an area. The optimal motion is a back-and-forth raster scan of the area that leaves parallel lines for a fill pattern. For variation, the lines can be spaced differently, run at different angles, or even make a cross-hatched area.

绘图时间的另一个考虑因素是更换笔。这通常比任何绘图操作花费的时间都多，有时需要移动以便书写头能够到达笔存放的位置。因此，最好先绘制一种颜色的全部内容，然后再移动到下一支笔。

Another consideration in plotting time is pen changing. This usually takes more time than any drawing operation and occasionally requires motion so that the writing head can get to where the pens are stored. Thus it is best to plot all of one color before moving to the next pen.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 9 章：图形

9.4 输入设备

9.4 Input Devices

本章介绍的图形的最后一个方面是向系统输入信息。大多数图形输入设备不需要编程，因此它们的接口非常简单。诸如平板电脑、操纵杆和鼠标之类的二维设备提供二维值；诸如旋钮和指轮之类的一维设备提供单一值。唯一可能的软件操作是缩放和相对运动跟踪。因此，本节将集中介绍各种图形输入设备的物理工作原理，以提供使用感受。

The final aspect of graphics covered in this chapter is the input of information to the system. Most graphic-input devices require no programming, so their interfaces are quite simple. Two-dimensional devices such as tablets, joysticks, and mice provide two-dimensional values; One-dimensional devices such as knobs and thumbwheels provide single values. The only possible software operations are scaling and relative-motion tracking. This section will therefore concentrate on the physical workings of various graphic-input devices to provide a feel for their use.

9.4.1 评估者

9.4.1 Valuators

一维输入设备，例如旋钮和指轮，称为 赋值器。通常，旋钮会聚集在大型集合中，每个旋钮都有与之相关的特定功能。 指轮是直径较大的旋钮，侧放并沉入面板中，这样露出的边缘就可以像滑动表面一样滚动。通常有两个指轮以直角放置，以便 可以完成 x轴和y轴的指定。

One-dimensional input devices, such as knobs and thumbwheels, are called valuators. Typically, knobs are aggregated in large sets, each one having a specific function associated with it. Thumbwheels are large diameter knobs turned on their side and sunk into a panel so that the exposed edge can be rolled like a sliding surface. Typically there are two thumbwheels placed at right angles so that x- and y-axis specification can be done.

估值器可以有固定的旋转范围，也可以无限滚动。如果在旋转范围的末端有停止点，那么程序员将从设备获得绝对坐标值。但是，如果估值器不停地转动，则每次转动都会提供一个相对运动值，必须累积该值才能确定总值。相对运动设备更灵活，因为它们可以提供更大范围的值，可以缩放以进行微调，甚至可以非线性处理。非线性输入处理的一种常见用途是定时加速，其中快速变化的缩放比慢动作更大。这使得可以用快速的手部动作覆盖很远的距离。

Valuators can have fixed ranges of rotation or they can roll infinitely. If there are stops at the ends of the rotation range then the programmer will be given absolute coordinate values from the device. If the valuator turns without stops, however, each turn will provide a relative-motion value that must be accumulated to determine the overall value. Relative-motion devices are more flexible because they can give a greater range of values, can be scaled for fine tuning, and can even be treated nonlinearly. A popular use of nonlinear input handling is timed acceleration, in which rapid changes scale more than slow motion does. This enables a great distance to be covered with a quick hand motion.

 

 

9.4.2 平板电脑

9.4.2 Tablets

早期的图形输入设备使用特殊的笔和可以跟踪笔位置的特殊表面。第一批手写板被称为火花笔，因为笔通过产生火花发出咔嗒声。手写板表面的边缘有成排的麦克风，它根据笔和麦克风之间的声速延迟对笔的位置进行三角测量。由于Rand 手写板的出现，这些设备如今很少使用 。在 Rand 手写板中，表面下有一层金属线网，笔充当通过金属线发送的信号的天线。与火花笔相比，Rand 手写板更便宜，更安静。

Early graphic-input devices used a special pen and a special surface that would track the pen position. The first tablets were called spark pens because the pen emitted clicking sounds by generating sparks. The tablet surface had rows of microphones along its edges and it triangulated the pen position from the speed of sound delay between the pen and the microphones. These devices are rarely used today because of the advent of the Rand tablet. In the Rand tablet, a mesh of wire runs under the surface and the pen acts as an antenna for signals that are sent through the wires. Rand tablets are less expensive and quieter than spark pens.

平板电脑的指点设备上通常有一个或多个按钮。使用实际的笔时，笔尖上有一个开关，可以通过按下平板电脑表面来激活。平板电脑上也可能有一个带有一组按钮（多达 16 个）的圆盘。这些设备可以编程为在按钮按下、按下、释放和抬起时执行单独的操作。当然，坐标值在平板电脑表面范围内是绝对的。

Tablets typically have one or more buttons on the pointing device. When an actual pen is used there is a switch in the tip that can be activated by pressing down on the tablet surface. There may also be a puck that has a set of buttons on it (as many as 16). These devices can be programmed to do separate actions on the downstroke of a button, while it is down, when it is released, and while it is up. The coordinate values are, of course, absolute within the range of the tablet surface.

通过在当前位置绘制光标 ，可以在屏幕上显示手写板位置 。光标是一个符号，例如 X、箭头或十字线，由从屏幕一边到另一边绘制的两条垂直线组成。尽管某些显示器在硬件中处理光标跟踪，但是许多显示器需要在每次光标前进时保存、设置和恢复图像。要使光标在屏幕的任何部分都可见，它必须是一种独特的颜色。这种颜色可以简单地是通常存在的值的倒数，以便光标的每个像素都会突出显示。但是，请警惕在互补位置使用相同颜色的色图；可能需要更合适的光标颜色算法。正确的手写板光标跟踪将使用户无需看着手写板，因为手眼协调会让用户的注意力集中在屏幕上。

Tablet positions are displayed on the screen by drawing a cursor at the current position. This cursor is a symbol such as an X, an arrow, or crosshairs, which consist of two perpendicular lines drawn from one edge of the screen to another. Although some displays handle cursor tracking in hardware, many require saving, setting, and restoring of the image at each advance of the cursor. For the cursor to be visible over any part of the screen, it must be a unique color. This color can simply be the inverse of the value that is normally there so that each pixel of the cursor will stand out. Beware, however, of color maps that use the same color in complementary positions; a more suitable cursor-color algorithm may be necessary. Proper cursor tracking of the tablet will free the user from the need to look at the tablet, because the hand-eye coordination keeps the user's attention on the screen.

 

 

9.4.3 屏幕表面

9.4.3 The Screen Surface

解决特殊手写板表面问题的一个明显方法是使用显示屏作为表面。光笔就是通过笔尖上的光电管来实现这一点，光电管与屏幕刷新同步。当光笔触碰屏幕上的某个点时，显示屏会确定其位置，因为光笔会在检测到电子枪扫描时发出信号。在无法保证电子枪击中每个点的书法显示屏上，会在光笔下方绘制一个光标，这样朝特定方向移动时，光标就会朝那个方向移动，从而始终将一些图形保持在光笔下方。

An obvious solution to the problem of having a special tablet surface is to use the display screen as a surface. The light pen does just that by having a photocell in the tip of the pen that is synchronized with the screen refresh. When the pen is touched to a point on the screen, the display determines its position because the pen signals when it detects the sweep of the electron gun. On calligraphic displays that cannot guarantee a gun hit at every point, a cursor is drawn under the pen so that motion in a particular direction signals the cursor to move that way, keeping some graphics under the pen at all times.

但为什么要用笔呢？触摸屏允许用手指在显示屏上进行指向。可以使用声学方法对手指位置进行三角测量。当然，手指是最不敏感的指点设备，因此设计无法通过这种输入取得很大进展。但一般来说，长时间使用屏幕指点会让人感到不舒服，因此 CAD 系统中很少使用光笔或触摸屏。

But why use a pen? The touch screen allows a finger to point on the display. Acoustic methods can be used to triangulate the finger position. Of course the finger is the least sensitive pointing device, so design cannot get very far with such input. In general, however, it is uncomfortable to use screen pointing for long periods, so few light pens or touch screens are found in CAD systems.

 

 

9.4.4 鼠标、追踪球和操纵杆

9.4.4 Mice, Tracker Balls, and Joysticks

鼠标是当今最常见的二维输入设备，因为它价格低廉、体积小巧且易于使用。它没有特殊的表面，只有一个从底部伸出的圆盘，圆盘内有一个大滚珠轴承。圆盘可以在任何表面上滚动，传感器可以检测轴承上的运动。圆盘顶部还有按钮，使其具有与平板电脑相同的功能，但没有笨重的表面。

The mouse is the most common two-dimensional-input device today because it is inexpensive, compact, and easy to use. There is no special surface; only a puck with a large ball bearing in it that sticks out of the bottom. The puck is rolled over any surface and sensors detect motion on the bearing. There are also buttons on top of the puck, giving it the same power as a tablet but without the cumbersome surface.

实际上，鼠标必须在特殊的表面上滚动才能获得适当的牵引力。而且，这些表面会变脏，污垢会积聚在轴承内。为了解决这个问题，光学鼠标没有移动部件，而是在纹理表面上跟踪明暗图案 [Lyon]。鼠标使用的表面可以比平板电脑表面小，因为设备使用相对运动，因此当用户碰到边缘时，他或她只需拿起鼠标并将其放回中心即可获得更大的范围。

In actuality, the mouse must be rolled over a special surface so that it can get proper traction. Also, these surfaces get dirty and the dirt collects inside the bearing. To solve this, the optical mouse has no moving parts but instead tracks patterns of light and dark on a textured surface [Lyon]. The surfaces used with mice can be smaller than tablet surfaces because the devices use relative motion, so when the user hits the edge he or she need merely pick up the mouse and drop it back in the center for more range.

追踪球只是一个倒置的鼠标（实际上，追踪球是先出现的，所以反过来更正确）。将滚珠轴承放在顶部，让用户用手在上面滑动，可以实现相同的控制。虽然不需要表面，但当手移动时，按钮更难握住，而且没有光学版本可以防止灰尘堆积的问题。如今追踪球很少见。

The tracker ball is simply an upside-down mouse (actually, tracker balls came first so the converse is more correct). Placing the ball bearing on top and having the user run a hand over it allows the same control to be achieved. Although no surface is needed, the buttons are harder to hold onto when the hand is moving, and there is no optical version to prevent the problem of dirt accumulation. Tracker balls are rare today.

操纵杆是一种相对输入设备，由一个可在两个轴上移动的手柄组成。当用户拉动或推动手柄时，可实现y控制；当用户向左或向右移动手柄时，可控制x。有些操纵杆会弹回中心位置，而有些则必须手动返回。由于中心是一个固定的概念，因此操纵杆通常用于速度控制而不是位置信息。它也可能在手柄上有按钮。

The joystick is a relative input device consisting of a handle that can be moved in two axes. When the user pulls or pushes the handle, y control is achieved; when he or she moves it left or right, x is controlled. Some joysticks spring back to a center position and others must be returned manually. Since the center is a fixed concept, the joystick is typically used for velocity control rather than position information. It may also have buttons on the handle.

 

 

9.4.5 不常见的输入设备

9.4.5 Unusual Input Devices

计算机输入的一个新概念是反馈输入设备 的概念 [Noll；Atkinson等]。当电机与传感器一起加入时，计算机不仅可以感知位置，还可以改变位置。显然，这只适用于可以用手物理移动的设备，例如操纵杆和机械跟踪平板电脑。可以对电机进行编程，使其以相等的力向后推，以便用户“感觉”到坚固的屏障。例如，这种效果可用于阻止违反设计规则的行为，以及 CAD 系统可以指导或限制设计过程的其他情况。

A novel concept in computer input is the notion of a feedback input device [Noll; Atkinson et al.]. When motors are included along with the sensors, the computer can not only sense position but also change it. Obviously, this works only with devices that can be physically moved by hand, such as joysticks and mechanically tracked tablets. The motors can be programmed to push back with an equal force so that the user "feels" a solid barrier. Such an effect could be used to stop design-rule violations, for example, and in other situations in which the CAD system can guide or restrict the design process.

在计算机设计中，一个一直很流行的概念是使用 语音输入的可能性。如今甚至有 CAD 系统使用耳机麦克风来接收诸如“放置”、“旋转”等命令。虽然这对非用户来说看起来很诱人，但花几个小时“说”一个电路就会让任何人相信一定有更好的方法。语音输入最好只用于不频繁的对话，以及那些无法进行手动输入的情况。例如，在处理集成电路晶片期间，工程师可能将双手放在手套箱中，但仍然需要指挥计算机。这就是语音输入的用武之地。

An ever-popular notion in computer design is the possibility of using speech input. There are even CAD systems today that use a headset microphone to take commands such as "place," "rotate," and so on. Although this looks sexy to the nonuser, a few hours spent "speaking" a circuit will convince anyone that there must be better ways. Speech input is best used for only infrequent conversations, and in those situations in which manual input is not possible. For example, during the processing of integrated-circuit wafers, an engineer may have both hands in a glove box and still need to direct a computer. This is the place for speech input.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 9 章：图形

9.5 总结

9.5 Summary

图形是任何 CAD 工作的必要组成部分。尽管本章中介绍的大多数显示技术都由越来越复杂的设备自动处理，但当缺少所需功能时，能够填补这一空白非常重要。了解图形输入和输出硬件的基础知识对设计人员也很有用，这样当指定完整的 CAD 系统时，他或她就可以做出正确的封装决策。下一章将在此基础上介绍高级图形技术如何使用户界面舒适而高效。

Graphics is a necessary part of any CAD effort. Although most of the display techniques covered in this chapter are automatically handled by ever more sophisticated devices, it is important to be able to fill in when a needed function is missing. It is also useful for the designer to understand the basics of graphic input and output hardware, so that he or she can make proper packaging decisions when a complete CAD system is being specified. The next chapter builds on this one by showing how advanced graphics techniques can make the user interface comfortable and productive.

问题

Questions

  1. 为什么书法显示对于 VLSI 设计来说不是一个好的选择？
  2. Why are calligraphic displays a poor choice for VLSI design?
  3. 块填充操作如何加速线条的绘制？
  4. How can block-fill operations speed the drawing of lines?
  5. 如何使用裁剪来找到两个多边形的并集？
  6. How can clipping be used to find the union of two polygons?
  7. 如何使用块传输功能来写入图案区域？
  8. How can the block-transfer function be used to write patterned areas?
  9. 除了加色法（红、绿、蓝）和减色法（青、洋红、黄）之外，还有哪些其他的颜色表示法？
  10. What other color representations exist beside the additive (red, green, blue) and the subtractive (cyan, magenta, yellow)?
  11. 为什么鼠标是最受欢迎的图形输入设备？
  12. Why is the mouse the most popular graphic-input device?
  13. 如何延伸样条曲线以使其通过其第一个和最后一个控制点？
  14. How can a spline curve be extended so that it passes through its first and last control points?

References
