超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 10 章：人体工程学

Chapter 10: Human Engineering

10.1 简介

10.1 Introduction

系统的成功往往更多地取决于其易用性而非其功能。好的系统不仅能满足用户的需求，还能提供快速周到的交互。本章讨论人体工程学，即对系统进行量身定制，以便所有人类都能最大限度地利用它们。这项工作包括开发良好的用户界面，即系统中与人交流的部分。此外，系统必须具有底层完整性，以便能够正确满足新的和不寻常的需求。

The success of a system is often more dependent on its ease of use than on its power. Good systems not only address the user's needs, but also provide rapid and considerate interaction. This chapter discusses human engineering, the tailoring of systems so they can be used to maximal advantage by all humans. Included in this effort is the development of a good user interface, the part of the system that communicates with the human. In addition, there must be an underlying integrity to the system so that new and unusual needs can be properly met.

本章讨论了构成人体工程学的四个领域：任务和用户建模、信息显示、命令语言和反馈。 任务建模是人体工程学中运行最深的一个方面，因为它要求任务视图与用户的操作和感知一致。这还包括一个用户模型，以准确预测这些操作和感知。信息显示必须经过适当设计以防止混淆，这在图形编辑器中尤其重要。良好的命令语言是必要的，因为它们是来自用户的控制路径，可能会造成最大的瓶颈。最后，信息反馈可以让用户感到满意，并防止新手感到困惑。

This chapter discusses four areas that compose human engineering: task and user modeling, information display, command language, and feedback. Task modeling is the aspect of human engineering that runs deepest in the code since it demands a view of the task that is consistent with the user's actions and perception. This also includes a user model to predict accurately those actions and perceptions. The information display must be designed properly to prevent confusion, and is especially significant in graphics editors. Good command languages are necessary since they are the control path from the user and can create the largest bottlenecks. Finally, informative feedback keeps users happy and prevents confusion on the part of newcomers.

人体工程学必须从一开始就融入系统，不能像某种宏包一样被附加在上面。虽然本章是一系列 CAD 系统讨论中的最后一章，但其主题应该首先考虑。然而，这个主题并不令人意外，因为前面的许多章节都呼应了这种呼声，即要求有更好的、可以很好地使用的系统。

Human engineering must be built into systems from the start and cannot be tacked on top like some kind of macro package. Although this chapter is the last in a string of CAD system discussions, its subject matter should be considered first. The theme, however, will come as no surprise because many of the preceding chapters have echoed this cry for better thought-out systems that can be used well.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 10 章：人体工程学

10.2 任务和用户建模

10.2 Task and User Modeling

正确的人体工程学的先决条件是深刻理解用户的特定目标和操作方法。同样有用的是对人机交互方式的一般理解。当程序员不了解这些问题时，他们会做出直觉上的假设，希望一切都能正常工作。结果往往是用户界面和代码内部都不一致。试图纠正用户界面充满了困难，因为代码变得复杂、难以维护，而且充满了错误。

The prerequisite for proper human engineering is a deep understanding of the user's particular goals and operating methodologies. Also useful is a general understanding of the way humans interact with machines. When programmers are unaware of these issues, they make assumptions that are intuitive to them in the hope that all will work right. The result is often inconsistent both at the user-interface level and internally in the code. Attempts to rectify the user interface are fraught with difficulties because the code becomes complicated, hard to maintain, and full of bugs.

当任务模型正确时，人体工程学的其他方面就会顺利进行。命令语言语法变得显而易见，因为它可以直接从任务映射到程序内部。信息显示和反馈的性质也是如此。此外，真正一致的任务模型符合用户对什么是困难、什么是简单的概念，从而减少了使用耗时操作的挫败感。

When the task has been modeled correctly, the other aspects of human engineering proceed easily. Command language syntax becomes obvious because it maps directly from the task to the program internals. The same is true of the information display and the nature of the feedback. Also, a truly consistent task model agrees with the users' notions of what is difficult and what is simple, reducing the frustration of using time-consuming operations.

因此，构建 VLSI 设计系统的第一步是加深对电子和设计的理解，以便可以建立合理的模型。 第 1 章讨论了电路设计过程， 第 3 章展示了 VLSI CAD 的一些表示：拓扑、几何和层次数据结构。每个综合和分析工具都需要这些数据结构的组合才能发挥最佳作用。

Thus the first step in building a VLSI design system is developing an understanding of electronics and design so that a sensible model can be made. Chapter 1 discussed the circuit-design process and Chapter 3 showed some representations for VLSI CAD: topological, geometrical, and hierarchical data structures. Every synthesis and analysis tool needs a combination of these data structures to work best.

10.2.1 人类的时间

10.2.1 Timings for Humans

构建任何用户界面的下一步是了解人机交互的方式。这种交互最近才开始被分析，现在已经有一些定量结果可用 [Card、Moran 和 Newell]。本质上，人类在与计算机交互时执行三种不同的操作：感知、认知和运动。感知是观察屏幕以获取某些信息的操作。实验表明，单个感知动作需要 50 到 200 毫秒，平均为 100 毫秒或 0.1 秒。这意味着，例如，任何显示动作（例如每秒发生至少 10 次的运动）在观察者看来都是连续的。认知操作是人类在决定如何对感知做出反应时所采取的步骤。在平均 70 毫秒的认知步骤之后，人类可能会进行另一次感知，或者更可能进行运动。 运动动作包括敲击按键或移动指点设备。基本动作仅需 70 毫秒，但前提是用户的手已放在设备上。如果用户的手放错了位置，必须切换设备，则延迟时间为 400 毫秒。因此，虽然鼠标或操纵杆使用起来可能更快，但设置时间太长，以至于对于键盘活动前后的短操作，键盘仍然是首选设备。

The next step in building any user interface is developing an understanding of the way humans interact with machines. This interaction has only recently been analyzed and some quantitative results are now available [Card, Moran, and Newell]. Essentially, the human performs three different operations when interacting with a computer: perception, cognition, and motion. A perception is the operation of observing the screen to obtain some information. Experiments have shown that a single perception action takes from 50 to 200 milliseconds, averaging 100 milliseconds or 0.1 seconds. This means, for example, that any display action such as motion that occurs at least 10 times per second will appear continuous to an observer. The cognition operation is the step that humans make when deciding how to react to a perception. After a cognition step, which averages 70 milliseconds, the human may do another perception or, more likely, a motion. Motion actions include striking a key or moving the pointing device. Basic motion actions take only 70 milliseconds, but this presumes that the user's hand is already on the device. If the user's hands are incorrectly placed and must switch devices, the delay is 400 milliseconds. Thus, while the mouse or joystick may be faster to use, the setup time is so high that for short operations preceded and followed by keyboard activity, the keyboard is still the preferred device.

Card、Moran 和 Newell 还描述了与设计系统的使用更直接相关的更大规模的操作。打字结合了感知、认知和动作，平均每键需要 0.2 秒。将光标移动到显示屏上的某个位置需要 1.1 秒。为新命令或命令的新部分做好心理准备需要 1.35 秒。这些数字当然是简化的，但它们允许评估设计功能的相对效率。

Card, Moran, and Newell also describe larger operations that relate more directly to the use of a design system. Typing, which combines perception, cognition, and motion, averages 0.2 seconds per key. Moving the cursor to a spot on the display takes 1.1 seconds. Mental preparation for a new command or new part of a command takes 1.35 seconds. These figures are certainly simplifications, but they allow design functions to be evaluated for their relative efficiencies.

这些时间可用于评估不同人机交互方法的相对优缺点。例如，“替换”命令用新对象替换当前选定的对象。此命令可以通过键入字符串以传统方式发出，rep new-object也可以通过菜单选择发出。菜单方法首先选择“替换”条目，然后从对象菜单中选择新对象（实际上可能需要两次菜单点击才能选择一类对象，然后选择该类中的对象）。键入方法需要四个步骤：键入命令关键字（rep），终止关键字（空格），键入新对象名称（平均 10 个字符）并终止命令（回车）。这些操作中的每一个都需要一个心理操作来启动它，然后进行多次击键操作（见图 10.1）。菜单选择方法需要按三次按钮来选择命令、新对象类和新对象。每次选择都涉及心理操作、光标移动和按钮按下。图中显示，这比键盘方法稍微快一些，但许多因素可能会改变这一点，例如需要额外的菜单点击、机器响应时间延迟或需要在键盘和鼠标之间移动手。

These timings can be used to evaluate the relative merits of different human-interaction methods. For example, the "replace" command substitutes a new object in place of the currently selected object. This command can be issued in the traditional way by typing the string rep new-object or it can be issued with menu picks. The menu method starts by selecting the "replace" entry and then selecting the new object from an object menu (which may actually have to be two menu hits to select a class of objects and then an object in that class). The typing method requires four steps: type the command keyword (rep), terminate the keyword (a space), type the new object name (average of 10 characters), and terminate the command (a carriage-return). Each of these operations requires a mental operation to initiate it followed by a number of keystroke operations (see Fig. 10.1). The menu-pick method requires three button pushes to select the command, the new object class, and the new object. Each pick involves a mental operation, a cursor movement, and a button push. The figure shows that this is slightly faster than the keyboard method, but many factors could alter this, such as the need for an additional menu hit, delays of machine response time, or the need to move hands between the keyboard and the mouse.

键入：rep new-object
行动手术     时间
选择命令精神的1.35
输入“rep”3（键）3 × 0.2
终止关键字精神的1.35
类型空间钥匙0.2
选择替换对象  精神的1.35
类型对象名称10（键）10 × 0.2
终止命令精神的1.35
键入回车符钥匙0.2
全部的8.6 秒   
 
 
指向：“替换”、“新对象类”和“新对象”
行动手术时间
选择命令精神的1.35
指向“替换”光标1.1
按钮按钮0.2
选择新的对象类精神的1.35
指向“类”光标1.1
按钮按钮0.2
选择新对象精神的1.35
指向“对象”光标1.1
按钮按钮0.2
全部的7.95 秒
图 10.1键盘和鼠标命令的比较时间。

 

 

10.2.2 术语

10.2.2 Terminology

正确任务建模的另一个方面是正确使用术语。程序员应避免编造新词来描述情况，而应找出正确的术语。这将使代码更具可读性，并且还可以防止内部错误消息完全晦涩难懂。然后，用户将能够在那些原本隐藏的系统部分突然浮出水面的异常情况下提供帮助。

Another aspect of proper task modeling is the correct use of terminology. Programmers should avoid making up new words to describe a situation and should instead find out what the right jargon is. This will make the code more readable and also will keep internal error messages from being totally obtuse. The user will then be able to help in those unusual circumstances in which otherwise hidden parts of the system suddenly surface.

除了使用正确的术语外，程序员还必须考虑让用户清楚地记住术语的最佳方法。术语混淆的问题称为干扰，它以两种形式出现：声学和语义 [Card、Moran 和 Newell]。 声学干扰是由两个单词发音相似引起的。当新单词被呈现以供立即使用时，这种问题在短期记忆中更常发生。例如，当首次介绍单元名称为“hit”、“fit”和“kit”的库的功能时，用户可能觉得它们有意义，但它们之间的声学​​干扰会损害用户在短时间内回忆名称的能力。

In addition to using correct terminology, the programmer must consider the best way to keep the terms clear in the user's mind. The problem of terminology confusion is called interference and it occurs in two forms: acoustic and semantic [Card, Moran, and Newell]. Acoustic interference is caused by having two words sound alike. This problem occurs more often in short-term memory, when new words are presented for immediate use. For example, a library with the cell names "hit," "fit," and "kit" may make sense to the user when their functions are first introduced, but the acoustic interference between them will damage the user's ability to recall the names a short while later.

语义干扰是由于两个单词或概念具有相同的含义而引起的。这个问题出现在长期记忆中，即学习单词含义的地方。例如，教授第二种计算机语言会导致语义干扰，从而损害使用第一种计算机语言的能力。

Semantic interference is caused by having two words or concepts share their meaning. This problem appears in long-term memory, where word meanings are learned. For example, teaching a second computer language causes semantic interference that damages the ability to use the first computer language.

有一个非常简单的任务模型质量测试方法。查看复杂操作的命令序列，确定它们是舒适且直观的，还是仅仅是无意义命令的配方。避免告诉用户“发出这些命令而不必担心它们的含义”，因为用户确实担心他们所输入内容的含义。配方很糟糕，会鼓励用户和维护人员的无知。当提供正确的任务模型时，对复杂和令人困惑的序列的需求就会大大减少。

There is a very simple test of the quality of a task model. Look at the sequence of commands for a complex operation and decide whether they are comfortable and intuitive or are merely a recipe of mindless commands. Avoid having to tell the user to "issue these commands without worrying about what they mean" because users do worry about the meaning of what they are typing. Recipes are bad and encourage ignorance on the part of users and maintainers alike. When a correct task model is provided, the need for complex and confusing sequences is greatly reduced.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 10 章：人体工程学

10.3 信息显示

10.3 Information Display

用户注意到 VLSI 设计系统的第一件事就是它的显示屏。如果用户要继续看显示屏，观看位置必须舒适。Card、Moran 和 Newell 报告称，最舒适的视觉位置是与头部平面成 15 度角，而头部与地平线成 20 度角时最舒适。因此，显示屏应与眼睛成 35 度角。

The first thing that a user notices about a VLSI design system is its display. If that user is going to continue to look at the display, the viewing position must be comfortable. Card, Moran, and Newell report that the most comfortable vision is 15 degrees down from the plane of the head, and that the head is most comfortable when tilted 20 degrees down from the horizon. Therefore the display should be 35 degrees down from the eyes.

人们普遍认为彩色显示器是一种优势。但是，有些图形即使上色也没有任何优势。例如，在显示器的不同区域使用不同的颜色并不能提高用户的响应时间。在这种情况下，颜色的唯一积极价值是它会让用户更开心，因为他们会发现他们的工作区域更加明亮 [Varner]。还要注意不能像黑白显示器那样聚焦的彩色显示器：确保系统绘制非彩色对象时彩色屏幕看起来清晰明快。

The availability of color displays is generally considered to be an advantage. However, there are certain graphics that gain no advantage by being colored. For example, using different colors in different areas of the display does not improve user response time. The only positive value of color in such situations is that it makes users happier because they find their work area to be more cheerful [Varner]. Beware, also, of color displays that cannot focus as well as black and white displays: Make sure the color screen looks clear and crisp when the system is drawing noncolored objects.

对于 VLSI 设计师来说，显示内容的组织也非常重要。显示屏上通常有四个区域：带有电路的编辑窗口、命令选项菜单、永久状态信息和临时消息。为了避免混淆并提供易用性，显示屏的这些部分应该整洁、可区分且放置合理（见图 10.2）。精心设计的平面图可以有效地向用户呈现这些信息。
图 10.2 典型的信息显示布局。

当系统只使用一个屏幕时，该表面必须包含上述所有显示。具有多个屏幕的系统可以合理划分显示区域，为每个区域提供更多空间。在双屏系统中，通常有一个带有编辑窗口和菜单的图形显示器和一个可以处理消息的视频终端（见图 10.3）。
图 10.3 典型的双屏信息显示布局：（a）文本屏幕（b）图形屏幕。

在某些系统中，用户可以选择重新排列屏幕上窗口的大小和位置。然而，如果没有这样的功能，程序员必须提前确定布局图。在设计布局时，请考虑过度眼球运动的问题；例如，将命令菜单放在指示命令响应的消息区域附近。还可以通过使菜单和编辑窗口靠近来减少指点设备上的手部运动。当使用双屏系统时，应提前知道监视器的相对位置，以便进行合理的布局。

In some systems, the user is given the option of rearranging the size and location of windows on the screen. In the absence of such a facility, however, the floor-plan must be determined in advance by the programmer. Consider the problem of excessive eye movement when designing the layout; for example, place menus of commands near the message areas that indicate command response. Also reduce hand motion on the pointing device by keeping menus and editing windows close. When two screen systems are used, the relative placement of the monitors should be known in advance so that a sensible layout can be made.

每个显示区域应有区别，以便用户知道该看哪里。因此，不要让显示屏的不同部分重叠；例如，不要在编辑窗口上打印消息。确保屏幕的每个部分都占用适当的区域，并保持不同部分的数量较少，将密切相关的功能合并为一个。

Each display area should be distinct so that the user knows where to look. Therefore, do not let the different parts of the display overlap; for example, do not print messages over the editing window. Make sure that each section of the screen takes an appropriate area, and keep the number of different sections low, combining closely related functions into one.

10.3.1 编辑窗口

10.3.1 Editing Windows

显示电路的编辑窗口应该是屏幕的最大部分。虽然许多 CAD 系统只允许一个窗口，但理想的电路显示可以分成多个窗口，以便并行查看设计的不同方面。这允许用户查看层次结构的不同级别、同一电路的不同视图、同一单元的不同部分或不同的显示比例。窗口应该能够显示任何类型的设计信息，包括布局、原理图、波形和文本。

The editing window that displays circuitry should be the largest part of the screen. Although many CAD systems allow only one window, the ideal circuit display is divisible into multiple windows for parallel viewing of different aspects of the design. This allows the user to see different levels of the hierarchy, different views of the same circuit, different pieces of the same cell, or different display scales. Windows should be able to show any kind of design information including layout, schematics, waveforms, and text.

尽管编辑窗口的完全灵活性是一个理想目标，但实现起来可能成本高昂，而且很容易被忽视。然而，除了单窗口系统之外，还有一个折衷方案：几个专用窗口可以带来很多优势。例如，Icarus 系统[ Fairbairn and Rowson] 使用一个编辑窗口和一个较小的世界视图窗口。虽然无法在世界视图窗口中进行更改，但它会显示当前正在编辑的整个电路，并允许用户轻松选择要在主窗口中显示的子区域。这种功能也出现在侧面有滚动条子窗口的文本窗口中。滚动条显示当前窗口在文件中的位置，并允许直接访问文本的其他部分。

Although complete flexibility of editing windows is an ideal goal, it can be expensive to implement, and tempting to ignore. Rather than stop at a one-window system, however, there is a middle ground: a few special-purpose windows can give much advantage. For example, the Icarus system [Fairbairn and Rowson] uses one editing window and a smaller world-view window. Although changes cannot be made in the world-view window, it shows the entire circuit currently being edited and allows the user to select easily subareas for display in the main window. This same facility appears in text windows that have scroll-bar subwindows on the side. The bar shows the location of the current window within the file and allows direct access to other portions of the text.

在窗口布局中必须做出的一个决定是多个窗口是否应该重叠或相邻。重叠窗口是一个流行的概念，因为它们模拟了任意放置纸张的桌面。不幸的是，使用重叠窗口意味着总会有一些窗口被部分遮挡，这可能会令人烦恼。此外，由于无法使用简单的裁剪方法（例如Sutherland-Cohen 算法 [Newman and Sproull]）， 因此在被遮挡的窗口中绘制所需的代码复杂性和时间很高。

One decision that must be made in window layout is whether multiple windows should overlap or abut. Overlapping windows are a popular notion because they simulate a desk surface with arbitrarily placed pieces of paper. Unfortunately, the use of overlapped windows means that there will always be some that are partially occluded and this can be annoying. Also, the code complexity and time required to draw in an occluded window is high because simple clipping methods such as the Sutherland-Cohen algorithm [Newman and Sproull] cannot be used.

另一种方法是将屏幕划分为不重叠的窗口，这些窗口相互邻接并填满整个显示屏 [Gosling]。用户不必浪费时间重新排列重叠的顺序，图形编程起来也更简单，系统运行速度更快，用户仍能同时看到任意数量的不同内容。

The alternative is to divide the screen into nonoverlapping windows that abut and fill the display [Gosling]. The user will not have to waste time rearranging the order of overlap, the graphics will be easier to program, the system will run faster, and the user will still be able to see an arbitrary number of different things at once.

 

 

10.3.2 菜单

10.3.2 Menus

菜单是屏幕上显示的选项列表。通过将指针设备的光标移到菜单项上并按下按钮，用户即可调用该选项。早期的菜单只是块状单词列表；单词是缩写的命令，块状划定了菜单选择期间可识别的区域。这一基本公式已在许多方面得到更新。

Menus are lists of options that appear on the screen. By moving the cursor of the pointing device over a menu entry and pressing a button, the user invokes that option. Early menus were simply lists of words in blocks; the words were abbreviated commands and the blocks delimited the area that would be recognized during menu selection. This basic formula has been updated in many respects.

菜单最重要的改进是使用 图标（有时称为字形或图形符号）代替菜单框中的文本。文字的问题在于它们含糊不清，会在每个设计师的头脑中引起语义干扰。经常发生的情况是，文本菜单条目的确切含义在会话之间被遗忘，必须重新学习。另一方面，图标的外观独特，在菜单中很容易区分。实验表明，观众识别以前见过的图形信息要比识别以前见过的文字好得多 [Haber]，因此图标的学习速度更快。

The most important improvement to menus is the use of icons (sometimes called glyphs, or graphical symbols), instead of text in the menu boxes. The problem with words is that they are ambiguous and evoke semantic interference in the minds of each designer. It often happens that the precise meaning of textual menu entries is forgotten between sessions and must be relearned. Icons, on the other hand, are unique in their appearance and are easily distinguishable in the menu. Experiments have shown that viewers recognize previously seen pictorial information far better than they do previously seen words [Haber] and so the learning of icons is faster.

大多数现代计算机都支持下拉菜单，它由显示屏顶部的一排菜单标题组成。单击标题会显示下面的完整菜单。这些菜单项可以包含其他菜单，从而为用户提供大量命令。

Most modern computers support pulldown menus, which consist of a row of menu titles along the top of the display. Clicking on a title displays the full menu underneath. These menu entries can contain other menus, thus offering a large set of commands to the user.

人体工程学中一个值得关注的问题是光标的双重作用，既是编辑窗口中的指针，又是菜单中命令的选择器。用户如何才能指向电路中的某个位置，然后指向相应的菜单项而不丢失电路位置？显而易见的答案是将命令放在指点设备的按钮上，以便保留电路中的位置。另一个解决方案是使用两个光标，一个指向编辑窗口，另一个出现在菜单中以选择命令。当按钮被按到所需的电路上时，第一个光标会冻结，第二个光标会出现在菜单区域中，在按住按钮时在该区域中漫游。当设计人员释放按钮时，将执行第二个光标下的菜单操作，该光标会消失，编辑窗口中的原始光标会重新激活。这减少了从编辑窗口到菜单区域的手部运动，并清楚地显示了命令及其预期主题。

One concern in human engineering is the dual role of the cursor as a pointer in the editing window and as a selector of commands in the menu. How can the user point to a place in the circuit and then point to a corresponding menu entry without losing the circuit position? The obvious answer is to have the command be on a button of the pointing device so that the position in the circuit is retained. Another solution is to have two cursors, one that points in the editing window and a second that appears in the menu to choose a command. When a button is pushed over the desired piece of circuitry, the first cursor freezes and a second cursor appears in the menu area to roam through it while the button is held down. When the designer releases the button, the menu action under the second cursor is performed, that cursor disappears, and the original cursor in the editing window is reactivated. This reduces hand motion from the editing window to the menu area and clearly shows the command and its intended subject.

解决菜单选择效率问题的一种更流行的方法是让弹出菜单 出现在编辑窗口顶部光标所在的位置（见图 10.4）。这些菜单仅在选择命令时遮挡电路，然后被移除。它们不会占用永久的屏幕区域，从而为电路显示留出更多空间。弹出菜单的最佳功能可能是它们可以通过在光标下方直接绘制首选条目来实现默认值。用户根本不需要移动光标来选择此选项；他或她只需按下指点设备上的按钮即可。
图 10.4 弹出菜单出现在光标位置（X）。

弹出菜单可以包含任意复杂的命令选项，方法是将其分层。这是通过将选项类别放置在初始菜单中来实现的，这样选择一个条目会导致另一个带有子选项的弹出菜单出现。每个较低级别的弹出菜单都与前一个菜单偏移绘制，使用户能够看到已选择的选项的进展。分层菜单的概念也可以在非弹出环境中找到，例如在编辑窗口下方的屏幕底部从左到右出现的 行进菜单[Applicon]（见图 10.5）。
图 10.5 行进菜单显示层次结构并从左到右构建。

层次结构并不是命令语言的终极目标，程序员应注意不要让命令选择的复杂性失控。有些系统需要五次或更多次菜单选择才能调用完整的命令，这太多了。通过正确使用默认值、记忆状态和任务建模，可以减少大部分复杂性。

Hierarchy is not the end-all in command languages and the programmer should be careful that the complexity of command selection does not get out of hand. There are systems that require five or more menu selections before a complete command is invoked, and that is too much. With the proper use of defaults, remembered state, and task modeling, much of this complexity can be reduced.

菜单的另一种实现方式（只有当指点设备是平板电脑时才可能实现）是在平板电脑表面（而不是屏幕上）上没有对应位置的选项绘制方式（见图 10.6）。这种方式是可取的，因为它不会占用固定菜单的屏幕空间，而且平板电脑上印刷的标签可能包含比可显示内容更多的细节。然而，从人机工程学的角度来看，这是一个坏主意，因为当用户反复从屏幕转向平板电脑时，它会导致眼睛甚至头部过度运动。使用平板电脑通常不需要用户注视平板电脑上的手，因为屏幕上光标的移动就是足够的反馈。使用平板电脑菜单、控制盘上按钮过多或任何其他导致注意力转移的方案都会减慢设计过程。

Another implementation of menus, possible only when the pointing device is a tablet, draws the options on the tablet surface (rather than the screen) in a location that has no correspondence on the screen (see Fig. 10.6). This is desirable because it does not use screen space for fixed menus and also because the printed labels on the tablet can contain more detail than can be displayed. From a human-engineering standpoint, however, this is a bad idea because it causes excessive eye and even head movement when the user repeatly turns from the screen to the tablet. Tablet use does not normally require that the user watch the hand on the tablet because the movement of the cursor on the screen is adequate feedback. The use of tablet menus, too many buttons on the puck, or any other scheme that causes a shift in attention, will slow the design process.

图 10.6 数位板菜单位于数位板表面与屏幕上没有对应的位置。

 

 

10.3.3 信息显示

10.3.3 Message Display

在所有交互式系统中，即使是高度面向图形的系统，也存在文本对话。尽管使用图形和菜单可以减少对键盘的需求，但总会有一些内容需要输入。此外，系统需要在屏幕上的某个位置打印状态、错误和信息消息。必须显示两种文本：固定位置信息和滚动消息。

In all interactive systems, even those that are highly graphics oriented, there is a textual conversation taking place. Although the use of graphics and menus can reduce the need for a keyboard, there will always be some things that are typed. In addition, systems need to print status, error, and information messages somewhere on the screen. Two kinds of text must be displayed: fixed position information and scrolled messages.

固定位置信息非常重要，要求用户始终能够看到它。例如，用户经常请求当前状态（如正在编辑的电路和机器的运行状态）。此信息属于固定消息的屏幕单独区域，以便可以立即找到每条信息。程序员必须为可能出现的最大消息留出足够的空间，并且仍要为过大的消息留出空间。例如，当文本字段溢出时，可以在右侧截断，但当数字字段溢出时，不能缩写，并且应该有明确的迹象表明数据是错误的。

Fixed position information is important enough to demand that the user always be able to see it. For example, current status such as the circuit being edited and the machine's run state are frequently requested by the user. This information belongs in a separate area of the screen for fixed messages so that each piece of information can be found immediately. The programmer must allow enough space for the largest message that may appear, and still have provisions for messages that are too large. For example, when a text field overflows it can be chopped off at the right but when a numeric field overflows it cannot be abbreviated and there should be a definite indication that the datum is wrong.

不太重要的信息可以放在屏幕滚动的另一部分。 滚动是大多数视频终端上都会发生的动作，其中随着显示向上移动，新行会添加到屏幕底部。由于添加新行时顶部行会从视图中消失，因此当滚动区域填满新消息时，好的系统会暂停。然后用户可以确认此暂停以允许系统继续显示消息。有必要给出一些暂停已发生的指示，例如蜂鸣声或在底部显示单词“更多”。暂停指示和用于确认暂停的方法应该与操作系统其他地方的等效功能相似。滚动控制的另一个有用功能是可以设置下次暂停之前将滚动多少。通常，用户愿意让所有当前消息滚动走，但有时可能只希望在系统再次暂停之​​前再滚动一行。

Less important information can be placed in another part of the screen that scrolls. Scrolling is the action that takes place on most video terminals in which new lines are added to the bottom of the screen as the display is shifted up. Because the top line is lost from view when a new one is added, good systems will pause when the scrolling area fills with new messages. The user can then acknowledge this pause to allow the system to continue displaying messages. It is necessary to give some indication that the pause has happened, such as a beep or the word "more" displayed at the bottom. Both the pause indication and the method used to acknowledge the pause should be similar to equivalent functions found elsewhere in the operating system. Another useful feature of scrolling control is an option to set how much more will be scrolled before the next pause. Typically, the user is willing to allow all the current messages to scroll away, but may sometimes want only one more line before the system pauses again.

对于文本输入，滚动区域应像终端一样使用。这就要求有字符光标，以便用户可以看到行的进度。应打印一些提示字符，以便用户知道何时需要输入，并区分输入和输出。

For text input, the scrolling area should be used like a terminal. This demands a character cursor so the user can see progress along the line. Some prompt characters should be printed so that the user knows when input is expected and so that input can be distinguished from output.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 10 章：人体工程学

10.4 命令语言

10.4 Command Language

命令语言是用户输入的渠道，它必须能够表达所有可能的交易，无论这些交易是从键盘发出的还是从某些图形指点设备发出的。即使不同设备的数量不断增加，命令语言也必须具有统一的设计，以便于学习和清晰地扩展。重要的功能应该在不同设备上冗余提供，以便于调用，并且应该有重新排列不同命令位置的选项。命令语言的其他理想特性包括最少使用模式、方便的中止、在线帮助和适当的错误恢复。接下来的两节讨论了命令语言的设备特定方面，然后是对命令语言特性的一般讨论。

The command language is the channel for user input and it must be capable of expressing all possible transactions, whether they are issued from the keyboard or from some graphical pointing device. Even when the number of different devices grows large, it is necessary for the command language to have a uniform design so that it is easy to learn and extends cleanly. Important functions should be redundantly available on different devices for ease of invocation, and there should be options for rearranging the location of different commands. Other desirable features of a command language are minimal use of modes, convenient abort, online help, and proper error recovery. The next two sections discuss device-specific aspects of command languages, followed by a general discussion of command-language features.

10.4.1 文本命令语言

10.4.1 Textual Command Languages

键盘是并且将继续是最强大的输入设备，因为它可以传输最复杂和最具体的命令。由于 CAD 系统的用户通常键入一定数量的操作系统命令才能使用机器（登录、运行程序等），因此 CAD 系统模仿该命令语言是有利的。这并不意味着重复命令，而是使用相同风格的命令结构。例如，在UNIX操作系统 [Ritchie and Thompson] 上，开关以“-”为前缀，而在 DEC 操作系统 [Digital] 上，开关以“/”开头。

The keyboard is and will remain the most powerful input device because it can transmit the most complex and specific commands. Since the user of a CAD system typically types a certain number of operating-system commands in order to use the machine (login, run programs, and so on), it is to the advantage of the CAD system to mimic that command language. This does not mean duplicating commands, but rather using the same style of command structure. For example, on a UNIX operating system [Ritchie and Thompson], switches are prefixed with a "-", and on a DEC operating system [Digital] the switches begin with a "/".

由于 CAD 在很大程度上是一项编辑任务，因此可用于命令界面的另一种可能模型是模仿当前的文本编辑器。例如，如果 CAD 系统在提供EMACS编辑器 [Stallman] 的机器上运行，它可能允许类似的概念，如动态键绑定、单键命令以及使用特殊键作为较长命令的前缀。可以共享一般的编辑概念（例如，命令语言中动作动词的语义和操作数的语法）。

Since CAD is very much an editing task, another possible model that can be used for the command interface is to mimic the current text editor. For example, if the CAD system runs on a machine that provides the EMACS editor [Stallman], it might allow similar concepts such as dynamic key binding, single-key commands, and the use of special keys as a prefix for longer commands. General editing concepts--for example, the semantics of action verbs in the command language and the syntax of operands--can be shared.

前面的讨论提出了键盘命令语言中是否单独使用按键作为复杂功能按钮的问题。许多系统允许单次击键执行完整操作，例如创建和删除。没有此功能的系统要求输入整行文本，包括回车符。由于完整命令功能更强大，因此它们必须始终可用，即使在单次击键环境中也是如此。可以通过在较长命令的输入前添加一个特殊的单键来提供此选项，例如Caesar [Ousterhout] 和Electric。

The preceding discussion raises the issue in keyboard command languages of whether or not to use the keys individually as complex function buttons. Many systems allow a single keystroke to do a full action such as creation and deletion. Systems without this capability require a full line of text to be typed including a carriage-return. Since full commands are more powerful they must always be available, even in single-keystroke environments. This option can be provided by having a special single key that prefixes the typing of longer commands, as in Caesar [Ousterhout] and Electric.

在输入长命令时，命令补全 会很有帮助 。此功能最初发现于TENEX操作系统 [Bobrow等]，如果已输入足够多的字母来唯一标识该关键字，命令解释器会填写任何部分输入的关键字。例如，如果系统期望命令“compile”、“compose”或“create”，并且用户已输入cr，则系统知道选择了哪个命令，并且可以eate在输入回车符或其他分隔符时附加字母。命令补全系统还提供特殊键以立即完成和提供帮助。特殊补全键（例如escape）会填写关键字，而无需终止行或采取任何其他操作。帮助键（通常是“？”）列出当前点的所有选项。如果在前面的示例中，用户输入了coescape ，则系统会附加但仅此而已，mp因为此后存在歧义。系统还可以给出一些指示，表明关键字不完整（蜂鸣或闪烁）。如果用户随后输入“？”，系统将列出选项“compile”或“compose”，然后将用户返回到“comp”之后的输入。

When typing long commands, it is helpful to have command completion. With this feature, originally found in the TENEX operating system [Bobrow et al.], the command interpreter fills out any partially typed keyword if enough letters have already been entered to identify that keyword uniquely. For example, if the system expects the commands "compile," "compose," or "create" and the user has typed cr, then the system knows which command has been selected and can append the letters eate when a carriage-return or other delimiter is typed. Command-completion systems also provide special keys for immediate completion and for help. The special completion key, for example an escape, fills out the keyword without terminating the line or taking any other action. The help key, often a "?", lists all options at the current point. If, in the preceding example, the user were to type co and an escape, the system would append mp but nothing more because there is ambiguity after that. The system could also give some indication that the keyword is not complete (a beep or flash). If the user then types a "?", the system will list the options--"compile" or "compose"--and then return the user to the input after "comp."

此示例表明，需要仔细选择命令语言中的关键字。如果用户想要通过缩写命令来减少输入，那么舒适的命令集的前几个字母将是独一无二的。如果两个命令都以相同的四个字母开头，则需要用户输入五个字母才能进行最少的缩写，而这比输入完整命令节省不了多少。在此示例中，建议程序员将“compose”更改为“assemble”或任何其他不与“compile”冲突的单词。

This example shows the need to select the keywords in a command language carefully. If the user is going to have the advantage of abbreviating commands for reduced typing, then a comfortable command set will be unique in the first few letters. Having two commands that both begin with the same four letters requires that the user type five letters in order to abbreviate minimally, and that is not much of a saving over typing the full command. In the example, the programmer would be well advised to change "compose" to "assemble" or any other word that does not conflict with "compile."

 

 

10.4.2 图形命令语言

10.4.2 Graphical Command Languages

计算机用户认为，键盘是一种不适合图形活动的输入设备，应尽量减少使用。相反，鼠标或其他指点设备似乎更适合这项工作。实际上，键盘可能非常强大，可以提供比鼠标多得多的带宽，但这需要用户有经验。为了让新手更舒服，鼠标很方便，实验表明使用鼠标更快 [Card、Moran 和 Newell]。当然，键盘不能完全被取代，因为总是需要输入名称和数字，但命令输入可以转移，使键盘成为次要设备。在某些系统中，键盘用于增强指点设备，方法是将单个按键用作指针按钮，从而为指点操作提供更多选项。然而，这需要将注意力从屏幕转移到键盘，这是人类工程学试图避免的延迟。在适当的图形命令语言中，必须对输入设备进行编程以实现最大便利性，否则用户将要求再次使用键盘。

There is a feeling among computer users that the keyboard is an inappropriate input device for what is essentially graphical activity, and that its use should be minimized. Instead, a mouse or other pointing device would seem better suited to the job. Actually, the keyboard is potentially very powerful and can provide much more bandwidth than can a mouse, but this requires that the user be experienced. To make novices more comfortable, a mouse is convenient and experiments indicate that it is faster to use [Card, Moran, and Newell]. Of course, the keyboard cannot be totally replaced because there will always be names and numbers to type, but command input can be shifted away, making the keyboard a secondary device. In some systems, the keyboard is used to enhance the pointing device by having single keystrokes act as pointer buttons, thus giving many more options to a pointing action. However, this requires a shift of attention from the screen to the keyboard, a delay that human engineering seeks to avoid. In a proper graphical command language, the input device must be programmed for maximum convenience or else the user will demand to use the keyboard again.

菜单是实现基于图形的命令语言的明显选择。虽然之前报告称选择菜单项所需的时间为 1.1 秒，但该时间实际上取决于菜单项的大小及其与当前光标位置的距离 [Card、Moran 和 Newell]。为了更好地理解这种依赖性，有必要更详细地研究菜单选择。

Menus are an obvious choice for implementing a graphically based command language. Although the time taken to select a menu entry was reported earlier to be 1.1 seconds, this time is actually dependent on the menu-entry size and its distance from the current cursor position [Card, Moran, and Newell]. To understand this dependency better, it is necessary to examine menu picking in more detail.

回到人类活动模型，可以看出将光标移向菜单项的操作需要一个感知操作（查看手要移到哪里）、一个认知操作（确定要做什么）和一个运动操作（执行）。根据前面给出的时间值，这三个操作需要 240 毫秒。但是，这不会将光标放在菜单中，而是将其向目标移动某个固定百分比。因此，到达菜单的实际时间是基于距离和准确性的指数函数。这个函数称为Fitt 定律，它指出到达菜单项的时间将是：

Returning to the model of human activity, it can be seen that the action of moving the cursor toward a menu entry requires one perception action (to see where the hand is going), one cognition action (to determine what to do), and one motion action (to do it). These three operations require 240 milliseconds, according to the time values given earlier. However, this does not put the cursor in the menu, but rather moves it some fixed percentage toward its goal. The actual time to get to the menu is therefore an exponential function based on distance and accuracy. This function, called Fitt's Law, states that the time to a menu entry will be:

我 × 日志2 2D
年代

 

 

其中S是菜单的大小，D是到菜单的距离，I 是常数：100 毫秒。因此，为了获得最佳响应，菜单条目应该靠近且较大，并且大小和距离之间存在线性权衡。

当然，还有其他方法可以用图形方式指示命令，例如草书识别。Ledeen 字符识别器 [Curry] 是一种简单有效的区分手写字母的方法，可用于识别大量由笔画组合产生的命令。Bravo3设计系统将此用作其主要命令界面 [Applicon]。

There are, of course, other ways to indicate a command graphically, such as cursive-script recognition. The Ledeen character recognizer [Curry], a simple and effective method of distinguishing handwritten letters, can be used to identify a large set of commands that are the result of stroke combinations. The Bravo3 design systems use this as their primary command interface [Applicon].

尽管图形命令语言具有轻松指定屏幕位置的优势，但它们无法提供精确的坐标或其他精确的数值。一种解决方案是提供模拟熟悉设备（如电话或加法机）的数字菜单。此菜单的工作方式与其物理模拟类似，并允许用户“输入”所需的值。此外，它还提供与真实设备相同的功能，包括符号输入、小数点、备份和中止。

Although graphical command languages have the advantage of easily specifying screen positions, they are unable to give precise coordinates or other exact numeric values. One solution is to provide a number menu that mimics familiar devices such as telephones or adding machines. This menu works like its physical analog and allows the user to "punch up" a desired value. Further, it supplies the same functionality as a real device including sign entry, decimal point, backup, and abort.

在定义精确值时，选择单个数字的繁琐工作的一个替代方法是使用图形数字轮[Thornton]。屏幕上显示一个轮子和轮子上的当前值，这样当用户指向它并移动光标时，轮子就会“转动”，值就会改变。轮子可以在“拉”之后继续旋转，并且额外的拉动可以加快速度。较慢的拉动将使值更慢地增加，一次拉动将停止旋转，从而完全模仿物理轮子并让用户对数字选择有熟悉的感觉。

An alternative to the tedium of selecting individual digits when defining an exact value is to use a graphical number wheel [Thornton]. The screen displays a wheel and the current value on that wheel, so that when the user points to it and moves the cursor, the wheel is "rolled" and the value changes. The wheel can keep spinning after a "pull," and additional pulls can speed it up. Slower pulls will advance the value more slowly and a single grab will stop the spinning, thus completely mimicking a physical wheel and giving the user a familiar feel to number selection.

对于某些任务，可以通过特殊方法使光标的不准确性变得更精确。如果绘图任务具有已知的规律性，则可以通过强制执行该规律性来提供帮助。例如，在绘制对象时，可以将其位置捕捉到用于对齐屏幕上所有内容的网格上。网格的大小应该是可控的，显示网格的选项也应该是可控的，以便用户可以看到间距。再举一个例子，当绘图要求所有线条都成直角或以 45 度为增量时，可以将光标位置从光标所在的位置调整到满足此要求的最近点。

For some tasks, the inaccuracy of the cursor can be made more precise in special-purpose ways. If a drawing task has known regularity, it may be helped by enforcing that regularity. For example, when objects are drawn, their placement can be snapped to a grid that is used to align everything on the screen. The size of the grid should be controllable, as should the option of displaying it so the user can see the spacing. As another example, when drawing demands that all lines be at right angles or at 45-degree increments, the cursor position can be adjusted from where the cursor is to the closest point that meets this requirement.

当光标接近某个对象时，通常意味着要接触该对象。因此，当用户指向屏幕时，如果需要连接，光标可以捕捉到最近的其他对象。在可能需要或不需要连接的情况下，光标只有在靠近该对象时才能捕捉到另一个对象。这个邻近区域称为重力场，顶点周围的区域比边缘周围的区域大，因为顶点是光标的首选位置（见图 10.7）。
图 10.7 重力场的“哑铃”形状。当光标进入此区域时，它会被吸引到对象上。顶点的重力场比线的重力场大。

 

 

10.4.3 通用命令语言特性

10.4.3 General Command-Language Features

所有命令语言都应具备某些属性，无论它们是通过键盘、指点设备还是语音输入发出的。界面应友好、不受模式限制，并且能够中止、撤消或从错误中恢复。

There are certain attributes that all command languages should possess, regardless of whether they are issued from a keyboard, a pointing device, or even speech input. The interface should be friendly, mode-free, and able to abort, undo, or recover from errors.

命令语言最重要的特性是友好性。错误消息必须是积极的，为用户的情况提供替代方案。消极消息“不能做……”应该改为“必须先做……”。

The most important command language feature is friendliness. Error messages must be positive in nature, suggesting alternatives to the user's situation. The negative message "cannot do . . . " should instead be "must do . . . first."

此外，帮助需要在用户输入的每个机会中提供。不仅所有命令都应提供在线帮助，而且每个提示都应准备好更全面地解释所需内容。在线帮助信息的结构最好与所解释的实际命令相同。这意味着树状结构的命令语言应该具有树状结构的帮助系统。此外，获取帮助的方法应该一致且易于猜测 - 例如“？”键。除了基本帮助之外，还可以提供帮助指南来建议针对给定主题提出适当的问题，甚至可以提供教程来介绍基础知识。最终的系统具有一个智能代理，可以观察和批评用户的操作。有了这样的设施，完全的新手也可以使用该系统而不会产生任何困惑或需要人工帮助。

In addition, help needs to be available at every opportunity for user input. Not only should online help be available for all commands, but each prompt should be prepared to explain more fully what is wanted. The online help information is best when it is structured in the same way as the actual commands being explained. This means that tree-structured command languages should have tree-structured help systems. Also, the method of obtaining help should be consistent and easy to guess-for example, the "?" key. Besides basic help, there can be help guidance to suggest the proper questions to ask for given subjects and there can even be a tutorial available to present basics. The ultimate system has an intelligent agent that watches and critiques user actions. With such a facility, a total neophyte can use the system without any confusion or human assistance.

程序员试图避免但很少避免的命令语言的一个方面是模式。 模式是针对特定任务定制的命令集合。虽然它们对于特定任务很方便，但它们学习和使用起来很混乱，因为它们往往会使手动操作超负荷，在不同时间重新定义它们。例如，用户可能会了解到“X”键在“放置模式”下表示擦除，而在“模拟模式”下表示未定义。这不可避免地导致在错误的模式下发出正确的命令，从而造成任意的坏事。

One aspect of command languages that programmers attempt to avoid but rarely do is modes. Modes are collections of commands that are tailored for specific tasks. Although they are convenient for that particular task, they are confusing to learn and to use because they tend to overload manual operations, redefining them at different times. For example, the user might learn that the "X" key means erase when in "placement mode" and it means undefined when in "simulation mode." This inevitably leads to issuing the right command in the wrong mode, which does arbitrarily bad things.

如果要使用模式（而且几乎不可能避免），则应将其保持在最低限度。当前模式应清楚地显示在永久消息区域中，并且那些含义在每种模式下都会发生变化的功能应显示其当前含义。最重要的是，用户必须能够从错误中恢复，无论是由于模式混乱还是纯粹的愚蠢造成的。这意味着允许中止任何部分完成的操作并撤消任何已完成的错误。

If modes are to be used (and they are nearly impossible to avoid), then they should be kept to a minimum. The current mode should be clearly displayed in the permanent message area, and those functions that have meanings that change in each mode should have their current meaning displayed. Most important, the user must be able to recover from mistakes, whether they be due to mode confusion or the result of just plain stupidity. This means allowing the abort of any partially completed action and the undo of any finished mistake.

中止选项不只适用于可能出现问题的地方；它们必须存在于所有提示用户的地方。它们应该是显而易见的选项，并且应该恢复到合理的状态以继续工作。撤消控制更难实现，因为它可能需要跟踪和重置大量状态。除了撤消最后一个命令外，还应该可以撤消许多先前的操作并撤消一次撤消，这相当于重做。请注意允许用户发出不一致的更改请求的复杂撤消控制。

Abort options do not belong only in likely trouble spots; they must exist in all prompts to the user. They should be an obvious option and should revert to a sensible state for the continuation of work. Undo control is harder to implement because it may require the tracking and resetting of large amounts of state. In addition to undoing the last command, it should be possible to undo many previous actions and to undo an undo, which amounts to a redo. Beware of complex undo control that allows the user to make inconsistent change requests.

 

 

10.4.4 崩溃恢复

10.4.4 Crash Recovery

当然，最终的错误恢复是避免崩溃。坚持大型计算机系统不会崩溃绝非易事。人们花费数年时间调试程序和编写诊断程序，但系统仍然会失败。即使编写了完美无缺的程序，也总会有外部错误源，例如操作系统故障和硬件故障。简而言之，没有程序可以避免崩溃，使程序健壮的唯一方法是让它正确恢复。

The ultimate error recovery is, of course, safety from crashes. It is no small thing to insist that a large computer system be immune to crashes. People spend years debugging programs and writing diagnostics, yet systems still fail. Even after the perfect, bulletproof program has been written, there will always be external sources of error such as operating-system faults and hardware failure. In short, no program is safe from crashes and the only way to make a program robust is to have it recover properly.

当对电路进行更改时，该更改可能不是永久性的，因为大多数系统仅更改内存表示而不是磁盘版本。只有当电路保存在磁盘上时，更改才会被 提交或永久保留。高度可靠的数据库系统在每次更改后都有明确的提交步骤，以便对该操作进行安全的磁盘记录。在大多数 CAD 系统中，这太昂贵了。此外，用户在完成编辑会话之前不愿意提交。

When a change is made to a circuit, that change is probably not permanent because most systems change only the memory representation and not the disk version. It is only when the circuit is saved on disk that the changes are committed, or made permanent. Highly robust database systems have explicit commit steps after every change so that a secure disk record is made of the action. In most CAD systems this is too expensive. Also, users are not willing to commit until they finish an editing session.

在仅更新内存的系统中，崩溃将导致自上次保存以来所做的所有更改失效。在这种情况下提供恢复的一种方法是每隔几条命令自动将电路保存在磁盘上，从而对电路进行检查点检查。然后用户将能够使用最近检查点的版本，该版本仅落后一些更改。不幸的是，VLSI 设计文件可能非常大，以至于频繁保存它们比重做丢失的工作更令人讨厌。

In systems that update only memory, a crash will cost all of the changes made since the last save. One way to provide recovery in this situation is to checkpoint the circuit automatically by saving it on disk every few commands. The user will then be able to use the most recently checkpointed version, which will be only a few changes behind. Unfortunately, VLSI design files may be so large that saving them frequently is more annoying than is redoing lost work.

保存设计的另一种方法是保存对设计的更改。此信息更加紧凑，可以频繁快速地写入磁盘。由于设计系统将用户输入转换为 数据库更改，因此可以保存该处理管道的任一端。如果保存了用户输入，则每个击键、指针位置和按钮按下都会记录在会话日志文件中。如果保存了数据库更改，则每个新对象、对象修改或对象删除都会被记录。

An alternative to saving the design is to save changes to the design. This information is much more compact and can be written to disk frequently and quickly. Since a design system transforms user input to database changes, either end of that processing pipe can be saved. If the user input is saved, then each keystroke, pointer position, and button push is recorded in a session log file. If the database changes are saved, then each new object, modification of an object, or object deletion is recorded.

使用更改文件进行恢复需要“回放”文件以重新创建数据库的最后状态。用户输入回放将更准确地显示导致崩溃的步骤，因此更有助于调试。此外，用户输入文件比数据库更改文件小，因为用户通常只提供很少的与生成内容相关的信息。毕竟，CAD 系统的工作是将简短的用户请求转换为日益复杂的电路。因此，用户输入日志记录是从崩溃中恢复的最简洁、最有效的方式。它还可以很好地演示设计系统，以高速会话回放查看整个电路的构建。

Recovery using change files requires that the files be "played back" to re-create the last state of the database. User input playback will more precisely show the steps that led to the crash and are thus more helpful in debugging. In addition, user input files are smaller than database change files because users typically give very little information in relation to what is produced. After all, it is the job of the CAD system to translate brief user requests into circuits that are increasingly complex. Thus user-input logging is the most concise and effective way to recover from crashes. It also makes a nice demonstration of a design system to see an entire circuit built at the high-speed of session playback.

在用户输入文件中要确保的一件事是记录了足够的信息以正确重现会话。例如，如果在光标位于两个相同对象上时发出“select”命令，则数据库状态将确定首先选择哪个对象。如果在回放期间无法保证该数据库状态，则可能会选择不同的对象，从而导致恢复不正确。为了解决这个问题，可能必须在日志文件中记录其他特定于命令的信息。

The one thing to ensure in user-input files is that there is enough information recorded to reproduce the session correctly. If, for example, a "select" command is issued when the cursor is over two identical objects, the database state will determine which object is selected first. If that database state cannot be guaranteed during playback, a different object may be selected, causing incorrect recovery. To overcome this problem, additional command-specific information may have to be recorded in the logging file.

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 10 章：人体工程学

10.5 反馈

10.5 Feedback

人体工程学的任务是让用户在使用系统的过程中感到愉快。这意味着，无论用户做什么，都需要有一个明确而友好的响应。消息应该始终是积极的，必须承认成功或失败，并且长期任务的进展应该是令人鼓舞的。输入请求需要可识别的提示，以便用户始终了解系统的活动。

It is the task of human engineering to keep the user happy during sessions with the system. This means that whenever the user does something, there needs to be a definite and friendly response. Messages should always be positive in nature and must acknowledge success or failure, and progress on long tasks should be encouraging. Requests for input need identifiable prompts so that the user is aware at all times of the activity of the system.

为了提供最佳反馈，请考虑用户视线所及之处，并在该区域进行操作。当从键盘调用命令时，应在滚动区域打印一条消息，以指示成功、失败或进度。当从指点设备调用命令时，用户的注意力集中在显示屏上，反馈就在那里。当出现意外情况时，必须从用户注意力所在的地方吸引用户的注意力，例如，通过蜂鸣或屏幕闪烁。但是，蜂鸣声要少，否则用户会忽略它们，最终可能会断开扬声器。

To provide the best feedback, consider where the user's eyes are directed and work in that area. When a command has been invoked from the keyboard, a message should be printed in the scrolling area to indicate success, failure, or progress. When a command has been invoked from the pointing device, the user's attention is on the display and feedback belongs there. When an unexpected condition occurs, the user's attention must be grabbed from wherever it is--for example, by beeping or by flashing the screen. Keep the number of beeps low, however, or else users will ignore them and eventually may disconnect the speaker.

当输入来自键盘时，反馈是文本，其性质取决于输入的结果。对于成功的结果，应该有一条简短的消息指示已发生的任何重要状态变化。失败消息应该建议错误输入的替代方案，以便可以完成所需的任务。长时间的操作应该确认它们已经开始并且已经完成。非常长的任务应该打印一些进度指示。这些进度消息可能指示任务的哪一部分正在完成以及完成了多少百分比，或者它们可能仅打印一个字符（例如“X”），以便可以观察这些字母的进展。用户很快了解所有反馈的性质并正确解释它。

When input is from the keyboard, feedback is textual and its nature depends on the result of the input. For a successful result, there should be a short message indicating any important state changes that have occurred. Failure messages should suggest alternatives to the erroneous input so that the desired task can be completed. Long operations should acknowledge that they have started and that they have completed. Very long tasks should print some indication of progress along the way. These progress messages may indicate what part of the task is being done and what percent of the effort is complete, or they may merely print a single character (such as an "X") so that the progression of these letters can be watched. Users quickly learn the nature of all feedback and interpret it correctly.

来自光标的输入应在光标附近引起反馈。在某些情况下，显示变化的正常进程提供了足够的反馈。例如，对于弹出菜单，菜单在选择后消失，对于更改显示的命令，更改完成后确认命令。因此，隐式反馈是可用的，因为系统以图形方式执行请求。失败消息必须显示在光标附近，否则必须将其视为用蜂鸣声指示的异常情况。

Input from the cursor should elicit feedback near the cursor. In some cases, the normal progression of display changes provides adequate feedback. For example, with pop-up menus, the menu disappears after selection is made, and with commands that change the display, completion of the change acknowledges the command. Thus implicit feedback is available because the system does what is requested in a graphical manner. Failure messages must be displayed near the cursor or else they must be treated as exceptional conditions that are indicated with a beep.

以图形方式指示进度和完成情况的 最佳方法之一是更改光标形状。NEWSWHOLE系统 [Tilbrook] 将光标从 X 更改为佛像，以请求用户保持耐心。沙漏传达了相同的含义，表示不能输入新命令。另一种方法是擦除光标，然后在取得进展时慢慢重新绘制它。

One of the best ways to indicate progress and completion graphically is to change the cursor shape. The NEWSWHOLE system [Tilbrook] changes the cursor from an X to the image of a Buddha to request patience on the part of the user. Hourglasses convey the same meaning and indicate that no new commands may be entered. Another method is to erase the cursor and then repaint it slowly as progress is made.

光标还可用于指示用户需要执行的操作类型。当用户指向单个对象时，光标为 X；当用户绘制草图时，光标为笔的形状；当需要键盘输入时，光标会变为打字机图标，以指示应使用其他设备。当请求特定输入时，给出合理的提示要比简单地锁定所有其他设备并忽略它们的输入好得多。

The cursor can also be used to indicate what kind of action is expected from the user. When the user is pointing to single objects, the cursor is an X; when he or she is drawing a sketch, the cursor is the shape of a pen; and when keyboard input is expected, the cursor changes to a typewriter icon to indicate that a different device should be used. When requesting specific input, it is far better to give a sensible prompt than simply to lock up all other devices and ignore their input.

另一个可用于使菜单选择响应的反馈选项是当光标经过菜单项时突出显示菜单项。具有块传输功能的显示器可以在光标进入时快速反转菜单项。另一个选项是绘制没有封闭框的条目，然后在光标经过当前条目时在其周围显示一个框。

Another feedback option that can be used to make menu selection responsive is to highlight the menu entries as the cursor passes over them. Displays with block-transfer capabilities can quickly invert the menu entry when the cursor enters. Another option is to draw the entries without enclosing boxes and then show a box around the current entry as the cursor passes over it.

良好的反馈可以让用户即使在最糟糕的情况下也能感到满意，因为它可以让用户知道会发生什么——以及什么时候去喝咖啡。然而，糟糕的反馈会让系统使用起来很困难，即使机器响应足够好，因为用户永远不知道下一步该怎么做。永远不要让用户疑惑，“现在该做什么？”

Good feedback can keep users happy even in the worst conditions because it lets them know what to expect--and when to go get coffee. Poor feedback, however, will make system use difficult even when the machine response is adequate, because the users will never be sure of their next step. Never let the user wonder, "Now what?"

超大规模集成电路设计的计算机辅助
史蒂文·M·鲁宾
版权所有 © 1994

第 10 章：人体工程学

10.6 总结

10.6 Summary

人体工程学包括良好计算机系统的最内层和最外层。最深层是任务和用户模型，它贯穿于系统设计中，以符合用户的能力和期望。最顶层是友好和聪明的光泽，通过智能交互让用户感到舒适。这些之间是构成 VLSI CAD 系统的许多其他系统功能。

Human engineering comprises both the innermost and the outermost levels of a good computer system. At the deepest level is the task and user model that permeates the system design to correspond with the user's abilities and expectations. At the top level is a sheen of friendliness and cleverness that comforts the user by interacting intelligently. Between these are the many other system functions that constitute a VLSI CAD system.

问题

Questions

  1. 包含“转换”和“转置”命令的系统有什么问题？
  2. What is wrong with a system containing the commands "transform" and "transpose"?
  3. 为什么要将展示组织得将常用区域靠近在一起？
  4. Why should the display be organized to position commonly used areas close together?
  5. 移动菜单和弹出菜单的相对优点是什么？
  6. What are the relative merits of marching menus and pop-up menus?
  7. 当单个按键作为完整命令的缩写时会遇到什么问题？
  8. What problems will be encountered when single keystrokes are used as abbreviations for full commands?
  9. 哪个可以更好地减少菜单选择时间：增加菜单的大小还是减少菜单条目与光标的距离？
  10. Which will better reduce menu selection time: increasing the size of the menu or decreasing the distance of the menu entry from the cursor?
  11. 哪种数据库组织可以保证前一个会话的击键回放能够正确工作？
  12. What database organization guarantees that keystroke playback of a previous session will work correctly?
  13. 为什么高级用户更喜欢较少的反馈？
  14. Why do advanced users prefer less feedback?
